reviews.text: Let me start off by saying the usual rating I would give this restaurant based on the average of all my experience here would be higher, but today&#39;s trip was pretty terrible. <br><br>Today was the first time I got to go, we ordered two pasta dishes and two slices of cheesecake once we got there. After getting out pasta we waited for a good 8 minuets watching our cheesecake packed and sitting on the counter. The person taking ordered seemed distracted and we needed to inquire twice before getting our cheesecakes packed. <br><br>After getting back to the car we didn&#39;t want to wait for the pasta to clump anymore than the previous wait had made it already and ate in the car. We found multiple pieces of plastic in our food. <br><br>Pictures will be attached.

I ORDERED THE Broclie and chicken pasta. my pasta seemed as if the Noodles had been cooked and sitting for a bit. The veggies were delicious. My friend ordered the fettuccini alfredo but the sauce had to much of something but we couldn&#39;t put our finger on it. The waitress was delightful. Have found memories of this location. Had a birthday lunch with my besstie.

After waiting hour and half, everything was cold except for fries. Ordered calamari which tasted liked cold grease. Jambalaya was just noodles, pieces of chicken, shrimp and oil. No sauce in sight. Fettuccine chicken alfredo with no alfredo sauce. Fish and chips were fish had no flavor tasted like cold grease. Green beans that were not snapped with steams from the bush. Chicken was supposed to be crusted but had no flavor. Spent $155 for this... worst Mother&#39;s Day meal in history.<br><br>**update**<br>David, manager at Cheesecake, rectified the issue and my family will try again. Thank you David you rock.

We went for Happy Hour between 4 and 6pm on a Thursday and it wasn&#39;t that busy. We are still in the COVID-19 pandemic and they only have a few tables open so that customers aren&#39;t close to each other. We barely made it by the 6pm cut off and we ordered various items from the scan the code menu that you use on your phone. I ordered the Happy Hour cheeseburger and a Blue Moon beer on tap. The burger was spot on delicious with love at first bite. The table service from our waiters was top notch because they kept checking up on us to make sure everything was okay and if we wanted to order anything else.

Cheesecake Factory is always a solid meal.  Be prepared for this location (and most others) to be crowded and busy!  The food rarely disappoints, but you need to know what to expect.  This is high quality food that is very standardized and the chef is trained to execute...not be creative.<br><br>Came here the other night with my family for a Saturday dinner out.  The kids had a meal from the kids menu, which they enjoyed and my wife and myself shared a Chinese Chicken Salad and the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta.  I usually get the pasta dish, and this one, just like all the others was very standardized and what I expected.  The Chinese Chicken Salad has begun to have way too many of the cruchy noodles and less of the actual lettuce.  I&#39;m sure this is how it is supposed to be made, but I wish there was more lettuce and less of the noodles.  Maybe I need to ask next time?<br><br>We made reservations via Yelp, and it worked great.  We quickly got seated before others who had put their names on a waitlist.  I appreciate the staff honoring the Yelp reservations and seating us relatively quickly.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is not the worlds fine dining, but it is somewhere you can grab a bit to eat and know what to expect.

The food is always consistent, excellent. Was able to eat inside during the small window opened.. remained socially distant. <br><br>Ordered through door dash. Very good experience. The Lettuce Wales were wonderful!!!

Came here the other evening with my parents. It was only a 10 minute wait for the 3 of us around 6:30 pm. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory many times. I typically order the four cheese pasta or the falafel salad from the superfoods menu. This time I ordered a couple things off of the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu. They were out of the grilled artichoke that I wanted. <br><br>I got the endive salad and the ahi tartare. Both were pretty good. They were off of the small plates menu but they were very small. And for $7-8 each I thought they were a bit on the expensive side for what they were. But they did taste pretty good. <br><br>The service was quite slow. It took longer than normal for our food to come out and they also forgot things when they brought out our food. My mom&#39;s tacos were missing the crema that comes on the side. I ordered my dressing on the side and they had to bring that separate as well. It just felt a little disorganized. <br><br>Next time I&#39;ll probably get the falafel salad and save some for later since it&#39;s so huge. The only downside is that if you want to add meat to your salad/food, it can be really expensive for the quality of food.

I&#39;ve always been a really big fan of the Cheesecake Factory. Their pastas are all very big, filling and delicious! I highly recommend the 4 cheese pasta! And my favorite is the lemon raspberry cheesecake!<br><br>I&#39;m taking off stars because our server, Nikki, was terrible. When my friend and I were ordering dessert we both said we wanted the same cheesecake and our server, Nikki, rudely said no, and that I had to order a different cheesecake. She questioned why I was ordering the same thing as my friend and told me to get the lemon meringue flavor and I said that&#39;s fine but I what I want is the lemon raspberry and she still said no. I couldn&#39;t grasp as to why She wouldn&#39;t accept my order. I didn&#39;t feel like arguing so I pointed at a random flavor. <br><br>I ended up not liking it. And, she passed by the table once more just to point and say &#34;oh wow you didn&#39;t even eat it.&#34;<br>And walked away.<br><br>I kept trying to get her attention to even get the check but she&#39;d make eye contact, help the tables next to us, and walk away. <br><br>I ended up having to ask another worker to get it.<br><br>Worst server, ever.

CHEESECAKE FACTORY MAINTAINS ITS REPUTATION<br><br>Cheesecake factory does well in ensuring that every cheesecake factory you go to, you enjoy your experience. Their system that they have in place secures their spot as one of the most sought after restaurants to dine in.<br><br>Huge thank you to Miguel, our server, for delivering excellent customer service with a smile and prompt timing. Also, an even bigger shout out to the front staff (two ladies) working Saturday evening. Ya&#39;ll made it happen, ya&#39;ll were kind, ya&#39;ll made it possible.<br><br>Food was excellent, as always. Would highly suggest their Gumbo dish and cherry chocolate cheesecake. They came in clutch after a long day.<br><br>Tip: Once you book a table, if it&#39;s gonna take a while, have someone from your party stay at the restaurant and once you&#39;re up, you call your party and tell them to come. We had a slight miscommunication error and it cost us 30 minutes extra time. Our fault though, not the restaurant so yeah I think this tip would be beneficial for both the restaurant and the party.<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake factory! I&#39;ve got like 5 more cheesecakes to try out and I will have finished my tasting test of all your cheesecakes!

I place two (2) orders for pick up on 7/3. One was placed at 12pm and the other was placed at 3:30. Both to be picked up at 4:15pm. When I came to pick it up, it was a hot mess. Two lines - one to check in and the other one after you checked in with one of the workers. I waited more than 45 minutes to picked up an order that was supposed to be ready at a certain time. Doordash people get priority before anyone else, so heads up. I&#39;m super disappointed for having to wait this much. What&#39;s the purpose of picking your food at a certain time if you&#39;re going to wait? :/

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory many times and it never disappoints.  Sometimes the service may be slow, but otherwise, the food &amp; service is always good.<br><br>Some of my favorite foods -<br><br>The complimentary brown bread - OMG, I can eat baskets of the bread.  A bit sweet, soft &amp; topped with oats. Add a bit of butter.... It&#39;s perfection. <br><br>Pasta di Vinci - chicken, mushrooms &amp; onions sautéed in a creamy Marsala sauce with penne pasta.  Sooo yummy. <br><br>Miso salmon - delicious grilled salmon atop a bed of white or brown rice with a cream sauce &amp; sweet teri sauce with snow peas.<br><br>Thai lettuce wraps - build your own wraps with grilled chicken strips, carrots, noodles, cucumbers with cashew, peanut &amp; soy sauces. It&#39;s messy! It&#39;s a light filling meal. <br><br>Avocado eggrolls - OMG!  Chunks of avocado with a great seasoning and fried to perfection. Dip it in the yummy cashew sauce! <br><br>The list of cheesecakes is epic!  My faves include the Tiramisu cheesecake &amp; Vanilla Bean cheesecake.  Both are on the less sweet side. <br><br>Let me talk about the Happy Hours @ Monday - Friday 4-6pm in the bar area. Great munchies including the sweet corn tamale cakes, Buffalo blast chicken, sliders &amp; yummy drinks. <br><br>The service is usually on point. <br><br>The ambiance is nice as it is very open with big windows to the street. It&#39;s clean and organized, no complaints here. <br><br>It is located at a very busy corner and parking is available in the structures. <br><br>Recommended!

You could never go wrong with Cheesecake factory. I come here when my friends and I can&#39;t decide on a certain style of food. What I love about Cheesecake Factory is all the options. They have American, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, etc. They have great appetizers my favorite are the Mac n cheese balls and avocado rolls. Some of my favorite dishes are the lemon chicken, chicken Parmesan, the filet, and all the pastas are amazing. All the cheesecakes are phenomenal I try to taste a different one each time but you can&#39;t go wrong with the classic cheesecake.

Came here with about 25-30 coworkers which was a great choice since they have a wide variety of dishes. This location has never disappointed me and customer service has always been great. One thing though it can be pretty cold here as their a/c is strong. Got something new and different which was the Louisiana Chicken Pasta which was really tasty.

I dropped in for a quick lunch at the Pasadena Cheesecake Factory.  In mulling over the extensive menu, I opted for their Asian Chicken Salad.  Service was very prompt and courteous, and the salad made its way to my table in good time.<br><br>The salad comes in two different sizes, lunch and dinner.  I&#39;m happy I selected the lunch size, because as it turns out, it was a good size.  The salad was tasty and fresh.  I do believe it was a healthier choice for me that some of the other items on the menu.<br><br>Given their central location in downtown Pasadena, the quality of the food and the service, I would definitely go back again.  And I would certainly recommend it!

Lindas chocolate cake was sooo good! The food was also good only thing I can say is the jambalaya pasta could use some more seasoning or flavor, other than that good experience. This was a DoorDash delivery btw.

I called at 8:30pm on August 12, 2019 to place an order for a Louisiana chicken pasta. The lady in bakery stated 15 minutes it&#39;ll be ready. I pull up at 8:40pm, my assistant goes in, foods not ready. No problem. Waits and next thing u know it&#39;s 9:00pm. I then called the restaurant, spoke with the manager and he stated, let me check on ur order and gets back and stated my assistant left 10 minutes ago. <br>So, I said I&#39;m parked right in front of your restaurant (meaning I see who goes in and out) and he replies how would I know that? But granted, few seconds later I hung up, my assistant came out. <br><br>If the manager is willing to lie about something so small as to how long ago my assistant left. How can you really trust the dude? <br>I was literally parked in front where I could see my assistant sitting and waiting.<br><br>All in all, shitty service.

Why Oh Why do I come to these Cheesecake Factories?! They do not care for folks who do not eat chicken or meat. Of course, they will delete chicken and/or meat, but they will not delete the $6-8 they would add to your bill if you Added  those same exact items. No one needs indigestion from being ripped off by the lazy restaurant management. Dishes: Every dish is the same at every restaurant. Quality Control is job #1. <br>Used to get the fish tacos but at $17 for about 3 ounces of fish is insulting.

Probably the last time I will ordering food from here. The prices are extremely ridiculous for the quality of the food. I ordered a ceasar salad with pasta and fried zucchini. My total came out to approx. $60 which I thought was a little too much but I&#39;ve eaten here before and the food always came out good. This time, my pasta and the fried zucchini  were dripping in grease, I had to throw them away. Waste of $60. The only thing that I could eat was the ceasar salad. So upset, wasted my hard earned money.

This place has really fallen off the tracks, right? It used to be such a nice place to go. That&#39;s in the past. <br><br>Service is decent. But not strong enough to carry this place. The receptionist are rude and unkempt. <br><br>The menu is ridiculously long. It takes 30 minutes to read through. The vast majority of options are very high-caloric. The desserts are so sweet you can&#39;t even finish one alone.<br><br>All of this and they still charge such high prices. I got a $10 salad and I thought they were joking and brought me a side salad. <br><br>Don&#39;t recommend! So many better options in Old Town to choose from.

Note: If you come here on a Sunday morning/afternoon, considerably lower your expectations. <br><br>My mom and I arrived for lunch yesterday and were promptly seated thisclose to another table. We felt so uncomfortable and asked if we could be seated in a different spot. Switch was no problem. Shortly thereafter, our server arrived and introduced another woman as his &#34;friend who will be taking over&#34; while he goes on break. She was awful. Completely inattentive and kept disappearing to the point where we really wanted to just switch servers altogether, but we stuck it out. She went away and then when she returned, we asked for straws. We were ready to give her our orders, until she immediately left to get straws as soon as she heard the word, dropped them off and sped away. <br><br>More waiting. She finally returned after I got up and tried to find her, and she said that all of her tables were closing at the same time, so she was trying to get them situated. Ok. What about us? They&#39;re more important because they&#39;re closing out? Could the guy leaving have picked another server or even a manager to help, if she was this overwhelmed? We ordered, and instead of hauling her down again for a drink, I went to the bar. <br><br>The bartender had his back facing the bar, as he was at the computer. I said hello. No answer. Then &#34;I&#39;d like to order a drink when you&#39;re free.&#34; No answer. Was this guy so deep in thought that he couldn&#39;t hear a customer? Finally he turned around. I ordered a Strawberry Martini. He made it quickly and gave it to me without strawberries on the rim. I&#39;ve had this drink more than a few times, and I know what it should include, after all, it&#39;s a $15+ drink. I asked for a strawberry, and he said they would need to get more. He told a manager, and I waited for probably five minutes at the bar. Strawberries arrived, he rinsed them, and asked if I wanted one or two. I said two, and he placed them on the rim. Not trying to pick on berries, but he chose two of the blah-est looking ones. Give a girl the biggest, reddest berries in the package, since you had her waiting from the second she walked up!<br><br>Made it back to the table, food arrived and it was pretty ok. Nothing spectacular, in fact, we asked a manager for a side of Teriyaki sauce to go with my mom&#39;s Teriyaki chicken dish, since the rice that came with it didn&#39;t have anything on it. My Almond-Crusted Salmon Salad was tasty  but could have used more dressing for sure. <br><br>We ordered a slice of Strawberry Cheesecake with our original server, who conveniently returned just as our dining experience ended, and that was it. We took our leftovers, as well as two flatbreads we had ordered to go, and left. I can&#39;t see myself ever going here again.

Went there today for lunch but the wait was 45 minutes. So I decided to order to go. They said 15 minutes. So I ordered a low calorie fish plate. I waited 35 minutes and asked if my meal would be ready soon. The guy host in the front said would you like to be seated now I said sure and he went back to check on my food. He came back with the food in a bag and said the wait for a table would be another 30 minutes???? Lol. I said no thank you im starving and I left with my order. As I was leaving I noticed there was an open table uncleaned outside. I guess he just stands there and waits for someone else to buss the tables. Any way when I hot home to eat the food was not warm but it was very yummy.

This is a standard Cheesecake Factory with standard food and standard service.<br><br>Even with a half empty restaurant they make you wait at least ten minutes to be seated.  There is not much waiting space in the entry area and it is hard to not feel in the way as people are checking in with the hostess and picking up to go orders.<br><br>The best thing about Cheesecake Factory is the extensive menu.  I think this is arguably the biggest menu in the country.  There is truly something for everyone and every diet.  Most of the food borders on extremely unhealthy, though I do appreciate the full disclosure of caloric content.  My go to is often the Louisiana chicken pasta, which with my luck, is the entree with one of the highest calorie counts on the menu.  On lighter days I like the tuna tataki salad.  I love that they have small bites at great prices which are perfect for sharing without too much guilt.  Of course, every meal should end with cheesecake and the fresh strawberry is my fave.<br><br>Service is a bit slow and scattered, even at off hours.  Overall, it&#39;s the best you could ask for from a chain restaurant.

The food is fine/ok here but the cheesecake is the redeeming factor.  Tonight I asked a manager to honor the certificates that expired during the mandatory covid shut down.   (They expired while the store was closed and we couldn&#39;t use them at all.)  They refused to honor the certificates.  This has happened at another restaurant in Pasadena and there was absolutely no questions asked they just honored the certificates graciously.  Not only were we told no but we were told NO RUDELY.  Sadly we ended up spending too much money on average food with no dessert.  Next time I may pick up dessert only.  Dinner at Grainville who stood by their certificates!

I&#39;ve never ordered takeout where I had to come home and add my own seasoning in order for my food to be edible! It&#39;s like the head chef doesn&#39;t taste the sauces or dishes before things are put together! <br><br>We ordered Buffalo Blast, Chicken Bellagio and Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo. The best part of this entire order was the pineapple upside down cheesecake! The rest of the order was money wasted. <br><br>The buffalo blast are supposed to have buffalo sauce inside, I mean, they&#39;re called buffalo blast for a reason! Well, they didn&#39;t have a drop of buffalo sauce in them. So disappointing! <br><br>My Chicken Fettuccine looked way better than it taste. The Alfredo sauce tasted like it came straight out of a jar! It wasn&#39;t seasoned or cheesy at all. I mean, where is the garlic and parmesan cheese. The chicken was chicken without seasoning as well and it was breaded with NO SEASONING! Like, how sway!? I ended up getting BBQ sauce and eating the chicken like tenders <br><br>My wife&#39;s Chicken Bellagio was just as bland. She said the best part was the prosciutto and arugula on top. She had to add seasoning to make hers edible as well. Just horrible! <br><br>We won&#39;t be eating at this location ever again! We didn&#39;t even finish half our food, that&#39;s how bad it was. <br><br>We won&#39;t be ordering from here AT ALL!

Normally I love The Cheesecake Factory. I was staying at a near by hotel and ordered the Chicken Enchilada&#39;s from the local CCF (Cheesecake Factory Old Town Pasadena) to by delivered by door dash, who did a great job. It was a horrible meal. I couldn&#39;t eat it. It came with the enchiladas, rice and beans. Very, very disappointing. Absolutely not worth the money.

The worst service ever and this is only for two frozen cheesecakes that were ordered and paid for in advance. I placed an online order early in the morning on 7/3 and asked to pick up at 2PM one original cheesecake and a banana cheesecake. My husband gets there and it is a cluster of people either waiting around for hours to pick up their meals or canceling their orders because they were waiting for hours. When my husband complained one of the workers told him there is a better place in Eagle Rock to buy cheesecakes. Thanks for the advice because as much as we like the food at Cheesecake factory, they will never get a dime of our business again. Shame on you for putting all these people at risk during a pandemic.

We were almost at the end of our road trip and stopped in Pasadena after a day trip in Los Angeles.  My party didn&#39;t really have a consensus on what type of food we should have for dinner so we decided to try the local Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>It&#39;s located in what seems to be Pasadena&#39;s  quaint downtown area.  I love the different stores and lights along Colorado Blvd but it was a very cool and windy night to be strolling.  We parked our car in a public car park just across from the resto; first 90 mins was free!<br><br>The restaurant was buzzy when we walked in and was sat within 10 minutes.  The restaurant was dark but had enough light to read their massive menu.  It was also very loud as it was packed with lots of younger people and even some families celebrating birthdays (the wait staff still sing for the diners!) <br><br>Our waitress was superb!  She was very engaging and helpful.  When she found out that we preferred the brown whole wheat bread from the wonderful bread basket she brought us, she brought us some more and suggested we dip it in their house ranch dressing.  She was right; the sweetness of the whole wheat and the richness of the ranch married so well! I would&#39;ve been so happy just eating that but I had to restrain myself.<br><br>I ordered the Chicken Piccata with angel hair pasta. I was overwhelmed when I received my dish as there were 3 pieces of chicken and a big serving of pasta (or maybe because I ate too much of their wonderful bread!)  Unfortunately, I was a bit underwhelmed by my main. The sauce was creamy with a hint of lemon with plenty of sautéed mushrooms.  I would prefer a bit more lemon.  The pasta was a bit gummy so had to swirl it around the sauce to separate them.  The chicken was a bit dry and had to be dragged through the sauce to get more taste.  On the other hand, I tasted the &#39;Famous Meatloaf&#39; someone on my table ordered and it was full of flavour and nicely grilled on both ends with rich brown gravy. <br><br>My main was meh but our waitress (sorry I forgot that lovely girl&#39;s name) and her suggestion to elevate the already delicious whole wheat bread with ranch was excellent.

Horrible service over the phone. I called to ask about the $20 deal meal and the girl who picked up the phone said she &#34;will go get the manager&#34;. I waited on the line for ten minutes but no one ever picked it up again.

The worse experience ever!  Completely ruined my Father&#39;s Day for my father who&#39;s celebrating his first Father&#39;s Day as a grandfather,  after a major surgery he underwent during Covid19.  I placed an online order for their 10&#34; mango keylime cheesecake to be picked up on Father&#39;s Day. This location charged my card and then 20 minutes before my pick up time, sends me an email stating there was an error with my order.  I was already at the parking structure waiting with my crying toddler!  When I called from my car,  I was on hold for 30 minutes before someone came on the phone to tell me they no longer had the cheesecake flavor I had ordered at 9am!  I asked to replace my order with a different flavor and the gal said I had to place a brand new order and come into the restaurant and wait in line for it!  Seriously?  Wtf?  I told her my situation and all she could say was, &#34;sorry for the inconvenience.&#34;  I am not waiting in line with a baby who&#39;s too young to wear a mask!  The whole point of ordering online is so that my husband can just walk in and pick up the item while I waited in the car with our baby and head over to Father&#39;s Day family dinner.<br><br>Oh...and you can&#39;t order days ahead!  So I had to order the day-of for online orders,  which I did! This tells me that they had my item and just sold it because they weren&#39;t paying attention to their stock!  And why didn&#39;t I go into the restaurant?  Because of Covid 19 my husband was just going to go in pick up the cheesecake. Now,  we&#39;re driving around town scrambling to find a cake for Father&#39;s Day dinner.<br><br>Seriously, we are never coming back to this location unless management can get their act together!   Worse experience ever!  Do not order online unless you want your card charged for an order they cannot fulfill and will give priority to those who actually show up at the doors to wait in line during a pandemic. Btw, I was also told it&#39;ll take them 7 days for the refund to be processed! Seriously?  Wtf?!?  Why even charge me for an order you couldn&#39;t fill?  It&#39;s been beyond an inconvenience and a little &#34;sorry&#34;  from the gal who answered the phone is completely unacceptable!   I just wanted to make today extra special for my Dad and I&#39;m just super pisted and beyond disappointed now. Never coming back and I hope those who value good service will do the same.

The. Worst.  First off, food is way overpriced for the quality and service. <br><br>I came with my two children on a Thursday at 5:30pm.  I was sat in the bar area, which I thought was odd with two children. We ordered one adult entree, and one child&#39;s entree. I had to remind the server to bring our drinks. Then, each meal was brought our separately.  This upset my young daughter because she was hungry and saw her brother eating.  Rule #1 with kids:  bring their food first, or everything altogether. Also, the food took forever to get, and they weren&#39;t that busy.  AND.... the chicken was very dry, and my daughter wouldn&#39;t eat it. <br><br>But the part that bothered me the most was that our server - after attempting to call her over to my table (I politely called her by saying &#34;excuse me miss.&#34; ) I was waived off and told to hold on, not because she was helping anyone, but because she was having a conversation with two men about their freshly inked tattoos. Nothing upsets me more than a server that ignores me after serving the food, as if no other service was needed.<br><br>Cheesecake - either improve your food or lower your inflated prices. And train your servers better. <br><br>Will not be back. It&#39;s a tourist trap anyways.

These guys are bad when it comes to delivering. Hey if you want brown rice make sure you put white rice instead, they will always do the exact opposite. Want extra sauce? They will give you condiments you didn&#39;t ask for. New manager took over this year but does that change anything? Nope, tough titty.
I have never been to a Cheesecake Factory so I decided to give them a try today. What a mistake-Bad food and bad service. The ice tea was the only saving grace.

Same as other locations. Large menu, lots of choices for everyone. Location is in Old Town Pasadena so a mix of locals and tourists. Food is tasty and price point is good. Service is friendly and  efficient. Can be a bit loud, this is not a quiet, first-time date type of place. Had the shrimp/ chicken w/ pineapple and it was delicious. Cannot leave without enjoying their cheesecake! They don&#39;t validate just park at one of the structures nearby. Hope to be back soon!

Ordered food to go. No organizations at all. With Covid-19 most stores have x on the floor to stand six feet apart or a sign. We were all yelled at to go outside. The manager wearing jeans, may be Tamera was standing there in shock looking at us and yelling that only six people at a time. She said don&#39;t you know the law we could be shut down. That is for her to manage not the customers. When she walked away she said I better not see this when I come back. One customer showed her the phone and she said move back, but wasn&#39;t very nice about it. This was the worst experience I&#39;ve had at any takeout restaurant during Covid-19.

Okay , I&#39;ve been a patron at this Cheese cake factory for 7 + years as long as I&#39;ve worked across the street , and although this isn&#39;t the first time the service was less than i really enjoy the food and the convenience of it being across the street from my work so i continue to order from them , i regret it every time . I&#39;ve spoken to managers about the poor customer service there before and it just hasn&#39;t gotten better . I always place my order online in advance bc I&#39;m on (timed) lunch and I want to just walk in and pick up my food. Today was kind of the tipping point for me . There was a customer ahead of me who ordered some cheese cakes (plural ) and wanted the workers to unbox each one so she can see them , which is fine that&#39;s their job but there were two of them helping her while there was now a line behind me , mind you I&#39;m on a timed lunch and i purposely ordered ahead of time so i can be in and out of there. I asked the hostess to check the order that had been sitting in the counter since i arrived to check if it was mine . She checks and says it&#39;s not mine ; it&#39;s finally my turn and i repeat my name now to the cashier and she tells me this this is your order , so not only did i have to wait for my order that was sitting on the counter the whole time when i finally sat down to eat my food was cold  I received no apology not even a sorry about that or sorry for the wait .. . I truly have no hope for this particular Cheesecake Factory , I&#39;ve also waited 10 min for a strawberry lemonade not once but twice ..you think i would have learned my lesson . That is all for now . I&#39;d like to say this time i wont be back .

Be aware. People there they have no clue how to use properly disposable glove....me and my friend ordered a piece of cheesecake and people there used the same gloves to put on the computer and charged our order and failed to change the glove even after the fact we notice and mentioned ask for different piece because she was touching everything with The dirty glove and failed again to get a new gloves.....

This location is pretty busy and located in busy Old Pasadena. Parking is mostly paid unless you find parking on the street. The staff was attentive and kind. Food did take awhile to come out but it was the weekend lunch rush. <br><br>I had the Spicy Cajun pasta which was scrumptious but wish it was a little more on the spicier side. I asked for more of the cajun seasoning on the side. The waiter did say next time I can ask them to make it spicier. <br><br>All in all, if you go during a less busy day like during the weekday. I am sure there will be less waiting time for the food. Definitely great for a date to any celebration like a birthday or good- bye party.

It&#39;s always busy in here!  But this review mostly focuses on their happy hour.  Such a great happy hour with the drink options and the food options.  You get all your money&#39;s worth.  I&#39;m going, usually quick to grab a seat at the bar, and the staff there are typically very patient and attentive, especially with how busy the rest of the place can be.  <br><br>The chicken samosas and the beet and cheese salad or delicious options for happy hour apps.  <br><br>It&#39;s hard to go wrong here, and if you love cheesecake, this place will always hit the spot.

The Cheesecake Factory was amazing like always any negative reviews have to be something over really silly or those people&#39;s expectations are over the roof and never satisfied. I never have a bad experience the waiter was nice the food came on time even with a full house I didnt have to wait since I made reservations and when the food arrived it was so good and large quantity! If you havent gone I recommend that you do  those who complain about the price, dont go if you cant afford a &#34;$$&#34; meal

This place is incredible!!! Really friendly staff and some of the best customer experience I have ever had. They also offer great takeout options which is especially important now because of Covid. I would highly recommend the guacamole salad with chicken.

I don&#39;t care what people say... so what it&#39;s chain, portions are too big  and unhealthy, IT IS DAMN GOOD!<br>You can&#39;t go wrong with your order every thing tastes amazing...Love the buttery, creamy, and garlicky flavors <br>Bonus, just found out you can get their delicious breakfast omelettes during the week too!

I&#39;m not positive why your chocolate mousse cheesecake is not on the DoorDash menu option however when calling and asking if they would accommodate the gentleman on the phone was so extremely kind. You guys always exceed my expectations when it comes to quality taste, but customer service goes a long way. Thank you for those who were working tonight. Glad you guys are still in buisness through this hard time. Thank you for the marvelous chocolate mousse and exceptional customer service! YOU ARE APPRECIATED
I have ordered online and given a pick up time.  I need to wait more than an hour for my pick up.  If you can&#39;t fulfill an order within a reasonable time.  Do NOT accept an order!

This is ridiculous for Mother&#39;s Day pickup order. All people are waiting outside for 1 or 2 hrs. My order receipt shown food ready by 5:18pm. We were waiting outside for 1 hr.  When we finally got closed to the front, they told us the food was not ready. We canceled the order then. Come on, if your store can not handle this then don&#39;t open your online ordering. This is really disappointed and waste time and ruined the Mother&#39;s Day.

Want to be treated badly and pay lots of money? This is the perfect place for that. The food is not excellent but it doesn&#39;t help that the service was bad, too. <br><br>I came here with a party of 2 and from start to finish, we felt totally ignored. Mind you, it wasn&#39;t even busy during the time we dined, there were plenty of empty tables around. It was pretty inexcusable for us to wait 15 minutes for our orders to be taken; not sure if out server totally forgot about our table or they were busy chitchatting with their colleagues. <br><br>I felt like our table had to basically chase after the server to be served properly because we were ignored throughout our dining experience. It feels terrible to spend so much money and have the server not even care about making your dining experience a good or even decent one. I can see why a majority of the reviews on here rate badly for the service. The service at this location is severely lacking which is surprising for such a well-established restaurant. Wow.

Tried to order the 20$ promotion for pickup in Pasadena, ca.<br>After waiting an hour past the scheduled pickup time we still didnt have our food,husband was given tons of excuses and even sent the text that the order was ready from the store but when he went to the counter was told they were sending out the text that orders were ready even though they werent so that customers wouldn&#39;t leave.<br>We never got our food nor confirmation that our order would be cancelled.<br>Not to mention they kept crossing out names on order boxes and drinks and writing different names.<br>They had no idea what they were doing.<br>People walking in to order were leaving before us with their orders.<br>Meanwhile we waited over an hour for nothing.<br>I contacted corporate to voice my concerns via their online contact form and facebook.<br>So yesterday afternoon Tamara from Pasadena store called me and began to leave a voicemail with her &#34;heartfelt apology&#34; that quickly trailed off into silence and a hang up.<br>I&#39;m sure shes tired of making these calls but she wouldnt have to if the restaurant was ran correctly.<br>I thought maybe she got disconnected and would call me back BUT SHE NEVER DID.<br>this is how you guys do  &#34;heartfelt apologies &#34;????
Food was cold<br>Insufficient waitstaff<br>Too long to get checks<br>Management did not care <br>People waited forever around us to get check, including us

If you ordered online for pick up today, they are running late!  I&#39;ve been in line to get my order which would be ready at 5:47 pm since 6:04 pm. The line stretches from Fair Oaks almost down to Delacey. Parking is also challenging as all of the public parking lots are closed. Their phone is just a busy signal.

Went here to pick up lunch and it was an hour and half of unorganized hot mess.<br><br>1) There was a check in line and a pick up line that managed to turn into 4 lines. So now the lines were check in, pick up, door dash, or been waiting for over 45 mins.<br><br>2) No social distancing or any one enforcing masks. <br><br>3) Gave us the wrong order<br><br>Cheesecake factory was unorganized and careless. Wasn&#39;t worth it.

My order is over 90 minutes late and I am still in line waiting for my prepaid online pickup order. Cannot enter the store to cancel my order and no one at the restaurant is bothering to pick up the phone. <br><br>Spent one hour waiting in line to &#34;check in&#34; and will probably spend another hour waiting in line to pick up my food. Very poorly organized and will not order online pickup at this location again.

Disappointed experience.... <br>I love Cheesecake Factory probably one of my favorite restaurants. BUT today was a different story. During this lockdown I&#39;ve been taking food to elder family members today I received an email about ordering online and receiving a free piece of cheesecake so I did that. I ordered 2 dinners and during checkout it did not allow me to get my free slices. <br>Long story short, the girls told me I could only get 1 Alice if bread per bag even though both dinners were going to different people. I got my extra piece of bread after talking to the manager but she said I must have not entered my &#34;promo code&#34; right to get my slices of cheesecake. Which was so WRONG because I still ordered online and they should have granted it.

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve had Cheesecake Factory. Last week, my friend and I were deciding where to grab dinner from, as many different options were open in the Old Town Pasadena area. We decided upon Cheesecake, as we were craving pasta with the recent cold weather. We were directed to Takeout and placed our order with the Takeout employee. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and my friend ordered the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic. We debated ordering an appetizer to share, our eyes on the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes. I had asked the Takeout employee how much the Tamale Cakes cost, and he informed me of the price. I shook my head &#34;no&#34; and said &#34;No thank you, just the pastas&#34;. After splitting the check, paying, and leaving to walk around Old Town Pasadena, we were both contemplating the split price we paid. Approximately $29 each. How could 2 pastas cost $60? When we returned back to pick up our food, I asked the same Takeout employee who had taken our order why the final price was so high for 2 pastas. He said that we ordered the 2 pastas and the Tamale Cakes. I corrected him, informing him that we did &#34;not&#34; order the Tamale Cakes, and I clearly told him no thank you. His response was, &#34;you said you wanted them&#34;, and he walked away, I assume to grab a manager to fix the situation. A few minutes later, an older hispanic woman who appeared to be the manager walks up to where our order was taken, performs several actions on the Posi Computer, reprints receipts, hands my friend and I our &#34;new&#34; totals, and says &#34;You should only see one charge on your account&#34;. She tells the Takeout employee to remove the Tamale Cakes from our already bagged order, and he does. We signed the new split checks, handed them to her (the manager), she gives the checks to the Takeout employee, and walks away. At no point does this &#34;manager&#34; greet my friend and I upon initially walking up to the Takeout computer. No apology for the overcharge on our cards, nor for the inconvenience this caused, as our meals were already ready to go, getting colder by the minute. After handing her back the new checks, again, no apology for the overcharge, minimal eye contact, as she seemed to be annoyed and angry with US about the situation, and then walked away with the Tamale Cakes the Takeout employee had removed. Didn&#39;t bother saying &#34;Have a good night&#34;, &#34;Thank you for coming&#34;, &#34;I&#39;m sorry this happened&#34;. I asked the Takeout employee for her name before leaving the restaurant, he informed me that her name is CANDICE. The level of unprofessionalism with this &#34;manager&#34; is truly sad and disappointing to witness and have experienced, knowing the high caliber Cheesecake&#39;s reputation has always held. Extremely unprofessional, bland and rude &#34;personality&#34;, non-apologetic, seemingly making it our fault for what happened, and to top it off, walking away without saying anything to my friend and I. Not to mention her bra strap was clearly showing and sticking out from her shirt. The professionalism I know Cheesecake to hold was utterly non-existent during this entire process. When it came time to eat our food, of course our food was cold, the pasta was hard, appearing to be undercooked, and the chicken in my Louisiana Chicken Pasta had a rubbery texture, indicating it was also undercooked. A truly disappointing experience with Cheesecake after not eating here for years. I have always gone to the Westfield Santa Anita Mall location, which I have never EVER had this problem with there. I recommend anyone thinking about coming to this Cheesecake location, to drive a few more minutes East, to the Cheesecake location in Arcadia. I look forward to hearing from Cheesecake regarding their response to this, as I will be reaching out to corporate soon if this situation is not dealt with, professionally.
This place have one of my favor Pastas <br><br>I love this place , the Food and the service is just great  <br><br>I recommend this restaurant

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory, what do you expect.  They have a huge menu of just about everything.  The food is pretty good, just average.  It&#39;s not about the food though, it&#39;s all about the delicious cheesecake.

Came here for my lunch break. Very fast and super friendly service. Gustavo was my waiter and he provided great customer service. I ordered the Almond Crusted Salmon Kale Salad and omg it was amazing!!!

Pick up orders are consistently late. Today wasn&#39;t bad, only a few minutes late. But they forgot to pack utensils and napkins this time. Haven&#39;t got it right in the 4 - 5 times I&#39;ve ordered to go.
I love this place. The drinks, the food, the desserts. Omg I don&#39;t even have words lol  Personally, the gumbo is my favorite. Delicious! A must try.

Centrally located in the middle of Pasadena this location seems as full serviced as the other locations.  <br><br>Do not bother calling in an order as they answer but then transfer you to a long hold --- I hung up after about a 20 minute wait.<br><br>The service is also somewhat slow as I was told 15-20 for a to go order and came back 30 minutes later and still waited about 5 minutes after.<br><br>I was also given an incomplete order,  so those looking to come here be sure to triple check what they give you!<br><br>Food quality is good
Good food. Great service. Very nice ambience and vibe. Will definitely be returning in the near future.
Went to Cheesecake Factory Pasadena and the food was great. There is a limited outdoor seating but only waited 30 minutes. Staff were great and very friendly. Will return again.

Ate here last night. Haven&#39;t been here in a while but always liked it. I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana Pizza style. Last time I order that! First off... it was a GIANT portion! The calories &amp; carbs were in the 1,000s( not a calorie counter but this was OVERKILL)! Tasted a little too bland for that much food to try to eat. I felt guilty for not taking home the leftovers... this is not what you want to heat up the next day! The 1/2 of the meal I did manage to take care of was too much to order the cheesecake after! I have to add though... Erica was GREAT... really. I&#39;m moving around the corner from them and look forward to more of her (without the chicken parm of course)! She&#39;s the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 1.

Well I just noticed I got no bread my friend ordered Lasagna verde but with Alfredo instead of marinara and wanted to add shrimp but they gave him the picture below. My food isn&#39;t there yet he has had his for like 5 min.<br>Okay I forgot to mention I got my chicken piccata finally. So bomb Omgeee I can&#39;t even say one bad thing about it. So delicious. We finally got our bread which was cold lol of course but I was satisfied with my meal feel bad for my bestie though when he got to the bottom of his lasagna it was burned haha poor guy

I have been to other locations, this one is not up to par with the rest. Went on a Monday night so not busy. Plenty of open tables but had to wait 15 minutes to get seated.<br><br>Ordered draft beer, stuffed mushrooms, and the ribeye.  Took 20 minutes to get a water. Then had to ask for bread. Mushrooms were good, but the steak was thin and bland. Green beans were raw, not even blanched (yes I know the difference). Bad service and poor food. Not a good combo.
This place is the worst. The girls here look miserable. They never smile and if you&#39;re here to pick up food, you will definitely get an attitude. Taking my money somewhere else. Forget this plac

Poor service. Not only is there a discriminatory undertone, but just generally unprofessional and slow service. They never acknowledge with you despite the low amount of customers. I had to wait a couple minutes just to get the attention of my server, I had to resort to waving my hand. When she finally came to my table, she opened with a smirky comment on how it is impolite to wave. What I find more impolite is how I was forced to resort to wave just to get service. <br>This place is just embarrassing compared to other restaurants like the one in Glendale. The service is so poor, its worth the 2 hour round drive just to eat in Glendale. <br>If you want to be scolded and ignored by your waiter, this place is for you. I&#39;m not masochistic or sadistic so this isn&#39;t my slice of cheesecake. <br>My experience might have been a unique one, but I seriously doubt it after seeing the other reviews. There just isn&#39;t room for doubt that this was a one time slip up. <br><br>Food wise? It&#39;s like Gordon Ramsey blessed the entire kitchen. Kitchen Nightmare? More like Kitchen Heaven with demonic servers. <br><br>TLDR: Go here if you&#39;re masochistic or sadistic and like to be ignored. Came here on Monday. Server was Priscilla.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory many times in different cities, I&#39;ve always enjoyed them, and I&#39;d have to say this one was the most disappointing. My husband and I stopped by for a quick dinner around 9pm on Sunday and were seated after a couple minute wait. <br><br>Our server came by and was prompt with taking our drink and food orders. We had the Warm Crab and Artichoke dip because on a previous trip to San Diego, we had this and it was utterly delicious. Except.... this time it wasn&#39;t. In San Diego, the dip was very creamy and only had crab and small chunks of artichoke. I don&#39;t know what was going on with this one but it came with giant chunks of artichoke and... BREAD? The dip was filled with chunks of soggy bread, like half the dip was just soggy croutons or something. I&#39;d imagine this is a good way to beef up portions without using expensive ingredients. I hope you enjoy bread on your bread. <br><br>I ordered the Grilled Porkchop and my husband got their Factory Burger. Our server dropped my chop off with no knife, so I had to flag her down to ask for one and she stopped by without saying anything and just stared at me like I was bothering her. I asked for a knife and some more water. Sat there for a while waiting since I couldn&#39;t cut the pork chop, until she finally came back and dropped it off without any apology. I guess steak knives are a luxury at Cheesecake Factory nowadays. <br><br>The chop was tasty. The beans were NOT trimmed at all. I hope they&#39;re at least washed. The amount of mashed potato was grossly disproportionate to anything else but who&#39;s gonna complain about more food? <br><br>My husband&#39;s burger was kind of a disaster. The fries legitimately tasted stale, like reheated McDonald&#39;s fries. He loves just about any kind of French fry and he had a hard time eating these. The burger came with NO sauce whatsoever when it was supposed to come with BBQ sauce. I tried a bite and it tasted like unseasoned beef with a lot of grease (fried onions, bacon, buttered bun). He took half of it home just so he could eat it with some sauce.

The Cheesecake Factory is consistent across all locations so we knew what we would be getting when dining at this Pasadena location. I got the grilled salmon with green beans and asparagus (instead of broccoli and potatoes) and I got the crispy Brussels sprouts appetizer, hold all the sauces and toppings. While the portions were a TAD BIT smaller at this locations then others I been to where I ordered the exact same thing, the food was delicious, so I couldn&#39;t complain. Everyone else seemed happy too. Oh and our server was super friendly as well, so really, over all, not a bad time, especially because we were looking for a place that would get us in and out in an hour or less (there was no wait on the Tuesday evening we went).
Low carb cheesecake tastes like the real thing. Even got my bestie hooked on it who is a diabetic and wants the occasional sweet.

The person serving us was so  wow she was so pretty and she made our dinner very plesent. She gave us fresh out of the oven white bread only (bf requested), she also told the chiefs to put extra bread crumbs on my mac n cheese , she also came and checked up on us to see how our dinner was/ let us know how many mins until our dishs came out. Mac was so delishhhhhh the bread crumbs made a significant difference i didnt like that the cheese was a bit waterie than i like but nevertheless, bomb dot com ! She was so lovely and soooooo nice :,) made us so happy. It was late at night (wed)  with not a lot of ppl .

It&#39;s always crowded, no matter what time it is on the weekends, but worth it!  My server was really nice, and sat my entire family of 4 fairly quickly.  We ordered our drinks, then our appetizers and entrees.  The servers are REALLY busy here, but still nice!  <br><br>Good location.<br><br>I always get the chicken farfalle.  Hubby got a big burger and enjoyed it.
Ordered to go and they forgot the bread and the calamari is half the usual serving. Very disappointed.
Always very good and consistent. Just don&#39;t look at the calories if you want to sleep at night. <br>Spicy Cashew Chicken is my go to here.

I had the oriental chicken salad for lunch on a week day.  Being a big eater and knowing that the salad cost 15 dollars i was expecting a great tasting salad with a good amount of chicken.  But, i got the opposite.  Salad was blant and i could count the pieces of chicken With 1 hand.  Moreover, the lady assign to me had attitute.  Whatever, at least their bread and butter they serve is still one of the best.  I will come back just for appetizer and dessert and staying from salads here.

I took take out last night for two pastas and the total with tip came out to about $43 <br><br>We ordered the carbonara with chicken and the chicken bellagio. <br><br>1 STAR for the QUALITY. My friend and I tasted our respective pastas and found that they were EXTREMELY BLAND. We had to try and add salt and pepper to salvage the taste. We were incredibly disappointed because Cheesecake Factory is a well-known &#34;higher class&#34; chain. We found that we could have made the pasta better tasting and for a far cheaper price. The whole meal tasted bland of cheap quality and I feel completely ripped off. The pasta is way too oiled and the chicken tastes as though it&#39;s from McDonald&#39;s or a restaurant a bit of higher quality. <br><br>THE WAIT: it took about 35 minutes for us to receive our food upon our request of asking for it. I had previously asked for bread and butter but the workers didn&#39;t include the butter nor any napkins. <br><br>The problem isn&#39;t as much the price as the quality. I go to republique in Downtown LA where the pastas are $40 each and my boyfriend and I each order one for ourselves but the quality makes up for the high price. <br><br>Overall, we don&#39;t plan on returning for over-priced, bland food that isn&#39;t worth the price. <br><br>Here is a photo of my food halfway after I ate it. Overly greasy, oiled, and plan - very unappetizing for its price.

Ahh....Cheesecake!<br>The menu here is ALWAYS off the wall bonkers for choices!!!!<br><br>There must be at least two to four pages for each course in this book they call a &#34;menu&#34;.<br>This place has so many choices to choose from, you could easily read it like a Sunday Newspaper with a cup of coffee for thirty minutes.<br>Just when you think you may have found your meal during your visit. You may make the dreaded mistake of turning to the next page to find the next thing appealing to your tastebuds. Leaving you with the ultimatums of having your server choose for you, or you searching for a quarter to flip for what you hope will be the right food choice to satisfy your rumbling, grumbling now indecisive tummy.<br><br>The one thing that Cheesecake Factory&#39;s insane menu has going for itself is all the multi cuisine flavor options to any and all their courses. Because of this very Fact! <br>You could easily just go here for appetizers and drinks only, turning into a sampling for a group of friends. Like a Tapas bar.  Which I have done on more than one occasion. It turns out to be a lot of fun and enjoyable this way. Without having to make just one decision, you can enjoy the taste of many food items here.<br><br>Some of the good appetizers-<br>-Nachos with chicken <br>-Their potstickers are good, but taste much better if you cut into them while their still on the appetizer plate to allow the sauce on the bottom to absorb inside.<br>-Their hot dip appetizers<br>Just to name a few.<br><br>Granted their main menu items are all pretty tasty as well. <br>Many of their pastas dishes, fish dishes are all<br>Good and a less guilt free option before you look at the dessert section. <br><br>Love their chicken tortilla soup!<br>Can make a nice combo with one of their sandwiches or a side salad. <br><br>I&#39;ve  tried most of their cheesecakes over the years.<br>-Their white chocolate raspberry is ALWAYS on point and a go-to favorite!<br>-Oreo is yummy!<br>-Their Pumpkin cheesecake has officially ruined me of ever wanting another pumpkin pie again. Without having a flashback and wanting to make the drive back just for a piece of this.<br>-Their Pecan Carmel Turtle Cheesecake puts my southern ancestry DNA doing Happy Dance backflips!<br>-There&#39;s rarely a bad cheesecake in the bunch.<br>But.... their key lime is horrid! Perhaps it was a bad batch? Something turned? There was just something horribly wrong with this. Which makes me sad, because I normally love the taste of all things key lime. But MAN....just yuck!!!!<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is for a better lack of the term,  &#34;a yummy -but EVIL guilty pleasure food institution in all of the BEST ways!&#34;. Most of everything on their menu is going to temp you, your tastebuds, your mind, your waistline  and pummel it all into a happy submission. It&#39;s a place perfect for special gatherings, events, first dates and maybe once a month returns without your cardiologist appearing as a mini  angel on your right shoulder smacking their menu away from your hands.<br>YELLING AT YOU: ..,NO! BAD....! ....ohhh.... is that their new seasonal monthly cheesecake....? <br>Yup! That&#39;s Cheesecake Factory for ya...<br><br>Here&#39;s to guilty food pleasures! -CHEERS!!!!-<br>Until the next review!<br>-Jonesy-

Love this place. This location holds a special place in my heart. It&#39;s where my now husband and I went to eat when we first started talking. I always get the lemon chicken picatta. The customer service is usually good. Not a long wait time.

EXTREMELY SLOW SERVICE!  If I could give them a 0 rating, I would. My wife and I came here for lunch.  We both ordered salads.  Our original waiter went on his break while we waited for our salads.  Well, he came back 30 minutes later and our salads had not been brought to us.  Talked to manager.  Nice guy but totally ineffective.  Our salads finally came a full 40 minutes later.  Under these circumstances you figure the manager would at least offer a dessert. Nope! Never came to check. Nothing was offered.  The only one who apologized for this unacceptable slow service was the waiter.  Pasadena has many restaurants that offer better service.  I highly recommend you do NOT come here.

Came here for lunch on a weekday with my partner and was seated right away! I had forgotten the huge portions the Cheesecake Factory is known for and definitely went over-zealous with the lunch menu. We ordered fish+chips, a &#39;lunch-sized&#39; pizza, and a clam chowder soup + salad to share. We ended up not even touching the pizza (took it to go) and barely finishing the other dishes because we were so full! The fish and chips were nicely fried, golden, and cripsy; the soup was creamy and delicious and not watered down at all. I was so satisfied after this meal, that I didn&#39;t even have the capacity to enjoy one of their famous cheesecakes! <br><br>Service was quick and friendly (prompt water refills!) while parking was easy in the neighboring free 90 min lots. Will be coming back in the future and, hopefully, trying out their cheesecake!

The hostess named SiSi or CiCi was extremely rude , with horrible attitude , not answering questions, turning her back to us when we ask her a question.  It was very dissapointing to us and our in-laws who came from abroad and wanted to enjoy the food and the time.  Absolutely horrible and undeserved experience from this specific hostess.  A waitress offered a tray table to put a baby seat on, which is extremely unstable and endangeres the safety of the baby. And the manager doesn&#39;t seem to care one bit, nor was she willing to tell anything to the hostess or the waitress. <br>A face of the restaurant and a person who greets you, she is the face who turn people away from the restaurant. Horrible.

Great experience! Had a fun celebration with my fam. Our server Tyler was super helpful. There was another server, a lady, who was very kind as well. Thank you for a wonderful meal for my graduation dinner!

I always go to cheese cake factory but I came to the Glendale one this time and my waiter was very friendly, but my only complaint is that she would take a while to check up on us because of how busy it is. Our food was very good and I always stick to my usual chicken bialago, very good and tasty. I really would recommend to come in the afternoon no later then 6, Because the wait for two was about 45min or try another location. Sense it&#39;s in the galleria it tempts to get very pack then other locations. Our drinks and our food and the amount of bread we kept getting deserves a 5 star but the amount we had to wait to ask for another refill took a while now that&#39;s a 4 start for me.

I hope this place survives the C.v...All the food is super fattening and delicious which ever way you spin it.  Take a long walk down Colorado Blvd when your done.  Burn some calories !  <br>I found it curious when I was there, an Ellen DeGeneres cult here permeated the facility, campaigning for equal rights about 6 or 7 months ago.  Hardcore lesbians with ellen t-shirts, duct tape, and blindfolds in hand.  It was the weirdest thing.  Just another day in L.A. 6 months ago .I will return next time in town to fill my belly!!

I can&#39;t believe this is my first Cheesecake Factory review. I love this place. I used to get their shrimp and bacon club sandwich but sadly, they removed it from the menu. HUGE MISTAKE! I boycotted for a year before their Chicken Picatta pulled me in. Then their appetizer crab cake balls (forgot the name) quickly became a routine favorite. While on disability some months back, I tried their Philly Cheesesteak and again, delish! It&#39;s like this place can do no wrong food wise. <br><br>Recently I took another visit and got their CA Cheesesteak. I had to make some changes because I&#39;m picky and oooo weeee, again, delish! Not a fan of cheese sauce so I substituted for garlic mayo. Because I love cheese, I asked for extra cheese. The sandwich was delivered to the table looking ooey and gooey and I was too happy! A side of bleu cheese dressing for my french fries and I was SET for dinner! <br><br>Our waiter, I think his name was Ray, at least that&#39;s what my friend kept calling him lol, was fantastic!! He showed much patience with our indecisiveness and substitutions, then he showed his sense of humor as well. He was great. We couldn&#39;t wait to give him a 20% tip. We normally give 20% anyway but Ray, he deserved way more. Budgets, however, were at play lol. <br><br>Other than parking not being so friendly since I&#39;m not an Old Town Pasadena fan, I love this place. So far, they have done me no wrong except removing the shrimp and bacon club sandwich. That was just pure evilness. I still have an affinity for The Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s not because of their cheesecakes.
Unreliable. Service is poor. This licationis has mediocre meals. I placed an order for ick up and they screwed it up. I would not even consider this location again

Ate here at 3pm on a thursday.  Service was quick.  Was seated immediately near the window.  Ordered food and by the time we finished the free delicious bread, food arrived.  I had the Shrimp with Angel hair pasta which has always been a favorite. It tasted just as good as it did when I had it years ago at the SF location.  Good pieces of shrimp, flavorful, and pasta cooked well. My fiancé had the factory burrito which had a slight crisp to the tortilla, filled with rice and chicken.  Guacamole and beans on the side.  He enjoyed his meal too!  Clean place, friendly service.

Cheesecakes were good and the line moved quick. I hate seeing a lot of plastic being used, so it might help to find innovative ways to package cakes in one container versus three individual containers for each cheesecake. 5 stars for quality and flavor.

My boyfriend and I went here after restaurant are allowed to reopen. We got here around 8 and we made a reservation beforehand. We got seated within 10 min and we get to look at cheesecake while waiting  we seat at the booth close to the kitchen and i have no problem with it. My boyfriend wanted a drink off the menu and turns out they ran out of one of the ingredients so we ordered another drink off the menu. Same thing happened twice but my boyfriend didn&#39;t mind so he got something else. It&#39;s right after shut down so we get it that they might not have time to restock everything. I got the pasta and my boyfriend got the burger. They forgot to put the onion string on his burger. Our waitress was very nice as he keeps apologizing for everything that went wrong even though we never complain (not your fault buddy lol). A little after that the manager came by and apologized for everything and she gave us free cheesecake (thank you!!). we didn&#39;t find the need to complain cause it&#39;s understandable and it&#39;s not a big deal. Thank you to our waitress and the manager for trying to make our experience there better. We appreciate you!

All of the silver wear had food crusted on them. The ladies were rude, the table wasn&#39;t set when we sat down, and when it was this is what I got. We told the waiter and he didn&#39;t care...when we went to leave he said &#34;okay bye&#34; <br>Will NEVER go back

The audacity of this establishment to accept orders that they cannot fulfill.  I ordered dinner in advance today and received confirmation.  Received info that DoorDash driver was on the road and then when it didn&#39;t show up I called DoorDash and was told that when driver got there he was informed that they were too busy to complete the order.  I sure hope DoorDash drops them, as there is NO excuse to accept an order in advance and then after the scheduled delivery time my order was cancelled.  DoorDash next up for review because I blame them too, BUT like I said don&#39;t accept orders you can&#39;t fulfill.  Ridiculous!<br><br>-Ok Cheesecake Factory I see you responded with wanting me to go through your site and allow a few days for a response... That seems like more work for me than for you just to direct message me and apologize, but I did.  Don&#39;t like that you mandate I include my address etc, but I did.  We shall see what happens.<br><br>UPDATE-Utter waste of my time-and even worse requiring me to provide my address and personal info to receive &#34;Thank you for contacting us, I&#39;m sorry you didn&#39;t receive your order, yada yada&#34;  And NO, I will never order not ever visit a Cheesecake Factory ever again!&#34; AND DO NOT blame DoorDash for your shortcomings, Cheesecake Factory!

Not yelping 1 Star for the food. But in record heat today in LA their air conditioner isn&#39;t working. It&#39;s so hot in here and crowded. Moved tables bc it initially felt cooler in the back. That&#39;s when we found out the ac wasn&#39;t working. Everyone is fanning themselves. It&#39;s just miserable. But we are here and committed now with our order in. <br><br>No manager or anyone is talking to patrons. Offering dessert or anything for being uncomfortable. Disappointing.

I love Cheesecake Factory but their pickup order is not on top of their game. I placed an order online through their website which include their $20 special that includes 2 burgers, 2 fries, 2 drinks, and an Oreo cheesecake PLUS an order of their garlic chicken pasta; we scheduled to pick up around 12pm, got there and checked in around 12:10. The lady who we checked in with told us that we&#39;ll be receiving a text notifying us that our order will be ready for pick up. So we decided to walk around old Pasadena and 20 mins went by, didn&#39;t get anything from Cheesecake Factory. We started to go back to our car and waited for another 10 mins, still nothing. Then we started to go back to Alhambra to grab some boba, picked up our boba, yet still nothing from Cheesecake Factory. By the time, we were in Alhambra an hour has went by. So we went back to Cheesecake Factory after an hour and half of waiting for our food and no notification from text or email. My fiancé went in and talked to the manager regarding our order; the manager pulled out our order and told us that they called our name and didn&#39;t answer; that&#39;s why they put our order away. In that case, why did another worker told us otherwise or else we would&#39;ve waited there. So we picked up our order and left; then we got home and started eating, they forgot our Oreo cheesecake. Honestly, I get it that they&#39;re busy but they definitely need a better system for people to pick up and they need to get peoples order correctly.

Great food as usual, with exceptional service by Nikki. She is always on the top of her game and always  provides excellent service with the most wonderful smile. Thank you Nikki for making us feel very welcome at all times.<br>Cheesecake Cake factory In Pasadena is the place to enjoy exceptional quality and great variety of food, deserts and cocktails for any occasion. And if you are looking for a truly 5 star service, ask for Nikki.

Rarely do I don a hater hat, and I may catch some flack for this, but here goes. . .On the principle that value has been assaulted, I expect never to dine at this location of the Cheesecake Factory because of their outrageous valet parking fees.<br><br>Yes, there are other places to park in the area.  And I would never pay their blood money to park my car anyway.  It just reflects a greedy mentality that frankly offends me and turns me off wanting to spend any dollars there.<br><br>Are they in the food and beverage business, or are they in the parking lot industry?  The sign outside indicates $10 with validation, and $12 without.  What?!<br><br>We did walk inside as Dear Hubby wanted to see if there was anything he might want to take home.  He decided to pass.  <br><br>During his browsing of the dessert case, I observed that they have the same dim art glass light covers that other C.F. locations sport. While arty, the look is dark and becoming dated.  I guess I fall in the camp of not seeing what all the fuss is about with the chain. <br><br>I&#39;ve had some okay experiences with them, and a lot of mediocre ones, too.  Don&#39;t ask people to pay the equivalent of a menu item just to park.   Seems like bad form to me!<br><br>That&#39;s it, the rant is over. And Caveat Emptor.
Food is always good .<br>Service is great .<br>Our server &#34;Xochitl&#34; was very nice.<br>Thank you

So I usually come here for dinner or lunch but one day I decided to try this place for breakfast ( Wish I didn&#39;t ). Despite of them trying to serve breakfast it is just not a breakfast place. The service was terrible too, it wasn&#39;t even a busy day when we came yet the girl got my ordered wrong TWICE so I just ended up eating what they gave me even though it wasn&#39;t really what I wanted.

Service is extremely slow. The entire time I was there I noticed a clump of waiters chatting and following each other instead of servicing their assigned tables. <br><br>Food here is extremely bland. I ordered the fish tacos and had a hard time eating my food. The side rice and beans tasted like they came out straight from a can and dumped onto my plate.
Love their Happy Hour!!! The prices are great and there are many selections for appetizers. Yum!

I ordered my usual a Santa Fe chicken salad a mojito and iced tea and some strawberry cheese cake $47  plus $10 tip $57  plus $10 parking $67<br>Only to have a bad Meal. <br><br>The salad was bland not enough dressing or chicken with Too much Pepper. <br><br>This really never happens here but I&#39;m not happy on how the quality Is fading away at the Pasadena store.  I will not be going back

1. Skinnylicious Asian salad not good. Its like getting a $3.50 bag salad from grocery store. I had 3 bottoms of the lettuce/cabbage.<br>2. I gave the waitress $40.57 on a $33.57  check. The waitress short changed me with my change. So I said okay she&#39;s taking from her tip.<br>3. Never offered refills on water or bread.

I had online order pick up.  Waited line for 40 min. And waited another for text message.  Why they took online pick up order to make people wait this long.  I only waited because  I already paid for it online.  I wish I didn&#39;t order online and wasted more than an hour

Love this location right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of old town. The waiter recommended the fried macaroni and cheese, OMG they were the best appetizers I&#39;ve ever eaten, they were so creamy and delicious. The cheeseburger spring rolls were so good, all the flavors of a cheeseburger wrapped up in a deep fried roll. I definitely recommend both of these, the restaurant was nice and the staff were friendly. A little busy but that&#39;s to be expected, the only bad thing was no where to sit while waiting for a table, the cheesecake counter is right next to entrance so everyone was crowded in one area. Overall I will be coming back!

---Info, vibe &amp; Service---<br>With the same look and feel of other locations elsewhere, it&#39;s a great setting per usual. This location is located in the busty streets of Pasadena, a prime area to say the least with a lot of shops, restaurants, and stores in the area. The restaurant is located on the corner of Fair Oaks Ave and E Colorado Blvd.<br><br>Service was great the time I came in even on a busy weekend. Expect it to be fairly busy at all times. <br><br>Parking can be challenging based off the location. You have the choice of street parking (metered) and any parking structures in the area. I would advise you to park at the one on Fair Oaks Ave and E Green St, that seems to be the closest (they accept both cash and card I believe). <br><br>--Food, Drinks &amp; Prices---<br>I&#39;m sure you know what they provide here and at the many other locations; the menu is vast with all sorts of things. Many appetizers, small plates, pasta dishes, pizzas, burgers and sandwiches, soups and salads, tacos, chicken and steak dishes, seafood, and all other sorts of entrees, ranging and hitting many flavors of different cuisines. Portions are large and same with the calories in everything (don&#39;t look!). <br><br>Love the fresh bread and butter they serve first.<br><br>I&#39;ve pretty much loved everything I&#39;ve had at the Factory over the years, can&#39;t go wrong with anything really. <br><br>Here&#39;s a few things I&#39;ve tried:<br>-Avocado Eggrolls - Avocado lovers unite! Tons of it obviously with a couple other ingredients mixed in served with a tamarind dipping sauce. <br>-Tex-Mex Eggrolls - Crispy rolls filled w/spicy chicken, corn, black beans, peppers, onions and melted cheese. Served with avocado cream and a pica de gallo. <br>-Buffalo Bites - Lots of breading on this thing but for those who love buffalo sauce these are filled with chicken, cheese and wing sauce. <br>-Crab Cakes - Three of them I believe and pretty tasty. <br>-Meatballs with ricotta and garlic bread - Great meatballs and sauce, served with great bread for dipping<br>-Chicken Scampi Pasta - All the great flavors of a scampi, delicious. <br>-Steak Diane - Medallions of certified angus beef steak covered with black peppercorns and a rich mushroom wine sauce. Served with mashed potatoes and grilled onions. Great!<br>-Chicken Piccata - Great! Lemon sauce, mushrooms, capers...what&#39;s not to love. It&#39;s definitely a big portion. <br>-Pumpkin Cheesecake - If you like pumpkin pie you&#39;ll adore this just the same. <br><br>All sorts of drinks and a full bar is available. Something to note is that The Factory has it&#39;s own line of wine, I believe beer as well (I may be wrong on that). <br><br>Prices are in the $5-20ish range for the most part; entree&#39;s are in the $10+ range.

Can I just say yum to everything on the menu? I haven&#39;t tried everything, but I always go there in groups of up to 15 people, and no one says anything bad about the food because we all love what we chose. And the huge variety of cheesecakes to choose from is like no other. Today, several of us decided to get the different chocolate options. Mmmmm.... Each was just delicious! And don&#39;t forget to try the tall, 7-layer, chocolate cake. It&#39;s been a long time favorite of mine; I always take most of it home, and it delights my taste buds for several days after. They don&#39;t validate parking, but you can to go into one of the local 90-minute-free parking lots because street parking is solely a matter of excellent luck. Or you could leave your car with a valet for about $8.  You might have to wait a bit once you get inside the restaurant, especially if you have a large party, but it&#39;ll be well worth the wait.

The original Cheesecake Factory in SGV.<br><br>This location has been here for years. It used to be the most popular restaurant in Old Town. Always packed during rush hours, lunch and dinner. <br><br>Looks small from the outside but it is pretty big inside. Park at the School House lot, first 90 minutes free!<br><br>Menu is so overwhelming. They have so much to choose from. <br><br>Chinese Chicken Salad - $14.95 - My usual go to dish here. I like the combination of the salad toppings they use. The chicken are nothing special but when you combine it with the toppings and plum dressing, its so good! The plum dressing makes this salad amazing!<br><br>Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club - $14.50 - Chicken was juicy and tender. You get a ton of avocado. The bacon, tomato, and cheese all were great in the sandwich. Only negative was that the bread was super oily.

Really great for happy hour. Mon-fri 4-6pm. Came for a dinner on a Friday with large group, bar area has booth tables. No reservations but we were able to all fit. Happy hour is definitely worth it. Large portions about 7.50 appetizers. 4 pork belly siders pretty good! Very savory and soft bread. Also the mashed potato balls were interesting tasting, reminded me of Porto&#39;s potato balls but tasted more like mashed potato texture. I enjoyed it! Spinach dip was very creamy. My friend also got brussel sprouts and the fried fish. Very carb heavy And of course the free bread! Great service and very friendly staff. They were helpful and were nice even though we had a large group. My friend also spilled glass of water but the server was nice and helped clean it up too. Only complaint that it was a bit of a wait. As we left, I noticed a crowd waiting to be seated. Seems this place gets pretty packed!

Cheesecake factory, you have gained back the loyalty of a vegan. First of all the place was packed and we were seates quickly and our server was very attentive even though she was slammed. My girl and I ordered the vegan salad and the pasta served vegan(no parmesan or butter). I was blown away by how great the pasta was. I usually try to stay away from the carbs, but I couldn&#39;t help eating most of the bowl(I was supposed to share). The salad was beyond huge. This was definitely enough food for 4 people, but if you pig out just 2. I wont be able to stay away from that pasta again.
