The Cheesecake Factory consistently gets mediocre reviews despite the DELICIOUS cheesecake and entrees.  I happen to LOVE this chain restaurant and am not not embarrassed to admit it.  After a morning of sledding and playing in snow, we were ready for a hearty lunch.  We ordered our cheesecakes FIRST!  I ordered my usual Reese&#39;s Cheesecake with the chocolate cake and caramel layers.  My hubby ordered Salted Caramel.  Bother were DIVINE =).  My hubby preferred his.  I might conquer, but every time I stray from my usual I feel unsatisfied.<br><br>I then ordered the Santa Fe Salad chopped.  It was SUPERB and filled with ingredients.  Some locations are skimpy on the ingredients, but not this one.  I could only eat 1/3 of my salad.  <br><br>My family LOVES splurging here.  I would definitely eat here again.  Service was attentive and friendly as usual.  Expect a wait at this location on the weekends.

Ordered the Pasta Da Vinci- the Chicken in this dish was disgusting. There was a ball of chicken fat and the other pieces were gross tendon pieces that you could not eat. It was absolutely disgusting and I&#39;m shocked they even sent that out from the kitchen. I sent it back and the waiter apologized and offered to get me something else- I declined because I was too grossed out from the first dish. The Manager made no effort to come over to our table. I would expect much better quality from Cheesecake and I hope you educate this location on quality standards

I&#39;ve been to this location many times over the years.  Most recently I popped in with a friend to catch the halftime show. I love cheesecake factory.  I always have a good time here.  <br><br>We ended up sitting at the bar. The TVs are low in volume so we couldn&#39;t hear much, but it&#39;s also not a sports bar either.  The bartender was great and attentive. <br><br>Ended up ordering the hot spinach dip and avocado egg rolls which are my favorites! Food came out fast and was super delicious. <br><br>I usually don&#39;t sit at the bar at cheesecake, but it was nice this time.  Ended up having some great conversations with the people sitting by us.

The dollar menu style burger and middle school cafateria fries fit perfectly with the service youll receive.<br>Youll often be looking up for your, what i have to assume, stoned out of their mind server who forgets every word as you say it. <br>The owner will profusely apologize yet do nothing to change her restaurants behavior. <br>Overall a great place to eat if you have never eaten anywhere other than the garbage bin behind a burgerking
So so soooooo slow even when there&#39;s no one there. I wouldn&#39;t eat here at all, it took 15 min to order and 40 min to get our food. We actually had to ask for boxes lol cos we had no more time

Really unfortunate... I honestly expected more from this Cheesecake Factory, being in the heart of Pasadena and all.<br>The service was terrible. We had came for a friend&#39;s birthday and waiter was not attentive at all. We were left in the dark for quite some time. When the food finally came we ordered it wasn&#39;t good. From mediocre pasta to stale French fries, it just made our whole experience a lot less pleasurable. A couple of my friends requested a birthday wish from the staff and they never came by. We reached out to the manager, and she did try to make things better with free deserts all around. Everyone ordered a cheesecake and even that took 20 mins to get.<br>I don&#39;t think we will be returning to this location. I myself am very disappointed with the service and food from here. I feel awful for my friend&#39;s birthday experience.

Worst experience ever, don&#39;t waste your time here, the Cheesecake Factory at the Santa Anita mall is defiantly worth the further drive. I&#39;m currently here furious as hell. We came for my friends bday and the service is horrible. They took forever to take our order, took even longer to bring us our drinks, we literally had to look for anybody walking by to ask for refills or request the menu. When our food finally came, the food was cold and fries were stale. We told the waitress and they brought fresh fries half an hour later. Lastly, we spoke to a manager and she apologized, however the rest of our time here isn&#39;t going that great. Still hard to get a waiter around and this place really isn&#39;t busy right now. <br><br>Oh ... I almost forgot... they never came to sing happy bday even though we request it two times.

Always thought this was an okay place to eat until tonight. We asked 3 times for the exceptionally loud music to be turned down so we could have a conversation to no avail.  Annoying and frustrating to say the least.

Service was great, food was great and ambiance was quaint. I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory, but rarely go. I visited during Sunday brunch and celebrated a friend&#39;s birthday. I got the green chilaquiles with carnitas and eggs. One word -- YUM.

I usually love Cheesecake Factory, but I must say today I was disappointed with my meal. I have a newborn so I didn&#39;t want to risk dining in with the whole COVID  so we decided the best option would be to do take out. I ordered the chicken bilagio which is my one and only choice when eating here. Today they barley added any prosciutto or Parmesan sauce (this is my favorite part of the meal) and the chicken tasted dry. To top it off there wasn&#39;t utensils or napkins in the bag. Don&#39;t want to sound bratty but it was a date night so we we&#39;re planning to eat in the car at a nice view. Overall, I&#39;ll stick to dining in when the coast is clear.

Well now we don&#39;t get to go out to eat at this caliber of ape restaurant too often. But oh I insisted. There weren&#39;t very many people in the restaurant which should have been our first clue. I had spaghetti carbonara and my husban  am a chickem salad sandwich.

All of the Cheesecake Factory restaurants are consistently good in many ways. My family and I enjoy trying different locations. It is a restaurant that we all (5 of us) have a definite  favorite food. We had a great experience at this location. <br>Convenient to park in the lot across the street. <br>Nice spacious booths <br>Comfortable decor. <br>We were able to feel a part of the restaurant but also feel like we were at a private party. <br>Our waitress was wonderful. She made the experience even better. Her recommendations made some new favorite dishes for us. She knew when to check on us and when to leave us to our discussions. <br>This is my favorite location right now and I can&#39;t wait to go back.

What can I say, I love the Cheesecake Factory.  I come here regularly and have yet to have something I didn&#39;t like.  But if you look at the calorie count of their food, it&#39;s easy to see why it&#39;s delicious.  That being said, knowing how many calories are in the food, there are so many things I used to love, but now makes me think twice.  So in the last couple of years, I started ordering off the Skinnylicious menu.  I have to admit, I don&#39;t feel like I&#39;m compromising.  The food off their Skinny menu are just as large in portion, and what lacks in calories, they make up in flavor.  Diet food makes me sad, but the food off the Skinnylicious menu doesn&#39;t.  My favorite are the salmon and the Tuscan chicken.  I also love all the salads on that menu.  There is definitely a reason why there is always a huge crowd at any Cheesecake Factory.  The food is simply delicious.  <br>As for service, in the countless times I&#39;ve visited, I&#39;ve only had one bad experience.  They somehow forgot one of our order so we waited quite a while.  But as soon as they realized it, they sent over a manager to apologize and the order came out quickly after that.  They also gave us a free slice of their gigantic cheesecake.  And who doesn&#39;t like free cake?  They do a great job taking care of their guests.

I love this place but yesterday i came again to the one in santa Anita mall and looking the pictures of the food i started wondering  if  they charge me dinner price for the scampi shrimps when it was supposed to be lunch price or this plate is expensive for the amount of food.<br>They charged me $20.95 for this and they always give us a good quantity when is dinner price so that&#39;s why i was wondering if this was correct

Happy to find it open until 12:30am on weekends.  While we didn&#39;t stress test the service by arriving during dinner rush hour, our service and food were first rate.  (I recommend the Chicken Riesling entree, an item unique to the Factory.)<br><br>When an ordered item was later found not to be available, the manager personally stopped by to apologize, answer a question or two, and take a substitution order.  <br><br>Thank you Tamara for your professionalism.

So I would like to start that this is my first Yelp review. I actually downloaded the app because I wanted to give this review. I have been a long time fan of TCF on Colorado. My daughter received a gift card for her graduation that gave various options of restaurants, TCF being one of them, and of course she wanted the delicious fried Mac and Cheese balls so we decided to make a dinner of it and order to pick up. Placed my order from the website, and headed out to pick up our dinner. So here is where it gets bad. My husband and daughter show up to pick up the order and the red head hostess, after taking one look at my husband walked away without greeting or checking their confirmation, and that was just the beginning... she proceeded to rudely single out my husband and daughter telling them they were crowding the door, there were people every where! They were just standing in line like everyone else! The second hostess stepped in to check our confirmation. She told him that it would be 10-15 mins and to wait outside. 45 mins later my husband is still standing out side, as the red head brings food out to everyone else, completely ignoring us! As if we were not there! The hostess was a mess! She even had to chase another patron down the street because she gave him the wrong order and then was rude about it! My husband finally gave up, went inside and asked what was going on with our food and they say &#34;oh! Your food is right here, but you have to make sure it is all there.&#34; ..... and guess what, it was lukewarm. It had been sitting there! The red head hostess never even bothered to help us, it was clear she had an issue with my husband because the entire time he waited she addressed every other patron except him. I am so disappointed. I never in a million years expected to get that type of treatment. Especially with everything going on! I want my 14.00 tip back TCF! Because I ordered online I added the tip online so when we paid at the restaurant it was already included in my bill! The only upside to the whole ordeal was that my daughter enjoyed her Mac and cheese balls. Case in point the 2 stars, but the red head really ruined my husband&#39;s night. Thanks for the Friday night dose of discrimination TCF!

I was really unhappy with the service here. I came here as a part of a party of 2 on a Saturday night at around 5:20pm. We were seated within 15 minutes but then spent 30 minutes just sitting at the table trying to flag a waiter down. 30 MINUTES of sitting there, we weren&#39;t even served any water or bread. I must&#39;ve talked to two different workers there but they would just brush me off and tell me that they would find someone.<br><br>Several of the tables that were seated after us were served first and it was incredibly frustrating. When our food finally did come, it was good (maybe because I had waited at least 45 minutes longer than expected and at that point was ravenous and anything would&#39;ve tasted good). We ordered the Da Vinci pasta and a spaghetti bolognaise. <br><br>I wish I could give this Cheesecake Factory a higher score but the service was absolutely appalling.

Kimberly, the bartender is nasty!  She served me butter with her disgusting blue nail tip touching the butter patty because she was holding the dish by the lip (get a tray).  I ordered the clam chowder and she delivered it by handing me a cup of soup with no plate underneath and again  her filthy nails dipped inside the soup because she gripped the small cup by the lip instead of holding it by a plate or even on a tray.  The cup was sticky as the soup spilled over from no stability being provided by a plate--after she handed it to me and I sat the bare cup of soup with soup spilled on the sides of the cup on the bar counter where I was sitting--Kimberly then acted annoyed when I requested a small plate to place underneath the cup.  <br><br>I explained the issue to the manager and he agreed the soup was supposed to be served on a plate--&#34;he would talk to her.&#34;   Aside from Kimberly&#39;s unsanitary service, she never once asked about soup, if I needed anything etc.--I had to request everything.   <br><br>The most egregious act was watching Kimberly prepping mint for the mojitos with her bare unwashed, unsanitized hands while taking cash money for the register, pens to sign credit receipts, making drinks, going to the kitchen and rubbing her face, hair and lips--this woman was spreading fecal matter and germs like a machine.  She never once washed her hands or sanitized, I watched like a hawk.   <br><br>Drink that mojito at your own risk--trust Kimberly did not wash or sanitize her hands while she did dirty things and prepped bags of mint.  This is how food poisoning happens.

Beyond the doubt the worst place to eat in Pasadena, if you can stomach the subpar food and crappy service you&#39;ll find yourself wondering why you didnt just chug a glass of mercury and hope for the best.<br>Manager will run around like a chicken with her head cutt off and buck buck buck all night apologizing for her incompetence.<br>During my meal I wondered how has this place not been condemned by the city purely based on it&#39;s less than stellar service. Buck buck buck this place!

I was recently here for my birthday celebration and it was an ok experience. They wouldn&#39;t take reservations so it was difficult to gauge when to tell people to get there. I had a few friends show up early and they wouldn&#39;t let him ask for a table until at least half our party was there.<br><br>That was unfortunate because when we got there we had to wait at the bar for a few more others. The restaurant itself was empty so I don&#39;t understand why we couldn&#39;t just take a seat and enjoy a few drinks while we waited. It&#39;s not like anyone else was waiting for a table. <br><br>As for the rest of the night, the food was just okay and nothing to really remember. It was also quite difficult to flag down a waiter in an empty restaurant. Maybe the food was better then I thought but the entire experience left a nasty taste. I won&#39;t be coming here for another celebration. I could go somewhere else that&#39;s more professional and attentive to paying patrons.

This location is much better than the Americana location.  The wait is considerably shorter...often NO wait.  The food is always good with very large portions.  <br><br>They also offer luncheon size servings and even those are large.  All-in-all we enjoy the food, the service and the location.  Definitely one of the best chains.

I&#39;m so disappointed!!! I ordered my favorite dish last week from the Pasadena location as a takeout order, and the miso salmon was very dry and over cooked! My son ordered it this evening, and it&#39;s just as dry and over cooked as mine was.  Now we&#39;ve both been disappointed! To make matters worse, they only included the butter sauce with the orders, and not the red miso glaze!  This was a complete disappointment! Good luck!

I personally feel like food-wise you know what you are getting yourself into. I feel that way with a lot of chain restaurants. Few things really differentiate one branch from another. This was my second time at this location. My boyfriend and I go to the nearest Cheesecake Factory every year for our anniversary (this is our 6th time total). <br>Service was not unforgettable, I have a pretty good threshold for it as I feel like I am not always in need of something. Our wait on a Friday night was only 15 minutes or so and the food was cooked awesomely.<br>Farfalle bow tie pasta and the lemon piccata with angel hair is a must. Both delicious and creamy pastas that I can&#39;t forget.<br>We also got the banana cheesecake (our second time having it, it&#39;s a fresh fave) and also the lemon raspberry which was even better than I expected. <br><br>I knew what to expect going in especially since this was our 6th cheesecake factory visit, and nothing turned me off.

It was so BAD !!!!! I love cheesecake factory I always have but this was a total disaster first off I&#39;ve had impossible burgers before but this one was so overcooked and so dry and for a $16 It was disgusting I asked to speak with the manager and I explained and showed him the skimpy tomatoe the tiny piece of onion and how dry it was I only ate part of it --- all me kept doing was giving me excuses !!!! I&#39;ve cooked in restaurants I know what I was talking about !!! He gave me $4 off the billl that was it !!!!!! If you want an AWESOME veggie burger go to Houston&#39;s !!!!!!!!!!!!! I was not only disappointed in the burger but everything I needed I had to flag The waitress like more coffee ect ect even my BILL and they were not busy ! Now you want me to contact you and tell you what happened ???? I thought I just did ~~~

I ordered Cheesecake Factory yesterday and my son and I was very dissatisfied. The food just appeared to have been put together very quickly. Some of my food was burnt. It was just disappointing. My son didn&#39;t even eat his food. I&#39;m guessing it is because the focus is take out and not dine that presentation and quality has been placed secondly rather than priority.

Let me start out by saying the waitress was great!!! She checked up on us quite a bit to make sure we were ok. I&#39;m not one to put in a review unless it&#39;s over the top good, or in this case...falling well short of &#34;good&#34;. My son and I had steak (filet mignon) both tasteless and extremely dry...my wife had a pasta dish smothered and dripping in oil!! The presentation left a lot to be desired as well. The steak came on a huge plate with some green beans on it...all together covering maybe half the plate....this would never have bothered me if the food was actually good!!! Now I know that the Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t known for being a high end steak place, but at the same time. If you pay $32 for something...it should be good!!!

I should have really read the reviews before even stepping in . I am from Los Angeles so it is my first time in Old town Pasadena ( only reason for 3 stars bc Pasadena is nice) Anyway, I ordered the Louisiana chicken plate .. The flavor? the pasta? was so bland , stale and It didnt feel like Cheesecake menu expectations, it was so sad... Now lets talk about the customer service? We got a middle aged man ( I dont know his name bc he didnt even introduced himself) my gf and I shared our plate and once I said that he probably automatically assumed he was going to get no tip or something? because his face expression changed he was so dry and didnt even bother coming to offer us anything afterwards.. He was right though? We didnt leave him a good tip we left him only $5 not bc we shared a plate? But because he needs to work on his customer experience. Honestly saying? Worst Cheesecake Factory ever.. so dissapointing... Food &amp; Service was horrible, smh

This !!!! This was 17.50. The worst lunch menu EVER. 3 little small pieces of chicken with some watered down Alfredo sauce. The noodles are super hard. This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to and ordered lunch from. The chicken was supposedly grilled, looks like it&#39;s pretty much a frozen TV dinner.

Two old ladies decide to have drinks and lunch at the Cheesecake Factory today.  We patiently waited for a table even though there were lots of empty tables and they took people to tables who came in after us.<br><br>We were seated and given the drink and food menu.  Like any other normal restaurant, the food menu had prices listed; the drink menu contained wonderful descriptions of alcoholic drinks, however, no prices for drinks were indicate on the menu.  Before I order a drink, I need to know the price.  Asked our waiter if he could give us the price of the drinks we were contemplating ordering - his answer was no, he could not.  According to the waiter they don&#39;t give the price until you get the check.  Asked if he could ask the bartender - nope, can&#39;t do that either.  So I asked for a manager.  Waiting, waiting, waiting - no manager and the waiter was nowhere to be seen.<br><br>Finally, we took the menus back to the front desk staff, told them we would not be eating there today or any other day for that matter.  Explained the issue why we were leaving.  We received looks of sympathy from the front desk staff but no explanation as to why drink prices aren&#39;t listed.<br><br>So if you don&#39;t mind paying whatever price the Cheesecake Factory decides to charge for your margarita, vodka tonic or any other alcoholic beverage, then this restaurant maybe the restaurant for you.<br><br>These two old ladies won&#39;t be back.

Food was delicious . My family and I will<br>be coming back. In addition , What made our dinning experience great was our server, Sarah T. She provided exceptional customer service and is a sweet heart.

So I am a SUPER Cheesecake Factory fan! However today was literally the first negative experience I&#39;ve ever had with them. <br><br>Walked in today around lunch time, I expected for it to be busy and have to wait for a table,  if we were seated right away, I was super stoked! <br><br>We sat down waited for 10 minutes to see our waitress! She was amazing but you could tell she was busy. I already figured things might be a while. Takes our order and appetizers come out fast. So I&#39;m thinking hell yeah we&#39;re about to eat. <br><br>One hour later haven&#39;t received refills or out food. She came and said &#34;sorry the kitchen is backed up your food is coming out&#34; we continued to wait. I&#39;m not a dick so I waited 10 more minutes. I politely then canceled my order and asked for the check. <br><br>She brings the check we pay and leave. Never an apology, no manager came to follow up. Nothing. She even charged us after waiting 1.5 hours. I know she has no control, but bruh!<br><br>As I walked out I noticed the restaurant was slow and that the kitchen wasn&#39;t busy. Idk what happened today. A few people in the group will never go back... Cheesecake Factory you sadden me...

I came here to have lunch with the docs. It was three block away from work, so we just walked over here. This is one of many restaurants in the vicinity.<br>We were seated immediately. We got our drinks, and the delicious dark brown bread. I ordered the filet mignon, with a size of broccoli.<br>My meal was so so. I did not like how the filet mignon tasted. It seemed a bit too salted, and the cut was not right. There is not much to expect from the taste of broccoli, other than the Parmesan cheese I requested on top added a nice taste to it.<br>The service was alright, but they need to prepare their filet mignon better. I asked for rare, but I got more of a medium/well. I never eat steak in any way other than rare. It was over-salted, and lacking in flavor. Come on, people, up your game.
I had made a reservation for 1:45 didn&#39;t get seated till 2:00pm. The part that got me upset they sat another group who didn&#39;t have reservations and arrived at the same time

I ordered the herb crusted salmon with a side of mashed potatoes and asparagus as well as shrimp scampi through door dash from the Cheesecake Factory. I have never been so disappointed in the Cheesecake Factory in my life!!! I don&#39;t even know what this is! I can&#39;t even blame it on door dash because I feel like the Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t even package it correctly. This is like a soup! I couldn&#39;t even eat it, they were late in preparing my order and my food was cold by the time I got it. I only live 10 minutes away from the restaurant and I tracked my driver which means they just served me cold food that looks like throw up. Thank you so much for making me never want to support your business again!

PaSaDeNa CHeeSeCaKe Fact. Was aiL&#39;Rightttt this visit was for my sister&#39;s BirrrrthDAy. FarRheed sang with us. The manager came over...for a brief period. The Appetizers were OK. That&#39;s it. I got a Blood Orange Drink, that I shouldn&#39;t of bought.
I&#39;ve had the Thai Lettuce Wraps two more times since my last review. This dish is truly spectacular. Well balanced flavors and textures. I like variety and this dish is like a dance in my mouth.

First time at this location , second time going to A cheesecake factory. After going to the one in Arcadia and having not a good experience I had an awesome experience at this one. Waited 5 mnts to be seated and it was a friday evening , the service was good and the celebration cheesecake was bomb. The only thing I would change is the young lady who is at the front desk taking ur name down to sit you down, wasnt all that friendly. I like to be greeted with a smile. Its not too much to ask for .

Cheesecake Factory is a staple chain in most cities, and I like it, but I don&#39;t love it. However, my experience yesterday was so great, I had to leave a review. After running the LA Marathon, we were HUNGRY! From the staff at the front to our waiter, the team got us in, seated and with food asap. The food was delicious (and I&#39;m not just saying that since I ran 26 miles!). Everyone was so friendly and efficient that we truly felt like valued guests. The Cheesecake Factory at this location is definitely one that I will return to.

Had the Hisbaichi steak. I am disappointed for $20.00 was not worth it. Very chewy.  The mashed potatoes were weird. I think it would be better if they chilled out with mashed potatoes and not put a bunch of stuck in them and marinated the steak longer . I dig their pasta though!<br><br>Went there today 4/12/2018<br>Got a Marina pizza with chicken. Only have the pizza had cheese. I feel swindled. I payed $21.00 for a pizza with only half of cheese on the pizza ;(

Checked in at hostess stand and requested a booth by the window.  She asked for a name, said it would be a few minutes.<br><br>Fast forward about 10 min when I saw them seating someone else at one of the booths (who came in after us).  I approached the hostess stand and asked them why they gave our table to another party.  They couldn&#39;t find out name in the system and asked who took it.  The same person who took the request LIED and said she didn&#39;t.  I called her BS and we walked out.  I was livid.  Will never go back here again.  Very disappointing customer service (and one of the ladies at hostess stand appeared to be a manager - made no attempt to rectify the situation).<br><br>CFK Pasadena - you have lost my business for life.
Great customer service <br>We went with friends after 10 pm to have Cheese cake and we had so much fun.  Great  customer service . And yummy cheese cake .

I always order the Pasta da Vinci. I love the sauce and you can&#39;t go wrong with pasta.<br><br>However, I decided to try something new for lunch. I ordered the everything pizza (toppings: sausage, pepperoni, peppers, onions and mozzarella) with a soup on the side. The pizza was average. It did have a crunch to it but I would rather go elsewhere for pizza. The soup of the day was the tortilla soup which was also average. At least I still had the Honey Wheat Brown Bread with butter - it&#39;s seriously the best bread ever!! <br><br>I think I&#39;ll just stick to my regular order of Pasta da Vinci in the future.

The location of this Cheesecake Factory is top notch, however there is usually a slew of homeless people wandering around out front. Went in the other day for lunch and my pasta was really salty, the waitress apologized and asked the chef to make it again. They discovered that the whole batch was salty and it was going to take a while to recreate it, so they offered me anything I wanted and took it off our bill. Quality service! I felt like a diva sending it back but I love their four cheese pasta so much I order it almost every time!

Happy hour is a such a steal here! I accidentally stumbled in during happy hour and it was a treat! <br><br>Just like the regular menu, the happy hour menu is quite extensive and drinks are $6.50. Happy hour food is approximately $7 and under. <br><br>Happy hour is M-F 4pm-6pm - don&#39;t miss it!!!

We generally enjoy the Cheesecake Factory-the wide selection of menu items means that everyone can usually find something. We had good service here but the sweet potato fries were not up to the usual standard-they were not super warm and some tasted undercooked. Our waiter wasn&#39;t around after the food was ordered (he seemed to get a lot of tables all at once) and we didn&#39;t feel like going to the hassle of sending them back. This was not a bad experience , just not the best we&#39;ve had at a restaurant we&#39;ve grown to love in part because of their consistency.  <br><br>Update: wow-brunch menu is amazing.<br>The brûléed french toast is a must!!! Crispy on the outside and tasty on the inside with a buttery syrup. The avacado toast is lovely-the little pickled onions really make it. The heuvos rancheros are delish too. All in all very tasty and filling

We went today for lunch and the service was not great at all. First it took about 15mins for the server to come to even ask about our drinks. And then she brought out the bread (only 2 pieces) but the table next to us (2 people as well) were brought 4 pieces of bread. Not sure why they are not consistent with that. We got an appetizer and that was brought out within 10mins. But our server took another 15mins to come back to take our order. Once she took our order it took (I&#39;m not even lying) about 40mins to get our food. Other tables that were there after us  got their food before us. The whole experience was bad, she wasn&#39;t apologetic and not friendly at all. For the money you are paying for food you expect the service to be top notch. Last time we are coming here. Horrible. Food was just okay.

It is Cheesecake Factory, you know what to expect.  <br><br>- huge overwhelming menu<br>- high calorie foods done consistently decent<br>- nothing is stellar but nothing is bad<br>- the place is insanely loud and crowded<br>- the portion sizes are massive<br>- getting the attention of a server is a challenge<br>- the cheesecake is outrageously good in taste and breath <br>- the food is a bit over priced but you knew that before your walked in the door<br><br>Either you like this place or you don&#39;t.  Personally, I don&#39;t but the better half and the kid do.   Some days democracy is a PITA.
Had a great dinner,  but I have to say our waiter was so good.  What a happy, friendly, positive, helpful and very kind person.  Jimmy thank you for the great service.
A BIG thank you to Tamara the manager who went out of her way to make sure my girls graduation was memorable. Thank you thank you thank you.
Love this place! The bread is amazing! Mac and cheese Burger rocks my socks!! <br><br>Buffalo bites and the Mac and cheese bites!

Had a great time here for desert. Came in near closing and grabbed a cherry cheesecake and coffee. The staff were very friendly and checked in often. The location was clean and dimly lit which is nice.

Poor excuse for a restaurant. <br><br>Actually the food was inedible. The quality literally shouldn&#39;t be fed to anyone or any thing, let alone humans. <br><br>The service was just as bad if not worse. People were rude, unresponsive and terrible overall. Will never be back.

If there are so many eclectic and diverse dining choices in Pasadena, why should you visit The Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena? (1)-They have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu that is very diverse; low on calories but big on taste. (2)-The location is smack in the middle of Old Town Pasadena and seating by the sidewalk is ideal to see all the nightlife in action, (3)-the menu choices range from traditional American to Asian/Mexican/Italian. (4)-the appetizers are big enough to be a meal if you order a couple at one time, (4)-it&#39;s a great place for friends and family, (5)-DESSERTS! Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds. Parking is available across the street for a fee. No validation . You can walk off those calories by taking a walk along Colorado Blvd. Recommended for evening dining so you can enjoy the nightlife.
Food and drinks are good...but its truly the Desserts that always keep me coming back!

Always good service.. here I enjoy my favorite meal in the world... chicken madeira along with a long island ice tea.. I would&#39;ve given this place a 5 stars rating but I am so disappointed they only have 2 small TVs in the bar.. this place looks like it makes enough money to afford at least medium size TVs.. but other than that I always enjoy coming here..
Great service! Great food at this location ... <br>Always a pleasure dining at any Cheesecake Factory!
I love that they have so many vegetarian options. The avocado egg rolls are amazing and my husband and I order this everytime we go to Cheesecake!

I had a very scarring experience here. I was out to dinner with my friend and her entire family. When it came time to order, I ordered a veggie burger. Not the impossible burger, just a typical black bean, rice, veggie burger. When our meals came, I was surprised to find that my so-called &#34;veggie burger&#34; was not a veggie burger. It was very clearly some sort of meat burger, with mushrooms in it. Because the meat was lighter, it was most likely a turkey burger. So, I politely called the waiter over and asked if they perhaps got my order wrong, and gave me a turkey burger rather than a veggie burger. The waiter came over, looked at my burger, saw the mushrooms in it, and proceeded to tell me that this was definitely a veggie burger, because of the mushrooms. Now because I was a guest of my friend with her entire family, I did not want to cause of scene or seem high maintenance, so I just said &#34;ok&#34; and that was that. You might be thinking the same way the waiter was, &#34;well if there are mushrooms in the burger, its got to be a veggie burger, right?&#34;. If you are thinking this, you are wrong. I looked over the menu again, and there was a turkey burger with mushrooms on the menu. At this point, I was certain that what was on my plate before me was absolutely not a veggie burger. This was a turkey burger with mushrooms. And frankly, I think it is pretty easy to tell the difference between meat and vegetables, and this was most certainly meat. Anyways, because I was a guest and I did not want to seem rude, I was forced to eat this fake veggie burger. And on top of that, it was bad. It was one of the most awful dining experiences I have ever had to endure. I will not be coming back.

I come here at least 3-4 times a year. Every single time I come here or any factory my visits are pleasant. All the waiters I&#39;ve had are on point and I never have to chase them for anything lol. However the Factory is training their employees they have done a excellent job. Keep up the great work and keep making perfectly perfect perfection food....

First and Foremost, did you know they have HAPPY HOUR here at the Pasadena location 4p-6p.  <br><br>I took sis here for her birthday dinner the other weekend. The restaurant was a mirror image of the city that night: busy and chaotic. <br><br>Complimentary breads (french and squaw?) are served warm and with pats of butter.<br><br>We ordered:<br><br>- AVOCADO EGGROLL <br><br>Seriously. This is the best appetizer here. It sounds grossly ick but don&#39;t knock it &#39;til you&#39;ve tried it. The sweet tamarind sauce is such a winner here.<br><br>- STEAK DIANE AND SHRIMP SCAMPI<br><br>Sis said the steak was nice and tender (prepared medium plus). The mashed potatoes were more like smashed potatoes.<br><br>- SHRIMP SCAMPI AND CHICKEN MADEIRA<br><br>The chicken madeira is smothered with mozzarella and a beautiful sweet dark madeira wine sauce. The shrimp scampi is pretty yums as well. The breaded large shrimp is pan fried and then covered in this delicious garlic sauce. I wish they&#39;d leave out the breading as it becomes a bit gummy/thick after it sits in the sauce too long.<br><br>- MANGO KEY LIME CHEESECAKE<br><br>Nice and tart. I&#39;m not sure if this is a new item. Make sure to ask for extra whip cream. <br><br>I had whispered to the waitress before the meal that it was sis&#39; bday. She said they only give out a free sundae (?) or something? It was loud in the restaurant so maybe I misheard. I told her that would be great but I&#39;d like to order a slice of cheesecake (that I would pay for). We didn&#39;t get the free sundae but did appreciated the decorated cheesecake plate and the waitresses singing happy birthday to sis. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a fun place to have a meal if you don&#39;t mind the wait, chaos, and overall busy-ness of this place. Service and food tends to be consistent so that&#39;s always a plus. Don&#39;t forget about their Happy Hour -

Bad waitstaff service. Bread basket never came after we were shown to our table. We asked our waiter for it after we finished our appetizer which we assumed would have arrived after bread? Anyway...Still no bread and empty drink glasses now. Lots of staff humming around but not enough sense to look out for each others guest&#39;s and ask if we needed anything as I gave shivering baby kitten stares at any employee willing to lock eyes with me. Finally I decided to throw my arm out into the isle and beg the next passerby for bread and drink refills.. Sucess! Warm bread and libations inbound!! The kitchen help brought the bread and the passerby brought the drinks, still not sure where our waiter is at this point? Main course came next and then our waiter stopped by to check in as our visit had since moved full steam ahead. Overall we spent way more seat time than we had expected to and by the middle-end of the main course we found ourselves antsy for the desert menu &#34;to go&#34; and bill so we could return circulation to our lower extremities. Other than service the food was as expected and quality was consistent with previous visits.

So the one in Glendale is by far the worst one!! Don&#39;t ever go there. Even if you&#39;re in the area. <br><br>As far as the restaurant goes, I would recommend to stray from ordering any kind of steaks. My boyfriend ordered a steak once and it was dry, I have to a long time ago, and it was also dry and overlooked. But they&#39;re not a Steakhouse. So didn&#39;t expect much...<br>I&#39;ve had the miso salmon which I think is good. I also like the shrimp scampi but if you&#39;re not a garlic person, I&#39;d avoid it. <br>The chicken costoletta,The flatbread pizza, are good... I&#39;ve had other dishes but can&#39;t remember the names, so I&#39;ll leave it at that. <br><br>Overall, I think food is alright. Nothing too good but not too bad.<br>The best part about the Cheesecake Factory is indeed the Cheesecake. Try the banana cream one, it&#39;s the best one!!! <br>The staff are very attentive, there is little to no wait. You are seated quickly. Food is brought out hot not cold.

So I order to go after I wait 20 minute hold <br>My order was stake taco plate to go and this is what I got  <br>No utensil <br>Great  it&#39;s already second time <br>I don&#39;t think I will order to go here

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory pretty much everywhere in California and I have to say that I was surprised of how dirty this one was. The table and silverware were pretty dirty and the service wasn&#39;t as prompt and efficient as it is at other Cheesecake Factories.<br><br>Also, the food was burnt and lacked flavor. The complimentary brown bread wasn&#39;t as tasteful as it usually is. Nor was the shrimp jambalaya entree I always order; it tasted as if it could use some work.

I was excited to take my lady to this restaurant on a special occasion the food was less than mediocre the service was OK nothing to Blow a horn about and all of that cost $100 no way I won&#39;t be going back there
Wasnt as busy as I expected and we were seated in less than 10mins. Staff was great and food was good too. Would visit again

The hostess is unprofessional and rude.<br>Unprofessional: as a hostess, she didn&#39;t greet us nor take lead.<br>Rude: mistreated us and no apologies afterwards.<br><br>There was a group of people in front of us and she took them to their table. My friend and I, two of us waited first in line, so it&#39;s impossible she didn&#39;t see us. After she got back, she walked by us without eye contact nor greeting.<br>Instead helping us, she took the couple behind us first. But, we were there first?! Why she didn&#39;t approach, ask or take us first as a hostess should do? We were also 2 people just like the couple behind us. If there is no reservation and everyone is served based on first come first serve basis, then why we didn&#39;t get served like everyone else? Why we have been excluded from the waiting line?<br><br>We felt been mistreated. <br>NO APOLOGIES from her nor The Cheesecake Factory manager.<br>It&#39;s an unpleasant dining experience!

I love the food at cheesecake factory, even though it is a little pricey here especially for dinner. We always order the avocado egg rolls! This time, we ordered Shrimp Alfredo and the Buffalo Chicken Strips. I do recommend the chicken strips, but it is not crispy. If it was a little more crispy then it would be better. The shrimp alfredo was okay, not as flavorful. We also got drinks and I believe I ordered the Strawberry Daiquiri and that was really good! I do not really like to taste the alcohol and it masked it very well! I highly recommend that drink! The service was good, but a little slow since there was a lot of people on a Friday night. So our food came out pretty slow as well. But the waiter did come to check up on us to let us know the food will be out soon.

My girlfriend and I are huge fans of The Cheesecake Factory. Between us we have probably gone at least a hundred times to multiple locations. We&#39;ve never had any issues until we&#39;ve come to this specific location, and had to deal with multiple headaches on multiple separate occasions. <br><br>When we dined in, our waiter was rude, gave us attitude, and poured an excessive amount of olive oil and vinegar on a dipping tray when we never even asked him to. We felt uncomfortable so we asked the manager to have a new waiter. She seemed to have complied, however the same waiter kept coming back to serve us and it made us even more uncomfortable. I went back to speak with the manager and she said &#34;yes this guy is responsible for your specific area, is there a problem!?&#34; As if this was our problem and they didn&#39;t do anything wrong. They completely ignored my original request. So we were stuck with this rude waiter even after asking the manager for a different one. Not only that, the food tasted completely bland.<br><br>So after that experience we decided we wanted to avoid dealing with their terrible customer service, and opted to order their food through a delivery app instead. However, the problems do not go away there. For one, they NEVER follow the instructions correctly. Do you want parmesan cheese and peppers with your pizza? Good luck, that request gets fulfilled at a rate of about 1 in 5, or 20%. <br><br>One time we asked for pesto sauce on the side and they gave us pasta with NO PESTO SAUCE AT ALL. Wtf? How do you do the complete opposite of what was requested? We even called the restaurant beforehand to make sure they wouldn&#39;t mess it up because with our previous experiences we knew there was a high likelihood that they would. And the pasta was completely cold, as if it has been sitting on a counter for hours. It wasn&#39;t even room temperature cold it was colder than that! So I called the manager to complain and she said it was because they had a busy game day at the restaurant which is why the service was not as good. That was the worst excuse for anything that I&#39;ve ever heard and for a place like The Cheesecake Factory I would certainly expect much more. <br><br>I&#39;m sure most people would be livid too if they were waiting over an hour for their food, called the restaurant to further clarify how not to fuck up, and by the time the food arrives it is completely cold and they clearly did not follow any instructions.<br><br>These 10+ shitty experiences we&#39;ve had at this specific location has forced us to stop ordering there altogether and opted instead to dine in at the Arcadia mall location which is unfortunately a much further drive with a long wait but that should speak volumes to how crappy this location is.

If I could give zeros stars, I would because this was by far the worst restaurant experience ever. Firstly, they don&#39;t accept reservations &amp; my party of 7 had to wait over an hour &amp; a half or more to be seated. Right when we were seated, we ordered immediately but still had to wait over 45 minutes for our food! Worst of all, 5 out of 7 orders came out WRONG. <br><br>I am so beyond disappointed in my experience here today &amp; am truly saddened to be writing such a bad review but it was so bad I felt like I had to share &amp; hope no one else has to go through what we went through today.<br><br>I hope they change to save their business.

Sooo good and good service. First date with my now husband. Always order the lemon chicken picatta. Yummy!!!!!!!! Generally fast service. Maybe all cheesecake factory places are the same i don&#39;t know, but I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at this location.

Seriously, this is the &#34;fresh fruit&#34; that is served with the kids meal.  Is it because a kid probably won&#39;t complain about about the freshness? When I addressed it right away the server his response was &#34;all of it is like that do you want me to take it back&#34;. Also the plate was hot, the fruit was warm, and there was cheese mixed in.    Management did fix the issue but why do we have to complain about something so obvious.

For those times when I&#39;m not really sure of what I want to eat, I can always count on The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve enjoyed every item and you&#39;ll definitely get your money&#39;s worth in flavors and portions. I highly recommend the chicken Madeira, Louisiana pasta, avocado egg rolls, Thai lettuce wraps, macaroni and cheese burger with fries, the complimentary bread with butter, and the list goes on... the strawberry lemonade is good, but very sweet, so perhaps order it without the sugar-rimmed glass. You will not go wrong with cucumber lemonade. I&#39;m sure I will return to eat familiar meals and try different items on the menu.

This review isn&#39;t for the restaurant itself- it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. The food is universally the same at each location and you know what you&#39;re getting. <br><br>This review is specifically for Denise! My wife and I have eaten here a few times and Denise somehow ended up being our server every time. Denise is super attentive, anticipates our needs, is polite, friendly, helpful, kind and quick. We&#39;re very happy each time we&#39;re seated in her section.<br><br>The food here is good, but the experience deserves 5 stars for Denise&#39;s attentive service, great job!

This is by far the worst restaurant I&#39;ve been to. They make you wait an excessive amount of time for a table and their quality of food is mediocre. Not worth coming here if you come with a large party. They&#39;ll make the least amount of effort to seat you all. Beware! Don&#39;t waste your time.

This CCF has a historic feel, and many seats have a view of the foot traffic on Colorado Blvd. But the place is crowded, noisy, service is haphazard. They are trying to maximize profits, and the experience suffers. <br><br>More generally, CCF is a bit over priced and food is not that great. <br><br>I would only go here if nothing else is available.

Ordered the keylime cheesecake togo on a Monday afternoon around 3ish. The restaurant was nearly empty. There was no line to pay and order. That was fast, but after I paid and was told me to wait while they prepare the cheesecake togo. I literally waited 47 mins for them to just box and bag it before they can give it to me. <br>Really, it shouldn&#39;t take that long when the whole restaurant was almost empty. I see all the employees standing together in grps to talk and laugh with each other. Seriously, I&#39;ll never go back to this location ever. Horrible and a waste of my time since the employees just didn&#39;t feel like working.

NOT ACCOMMODATING <br><br>Called to get an idea of wait time for 8 people and they refused to say, they said we would have to find parking and come inside to find out how busy they are.<br><br>Ridiculous!

Really I&#39;m disappointed in this location in Pasadena on Colorado blvd.<br><br>I do deliveries almost four to five times a day at this location for Doordash. <br><br>I always wait patiently even when this staff is running late with orders.<br><br>Tonight around 6pm to 7pm I had a pick for a customer who ordered food through Doordash for cheesecake factory, normally there are hardly any problems just as long as the managers don&#39;t try to spread thin their staff. Or doesn&#39;t try to do their job. (managers suck at doing their employees job I&#39;ve noticed...)<br><br> I went in to pick up my online order for a customer, yet when I got there, the food wasnt even ready.<br><br>They were really busy and the manager was up front doing what they do best... messing up the order process that their staff knows better than they do.<br><br>I had a very nice regular staff help me with my order,<br> then all of a sudden the manager without even asking if he was busy attending to another customer starts to micro manage the staff member who was helping me out.... She ordered her employee to stop what he was doing to help with a cheesecake transaction for a customer...<br><br>I was really mad and felt disrespected.... It&#39;s a big problem for online orders/drivers who do these online app deliveries.<br>We never get treated like paying customers. <br><br>We get pushed aside or waiters won&#39;t help us since we aren&#39;t sit in customers who tip.<br>I dont blame the workers, it&#39;s the management that needs to be responsible for this.<br><br>They aren&#39;t informing or making sure their employees treat all paying customers with the same respect as a sit in dining customer/guest. <br><br>the orders I have to pick up are preordered always, so by the time I arrive to the restaurant my food should be ready for pick up, give or take 5 to 10 minutes.<br><br>This is never the case when the managers are upfront at the registers... They seem to be more of a problem then a help.<br><br>I feel from experience that the regular staff are better at running a smooth cashier/front desk than management. <br><br>I had the worst experience tonight with the female glasses wearing manager when I arrived. (7pmish)<br>When I told her about how she interrupted my order from being fully completed by ordering her staff to cash someone out before finishing with my transaction,<br> she just in a rude condescending fashion told me &#34;as you can see we are really busy, and I wasn&#39;t aware my staff member was helping you.&#34; <br><br>Isn&#39;t it her job to ask her staff before ordering them around to see if they are helping someone else currently? <br>She then decided to ban me from the store because I told her it was fucking bullshit and rude of her to do that... I will be contacting the company and rating poorly this <br>restaurant on every food rating site until they fix their management.<br> I don&#39;t want a sorry or coupon.... I just want this poor service/treatment to stop for customers who pick up food instead of dining in.<br>we&#39;re paying customers too.... We order way before hand so we should be treated better.<br>We are still paying customers, and we represent the customer who ordered the food. I bet she wouldn&#39;t have treated me so rudely if I was the actual customer who ordered the food.<br><br>P.S. I let all the customers I deliver food to know why their food was late or cold. This is so they can know what cheesecake factory thinks of their customers who order out.

We visited Cheesecake Factory on Thursday, Jan 19th at about 8pm with a party of four people.<br><br>This is a Cheesecake Factory with typical interior decor; however, it seemed a little bit smaller than many locations.  <br><br>Our table began with an order of the chicken nachos.  For my entree, I personally had the Cobb Salad replacing the tomatoes with beets.  Both of these items were excellent.   For dessert, I shared a slice of the Hazlenut Cheesecake with one other person, and as always the cheesecake was absolutely delicious.<br><br>The only reason for the slightly less than perfect rating is that the server we had for the first half of our dining experience clearly didn&#39;t want to be there and was just clearly not loving her job.   She identified herself as a replacement server filling in for someone who was on her dinner break.  Once our regular server returned, everything was quite nice again.

After finding the One Colorado Santa had packed it in for the rainstorm the other day (lame, btw) we returned to the parking structure with three disappointed kids to discover a fender bender between a UPS truck and a small car had thoroughly blocked and destroyed traffic on Union St.  Since we weren&#39;t going anywhere for a while, and the kids were hungry anyway, we decided to walk down the street to Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>For whatever reason I always seem to have a gift card or two for this restaurant (#educatorsFTW).  Walking into an old town Pasadena restaurant with three kids under eight on a Thursday night isn&#39;t my idea of a good time, but unlike some of the other competing places in the area, we were able to pull it off here.  Mrs. Picante and I ordered off the Skinnylicious menu: Greek salads and lettuce wrap tacos were both small, but satisfying.  The dipping sauces on the tacos were pretty salty, but tasty. 6 to 8 dollars a plate isn&#39;t a bad deal, even for appetizers.<br><br>The kids had assorted fare of macaroni and cheese, quesadillas, and picking olives out of my salad.  Service was pretty good for a rainy night, and the kids were actually pretty well behaved.  Pro parent tip: this restaurant is plenty loud enough to cover the occasional whining, yelling, screaming, or other assorted noises that children make.  <br><br>By the time everyone had eaten, the accident has cleared, and we were on our way. Still have to figure out how to get our Santa photographs with the kids taken, but at least we got out as a family on a traditional old town Pasadena date night, and didn&#39;t bother anyone else&#39;s good time... As far as we know.

What has happened to Cheesecake Factory? I have dined at this location here and there when I was in high school (that was 10-15 years ago). But have dined at other Cheesecake Factory locations over the years and am sad to see that the food quality has gone down hill within the last few years. Anyways, on my most recent visit to this location (yesterday afternoon around 2 pm for a late light lunch), my husband and I were seated at a small table near the kitchen. These are the items we ordered:<br><br>Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls, $10.95 prior to tax- My husband wanted something light since he had a big (late) breakfast and decided upon these spring rolls. I had low expectations for these spring rolls because with an American restaurant making spring rolls, I just had a feeling they wouldn&#39;t be good. And well, my suspicions were correct. These 3 rolls (pretty expensive for 3) were poorly wrapped and the wrong type of noodles were used in them. Also these summer rolls are supposed to have shrimp. Only one roll had 1 shrimp and the other 2 had none. I did like the peanut flavored sauce and the sweet chili sauce that came with the rolls though (these are the same sauces that come with the Thai Lettuce Wraps, which my husband should have ordered in the first place because that actually taste good, although it is not a light appetizer).<br><br>Luau Salad (Lunch portion), $10.95 prior to tax- The lunch portion size (you can order lunch portions until 5 pm) is actually a good size for one person (I shared part of my salad with my husband). The presentation of this salad was pretty. It comes with 2 large fried won ton pieces. It isn&#39;t exactly healthy so I didn&#39;t finish it. <br><br>Whenever I order a salad, I always order for the dressing to be on the side. In this salad, there are pieces of mango, cucumber slices, sliced bell peppers, green beans, macadamia nuts and sesame seeds. The sweetness of the mango was good enough that this salad didn&#39;t need the dressing (I had a little of the dressing and it does go well with the salad, just in case you are someone who just has to have dressing on your salad). I love the different textures, flavors and crunch.<br><br>Strawberry Lemonade, $3.95 prior to tax- This lemonade was pretty bad. The lemonade tasted too sour and tasted as if rotten fruit was made with it. When we got a 2nd glass, it still had the same taste. The reason being was that our server just ladled out the drink from a large container that was already premade (so our 1st glass wouldn&#39;t taste any different from the 2nd until someone makes a new batch... but I bet it will still taste the same). <br>------------------------------<br>(Total= $34.95 after tax and tip) <br><br>Service was just average and really could have been better attentive (especially it being in the late afternoon when the restaurant was not busy). Food was not that great, especially for the price. Do not see ourselves coming back here.

i attempted to order online for fathers day at about 0900 hrs. horrible website. when attempting to check out, the website kept asking for the date of pick up while not giving you a calendar to pick the date. after attempting it twice i decided to try to call in the order. i was on hold for 20 min before i gave up and attempted the online ordering again. because the restaurant was actually open it took the order but i was unable to order everything i wanted so i gave up and just ordered what the website would allow. i arrived to pick up and it was chaos inside. completely unorganized, you didn&#39;t know who was waiting for what.  i had asked for extra dressings for my salad and was charged extra for them. i also added and paid for  extra chicken to my santa fe salad and when i opened it up the amount of chicken that  was there was what is normally on the salad. i am pretty sure that if i was dining in and asked for extra dressing it wouldn&#39;t have been a problem. in all, my experience yesterday was horrible.  i wont be patronizing this location anymore .

Short and simple<br><br>My waiter jimmy is awesome and energetic, but the manger RAUL could use a few classes in customer service. Never met a manager that did absolutely nothing to fix a situation. We ordered appetizers and they should up 7 minutes after the entree. It&#39;s kinda hard to eat lettuce wraps angel hair pasta and avocado rolls all together. Not to mention that we had what felt like 10 plates on the table. Then RAUL the manager comes over and says &#34; I&#39;m the manager! What&#39;s the problem?&#34;  Definitely last time I go there...  too bad cause the food is amazing!

We were in the area so we stopped by the cheesecake factory. <br>As we entered the restaurant, no front, no manager was greeting us. People are coming in and we all were wondering where is the staff? The lady in the cheesecake stand knew we were waiting to be seated but she just ignored and didn&#39;t bother to help any of us.<br>Finally one of the staff came out from the back and seated us one by one. I&#39;m guessing there were short on staff. Our server didn&#39;t take our order til good 30 mins. It was ridiculous how it took them an hour to make a sandwich. <br>We had better service and experience with other location.

Okay Cheesecake Factory, you have always been my go to whether it&#39;s dine in or door dash I always come back to you. With my long hours at my job, not to mention graveyard shift, I have been ordering from you guys twice a week via DoorDash. It would be nice if I could have butter with my bread! Geesh! I spend enough a week with you guys to not get butter.  Please and thank you.

Sat in the bar area, and ordered mojito drinks for our party of five. We got bread while we waited for our drinks. When they finally arrived, the tasted like chemically lime juice drinks with ice. Cheesecake Factory mojitos are a signature drink, we were so disappointed. We informed our server and rather than making new drinks, we were only offered to have more syrup poured into them. <br>The manager was informed and she didn&#39;t care to offer us an alternative solution. <br>Never coming back here again, if we wanted cheap tasting drinks we could have grabbed one at a pub around the way for half the price. Gross.

First time at Cheesecake factory Pasadena for dinner with our granddaughter. (12/12). Jill recommended delicious dishes and she was very attentive and provided with outstanding service. We will definitely be back!

I have always loved Cheesecake Factory but not after today. I ordered through doordash. It was late, half my order was missing &amp; the food was either cold or undercooked and it did not taste fresh. I tasted like yesterday&#39;s leftovers. The last time I ordered the food wasn&#39;t cooked correctly either so I decided to give it another try today &amp; boy did I regret it. I will not be ordering from here again. Please improve your quality or you will lose more customers.

I love coming to the Pasadena Cheesecake Factory. The staff is always really nice and friendly. A friend and I came in the other night and were greeted by two very sweet hostesses. They sat us quickly in a nice booth. However, the service was unreasonably slow... <br><br>Our server, Brynda, got us our drinks, but then we had to wait a long time before she came back to the table. She eventually took our order and when the food arrived it was delicious, but still, the other servers were helping to take care of us more than she was... they refilled our waters and cleared our plates. At the end of our meal I got up to use the restroom and I walked by our server in a conversation with a coworker joking about how high she was. Overall unprofessional. <br><br>I would definitely recommend this Cheesecake Factory, as the staff is very friendly, but be advised to sit with a different server! If the food wasn&#39;t so great, this experience would have stopped me from ever coming back here.

Who ever answered the phone at 1:55pm today Friday March, 1st 2019 has a an attitude. I asked a question, she gave an answer. I asked another question and she had a fkn attitude in response. Why do they let people with no customer service savvy answer the phone? I was going to take my friend here for her Birthday but now we will be going somewhere else.

I ordered the smorse cheesecake fpr almost $10 honestly i dont think the price is worth the cheese cake. im pretty sure like other cheesecake factories ive been to, the deserts are the only thing you would want from there. Its a good cheesecake but if you need to find cheaper price dont go here.

Our family of five came in for lunch today and were seated quickly despite it being 1:30 on a Saturday. Service was excellent! Appetizers came out quickly and the meal followed nicely. Drinks were refilled at the halfway point every time. Bathrooms were busy but very clean. Great experience and delicious food. Thank you staff!

The food was delicious. The waiter was great. The front desk was very polite but the person setting us was a nightmare. She clearly didn&#39;t like kids. She told me 4 times in less then 30 second that I should put the stroller next to the plant. While I was trying to fold the stroller and take what I needed out of it. She didn&#39;t let us have a boot stating we have a child with us.

We are a party of 7. Its a slow night on a Tuesday in Old town Pasadena. We were seated right away as soon as our party showed up.<br><br>Did a alright job heping us. Nothing that really stood out. I was in good company. I had the veggie sandwhich. Plenty of fries. Its a bit on the greasy side but I still remembering the food being decent. <br><br>notes:<br>street parking<br>parking garages.<br><br>verdict: I guess you can come out here. haha.

We got gift cards so decided to go although the 3/5 score. Bad mistake. The service was friendly and the insides nice, but the food was bad and took a lot of time to get to our table. We ordered a salmon dish, a regular burger, a veggie burger and a lasagna. All bad. The only tasty thing was the bread they give as starter. Also the cheese cake at the end was ok, but really, the food was below average and I am sorry we went. For sure will not come back for dinner (maybe just for dessert).

Probably my last visit ever<br><br>There were 2 of us and one person ordered a cheese stuffed burger with fries and I ordered a Turkey Sandwich on Wheat which when it came out was a Turkey Club on white with a side salad which because I made it a side Caesar had a small up charge. We also got 2 Arnold Palmers and the bill was 44.60 before the $8.50 cent tip. I know the server Pete wrote down wheat, but the kitchen didn&#39;t read it.Te was so little turkey on the sandwich that part of it didn&#39;t even cover the bread! <br>In the Wall Street Journal today they said Fast Food sales were up in April, but other restaurant sales were down. This is a perfect example of why.

Great service and our meals delicious. My boyfriends burger was taking longer than expected the manager came to apologize although we were ok with it and without asking for any compensation the meal was taken off our check. We ended up ordering a cheesecake and oh my, it was delicious!

Just like every Cheesecake Factory, it tastes good and satisfying.<br><br>Their service is outstanding; but what makes me give them only 4 stars is the parking (because its in Old Town Pasadena which makes parking really difficult unless you know the area) and its affordability (all Cheesecake Factory cheesecakes are $7.95/slice).<br><br>Anyways, that&#39;s how this restaurant is and will always come back.
Shout out to &#34;Craig&#34; in the lounge. It was a super busy Sunday and he came in all smooth full of humor! Made our night great! Thanks Craig!

Chicken potstickers were undercooked and the chicken was mushy and disgusting! The chopped salad had old lettuce. I had food poisoning from this meal!!! The quality has gone wayyy downhill. Overpriced. Waitress did our bill incorrectly as well. Do not recommend.

Poor service from start to end.  The order was messed up. They didn&#39;t bother to clear plates. The servers don&#39;t pay attention while taking orders. The hostess was not respectful. Food was ok. Overall a very poor experience.
Great spin..mushroom omlete.<br>Brea potatoes a little dry but over all atmosphere and service snd price is always great

My family and I came to celebrate my son&#39;s birthday. It took way too long to get our food. I ordered a rib eye steak medium well. I was not pleased it was over well done so I sent it back and told the waitress that judging on how long it took to get our food to just remake it and I&#39;ll take it to go. They pack the food to go and my aunt says you better check it. I&#39;m so glad I did. They replaced the rib eye with a cheaper cut of steak. I eat rib eye once a week so I know a rib eye when I see and taste it and I tasted it. it was definitely NOT a rib eye, tasted like a New York strip. I&#39;m horribly disappointed in the integrity of this establishment. If our family or friends has future events I will recommend we celebrate elsewhere. On a side note the waitress was great! But I had to give 1 star as this experience left an extremely bad impression.

This is my first time at Cheesecake Factory and it was amazing. Our sever Natalie was so nice and a very good sever. My favorite were the pot stickers I would definitely recommend them to everyone. The strawberry lemonade was to die for and so refreshing for any day. For dessert I had the strawberry shortcake and if you have a sweet tooth like I do you would know how amazing it was. I would just like to say thank you to our sever Natalie you were really nice and cool. If you are ever looking for somewhere to eat I would choose Cheesecake Factory.
Great service, great food, great drinks! Miguel made our 27th wedding anniversary dinner a wonderful experience. Thank you Miguel! You are a class act!

It&#39;s always pricey here, I know that. However, yesterday we explored the menu a bit. Kids got the cheese flat bread, I tried the taquitos from the appetizer, and we also got the egg plate from the breakfast/brunch menu.. 2 eggs, bacon, toast, and super good potatoes.. with drinks the bill came out to just under $36. I think that was a pretty good deal for a decent meal. We were too full to try any of the cheesecake. The wait time was under 10 minutes.

Got a gift certificate here and I am not surprised to report that the food here is god awful. And it&#39;s always busy! And far too expensive relatively speaking.  I can&#39;t explain it. And the decor is so weird; like what is this place trying to be? The menu is far too extensive which is why the food sucks imo. There was absolutely zero love in any of the dishes we ate. Corporate chains like TCF need to die. They don&#39;t care about value or deliciousness. And what sucks is that it&#39;s these corporate chains that can afford to exist in Pasadena, so the food scene here isn&#39;t as awesome as it should be with few exceptions. Sad!

Ordered pickup and they forgot the cheesecakes I ordered. The food was alright, pasta carbonara was pretty bland and the guacamole was incredibly under-seasoned. Won&#39;t be going back to this location.

Sadly, an awful (and expensive) experience this evening. Standards have certainly dropped at this location for a restaurant chain that prides itself on consistency.<br>We had to send 2 appetizers back? The avocado rolls were burnt and the replacement spinach/cheese dip had no cheese, I joke not? My wife&#39;s steak came out rare iand although it is a matter of taste, my mai tai lacked rum and was overly sweet... we definitely thought we were sitting at table 13!<br>When we mentioned to the waiter that something was amiss in the kitchen, he got defensive and said that he just brought the food to the table! My thought was that he should know what looks right and what does not...?<br>Anyway, if you want a reall good cheesecake experience, then head to the Americana Mall location in Glendale... I&#39;ve always had a very good and consistent experience there!

I dined in last night for dinner. I had the carne asada plate. The food had no flavor and also found two pieces of hair in my food. I also took my daughter to bathroom and all three stalls were out of toilet paper and the bathroom was really dirty. There were so many people trying to use the bathroom to find out no toilet paper in all three. If im paying 90.00 I would think they would keep the bathrooms maintained. On a good note we had a great waiter and that&#39;s why I  didn&#39;t want to complain. I come here all the time and never had this happen.So disappointed and a waste of my money.

When you drive 45 minutes to visit an establishment like this in Pasadena and pay $15.00 for parking you expect good service. Right at the door the hostess gave us an attitude. She tried to sit us in a small booth when she clearly saw my 6&#39;3, 345 pound date wouldn&#39;t fit in it even if I cut him in half. When we politely ask for larger booth she rolled her eyes. I didn&#39;t know eyes could roll so far back. Thanks to Miguel our server for saving the night. The food was good and my dates Birthday was not completely ruined. To that hostess thank you for making my date feel so awkward and ruining his birthday.

We went here last night around 7:30pm on a Sunday night. There was a five minute wait and the hostess seated us very quickly.<br><br>We got the avocado egg rolls to start. Boy, they get better every time I order them! If you like avocado, you will love them too. The green dipping sauce they serve it with is really good too!<br><br>I got the Cesar salad and my boyfriend got the cheesesteak sandwich. Both entrees were made fresh and the portions were large! We now both have lunch for Monday. <br><br>Our waiter was attentive and helpful, just can&#39;t remember his name. Cheesecake Factory is always enjoyable and the food is great!

I usually LOVE the Cheesecake Factory, but the customer service at this location was not the best.<br><br>Right off the bat, my friend walked in and asked how long the wait for two was and gave the hostess his name and she rolled her eyes at him. And on top of that, we just didn&#39;t feel welcomed by her and her coworkers behind her. They all just glared at us.<br><br>SECOND, we were seated and ordered food. When it arrived, we asked for two plates -- we got one lol. We asked for an extra plate, our waiter came, gave us the plate and just glared at us. <br><br>Another thing I thought was weird was that they didn&#39;t offer cheese? Or at least didn&#39;t ask if we would like cheese with our pasta. But I&#39;m not using this against them. Maybe it&#39;s just this location hat has a different routine, but I just felt that it was odd that other locations did this and not this one. <br><br>So overall experience wasn&#39;t that great. But I still enjoyed the food. I most likely will not visit this location again.

This is the worst service and experience I have ever encountered at any restaurant. Service was extremely slow, we waited 45 minutes to receive our first meal with a party of four.  To make matters worst one entree was wrong and it took the kitchen forenever to bring the dish. That&#39;s right I said forenever because it never came. <br><br>Out of respect for my two daughters I didn&#39;t get raise my voice nor lose my cool even though I was beyond pissed about the whole dinner experience.  The manager did remove the missing entree from our bill and gave me a 25% discount but ruined my daughters celebration dinner.  Epic fail Cheesecake Factory!

I used to LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. So as a treat I decided to order in using Postmates. Sadly two of the four things i ordered &#34;weren&#39;t available&#34; and the only vegetable I was left with, the grilled asparagus, was the WORST vegetable dish i&#39;ve ever had. They were rubbery and had absolutely NO FLAVOR! Didn&#39;t even looked grilled. More like steamed. Definitely not worth the $ price tag.<br><br>Sad to say but i think the Cheesecake Factory has seen it&#39;s day, and it&#39;s long gone!

I come here for happy hour sometimes but after coming here on November 1st 2018 I doubt I&#39;ll go back.  I went to the bar around 410 pm no one was at the bar fine.  Girl came up and asked what I wanted.  No smile nothing.  I asked for a happy hour menu she looked at her watch oh ok.  I ordered a drink and then food.  She was smiling and talking to her coworkers but I felt like I was an inconvenience to her.  My drink was gone I put my card in the cup.  She never asked if I wanted another drink or anything so I just paid and left and went somewhere else.  I dunno I go to happy hour here a lot and I probably won&#39;t be back.  I haven&#39;t had an issue until today.  Maybe she&#39;s going through something but she&#39;s alienating the customers

Food is good but service is meh. The food here is as expected-- I had yummy italian pasta and it was pretty filling. But the service is terrible. I stopped by on Sunday evening for my godmother&#39;s birthday dinner and it had a 30 minute wait time because they don&#39;t do reservations. It took forever for the waiter to come by to take our order and our food didn&#39;t come out all at once. My skinny shrimp angel hair pasta came out last ... 10 minutes after everyone else&#39;s order. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t come here again on my own.

The ONLY reason to come here is THE CHEESECAKE!!! Of course the service is not great (you remember that Penny on the Big Bang  was a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena and the running joke was how bad the service was) but the cheesecake is worth it - get it to go if you must!
Fave place to celebrate my birthday with my loved one  their calamari is the bomb, I tried the other flavors of cheesecake, but I didn&#39;t like it, I&#39;d stick with original flavor.

Take advantage of the HH all their appetizers are very tasty + flavorful!! Got full off just HH appetizers made with great quality~<br><br>Fave/MUST TRY!!<br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls<br>That Lettuce Wraps<br>Buffalo Blast<br>Crab + artichoke Dip<br>Tex Mex Eggrolls<br>Fire Roasted Fresh Artichoke<br>Fried Macaroni Cheese

Alright. I went with OG and she got lasagna verde and I got carne asada steak medallions. We both got raspberry lemonade. First of all, the raspberry was EXTREMELY SWEET. She liked her lasagna, but she said that it was a bit salty. As for me, I was disappointed with the carne asada steak medallions. The steak portion is not worth getting this plate. <br><br>On a positive note, the atmosphere was great. The service was great.
Always good.   Great service and food is excellent.  I had the avocado, mango salad that is fantastic and my wife had the chicken taquitos.  Always a good place to stop

I lived in San Mario 10 years ago, used to come to this place all the time, loved it. But I guess that was 10 years ago. Came back with family on a Friday night. Was not busy, but server was horrible, maybe because we are Asian.Francisco our server did not came back to or table one time other than deliverer the food. Asked for stake knife after 10 minuets delivered the stake. Asked for Togo box, rushed throw to our table. He was so busy that not even had a minute to ask if we needed anything. I talked to the manager after, and Francisco screamed at me said he stop 5 time. Yes&#39; after I requested someone to get my server 3 times, he stops for one time!  Advice for Everyone! If you want your server scream at you on Friday night with family, this is the place to go

I&#39;m sorry but who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake factory? Yes it&#39;s bad for you, so is a lot of other food. Yes, the menu is ginormous but at least you&#39;re not limited with options.<br><br>The wait at this location has gotten much better over the years. This is likely in large part due to all the new restaurants popping up in old town. <br><br>My menu favorites are the spicy chicken chipotle pasta, bistro shrimp pasta &amp; the shrimp scampi. For apps, who doesn&#39;t love the avocado eggrolls &amp; fried mac &amp; cheese?
