The frozen iced mango is also delicious if you&#39;re looking for a cool, non alcoholic drink option... but no one is really looking for that :-)<br><br>The food is consistent as is the service. The bonus about coming to the old town location is that you can walk around &amp; shop before/after.

I love Cheesecake Factory I truly do but this one in Pasadena needs better management and employees. So I just wanted to grab a few cheesecakes on my way home and we all know their is no parking so you have to park in the parking structure and/or pay. So I go inside and no one greets me or anything ok cool let&#39;s get what we came for the cheesecake. As I&#39;m standing at the counter to order the cheesecake it&#39;s no line or anything actually it&#39;s one lady standing next to me and she looks really annoyed. The guy and girl employees on Friday night are laughing, chatting and more for I would say about 7 minutes before they even acknowledge my presence which they both looked at me a few times before even helping ok cool I&#39;m kind of getting annoyed but I&#39;m focused on the prize the cheesecake. Now it&#39;s been about 11 minutes and the guy finally asked me what I want? Hmmmmm  ok I told him he says it will be right out. Now at this point it&#39;s been 15 minutes and no cheesecake mind you I didn&#39;t sit down and eat this is a grab and go situation. The guy and girl employees are still laughing and chatting the whole entire time. Now I see why it takes so long to get the cheesecake the employees just take their sweet precious time to help customers. I have one question why would it take almost 30 minutes to get a few slices of cheesecake? When it&#39;s no line and only one other lady next to me? So it took 20 minutes of them talking and no cheesecake because I was extremely annoyed and upset that they could be so rude and not care. I will never come back to this Cheesecake Factory again after almost 30 minutes of waiting for a Cheesecake I never received I left I couldn&#39;t take it any longer.

Just by writing this review, I want to go to Cheesecake Factory for dinner tonight!!!! It&#39;s been a long while since I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory and every time I go, I always love it.  Without skipping a beat, my friend and I always order the following:<br><br>Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms: I just love everything about this dish,  from the tender juicy chicken to the sweet marsala/mushroom sauce.  <br><br>Chinese Chicken Salad: This is the &#34;it&#34; salad for me at Cheesecake.  They have tons of other delicious salads but this is the one for me.<br><br>This location can get really crowded and parking is not that fun but if all that bothers you, just think of getting a slice of the Vanilla Bean cheesecake for dessert and it will melt all your stress away.

Dont ever come here !!! I went yesterday around 2pm and waited 20 mins to be seated at the worst table ever !!! To top it off, the hostess didnt even ask if i want booth or table and got my bf and I a table in the worst place ever. Small table and i specifically said that it is my bday and i want a booth and she said ok i&#39;ll see if there is a clean table. There were like literally 3 booths open, no dirty plates what so ever and it was clean already! But she insisted saying it needs to be clean. So annoying . She was wearing all black, black skirt, skinny , long hair with a ponytail Hispanic girl, young , and she acted like she is all that ! No customer service what so ever. As customers we have the right to move tables. We are bringing money to your restaurant and thats how you served us? After waiting additional 15 mins, we left. Not only we wasted time finding parking, waited 20 mins to be seated in the worst table ever and then waited extra 15 mins to be moved and STILL NOT FOLLOWED UP TO MOVE , we were gone. I do not recommend coming here. That hostess should work in the kitchen or something not be the face of cheesecake factory. Such a bad vibe and to top it off there were OPEN TABLES !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I was extremely dissappointed and especially this happened on my bday. It was suppose to be a celebration but she ruined my vibe. Was it so hard to be moved to another table that was ready?!!!!!!!!! Literally no plates on the table what so ever. And her excuse was to be cleaned ? Clean what? It needs 15 mins to be cleaned ?!!!!!!! Mind you, no one even came to help us, not even saying wait a minute, sorry for the wait, nothing. Ridiculous !!!!!!! And to top it off, no busboy even came to clean the table, thats how you know the booth was clean already. She is something else. If i could give 0 stars, i would. This happened yesterday around 2 pm. Hostess: hispanic, young girl, black skirt, black stockings, black top. She is rude and has no customer service what so ever.

Ordered a dinner portion of Spicy Chipotle Chicken pasta during the lunch hour. What happened to the tortilla strips that use to come on the dish?? and I&#39;m pretty sure this is the lunch portion. The Cheesecake Factory sure isn&#39;t what it used to be.

This place is mine and my boyfriends favorite place to eat. Their servers are always nice and attentive. We&#39;ve never had bad service here!<br><br>Menu--huge selection.. I have trouble deciding what to eat here and it&#39;s really annoying. I always have to do the process of elimination cause I have trouble choosing between 5 entrees. Everything just sound soo goooddddd<br><br>After being here over 50 times....... here are my suggestions:<br><br>Appetizer: Fried Mac N Cheese-- SOOOOO good omg. Fills you up like crazy, though.. Caesar salad is also amazing. Their dressing is garlic-y so if you hate garlic.... stay away. Nachos, avocado egg rolls, spinach and artichoke dip... delicious.<br><br>Entree: My recent favorite has been the southwest chicken sandwich.. My favorite sandwich besides the california cheesesteak. The spicy chipotle chicken pasta is also one of my top choices!<br><br>Dessert: UM.. literally any cheesecake. They&#39;re all bomb.

So, here&#39;s the thing. I am starving. I decided to give Cheese Cake Factory another chance. BAD idea!!! Never ever again. I was seated immediately yay!!!!<br>I waited almost 15 minutes to be acknowledged by the wait staff. I decided 15 minutes was long enough. HELLO, they aren&#39;t very busy...<br>I will probably head over to IN and Out. Cheaper, better food, and no tipping...

A good place to get your grub on if the wait isn&#39;t longer than 30 minutes, which is almost never.... I came here with a party of 8, and the wait was atrocious. They quoted us around hour, it ended up being two.....<br><br>I wasn&#39;t feeling adventurous so I just got the Classic Burger with cheddar cheese. It&#39;s a typical burger with lettuce, tomato, grilled onion, and sauce served with a side of French fries. Large portioned and juicy, not a bad choice for those not in the mood for pasta or anything else. I also stole a bit of my friends steak Diane with shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta substituted for the mashed potatoes. The steak was juicy and tender and the shrimp scampi was full of flavor, not too salty. For dessert we decided on a chocoate mousse cheesecake. Now normally I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake at all, but holy crap the chocolate mousse was the perfect way to end the meal.<br><br>Food is a solid 4 stars, but I have to subtract a star for the absurd wait time.<br><br>Located in the heart of Old Town Pasadena between the crosshairs of Fair Oaks and Colorado, parking can suck depending on the time of day and day of the week. There are a few parking structures located in the vicinity but they can fill up often.

Came here for Sunday brunch because there was no wait. Their food is probably not the healthiest since it seems like everything is cooked with a lot of butter. I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, and although it was soft and fluffy, it was also very &#34;heavy&#34; at the same time. I had a serious case of food coma after eating there. This probably isn&#39;t the best place to eat, if you&#39;re on a diet.

This Cheesecake Factory is always packed! It is not surprising to see the crowd of waiting people go out the door here, especially at dinner time. It is pretty crazy, especially considering how much seating they have available inside. It is a large restaurant! Parking is either street parking or one of the public parking lots; the one I usually park at is just a block away on Green.<br><br>The last time I came here, I was with JC and we were seated at a table on the Fair Oaks side, with large windows letting in a ton of natural light. My favourite part about coming to The Cheesecake Factory is their complimentary bread! I usually always love white bread more than brown bread, but this place is the exception. Both breads are delicious, but there is something extra addicting about the brown bread. So good!<br><br>My friend ordered an omelette with potatoes and even more brown bread! I don&#39;t remember which omelette she got but she liked it. I just ate a few of her potatoes and that was it. I ordered their BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad: Avocado, Tomato, Grilled Corn, Black Beans, Cucumber and Romaine All Tossed with Our Barbeque Ranch Dressing; Topped with Lots of Crispy Fried Onion Strings for Crunch. It was really good! Next time I would get it without black beans, but I liked everything else. I really liked that they added onion strings to the salad, yum!<br><br>The portion sizes here are large so I had enough salad leftover to bring home. Combine that with the leftover bread from our second basket and I had enough for another meal.<br><br>I have to admit that I was not always a big fan of this chain restaurant, but I have since changed my tune and now I love it. I would come back just for that bread alone...

My steak medallions and shrimp were the best ever!!!<br>I&#39;ve had this same dish countless times and today it was superb!!! My raspberry martini was good, but not as I&#39;ve had it before.  I always order it &#34;double shaken&#34; so I can see the tiny crystals on top but today it was just cold. Still a great time with besties!!

if I can give no stars I would. The waiter was so rude I wish I had taken his name he was white with colored eyes and old and bald and spoke with a weird tone. He was so rude possibly the rudest most racist waiter I&#39;ve ever had. Actually all their staff is racist and rude they always stare at you for long periods of time if you&#39;re not white. But this one guy in particular he was already old asf he looked probably 50s and even my boyfriend said &#34;this guys kinda weird he spoke to us really strange&#34; my boyfriend never says stuff like that so I knew it wasn&#39;t just me. He kept passing by and staring at me like if he thought id killed someone then me and my boyfriend were barely 20 percent done with our food and this guy comes up to us and stands in front of our table and just looks at us till we both look at him and he says &#34;how are we doing?&#34; Like rushing us when it wasn&#39;t even busy. I felt so harassed. Then he came back to say that about three more times up until he said &#34;would you like a box for that?&#34; And we said no and he left. Then a couple minutes later he walked by and then sort of turned his back to look back at us and looked at our table and rolled his eyes and let out the biggest sigh even with everyone talking and the loud ambience I heard his sigh loud and clear and he walked back to us and said &#34;are we doing okay?&#34; Like if he was rushing us wtf that&#39;s when I lost it and I asked for the check I wish I hadn&#39;t left any tip but my boyfriends too nice for that so I had to leave tip but if it wasn&#39;t for me I would have left the dime that was left. So rude they think just because they&#39;re white means they have so much privilege no honey you don&#39;t sit down id be glad to take this to ACLU. I felt strongly harassed and couldn&#39;t enjoy my night out with my boyfriend.
From this day on I&#39;ll stick to the Arcadia location . Customer service was terrible . If you&#39;re not a people&#39;s person you shouldn&#39;t be working at a restaurant

Not so happy with this specific location..... Wait was so long which ok it was a Friday but my Cesar salad was all left over yellow part of salad come on I did pay almost 15$ bucks for this waiter was nice felt bad sending it back
My egg roll sampler was burnt. The manager removed the meal from my bill and made me a new sampler. My server was awesome as well. I appreciate the service!

I have always enjoyed The Cheesecake Factory,  but was extremely impressed with the service here!  Our waitress Barbara T was incredible,  efficient,  friendly and made our lunch experience such a wonderful experience.   The food was also wonderful!  Thank you Barbara for an awesome experience!
A great spot to eat.  The menu offers a great selection at affordable prices.  The atmosphere is cozy and the service is pleasant.

Went for to the first time and service was horrible and food was bland no flavor. We were seated within 15mins which I didn&#39;t mind the wait, but after ordering our food we waiting like what felt an hour. Our waitress had a ugly attitude when were waiting for our change. Never going back.

I ordered a Jambalaya suggested by the waiter. Said that it was the best option, it was supposed to have  shrimp and chicken. The taste was okay nothing to rave about but there was only 3 pieces of shrimp. When I told this to the waiter he said oh man you should of told me that before I could brought you more shrimp but the funny thing is that I wasn&#39;t done eating my food yet. So not sure I will be coming back to this place or ordering that dish again at this place. The last time I was here I had the fish and chips and their fries were cold.

Most effed up service ever. Asked for well done and they brought it out 3 times looking the same. Wife&#39;s pasta was cold. Manager CECILIA didn&#39;t want to compensate and in fact sassed back with major attitude. BRYANT ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER came in and calmed me down and situated everything. CICILIA YOU NEED A CHILL PILL, consider yourself not a customer service job.

My son and I just ordered food from this place. So disappointed. Shrimp pasta only had about 2 or maybe 3 shrimp at $20 a plate. Not just that, my jambalaya had ZERO flavor.  Bread was rock hard. Everything was tasteless. What a waste. The hell happened to this place???!!

I happened to have some time to kill and was hungry. I also had a gift card I figured I&#39;d take advantage of. <br><br>First of all five stars for service. The bartender was really awesome. I forget her name but she was super friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. She was also really amazing at dealing with the dbag sitting at the bar being obnoxious towards her. <br><br>The food I wish I could give zero stars. There weren&#39;t near as many healthy options as I had hoped for. And the one salad that looked appealing, tuna tataki, was insanely overpriced at $19. Tender Greens doesn&#39;t even charge that much for their Tuna Niçoise salad. <br><br>I ordered the skinnyliscious veggie burger. It came with a side salad. The side salad was only lettuce and tasted like chemicals. I immediately spit it out. I proceeded to eat the burger. It was ok. I didn&#39;t have high expectations for a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; veggie burger at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The issue was shortly after with the pains I felt in my stomach. I don&#39;t think I had full on food poisoning but there was something definitely not ok with the burger. <br><br>There are way better, healthier, and budget friendlier options in the area. I won&#39;t be returning.
The key lime cheesecake here is pretty good but the service here is so bad. We had been waiting for 30 minutes but nothing came out. We were so disappointed and decided not to come back.

Thank you to the man at the cheesecake counter that helped my daughters order cheesecake. This is the best experience we&#39;ve had at this location to date (they don&#39;t have an average of 3 stars for no reason). My husband and I are at home with a small child and it was so nice to be able to send out our older kids to bring us home some dessert. Thanks again!

Scratching this one off our list for our weekly meal out for a while. Seated within a few minutes and our drink orders were taken promptly. It took over ten minutes to actually get the drinks (iced tea and hot tea) yet another ten to get a tea bag. Order taken promptly after that: artichoke and spinach dip. The bread that came with the dip was so stale we were sure they had been donated by a local dentist to get new patients. When I tapped it against the plate, I was waiting for the plate to crack. New bread was indeed provided but by the time we got it we had plowed through the regular bread and found the huge unstirred lump of cream cheese in the bottom of the dish. Meal finally arrived: I got a burger. My burger came with a side of weave; long black wavy hair. I was too sick to even mention it, more like stunned to silence. Asked for more hot water for tea. Water taken, refilled and returned sans tea bag. Had to ask a different server for another tea bag. We were just writing the whole experience off as &#39;one of those nights&#39; when two tables of four were seated on either side of us: both with kids. Loud kids. We were boxed in. When the couple on one side of us with a noisy four year old order double vodka tonics, I knew we were sunk. <br><br>Asked for boxes to take our meal home (out of habit, I won&#39;t be eating it) and the server presented us with the smallest box possible.  I had to origami my fries to fit before I could close it. Another ten minutes to flag the kid down to get our check and I whipped my card at him like a Ninja Star so he wouldn&#39;t leave again. <br><br>Paid quickly and headed out. My partner did attempt the ladies room but it was so disgusting her shoes stuck to the floor worse than the gum that was stuck under our table!!!<br><br>We&#39;ve had good experiences here. This was not one of them.

I picked Cheesecake Factory for a milestone birthday dinner last night with friends. I&#39;m really sad about my choice. <br><br>It started with trying to make a reservation for 6pm on Sunday. I was curtly told I needed to call  back for a same day reservation, advance reservations are not made for Saturday/Sunday. I called back on Sunday as directed - about 11:30am. I was then told they only take reservations during the first hour. When I asked the hostess on the phone where I could find that information (on the website, etc.), she was confused, then flustered, then, being asked again, she said she was new and didn&#39;t know. <br><br>We had a mix-up of some kind on being called to our table. The cell phone was rung, then we were sent back to the bar for another 10 minutes. We&#39;d already closed our bar tab, I&#39;m not sure what the mix-up was, since I was the birthday girl, I didn&#39;t get involved. I was just glad our spots were still available. Overall, our wait was just over the quoted 30-40 minutes. <br><br>After a very long delay (shorthanded???), our table-ordered cocktails arrived - after the hot appetizers and my martini included an eyelash or similar. (It didn&#39;t have mascara on it, so it didn&#39;t come from any of us.) The wait for drinks, including the replacement, was quite long and without explanation. The only drink our server was on top of, was coffee for one of us.<br><br>A BIG DISAPPOINTMENT was that, even with the extensive menu, it was a challenge to find something for one of our group that has serious food allergies. No potatoes beyond french fries without dairy?!?!? We were told the smashed potatoes contained sour cream, and there is no baked potato option. Broccoli is great - but not exactly an indulgement. <br><br>The final straw was that at the end of our meal, we were approached by a previously-unseen employee, all in black, who abruptly asked &#34;Do you need something else?&#34; as though we were in the way. We were actually waiting for the additional &#34;To Go&#34; food one of us ordered as well as our packed up leftovers. Our actual server had nicely offered to keep them together in back until we were finished and ready to go. The employee was told why were waiting, he took off before we&#39;d finished getting the words out and then returned and essentially through 8 bags of food at us. Talk about a sour taste being left. :( <br><br>That final exchange - his tacky, disrespectful approach to us after we spent close to $100 each, inspired this review. I sincerely doubt I&#39;ll return to this, or any other, Cheesecake Factory in the future. It makes me sad since I usually meet friends once every month or two at various ones near different friends.

Best service , good drinks! Manager was very attentive, I didn&#39;t her name. She was pretty! Blonde hair. Also our 2 servers . Service was good , we felt very  appreciated for our business as a customer.ill be back !!!

Down the tubes...I&#39;ve never seen a restaurant tank so fast. They served me a veggie burger with an avocado buried in the lettuce that was as brown and putrid as wet paper bag. When I complained the manager came over and was phony and basically said sorry...I&#39;ll get you a new avocado. When she came back she only offered to fill my Coke which had sat empty for 10 minutes prior. They offered no service recovery or even offered to make me a new burger. It was gross. I can&#39;t say I&#39;ll ever go back.

I ordered my pasta for to go 30 mins before I came to the restaurant, and then no ppl at the cashier and no one willing to help. Finally someone come to me and she told me to wait and left again. ... What a great customer service here‍

Okay! Let&#39;s get something straight here... Whether it&#39;s a mom &amp; pop or a corporate chain, you just can&#39;t deny good food! ...and Yes, Cheesecake Factory whether you  like it or not has some hands down pretty darn delicious lean and mean dishes!<br><br>We arrived at the Cheesecake factory anticipating a long line, surprisingly eventhough there was quite a few of us waiting to be seated (it&#39;s a Friday night mind you) we didn&#39;t have to wait long. <br><br>Service was okay, our server took our drink orders while we browsed the menu; It&#39;s one of those night that calls for a flavor packed dish - &#34;Cajun Jambalaya Pasta!&#34; This very generous serving of Shrimp and Chicken Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a spicy cajun sauce really hit my cravings for tonight, I love how the spices did not over power each other giving this dish a nice balance between heat, flavor and spice. Served on top of Linguini pasta, this dish will sure fill you up! It&#39;s really good!<br><br>When you are at the Cheesecake Factory - you MUST save room for dessert! A slice of Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake for my friend and a slice of the Original Cheesecake for me! &#34;Sharing is caring&#34; we split up our cheesecakes so that we could both have a taste of this sinfully delicious slices! Absolutely divine! The Chocolate Mousse cheesecake felt light and airy yet so rich and decadent! The Original Cheesecake in my opinion was pretty darn good - just the right amount of sweetness, a slight hint of tart, creamy and overall just decadent. I LoVE it!<br><br>We had such good time at the Cheesecake Factory, Delicious dishes and amazing desserts, I really didn&#39;t mind the short wait, there&#39;s plenty of visual distractions in the waiting area - cheesecakes of every size and color, cakes layered so high and looked so sinfully good!!! So get your train of thought out of the rut about corporate and non-corporate restaurants - whether the food was prepared by your momma or by Executive Chef Boyardee... Good food is good food, plain and simple - so enjoy!

I&#39;ve taken a break from dining at Cheesecake Factory after going on a weight loss diet but I went there to see my family yesterday and was surprised to see that they&#39;ve added a diet menu! I would still consider the items to be cheat meals but they&#39;re at least half the calories of their regular menu items. The food was absolutely delicious and they brought all our food at the same time. This restaurant is quite consistent with the quality of their food and service of their staff and I am definitely coming back.

To management, I rarely file complaint because I was from restaurant business, but this time I really have no patient, at all! pls find my complaint below. <br><br>1. Server didn&#39;t bring the bread even my appetizer already came. <br><br>She said she would get me some, until I have to eye watching her &#34;3 times&#34;, then &#34;finally&#34; she remember <br><br>2. No follow up our table at all. <br><br>No refill nor take the empty plate away<br><br>I was so glad the server who was took over during her break (I forgot her name), she helped us do the refill, plus another sever who just &#34;walked by&#34;, she helped us took the empty plate away. <br><br>Pls note, the tips I gave is for those 2 person, who help us out, not for the server Alyssa, who basically didn&#39;t provide any service.<br><br>Thx for your attention!

Street parking is a challenge in Pasadena so you may want to just park at a structure. The wait to get a table was not bad but I was there in a Thursday night. Our server was very attentive and service was very good. That warm bread they bring is delicious. I had the Miso salmon as my main dish and Fried cauliflower and Ahi tartare for appetizers. Everything was delicious... except<br>the sangria, I was a little disappointed.

Came here 5/14/2017 for my birthday/Mother&#39;s Day dinner (joint celebration with me and my mom) Although it was obviously really busy, we got great service, and my mom got a tremendous champagne cocktail, that was better than I&#39;ve had at fancier restaurants. Even though I had made my birthday cake at home, a banana cake with fudge buttercream, I still got &#34;Happy Birthday&#34; sung to me with a mini hot fudge sundae. So cute!!! Better than many other CF locations, in terms of both food prep and presentation, as well as service

Good food - nothing special<br><br>Portion sizes are huge though<br><br>I can see this place being a fun place to go celebrate a family birthday party or something<br><br>The cocktails are not priced that reasonably at $12<br><br>But I did love their appetizers - the hot chicken was delicious<br><br>Cajun pasta was decent. Would go again

I had the chicken alfredo lunch special, which is half the size of the dinner portion and it was still too much food for one sitting. There is a bread basket presented to the table before the food comes out that is warm and delicious. <br><br>The pasta itself was fine. It wasn&#39;t spectacular and it wasn&#39;t disgusting. I would get it again but I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to go to Cheesecake Factory for it. <br><br>This location will not take reservations, which was sort of inconvenient. The lobby is small, but the actual dining area is rather large.

Worst services ever! The waiter was annoyed at the fact that we weren&#39;t ready to order our food. I ordered a kids slider for my 5 yr old &amp; it was so gross, the meat was raw &amp; all the blood from its was on the bun. I told him about it &amp; said well that&#39;s how it&#39;s supposed to be! Ummm excuse me but NO it&#39;s not! He had an attitude &amp; was annoyed after I made him take it back. We got our food &amp; he never came back to refill our cups. We were so damn thirsty from all the salt we had just consumed &amp; We waited and waited and waited but he was too too busy chatting it up with the female hostess. Every table was being waited by other waiters/waitress except ours. Then we finally got his attention &amp; just with an attitude gave us the check. We wanted a dessert but he didn&#39;t even bother to offer us anything else I was so upset I just paid and left. Never again will I go to that location again!

First time at this location celebrating a birthday with my sons. The service people were very kind and servers were excellent. I am very happy with the location and everything was quite clean and decorations were nice too.Bathrooms were clean and had paper towels and soap. I liked how nice the manager was and accommodating to us since we were a large group also. The food was not so great but the fish and chips looked good. I would highly recommend this place to anyone celebrating a birthday and will come back again.

The veggie burger was completely void of flavor! Not a grain of salt nor pepper mill was harmed in the making of this flat and lifeless pad of gray matter. I will leave this struggle burger where I found it and bid it adieu. FOREVER.

I wish there were half stars so I could give this 3.5 stars. I don&#39;t mind going here to eat, but I&#39;m likely not going to pick it if I&#39;m the one picking the restaurant. The portions are really big, so I&#39;m glad they have a section of the menu with smaller plate options and the prices reflect the size change. There are almost too many options, the menu book is a little overwhelming, however this problem would likely be an advantage of going with a group. <br><br>They provide complimentary bread and butter that&#39;s pretty tasty, but be sure to pace yourself.<br><br>My favorite part is that they have a display case for their desserts so you can see your options before ordering.<br><br>If you can&#39;t make up your mind on what to order some of the entrees can be halved and combined.

Came here last night after a few hours at the spa. It was my birthday so I decided to enjoy a nice meal at the cheesecake factory. We ordered the avocado egg rolls in Nashville hot chicken nuggets as appetizers.We had the flying gorilla blended drinks as well. After drinks and apps we were stuffed. We decided to take our entrées home to eat later. I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and my friend ordered the Neapolitan Pasta. Unfortunately, both of the pastas were dry, bland, and underwhelming. <br><br>The two stars is actually for the server. She was great... very attentive and super friendly. I love the Cheesecake Factory. Never been to this particular one and hope it was just a bad day for the pasta cook. I&#39;ll probably give this location another try.

I was born and raised in NYC and I&#39;ve had all kinds of shrimp scampi but this cheesecake factory&#39;s (Pasadena,CA) has some amazing shrimp scampi. My hubby got the ribeye with mash. OMG the food was amazing. We only waited 20 mins and for a saturday night, I would have to say that is not a bad wait time. The hostess and the waitress were super nice.

My gosh!!!!  They have 4 hostesses and not one of them can seat a table. The restaurant is only half full and we still have to wait. I honestly think that they just want it to look like there&#39;s a line out the door. So disappointing. By the way, it&#39;s 8:30 at night on a Tuesday and we are starving. What a joke!!!!!<br><br>Please take a moment to read the managements response to this post, that&#39;s what is wrong with this place. In order to get good service, or any service for that matter, you need to come in first thing in the morning or way after 8:30 at night for dinner. I&#39;m still laughing. What a joke!!!!

I&#39;m always pleased when I come here. I love the one in Santa Monica solely because of the balcony view. <br><br>However... <br><br>So, I always order the same thing when I come. The vegan Cobb salad. I&#39;m always pleased when there is a vegan option and I believe there&#39;s a few other vegans options as well. <br><br>I love this place! Everything is always on point, from the food, to customer service, to their amazing delicious cheesecakes, so I&#39;ve heard! I hope they add a vegan option cheesecake soon!

Normally I&#39;m okay with the Cheesecake Factory and I usually go to the one in Glendale. But I work close by to this location and my mother and brother were in the area. I&#39;m not expecting a 5 star dinner service but at least a decent service would be nice. That being said I&#39;m not returning to this location. <br>So I&#39;ll keep it short or as short as I can put <br>-waiting time to be seated was okay can&#39;t complain <br>However, <br>-it took the server to acknowledge us 20 plus minutes<br>-after those 20 plus minutes when he finally took our order it was 25 minutes until the serve came to &#34;inform&#34; us of our order. <br>-when the food finally got to the table  the plate that I ordered which was the lemon herb roasted chicken was way too dry. I believe chicken jerky would be more moist than the piece of chicken that I got served. So I ended just eating the vegetables and the mash potatoes. I left the chicken. <br>I didn&#39;t feel like complaining about anything because at that point I was over the place and the service.
The waiter izeem was super sweet and made us feel comfortable and right at home very nice and humble kept checking on us making sure we were taken care of, really appreciated it.

Went here for my friends birthday and told the waiter. He asked us if we wanted a sundae or a slice of cake. We order a cake and then he later tries to charge us for thew cake. He says that the cake is not free but the sundae is. I don&#39;t think the customers can assume that the sundae is free and the cake isn&#39;t when they give you an option bwtween the two. I had a horrible experience here. And the waiter was so rude and made me pay an extra $8.

Stopped in for lunch. Wednesday afternoon. Not too busy... food was good, as it should be for the price.  Had the breakfast burrito. Good balanced flavors. Not &#39;hot&#39; at all. We also had the Brioche Breakfast sandwich. Good. <br>Service was sub-par, but it cold have just been our server. We don&#39;t usually come down this way, but if I come back I&#39;ll ask for a window table... that area gets better attention. Parking is close walk on Fair Oaks &amp; first 90 min is free... plan on paying if you have to wait for your waitress though. ;-)

It was not long of a wait so my boyfriend and I decided to stay for dinner. We got seated pretty quickly. Our server came and took our drinks and appetizer. After we got our drinks it took 30mins for her to come back and take our order, and at this time we still haven&#39;t gotten our crab bites appetizer!! We waited a little longer and still nothing !!! People who sat and ordered the same time we did, had gotten their appetizers and was getting their food as we waited and had enough we got up and wanted to leave!!! The manager just said she&#39;ll comp our crab bites that we&#39;re nowhere to be found, but we were tired of waiting so we left and paid for our drinks. <br><br>Totally disappointment knowing how they treated us.<br><br>I&#39;m more upset cause it&#39;s also a celebration for my son birthday.a lot so when we have a date night it&#39;s rare and we don&#39;t have much time left that we can go out as much. So to me, this was all such a bummer and such bad service and such a waste of time !!!

I ordered the fish and chips plate. The fish was nice and soft, and the fries were crispy. The coleslaw tasted like I was biting into an onion, but it wasn&#39;t horrible. Our server made lighthearted conversation. Thumbs up! Our orders arrived on time. My delicious passion fruit iced tea was refilled promptly. This location is in downtown, so be prepared to pay for parking.

I love Cheesecake Factory but this location sucks. My experience here at this Pasadena location did not even reach satisfactory level.<br><br>I called in ahead to make a take out order and I was put on hold for 15 minutes. I hung up and tried again. This time I waited over 20 minutes and by that time I was already there so I go into the restaurant and they made me wait 5 minutes to take my order. While waiting the employees were yelling across the room when to clock out..what a pleasant experience that was.<br><br>Finally I get my order 30 minutes later. I ordered a strawberry lemonade and they gave it to me in a kids size cup. I always go to the Brea location and they always give it to me in a large cup which was triple the size of that tiny cup I received. So I asked about it and she said they only give it in that cup. I did not pay $3 for a tiny drink so at this point I was so frustrated and hangry. I wasn&#39;t even in the mood to argue with them so I just left. I got back to my place and my chicken nachos was missing the chicken! There was only just a sprinkle of cheese on my nachos, not to mention she did not even add any silverware or asked if I wanted complimentary bread (Brea location always includes it).<br><br>All I want to say is THIS LOCATION NEEDS TO IMPROVE.

I actually really like this place. I&#39;ve been here a few times. Even had a first date here! It&#39;s a nice place. But all Cheesecake places are similar. I&#39;ve always gotten the lemon chicken picatta. Always A+! My favorite place!

Took my brother here for lunch on his birthday. Surprisingly easy to get a table around 1 pm on a Friday. <br>Servers were really nice, especially when they signaled that we were ordering too much food. While the company might not like that, but ethical staff helps to prevent food waste. The servers also validated our good choices. I appreciated them with a nice tip in return. <br>Food tastes consistently good compared to other branches.<br>Old Town Pasadena makes parking more challenging. Hope this does not affect business like Cheesecake too much.

Again trying to give this place another chance and tonight the server says they have no bread because the bread distributors are on strike. I asked if they could substitute another type of bread and the answer was unfortunately no! Having bread before your meal is one of the perks of coming to the Cheesecake Factory and they can&#39;t  accommodate  a request to substitute their lack of bread. It&#39;s not the servers fault but really a poor excuse to not have a alternative to their complimentary bread. Disappointed once again.
Just got turned on to the cauliflower spicy bites so so good greasy but good - nice  bar and professional peeps

My favorite thing to order is the avocado eggrolls ! They are loaded with avocado and some small peices of sundried tomato. It also comes with this special sauce that tastes really interesting and a must try! I also ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta which comes with bowties and a battered chicken cutlet. The chicken was really tender and tasty and probably the best part of the dish. The pasta was mostly oil and I wish it has a cream base which would have made it much tastier. Make sure you add enough cheese to the dish so that it is less oily and more thick. Flavor was pretty subtle and the pasta was pretty dry in my opinion.

The only reason why I am writing this is because of how nasty my husbands dish was. He got the pasta with chicken and scampi sauce. It looked good except for the pool, literally pool, of oil at the bottom. The manager came out and showed us what the sauce was suppose to look like and it looked like a cream sauce which was definitely not what we got. The manager was nice enough to remove it off our bill but I don&#39;t know if that&#39;s a standard or a mess up. Either way it was discussing. <br><br>They would have gotten 1 star but my dish was delicious.
I don&#39;t understand how you could be out of bread on a Sunday at 3:45pm? <br>This is a major chain... It puzzles me...

Came for HH in Halloween.  Lucky it was not crowded and was able to have a table in the bar area.  Great services today and the spinach dip is always good here.  Ran out of chips so improvised with sourdough...not bad!<br>The HH slider order came with 4 sliders.  $1.50 add&#39;l for fries.  HH cocktail is good as well.

I have to say, I do have better experience with this place before.<br><br>Last week, I ordered a Pasta Da Vinci and Thai Wrap. The Thai Lettuce Wraps were great since the fresh lettuce went really well with the nice seasoned chicken strip and other ingredients. The pasta normally don&#39;t disappoint me, and the chicken were cooked well and soft, the pasta was not bad or meat was not dry at all.<br><br>The Big Part should be the all famous Cheesecake, correct?<br>Turn out, this was a big disappointment. The crust on the cake bottom was thin and wet, and I am pretty sure I have better cheesecake before. At the end, even the strawberry short cake was better than the cake.<br><br>Although the server was alright, I think I might prefer their Arcadia location next time.
Great place, food, and service, but the only problem it&#39;s the server having many tables to attend and might be a little difficult to get his or her attention after ordering your food and drinks.

It&#39;s a long story, but Hubs and I ended up with $100.00 worth of gift certificates to the Cheesecake Factory. Hence, the following review.<br><br>Every store in this chain has seemed overly &#34;grand&#34; IMHO, and this one is no exception.  The aftetnoon we lunched there we witnessed no less than three birthday parties. This is clearly a popular spot for the office workers of Old Town. <br><br>We were seated quickly in a nice cozy booth. Our server was professional and efficient. Hubs and I were confused by the three (3) menus with their numerous and often redundant choices. I found the caloric values of the dishes to be discouraging and off-putting, to say the least. I don&#39;t want to be told that the fish and chips is 1800 calories. I don&#39;t want a guilt trip or a Weight Watchers lecture from a restaurant whose stock-in-trade is cheesecake, for crying out loud. <br>WTF is this anyway? Might as well have a disclsimer saying &#34;welcome fatsos, to our fattening emporium of fatty fatness,  and now for a very special episode of &#34;My 600 lb Life&#34;<br><br>We started with the famous avocado egg rolls, which were amazing and disappeared quickly.<br>Hubs ordered the Seared Ahi plate, which was fundamentally the same thing as my Tuna Tataki salad. Both dishes were en pointe, tasty and surprisingly filling, considering the relative lowness of their respective caloric values.  Both entrees were priced around $20.00, and with our gift certificates,  were an even better value at free.<br><br>At this point in the meal, our server went on break. The guy covering for her was pretty douchey. I didn&#39;t appreciate him trying to take our bread away. By all means, clear our table but first ask if we&#39;re done with something before you just yank it away. Manners! You know how I love me some bread.<br><br>Douchey substitute server also delivered my Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake  without a fresh, clean fork. Or any fork for that matter. Lucky for me that I still had a clean spoon left. Hubs used his remaining fork to help me polish off the dessert, which was creamy, dense, and luscious as cheesecake should be. I love me some cheesecake. Sigh.<br><br>In all, the food was very, very good, albeit somewhat expensive, despite not having ordered any adult beverages. Thank goodness for the gift certificates.
Amazing Food! You cannot beat, The Cheesecake Factory! The salads are big, and taste amazing. The customer service can use to tuning up. But, overall great!
Tbh, idk they r happy to see customers or not<br><br>Ummm maybe I am the only one who did not receive some bread twice

Awesome wait staff. Wish I had gotten her name. <br>We had the egg roll combo platter for an appetizer. <br>Absolutely delicious. Would actually order it as a meal. My friend had breakfast and I had a pasta dish.  Both plates had good size serving, were perfectly cooked and delicious.
Someone should open a school for waiters and make Francisco the headmaster.  Unparalleled service.  Turned our meal into a celebration!
The terrible receptionist, the black girl who has the black curly hair got the worst attitude towards the customer. <br>She will ruin your appetite and ruin your rest of the day.

First off- the portions are HUGE. Way more than one person can eat in one sitting, so you should definitely share. <br><br>I was not impressed with the service. The wait to even get a table was well over 20 minutes, and after that we had to wait an additional 10 minutes for the waitress to take our order. After that we were given bread, which was kinda stale and old. And then we had to wait over 30 minutes for our food to actually come out. <br><br>VEGAN OPTIONS- a humongous vegan Cobb salad- almonds are phenomenal, avocado fantastic, solid salad. Make sure to mix it up.<br><br>Superfoods salad- the grapes are the best part and the dressing is delicious. <br><br>Overall- I enjoy the food, but not the wait or service. We got simple meals that should not have taken as long as it did

READ THIS 1ST (you can read the rest if you want or not. It doesn&#39;t matter. It&#39;s not like Yelp pays me to write.) <br>I remember seeing this food documentary that showed how huge food companies try to make their food as sweet as possible so that it tastes good and is addicting. That is what I feel The Cheesecake Factory is. It&#39;s use of cheap overly used sugar keeps you coming back for more.  If you come here, you&#39;re only wasting your own time and money. <br><br>REST OF THE REVIEW BELOW:<br><br>1st Visit (take out):<br>For take out I got a regular cheesecake and key lime cheesecake. Both were just under $9. They were both too sweet and too rich. They have a thick layer of cream cheese and have hardly any crust. My favorite part is the crust! Really a disappointment and WAAY overpriced for the quality you get and it&#39;s only 1 slice. I&#39;d rather buy a whole pie or cake for just a few bucks more. <br><br>2nd Visit (dine in, but got no service):<br>Why do people like this place??? I mean really. There are so many other better places to choose from. <br><br>DINING IN:<br>Here&#39;s what happened: I sat down, was served bread and was left alone for 20 minutes. WTF? I never had this happen to me at a restaurant before. I even asked another waiter about the problem and still no one came. I didn&#39;t want to waste my time anymore so I left. <br><br>A Comment on the Menu:<br>While I was waiting for 20 minutes I was looking over the menu and it&#39;s ALL American-ized food. Burgers, pasta, and typical breakfast &amp; sides. The reason I&#39;m pointing this out is because if you really want good food, in my experience, I would recommend going to a restaurant that specializes in a particular type of food, meaning if you want a particular type of dish then you should go to an Italian, Southern, or Asian restaurant. The Cheesecake Factory is like a one-stop-shop for all your food needs, which is my theory why people who can&#39;t make up their minds eat here. Next time say to yourself, &#34;Hey, I never had [Indian/Spanish/Peruvian/Vegan] food. Let&#39;s go there instead.&#34;<br><br>3rd Visit (dine in):<br>- Beet salad = slightly on the sweet side. Great combo of flavors. The 2 red and purple beets gave it a meaty texture. Pecans added crunch, but they should not have been candied pecans. Baby arugula added a smooth, mellow vibe. Cheese was creamy and mellowed out the overly sweet notes. Overall, too sweet. 3/5<br><br>- Spicy Cashew Chicken = way too sweet. Tasted like they chose a teriyaki sauce that had the most amount of corn syrup. It wasn&#39;t spicy at all. I assume it&#39;s because it&#39;s cheaper to pay for corn syrup than it is to pay for spices. I couldn&#39;t finish it.

Chain restaurant serving chain food like a chain.  The hours are good though and if you just want Cheesecake it&#39;s probably a good choice.   Otherwise, it&#39;s just middle of the road and priced pretty high for what it is.

I just want to put Veronica in the spot light for New Year&#39;s Eve dinner we had at Pasadena Cheesecake Factory.<br>We just did not have a perfect waitress like her for such a long time. She was kind, courteous, pleasant, quick, and attentive.<br>She made us feel so welcomed and nurtured.

Recently my husband and I decided to go to Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena. I was concerned that the wait might be long but I was pleasantly surprised. We were seated within 5 minutes at a window seat looking adjacent to Colorado Blvd.  Our waitress (I forgot her name sorry) was superb! My husband and I felt like royalty smiles. My husband order a fancy hamburger lunch and I ordered a gluten free dish. Fantastic! The cucumber lemonade is a must try! Sounds odd but the taste is cool, refreshing, just right for a nice spring day. Of course we had cheesecake, my husband loves pecans so we had a slice of cheesecake covered with pecans, caramel, and rich warm chocolate. Thanks Cheesecake Factory for a perfect meal for a perfect date day for my hubby and I. We will be back!

We came here on a Sunday evening for dinner. To our surprise when we arrived there wasn&#39;t much of a wait. The hostess said 5-10 minute wait. It took a little longer as more people walked in and they were being seated before us, which we summed they made reservations. Then we ordered our food and wow, it took FOREVER. It was such a long wait for the food, we were getting so restless. When the food finally came out, it was just okay. I tried a new dish and although it said it was one of their top dishes, it was just okay.

I love their Chicken Picatta! But, I love their customer service more!<br><br>My boyfriend accidentally left my wallet in the men&#39;s bathroom. One of their servers was kind enough to return it! Bless you sir! I&#39;m sorry my boyfriend forgot to ask for your name. He forgets everything, even his girlfriend&#39;s wallet.

Came here after a long long time. We got our seats right away which is pretty good , well it&#39;s on Wed night which is not as crowded as weekend. <br>I love their da Vinci, but I tried new dishes ,Cajun Jambalaya pasta. Huge portion with kicking flavor! <br>Having dinner at cheesecake factory isn&#39;t valid til we order the cheesecake. LoL! <br>1 slice of 30th anniversary cake and 1 slice of kahlua kahlua cocoal coffee cheesecake.NYAM! SUGAR OVERLOAD! <br>The server is so friendly!! I forget her name tho :(

The worst cheesecake factory ever. The wait is 2 hours just to get  sitted after that you&#39;ll get a very bad customer service, thats not even it. They&#39;ll get literally all of your orders the opposite. For example i ordered medium rare ribeye, they&#39;ll give you a well done one to add insult to injury they wont even give you a steak knife for your steak. Pasta&#39;s literally under cook. All the food that they serve looks all the same. And then when we ask for the manager they pretended they don&#39;t have one, then someone came and introduce herself as the manager. I dont know if the server just don&#39;t want to call the manager and lied to us. But yea this cheese factory is just the worst.

We came here as a group of colleagues during a conference week and were really impressed by the service! I wish I remembered our servers names, but although we had one main server, I feel like the team of women working that night all checked in on us at some point. <br>The manager also stopped by to make sure that we were &#34;being taken care of&#34;. <br>With the kind of company I was with, our conversations were pretty lengthy and work-related, but I feel like we were never interrupted even though there were many times that a server came over to our table. They were also really engaging with what we ordered and made suggestions as well. <br>I stuck to my usual: Chicken Picatta and Avocado Egg Rolls. The cheesecake slice that I took home is usually the Reese&#39;s one, but my peanut butter craving this time was fulfilled by the server&#39;s suggestion: (darn, I don&#39;t remember the full name) Adam&#39;s ____ something?<br><br>This location takes the (cheese)Cake!

Literally the slowest Cheesecake Factory ever. The service was so slow and our waitress was not attentative AT ALL. The hiring managers need to wake up. They should also consider selling half slices. They would do much more business!<br><br>*UPDATE*<br>Ordered postmates on a Saturday night because i was babysitting. Specifically asked for no peas and no mushrooms. Also ordered a cheesecake. My order arrives WITH MUSHROOMS AND PEAS and super salty and dry. <br><br>So at this point i am LIVID because I can&#39;t eat the food and now i have to drive to Cheesecake Factory and look for parking and pay for parking.<br><br>I explained to the manager what happened - she apologizes and offers to remake it. I tell her i prefer a refund. She then asks me &#34;but the cheesecake was okay right?&#34; And refunds me just for the pasta.<br><br>I should have been refunded for my ENTIRE meal being that they hugely inconvenienced me and I had to pay a delivery fee through postmates AND TIP the delivery person. All for me to get in my car WITH A BABY and drive there. They clearly dont care about customer satisfaction and just want money. Will never be back.

When to go have lunch with my sister we order chicken piccata was yummy, waiter was really nice a little flustered because both of our drinks had food inside eewww The waiter did apologize and gave us new water.. :)

They need to bring back the ORIGINAL Oreo cheesecake. This thing they are calling Oreo cheesecake is the worst thing I&#39;ve ever had! There&#39;s no Oreo, there&#39;s no cheesecake, just hardened chocolate mousse like substance, marshmallow, chocolate cake, and a bunch of other junk. The worst!

During the weekend you have to wait 15/20min to get a table. But the customer service is really nice !<br><br>We took some salads and as usual the portion were huge !!<br>The Cheesecakes were good, especially the Snickers bar chuncks and the Tiramisu chessecake.<br>The desert that I really love is The Warm Apple Crisp, SO DELICIOUS !<br><br>Of course, you have to ask for a bag before leaving, because it&#39;s pretty difficult to finish all the plates.<br><br>Negative : the thing I really don&#39;t like is that it&#39;s really too loud and it&#39;s very dark.... I prefer to see what i&#39;m eating !
Lmao didn&#39;t know carbonara had so much olive oil in it :/ it just tasted greasy and bland, couldn&#39;t taste any cream in it

I just ordered a Sangria &#34;light ice&#34; and why did they I get half a glass? Not ok. My cousin ordered a sangria as well and that&#39;s how I was able to tell. Come on, This is the Cheesecake Factory. Come on! I&#39;ve spent $300+ at this place! Wow.
Very good chicken Alfredo , I love this Cheesecake Factory the best the other restaurants have a different taste don&#39;t really like going to other cheesecake factories

A little different ambiance than other CCF&#39;s, probably due to this being inside of an existing old building and not built out to the normal CCF specs, but it all worked.<br>Don&#39;t be in a rush, service is slow.  Our wait staff changed during our visit and the 2nd guy was far better than the first (who just had zero personality and zero attention span).  The first guy asked us about 6 times in 5 minutes if we knew what we wanted - really?  You have a novel for a menu, give us a few minutes man.<br>It&#39;s a cheesecake factory.  Usually always ok.

This was the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory.  The restaurant was not crowded, and we were seated promptly, but we waited an hour and NEVER GOT OUR FOOD.  I was alone with my 6 year old and 1 year old, and had no choice but to walk out after an hour of waiting.  When I advised our waitress that we were leaving, she said &#34;They never brought your food?  I don&#39;t blame you for leaving,&#34; but provided NO EXPLANATION about why our food didn&#39;t come and everyone around us had their food, including people who were seated long after us.  It will be a very long time before we return to the Cheesecake Factory, if at all.

Good place for dinner :) <br>I had meatball pasta there and it was a little too salty for my taste. I asked for parmesan cheese, the waitress brought out a big chunk and started shredding some for me, she said I could stop her when i think that&#39;s enough cheese, and she just stopped unexpectedly without asking me. <br>I like the drink there though, maybe i&#39;ll just go back for a drink or something.

Food wise it&#39;s standard cheesecake fare which is not a complaint. Shared deep fried mac&#39;n cheese which is always good. I had the southwest chicken sandwich which I would have again.<br>I didn&#39;t care for the waitress she couldn&#39;t answer the simplest questions about things like parking.

Had lunch here with my wife. We had a veggie burger and a pear and pecan flatbread. Needed more toppings on flatbread. Server was excellent ( Tianna)<br>Very friendly and helpful! Wait for food was too long. Restaurant wasn&#39;t that busy when<br>we arrived. Waited over 30 minutes for food.

Good service, but don&#39;t get the steak.  The steaks are really thin (maybe less than half an inch thick and tough!)    My steak also came with a disturbing stray drop of raw blood on the plate.    I can&#39;t even say for sure that it came from the steak.  Needless to say I lost my appetite.
Love their food.  Waiting area is much to be desired though.  Way to small.  Parking structure nearby.  Lettuce wraps are fabulous!!

I wanted to take the kids out a little and I&#39;m realizing that Cheesecake Factory is now my favorite place to take them... Why...??  Well, I get to enjoy a nice environment with my little cutie pies AND eat their food!!!  LOL.  Unfortunately, my little ones have taken after their father and are extremely picky eaters (my wife totally despises me for it lol).  So, being that they are picky eaters and one of them can&#39;t really talk yet, I come up with a master plan to buy four different kids meals for all of us to share... typically I&#39;ll choose two really good/healthy ones like grilled chicken and grilled salmon and two not so healthy ones (which of course are the ones we all love) like mac n cheese, spaghetti, or pizza.  So our table has a bunch of random plates of different foods along with the bread...  Thankfully when we came to this location the waitress was really sweet.  She totally knew how chaotic it could be with three kids and no adult (I&#39;m the third kid, lol)... And she totally took care of us!!  Oddly enough my youngest ONLY eats the complimentary brown oat bread sticks out of all four plates that I order.  My daughter usually finishes a good half a plate and the rest is for daddy to take down.... Yay for me! <br>Out of all the cheesecake factory&#39;s that I&#39;ve been to, I have to say that this is one of the better ones.  I don&#39;t know if the waitress has kids and understands or not, but she was on point with getting me exactly what I needed when I asked for it.  Many other cheesecake factory&#39;s that I&#39;ve been to just don&#39;t understand that kids only have a small time span until they start getting crazy and the only thing on the table to play with is forks and knives (for those that are worried... dont worry... I supervise them while they play with forks and knives!  LOL j/k).  Honestly, compared to other cheesecake factory&#39;s, our waitress at this location was great, she brought out the food quickly, she brought our more bread when I mentioned that my little one only likes their bread and on top of great service, their food is great!! (even for a kids meal!! LOL).  <br>Overall, I&#39;d definitely come back here.  If I were to compare this cheesecake factory to BJ&#39;s down the street, Cheesecake Factory totally is the winner.  Come by this location and I&#39;m pretty sure you&#39;ll be very happy!

Food is a bit expensive for what you get, in my opinion.<br>Like this location over any others I&#39;ve been to.<br>Barbara was our server, she is so awesome and friendly.<br>Still a nice place to grab a bit in Old Town.
You can&#39;t really go wrong eating here. This is probably my favorite location the food and service are always good.

We happened to be in Pasadena for my son&#39;s soccer tourney and decided to have dinner since we had a gift card. The waitress was very nice and brought us a round of waters and bread while we perused the extensive menu. I ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio and upon arrival I could immediately tell the wine wasn&#39;t properly chilled. I took a drink and it was definitely room temp (a huge no no for white wine drinkers). I wasn&#39;t going to complain but at $9 a glass my hubby convinced me. The waitress brought me back a second glass. The wine glass looked wet on the outside and when I took a sip it was still not chilled (not even a little). The waitress was great and said if it wasn&#39;t chilled then to tell her. She suggested a different wine which I agreed to (at this point I just wanted a glass after being at the field all day). The THIRD glass was STILL not chilled properly but it was good enough. I was shocked that they couldn&#39;t serve a white wine properly!! I am no snob but don&#39;t serve patrons room temp white wines.<br><br>So I ordered the cashew chicken which was pretty good. My hubby ordered the fish tacos and he didn&#39;t like it at all. Rice was cold and hard, fish wasn&#39;t good. He tried to eat it but ended up just leaving it. My boys each ordered he Nashville chicken nuggets. They liked them. They made the mistake of each ordering their own side of fries which was a mistake..... they were HUGE!! I order was enough for a family of 5. <br><br>Needless to say after spending  $100 we left disappointed. We typically enjoy this establishment but this experience was just flat out bad.
One of my favorite place<br><br>Got here early so we didn&#39;t wait for so long on Valentine&#39;s Day.<br><br>Love Chinese chicken salad!<br><br>Steak was great! Juicy and tender.

I think it&#39;s pretty much impossible to not find something you will like here. Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is so vast, that you could go a few hundred times before trying everything on the menu.  <br><br>I, unfortunately am a creature of habit. I usually order the same dish until they remove it from the menu.  I only change it up every once in a while. I had the chipotle chicken pasta.  I love bold flavors and this dish definitely packs a punch.  It&#39;s also large enough that I can take seconds home for later.  I usually start with the arugula salad. I wish it didn&#39;t have as many raisins as it does, but it&#39;s still good. <br><br>Oddly enough, I don&#39;t like cheesecake, so I have never tried it.

I would consider myself a regular at the Cheesecake Factory Pasadena location... Considering the fact that I work within a 2min radius of the store and that fact that my high school friends and I frequent this location when we&#39;re all in town. However, today I was a little disappointed with the service and food provided. Given that the weekend are typically their busiest, from previous experiences, I understood that ordering to go may take a bit longer than usual. Long story short despite the wait time and random off day their management team have gone above and beyond to maintain customer service and have been open/receptive to feedback. The staff here have always been nothing short of pleasant, professional and helpful.

I can honestly say that all of the Cheesecake Factory locations vary immensely when it comes to service and atmosphere. Our server was FANTASTIC! I loved his sense of humor and he was super attentive. The food is usually pretty good, but, this time it was DYNAMITE because my girlfriend and I split the Oreo Cheesecake. Let&#39;s just say my craving was satisfied. The cocktails are always delicious so they get a good rating in that are. <br><br>The only thing that was disappointing is that the beer glasses we were given smelled TERRIBLE!  I don&#39;t know if they were washed thoroughly but they STANK!  Also, the floors were so ridiculously slippery so they either had the floors waxed recently or they were that dirty. I would love to give another star, but cleanliness is a big issue with me so hopefully those issues are resolved.

Hello a couple of days ago it was early close to 11 me and my boyfriend were looking for a place to dine so we chose the cheesecake factory but were very turned off by such loitering in front of the establishment and such very rude panhandling I just wasn&#39;t very comfortable with all the loitering and  smell and rudeness I would say so we decided not to eat there we actually went to a place called  White horse which is amazing you should go I really had an amazing time there and the food is great and there&#39;s no one loitering outside of their business which made me very comfortable and is very convenient and affordable and I really appreciated their services  <br><br>and such beautiful Decour I felt like royalty <br><br>Reiko
Lovely ambience,Yummy food and drinks. Had been here a couple of times and it&#39;s a hit every time and a walk on Colorado after dinner is a plus :)

It&#39;s my first time eating Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve heard so many wonders from it from a good friend of mine that we decided to come here on a Friday. It did not take long to be seated, we went in at around 4:20 and seated immediately. We got window seats which was splendid. My only down side is the utensils were dirty and so was our table. Besides that, I ordered the four cheese pasta with chicken, I was able to make it a lunch plate so that&#39;s a plus. The pasta was delicious and the bread they offer was amazing as well! I also ordered an original cheesecake which I might add didn&#39;t strike me to be all that good, I&#39;ve definitely tasted better. The only reason I give them a four star is due to the dirty table and utensils, besides that service was amazing and I can&#39;t wait to go back!

Talk about inconsistency. I&#39;m a fan of the Cheesecake Factory and have eaten at multiple locations. This one may have just soured my entire experience and desire to dine at another location altogether.<br><br>My Caesar salad was drowning in dressing and the leaves were limp and soggy. A very sad Caesar indeed! Since the very reason I crave the Factory is for their Caesar, it will take me a while to get that craving given my last distasteful experience. <br><br>As for my daughter&#39;s macaroni and cheese, it was scorching hot and the noodles were so dry as if it were microwaved full blast right before serving it to her. If their mac&amp;cheese is in fact microwaved, I would have never known it before. It&#39;s as if the mac&amp;cheese&#39;s dirty little secret were just revealed to me after years of believing it was made fresh daily and not recycled from yesterday&#39;s trash. It&#39;s always been this creamy, delicious and indulgent dish I only sample a few bites of for the sake of counting calories but for my two year old, she can afford it. Not even her mac&amp;cheese could salvage my poor meal here.<br><br>Worst. Cheesecake. Factory. Location.
This was my first time here and I can honestly say I&#39;m going to be coming back for this dish real soon! This Hibachi Steak was amazing and I&#39;m craving for it once again.

The waiter was great and so was the food.<br>The only issue i had today, was getting seated to my table. The hostess by the name Michelle has horrible service and just a bad attitude. She doesnt even bother saying hello nor hands us the menus politely. Like what? Who are you? Ive never been to a cheesecake factory that has had such horrible service. Will never be coming back here again, because of her ignorance.

SUCH BAD SERVICE...<br>Whats up with Cheesecake Factory nowadays?<br>Our bread came towards the end of our meal, our drinks came when we were halfway done with our food. They forgot our cheesecake.<br><br>We told manager who pretty much just came by and apologized and brought the check. It took us over an ENTIRE HOUR just to eat 1 thing at the bar with one drink each because the service was THAT SLOW. When the manager brought our check, she forgot a pen. We didn&#39;t want to wait another hour just to sign our check so we just left. <br><br>Very bad experience! Wasn&#39;t even busy.

We came here for my boyfriends birthday, and it was one of the worst experiences. <br>I try to give everyone in the service industry the benefit of the doubt but this was just uncalled for. <br>We were at first expecting a large party so we called for details, and they don&#39;t take reservations. Fine. My boyfriend then was asking advice on how early we should get there to put our names on the list and the manager had an attitude, didn&#39;t answer any of the questions, and HUNG UP ON US. <br>We get there. Put our names on the list. Told it will be an 1 1/2- 2 hour wait. <br>We over estimated how many people were coming due to nobody RSVPs anymore (our fault) <br>My boyfriend asked if they can take some seats away and she was SO RUDE. She popped a sarcastic attitude and wouldn&#39;t listen. His WHITE friend then says the SAME EXACT THING in the SAME EXACT TONE, and she changes her mood and says &#34;yes of course&#34; <br>I wish i would&#39;ve gotten her name, but i didn&#39;t. She was a white woman with blonde hair and a manager on Friday night 4/26/2019. <br>After we were sat FINALLY after dealing with that awful manager then waitress was very very sweet. <br>Food was eh. <br>Needless to say this isn&#39;t my boyfriends favorite restaurant anymore. <br>Also...why does CHEESECAKE Factory give watery ice cream for a birthday dessert? Haha i give up with this place.

This location is consistent with others.  We had a group of four, had lunch at 2PM on a Thursday and it was about 20% full.<br><br>The menu was extensive and the food tasted great.<br><br>The service, as usual for Cheesecake Factory, was excellent.  Our server was quick, polite, and attentive.  I dropped by huge glass of ice tea and it shattered everywhere.  The servers were quick and non-chalant about cleaning it up and moving along with the rest of the meal.

Read this message it explains A lot about this place just not happy at all . very sad to say I would never go here ever again . place is just terrible nice restaurant but the servers should be replaced . I hope you do retraing here so the next customers have a great experience they need to be very consistent with there service I always come here but never anymore its a done deal !

My coworker &amp; I had our Christmas lunch here. She ordered the Grilled Chicken Avocado club sandwich &amp; I ordered the lunch special fettuccine alfredo with chicken. Our plates arrived &amp; we were both so excited for our food. So my coworker picks up her sandwich slice &amp; finds a hair in it! (GROSS!!!) she has the slice in her hand, &amp; I look at the other slice &amp; there&#39;s ANOTHER hair!! The waiter brings the manager, &amp; the manager is very apologetic. My coworker was very understanding. We know these things happen. It&#39;s disgusting! But sometimes inevitable. So Merry Christmas to my coworker! Hahahaha!
It&#39;s not worth to eat truffle chicken for $18. I got  stomach cramping and diarrhoea right after eating there.

So I didn&#39;t eat here on this visit. We were in the mood for drinks. The mojitos were on point! Refreshing and super yummy. The bartender was busy but got our order out fast. Never got her name. Only reason they didn&#39;t get 5 Stars was the sangria. It was mainly ice and not to tasty. That said the margarita my friend had was crazy good.

Cheesecake Factory has a little bit of everything. For a chain, they are always very consistent. Ive enjoyed my meals here over the years. My only wish at this location is that it wasn&#39;t so crowded.

We had a group of six girls and were seated immediately. Right away we were brought warm bread. Erica was our server and she constantly checked on us and our waters were always full. She smiled and we felt very welcomed. All of us would come again if we are in the area. I would like to add that the fried Mac n cheese balls are amazing!!!
Great service. We were a party of 8 and they accommodated a table for us within 10 minutes. Everyone was really friendly and very attentive. Will definitely be coming back to this location.

This is always a safe option when you can&#39;t decide on lunch or dinner. I like their skinny menu and order the grilled medallions. Everytime I order, somebody asks me where it was on the menu, so people, it&#39;s the very last item on the skinny menu, you know, the one you&#39;re probably ignoring for those bigger plates. Trust me, it&#39;s worth a try!!!! I would like to add that my waitress was very friendly and accommodating; we were given dirty water glasses (food particles inside) and she quickly came over to exchange them. She was attentive the whole time and I&#39;ll probably come back again for lunch. I&#39;ve been here for dinner and the wait varies from 20-60 minutes. So don&#39;t come with too big an appetite if you can&#39;t wait.
Very poor and slow service. Server was not friendly nor attentive to table. Was looking forward to eating here for a girls night out and the server did not make this experience pleasant.

Seriously, been here a few times and it seems the service is getting worse. It&#39;s unfortunate but we were served way later than a couple that was seated after us. The waittress served and tended to the couple next to us even though we arrived quite some time prior to thr couple. The waitress also forgot our appetizer and blamed th line staff :/ when the food came there was a big rubber band in the omelette. We hardly ever have these experiences but this was a doozy.

This location is almost consistently--and shockingly-- crowded. There always seems to be at least 20-30 min wait to get seated and yet ppl always seem to want to come here... Even when there are more interesting places to eat next door w no wait! Shocking. Oh well, it happens. I mean you can go to a mall and go to a cheesecake so why come here and do so? <br><br>Even worse, I was actually taken on a first date here. Yep, it&#39;s nice to let people choose cause then they&#39;re guaranteed to enjoy the food.... But when the food is likely to have been mass produced in those creepy giant tubs of stuff you see in cafeterias (but they do it behind closed doors here so it&#39;s more ok?) and shipped in for consumption, ya gotta wonder what there is to like. Ironically, my only other cheesecake review mentions the ridiculousness of doing so. Ohhh karma. Or, is it worse that he prob hasn&#39;t heard of yelp? Lol <br><br>Aside from being a cool looking building, def feel like I&#39;m missing out on whatever draws the crowds... big portions? The cheesecakes do come out looking pretty though.. Who knows.

Dear god... Why must they drown their food in garlic??!! Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love garlic, A LOT.... But this I CANNOT handle. They have decent dishes that are partially ruined by this. One redeeming quality? Cheesecakes galore! Yum. <br>Service is usually pretty good, bordering annoying.

Location: 5 stars<br>Ambience: 3 stars<br>Food: 4 1/2 stars<br>Wait: 1 star<br><br>I like this particular location, but the waiters/waitresses are slow. Friendly, but slow. It&#39;s like they forget to check on all their tables in their given section. Despite the slow service, I recommend people to eat here when they&#39;ve got time. Took us 10 minutes to sit and eat, but nearly 45 minutes to receive our food even though it looked as though everyone else in our section was getting their food in a timely fashion. After we finished eating it took our waiter nearly 30 minutes just to give us our bill. Disappointed
The free cheesecake thru the Door Dash app is a scam. The FREESLICE promo code doesn&#39;t work at this location and apparently most locations to.

My boyfriend and I visited this location about a month ago and found seats at the bar. We ordered some cocktails and appetizers because it was late and we weren&#39;t in the mood for huge entrees. The bartender (sorry forgot her name) was nice and service was good.<br><br>We ordered some Tex Mex Eggrolls that ended up taking around 20-30 mins to come out. We were really bummed because we were starting to get full. So we just wanted to take them off the bill and cancel the order, because it looked like they had just forgotten about the order. However, a manager (Loretta) came over and took them off the bill and had given them to us anyways because of our inconvenienced. We thought that was super nice of her and she was great!!!

Valentine&#39;s Day in LA and its 86 degrees. We got here at 11:30am and there was no wait. We ordered a Strawberry banana smoothie and fire cracker salmon for starters. The sauce really brings out the flavor of the salmon. <br>For lunch, I had the Jamaican shrimp with mango salad and fried bananas my wife has her favorite jambalaya pasta. For dessert we tried the Oreo dream extreme cheesecake, it&#39;s very rich and filling. I got so full, I wanted to take a nap. But, there is more stuff to do in old town Pasadena.
Great selection.<br>Clean restaurant.<br>Waiter as attentive.<br>Parking is great, it&#39;s nice to have underground parking close by.

Poor service. Slow food. We walked in for lunch to find over a dozen empty tables, but the hostess told us there would be a wait. I explained we were trying to catch a flight and she said if we wanted to be seated right away, the only option was the bar. We get to the bar and order our food, which didn&#39;t arrive for over 30 minutes, even as the tables around us all got their food. The waitress never checked on us during that time. We ended up having to cancel our order. When we asked for the manager, he/she was too busy to meet with us. Absolutely worst experience at any Cheesecake Factory.

I have to start out this review by saying that I really enjoy CF&#39;s food. The portions are great, love the variety of flavors/types of food, great desserts of course. The restaurants always have great locations too, like this one which is in the heart of Old Town Pasadena. <br><br>I&#39;ve been noticing for some time now that the busyness of the place affects the service. Wait times are long and the servers run from table to table. Because of this, I&#39;ve been calling for pickup to just get the food. Unfortunately, the pick up option convenience is now getting worse. <br><br>When I called in the food, they told me 20 mins and it&#39;d be ready. I got there 25 mins later and paid, but my food wasn&#39;t ready. There were three &#34;Door Dash&#34; guys in front of me waiting for their food. Long story short, I waited for another 25 mins (and after asking the worker twice to look into my order). <br><br>Overall, not too impressed with the service. Pickup is negatively affected by these Apps that you can order and pickup with. Maybe I should just embrace it and use Door Dash or something like that.

Absolutely Disgusting. I ordered a burger and fries from here via Uber eats &amp; it was one of worse food experiences I&#39;ve ever had in my life. I literally took one bite trying my hardest to eat it bc I don&#39;t like wasting money and food but I could not. . . . My burger smelled like it was dipped in dirty mop water I gagged, tasted one bite and was not good. . had to throw it away. It was soggy as well . . would not recommend

This Cheesecake Factory is a typical Cheesecake Factory. However, several things stand out for me at the Pasadena location. 1) The bread served prior to the meal &amp; with the meal.
