There is usually a honey oat bran brown bread. It might have a bit of other bran or pumpernickel added to it. It is sweet and delicious. The sourdough is better served fresh &amp; warm. So, ask for warm sourdough. 2) The servers - Jimmy H. was our server. Sarah and Michael also assisted at our table. He was diligent, caring, paid attention to detail, and treated us with excellent hospitality and care. Jimmy H. treats all of his guests as family. If you visit this TCF, ask for Jimmy H.!
I think this location has a slimmer menu compared to other locations.  It&#39;s definitely smaller inside. Our service was quick and food was pretty good. Wait can get pretty long.

Ate here at 6:30p 2-27-2016.  Couple of issues bother me.<br>1.  Food was mediocre, nothing more.<br>2.  Very, very noisy.  Could hardly hear the person I was eating with.  They really need to do something about the acoustics.<br>3.  They now add a suggested gratuity without removing the tax!  That&#39;s not acceptable.  I tip what I want and am usually a generous tipper.  But when a restaurant does that I add it all up myself.  Thanks.<br>Probably won&#39;t eat here again.  No reason to.

Jimmy our server had us waiting legit 40 minutes to come to us and ask &#34;you guys are only have drinks right&#34; when the first thing I clearly stated when he first approached was the food that we would be having (which was nachos). He then goes &#34;let me check on that&#34; and I glanced to his station where he then put in the order for the nachos. It&#39;s not even pack in here, at least 40 people max. NACHOS SHOULD NOT TAKE OVER 15 MINS TO BE MADE ESPECIALLY WHEN ITS EMPTY INSIDE. A couple next to us came 20 mins after us and got there food way before us. Once the nachos were done, Jimmy did not bother to bring us our food but made a female coworker bring our plate out. I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH JIMMY.

Some first dates are more memorable than others. None in my life stand out more than the first date between my wife and me at the ever-busy Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena. Going back now to reminisce and laugh about the awkwardness and excitement of our first meal together is a tradition I hope we will continue for years.<br><br>Our &#34;first date&#34; order:<br><br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>These crispy fried Avocado, Tomato, Onion and Cilantro rolls are a filling appetizer. The side of Tamarind-Cashew Dipping Sauce is cool. I&#39;d prefer more spice, but maybe not on a first date, right. <br><br>Filet Mignon<br>Well, if you&#39;re going to tell a guy you mean business, why not get the most tender steak on the menu. She did. It&#39;s a decent meat offering and comes with some fairly standard French Fries and Onion Strings.<br><br>Sante Fe Salad<br>Even if she wasn&#39;t pretending to be a &#34;light eater&#34;, I was by getting this Mixed Green salad with Lime Chicken, Tomato, Corn, Black Beans, Cheese, Tortilla bits, and a Spicy Peanut-Cilantro Vinaigrette. Yummy and more calories than it should be.<br><br>Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake<br>Want to know if you can spend the rest of your life together? Give him/her the cheesecake test. Can you happily/willingly share a decadent slice of Chocolate Cheesecake with Fudge Cake and Vanilla Mascarpone Mousse. She and I both apparently passed the test and went on to discover that not only can we eat together, but we can stay together. <br><br>Wishing all you first-date diners out there the best of times at Cheesecake Factory. With consistent service, atmosphere, and food, the Pasadena location is worth sharing a special meal (and possibly a lifetime) together.<br><br>She picked the place. I picked her.
Excellent service from Steven. Made the experience even better than normal with his attentiveness.

Always a great experience at The Cheesecake Factory but I wanted to commend our waitresses, Maria and Astrid. So polite, cheerful, professional with all smiles all the time. Great service, great food, never disappointed! Thank you Maria and Astrid for making our lunch even more delightful!

The service here SUCKS.  Stick a fork in me because I&#39;m done with this location.  I&#39;ve given them a few chances and the last visit was my last.  I came for my favorite turkey burger and was told they &#34;might&#34; be out.  I asked the server to check, he went to check and came back and said, yes, out of turkey burgers.  I later spoke to a manager who said they&#39;ve been out at every restaurant for a few months.  They were also out of the dark bread.  We shared a chicken quesadilla because there was nothing else I really wanted.  Once the server saw we werent ordering a huge lunch, he basically ignored us.  Sorry CF, we wont be back.

Breeann is the best server.  Cheery, water glasses never empty, iced tea and coffee same.  Truly the best service we have ever gotten at this too busy restaurant.<br><br>Food as usual was decent, with pretty good sized portions.  New for us was the Crab - Articholke dip - very tasty, not creamed but just the main ingredients .<br><br>The place was extra dark tonight, but since we all had iPhones, using a flashlight took care of the problem.  <br><br>One of these days, we&#39;ll leave room for dessert!

More like 3.5 but there is no such option. I came here with my friend and her 2 children and the service we received was great. I&#39;m not a big fan of chains but I do enjoy the food and variety here. I had a turkey burger from the skinny menu and it left a lot to wish for. Flavor was not there and I was not pleased, but ehhh nobody said eating healthy would be fun. I tried their wings for the 1st time also and I was not impressed at all. Overall I would much rather eat elsewhere but the restaurant is not bad at all

After a long day at work, also a long week, decided to have dinner with my daughter Saturday 5 ish.  With the thought that everything at Cheesecake Factory is usually consistent, food &amp; service, I felt that was the best choice for us in old town. Everything that could go wrong did.<br>Waitress took forever to come to our table, took even longer to bring us drinks &amp; bread.<br>Watched two couples near us be served drinks and finish their dinner before we ever got our food. Our waitress forgot to bring customers credit cards back to two different tables right before my eyes.<br>My daughter ate 1/3 of her burger before she realized it had 1000 island dressing on it when she specifically asked for a dry burger. They were happy to remake the burger,but by that time it was too late, she was grossed out, took the new one to-go.<br>The manager was nice to come to the table and paid for one of our deserts but for $68 dollars, this should have been a relaxing and enjoyable experience. I guess your experience just depends on whether you get a good waitress or a bad waitress.

Ordered two plates: crusted chicken with spaghetti (there&#39;s a fancier name for it but I don&#39;t remember what it was but that&#39;s like basically what it is) and the Alfredo. They were both amazing and huge in portion (better be, I mean about 15 bucks a plate?). I do feel like the spaghetti isn&#39;t that special especially for the price but the chicken is good! The Alfredo is like one of the best ones I&#39;ve ever tasted so that would be my recommendation<br><br>Just because it&#39;s an expensive restaurant, I always do this thing where my friends and I would just share a plate and just split the bill. Also, service was very professional which is good! <br><br>Would come back!

Great food, service, friendly staff. Fun atmosphere. Definitely coming back!! Newly painted, very clean and bright with all the surrounding windows, no waiting to be seated. My  crusted salmon and asparagus was delish along with the mashed potatoes and scrimp scampi, will be getting that again. Delish!!!!
Great experience. We had a gift card and we&#39;re very satisfied with the service and quality of the food. I recommend it highly.

This particular location is always busy so you might have to wait !! The times I&#39;ve been here I go directly to the bar and have found a table ! I enjoyed the bar but it did take a while to get a waitress to come over and take out drink order !<br><br>We orders a cheesecake and it took a little too long for it to be brought to our table ! But it was very good and I enjoyed it very much ! <br><br>They have a television at the bar so you can catch a game or just enjoy a conversation with the person you go with !! Very cozy!<br><br>The one bad thing is that despite the fact that the place is always busy and they have a great clientele the bathroom was not very clean !! There was dirty paper towels all over the floor and the bathroom is not really stocked !! I think for an place that is always busy they need to make sure their facilities are clean and fully stocked !!

Do not go here! I just came by to pick up 3 cheesecakes. The pick up took 20 minutes, and there was really only one couple in front of me! I just got home to eat my cheesecake that I had waited so long, and drove so far for. There&#39;s freaking hair in the cheesecake and the whip cream!!!! How disgusting is this?! $26 for cheesecakes with hair in it!  I have platinum blonde hair, so you know this isn&#39;t my hair! Im so disgusted I barely took one bite and a chunk of hair was in my bite!! I want to throw up! I wasted gas and time, to get these disgusting cheesecakes! Do not eat here! Don&#39;t waste your money!! Service is rude, food is tainted with nasty strangers hair, no just no. This is not acceptable, not for a pretty pricey restaurant.
Our food was prepared perfectly, in a timely manner and everything was very tasty. The menu is very interesting and there is always something for everyone.

Consistently, and I mean consistently behind on all take out orders no matter the time of day. On top of that they are not cooperative when you ask how long your order that was supposed to be ready 20+ minutes ago will be ready. Cheesecake Factory in the Americana however is like 5/5 for takeout
Came here with my aunt.  long wait, uninspiring service, difficult parking, sub par service.  not comming back. no thanks.

Ok look, sometimes there really isn&#39;t a point in writing up a review on the Cheesecake Factory. You try one chain, and they all should essentially taste the same and have the same reliability... right? Well the couple times I &#39;ve come here (meaning I have given it many chances), it has completely backfired.<br><br>Service was terrible, having to ask multiple times for service and the waiters kept bouncing our request from one person to the next, and some were so obvious about NOT wanting to be at work that day.<br><br>The (usually) always delicious breakfast sandwich was cold! It killed me as that is my beau&#39;s absolute fave go-to breakfast meal, and we wanted a treat and failed miserably. <br><br>Also, for a cheesecake factory, this place was absolutely FILTHY.<br><br>NEVER AGAIN.

Big thanks to our waitress Patty, she was so nice right off the bat! <br>our food was amazing and on time, and I couldn&#39;t help but leave our waitress a little note with the tip! <br>we&#39;re from nor cal and our experience was so nice!
Excellent Service Love the Chicken Piccata and the stuffed mushrooms   Sometimes there is a wait but its worth it.  I highly recommend.
STUPID FKN PLACE. I literally had a party of 18 people and they refused to do a reservation for me. LOL i guess they dont want my money. NEVER going here again.

Be warned of server Kimberly. She made additional unauthorized charge of $15 to my gift card as her tip. That&#39;s straight out stealing and I wondered how many times she has done it without getting caught. Not many people like me : made note of server&#39;s name and tip amount . I came back and talked to Brian, the location manager. He was friendly, polite, apologetic and he solved the problem by reversing the charge. Kimberly should be fired.

Lots of food choices, good for big groups too. They don&#39;t take reservations. Service varies from great to bad...all depends on who you get. Same with the food. Some of the food is great, other food is just ok. I like the Tuscan Chicken, most the salads, and the lettuce warps. My aunt and uncle like the chicken marsala. Cheesecake of course is pretty good too. And I love the bread they bring too, especially the brown bread. Not the place to go for an amazing meal or something fancy, but for a meal out it&#39;s okay.

Great food but obviously management does not care about its customers because the place is understaffed resulting in poor customer service.  <br><br>They need to stop being cheap and increase the staff because pissy help due to being overworked kills what would otherwise be a great evening of dining...

This is the most &#34;meh&#34; Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. My BBQ burger was missing the fried onions, sweet potato fries were cold and the pineapple Moscow mule is way too sweet. What topped off my bad experience was the fact that the bathroom was a mess- I leaned up against the sink while washing my hands and the sink was soaking wet. I spent the rest of the night with dirty sink water on my shirt and my jeans.. yuck!
Oh my gossssshhhh!! Love love love their plain cheesecake and specially their tiramisu cheesecake. Will definitely come back!

First they made my wife and I with our baby wait in their empty lobby and did not want to seat our party of 8 because 6 people were not yet there. I can understand this, but the restaurant was not packed at all and its freezing cold outside. Come on! <br><br>I mean have a bit of compassion and seat us temporarily let us order some drinks appetizers and earn some money while we wait. Instead you let us stand in the lobby getting antsiest by the minute. <br><br>The problem with today&#39;s restaurants is that no one is geared towards customer experience. Food was so so and it was just a blah experience that started poorly in the first place. Cheesecake Factory management should really train their staff better.

The novelty of the cheesecake factory is wearing off. <br><br>First, the food is bland. That should be expected from a restaurant offering 50 dishes that span multiple food genres. Great variety to choose from, i highly doubt anything is fresh. Most would be from a freezer and tastes like it. The moment i bit into my burger, i regretted it. My kids ordered mac&#39;n cheese. Wife got the fish tacos. All mediocre. <br><br>Second, i&#39;m not a tourist. Why did i choose this place? <br><br>Third, the are 4-star options in all the food genres in that vicinity.

First of all costumer services is poor from management to staff members, this is unacceptable specially from this place to treat people unfair and rude, I went there and order something to go, and a server with the name Daniella right at the enter, she was very rude and inconsiderate when I asked for extra bread and dressing for my salad, and you got upset when I asked for more. If We are paying for it we should get great service. Eric the manager on duty that day... he gave me very poor service also. Shame cheese cake factory Pasadena ca <br><br>I went today to pick up the usual and I asked for extra dressing and the same girl name Daniella, charged me for the extra dressing. And still no smile and a how are you? Nothing. How sad

The service at this location is hit or miss. <br>Pro: <br>The bread basket they brought out was piping HOT! Yum!<br>The waiter attempted to make small talk with us. At least he tried. <br>The lunch menu is so worth it, especially because the portions are huge at Cheesecake. <br><br>Con:<br>The waiter was more invested in serving the large table-- which is understandable. However, waiting for over 15 mins for the check is just not cool.

One of my favorite restaurants. Plenty of items to pick from on the menu, including American, Mexican, Italian and Chinese. Of course their fresh cheesecakes are the best. Expect one hour wait on weekends.

I got a to go over of ahi tuna salad. There was so little avocado I thought they had to forgotten to add it in. So disappointed in the food I got especially because I had to pay over $20 for my meal. Huge proportions of tomato and two slivers of avocado. Wasn&#39;t even full when I finished my meal. Won&#39;t be returning.

I love The Cheesecake Factory, which makes me really sad to write a negative review for the Pasadena location. Happy hour is always an outstanding value (buffalo cheese blasts, yum), but service here was lousy.<br><br>Our server brought us bread, said she would return with plates and utensils but went straight MIA. We stared at the basket for so long, I had to grab a set from an empty table. The kicker was, the bread was too hard to enjoy.<br><br>Such a bummer, but at least there are plenty of other locations around.

2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 161/365<br><br>Only waited 5 minutes for a table, customer service was nice, but my chile relleno burger patty was dry. I asked for it well-done but the inside was still pink. Pink and dry? HUH? Not spicy either. But the bread they serve is delicious, refills are always flowing, and desserts are AMAZING.

I got the lunch BBQ chicken chopped salad and it disappointed. The lettuce and onions were not fresh and seemed like they were sitting out for a while. I&#39;ve had this same meal at other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s and the food was fresher and better.
Gave me the wrong order for the nth time. Every single time they&#39;ve missed something or gotten something wrong.

Okay, so I figure it&#39;s time to write a review on the Cheesecake factory, and the reviews here on yelp are sort of random. This is 5 stars because of the food and only the foos. Yes lines can be long, but i&#39;ve been there close to Saturday midnight and Sunday evening, and we were seated right away (party less than 4). <br><br>Yes your waiter can be a bit of an ass. One waiter actually checked up on us, another time they sort of ignored us, but it didn&#39;t bother me. All the tables around us were full, and they kept filling up, so I can understand it can be a little hectic. But there is also amazing service, very fast with the bread (just request the black bread dammit) and helpful with selection. Hell they&#39;re also great to call- I lost an item and the front desk was so sweet about it!<br><br>Anyways, I won&#39;t let a bit of bad service get in the way of the 5 stars-- because the food is freaking amazing! This is a great spot for dinner or lunch, the portions are huge, appetizer and entree alike, and the cheesecake makes for a great slice! <br><br>An entree I highly recommend is the eggplant burger. Yes you heard me, eggplant. If you&#39;ve had enough burgers as I have, bison or angus, it&#39;s definitely nice to eat something else. The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s eggplant burger is definitely a unique treat. It&#39;s a huge burger, extremely savory and fulfilling. The side of fries is also very very generously portioned. Instantly loved!<br><br>For sides, I&#39;ve tasted the quesadillas, nacho chips with buffalo (?) chicken and the sweet potato fries. The chips platter was insanely huge, definitely worth it if you just want to snack with another person. It was extremely savory, you get chicken, salsa, guac, and all the cheese ever. The quesadillas were a bit small/thin, but nevertheless tasty. And lastly the sweet potato fries... No regrets. It was another huge plate of just sweet potato fries. Top notch, soft, fresh, salty and sweet, doesn&#39;t taste that oily.<br><br>And lastly for the Cheesecake I taste: the something something Tuxedo cheesecake. Hahah I forgot the name oops, but I was already hooked on the fact it was called Tuxedo! It was chocolate, vanilla, and more chocolate! It did not taste bland or dull or stale, it melted in your mouth it was a sweet delight and it was damn fancy good. If you&#39;re gonna be at the Cheesecake Factory, order a fancy cheesecake right?<br><br>Anyways, the dinners I&#39;ve had here have been more than fulfilling (yes you can box it. In fact you&#39;ll probably box your leftovers) and very delicious. Your tummy will be very pleased.

COCKROACHES!!!!!! Beware of the roaches at this branch in pasadena. Me n my friend were dining on 5/27/17 at 10pm and she saw a ROACH behind me on the booth. We both jumped up and told the waitress named Channing L. and all she did was apologize instead of informing the manager of this situation. On our way out I spoke to the manager Lawrence and he acted like he wasn&#39;t surprised at all!! What kind of joint are they running here?? I&#39;m calling corporate on monday to report this nonsense. Who knows how roach infested they really are?? So disgusted!!!!!!!! Never again. Horrible customer service!! DONT BOTHER!!!!!!

We had three different waters, since one took his dinner break during our stay. <br><br>The food was fine. I appreciate that they have a menu with &#34;lighter fare.&#34; <br><br>My order was botched up and someone else in our party didn&#39;t get his food until the rest of us were almost finished eating. The servers didn&#39;t seem particularly familiar with the menu items.<br><br>When I went to ask about my order, the manager, to his credit, was right on top of it, apologetic, and corrected the situation immediately. He even comped my meal, which is very good customer service.<br><br>I realize it&#39;s  busy place and perhaps the servers are overworked or something. It just got a bit confusing and frustrating with all the different servers.

I&#39;m left with no words with the service I received at this location because there was no service at all. I have never gotten such poor service in my entire life. <br>1/4/16 I visited this location around 9:00pm with a friend after a long day of shopping . We were seated right away in the smallest table when we carried 3 extra large shoppers. Note that there&#39;s an entire back section with larger tables and seats that are &#34;blocked&#34;. Our host let us that our server will be with us momentarily. We ended up waiting at the table for over 30mins and no one ever came. A few waiters walked pass by and made eye contact with me but no one said a word to us. Not even offering us water. We got up and left feeling extremely livid and disappointed. Sad to say that I will never return again nor to recommend this place to anyone I know.
It is always hot and delicious and the wait is never too long. I usually come on the weekdays.  I had their crusted chicken romano and it was really a good sized dish. It was their lunch special too.

The fried mac n&#39; cheese appetizer is the best thing on the menu!! (No joke, it is that good). It consists of 4 fried balls with ooey gooey super cheesy Mac n&#39; Cheese and topped with a red sauce and Parmesan grated cheese. <br><br>Now that I got that out the way, the restaurant is beautifully decorated and clean. The food is great and the honey oat bread they serve to all guests is yummy! <br><br>Oh and you must make room for a slice of cheesecake (it&#39;s a pretty big slice for $7) and they have a ton of flavors to choose from! :)

I was out enjoying a leisure day of shopping in beautiful Old Town Pasadena. I had just finished off a Carmel skinny macchiato and decided to take a peek inside Sephora because, like treat yourself girl lolollol! However, as I strolled around the super cute urban decay eyeshadow pallets, a strange feeling flooded over me... cold, sweaty, hot flashes. Oh no, shall I say, diarrhea? The macchiato had betrayed me. I started to panic, as Sephora has no public restrooms. As I ran out the front door and battled my very urgent situation, I saw a glisten of hope across the street. CHEESECAKE FACTORY. As I entered the restaurant I was greeted with the upmost hospitality from the hosts. I felt welcomed and at home. I had no time unfortunately to politely greet them back, because time was running out. I spotted the restrooms in the back and made it in the nick of time. So, this is where my story ends and on a good note thankfully. I would like to thank Cheese Cake Factory for being so hospitable and for having the cleanest restrooms in town. Fully restocked toilet paper and good smelling soap. I will be returning, but hopefully for their skinny margs and not under the prior circumstances!
for the first time I said okay they are busy or they are human everyone has a mistake but for second time I got a burger from this location and it was uncooked
Me and my hubby finally decided to use our gift card. The food was great and the service was good too. Thanks.

Consistently predictable in both service and food quality.  We typically visit during lunch time on Friday&#39;s and while it is busy we sit at the bar and tend to find the service to be a bit more attentive at the high tables.   <br><br>Dishes are constant and typically never waiver off from previous visits.  Service is friendly and efficient which is great to get lunch in just under an hour.  Location is challenging, specifically for parking.  However, the garage across the street does have 2 hour free parking.
Consistently good food and always a really great staff. I love the variety in the menu. The place is always clean and the decor is great.

Pros:<br>- Food is delicious<br>- Service<br><br>Cons:<br>- Too many calories in each entree<br>- The cooks<br><br>We received our pasta, with next to literally no sauce. We contacted our waiter, who told us they would get the sauce, and it would only take 2 or so minutes. <br><br>IT TOOK 21. When the sauce came in a small bowl, it was only 1/16 full! Like, what the heck!<br><br>Overall, I would have rather gone to another restaurant where we would be getting our food on time, and have it be WORTH it.

My husband and I LOVE Cheesecake Factory but we really dislike this location due to their lack of customer service. We only came here because we were in the area. Never again! 1. The young man who walked us to our table gave me the dirtiest look after I decline the table. I requested a booth 2. Waiter forgot to bring my coffee, forgot my husbands orange juice 3. Never received my son&#39;s fruit. Service was slow and I can hear all the employees goofing around in the kitchen. Never returning to this cheesecake location.
Very bad customer service today. Sat at the bar area, other people that sat down after us got thier food first!!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain that my lady and I frequent often. Always 100% satisfied with the service and the food. <br><br>On this night however, that sentiment changed, drastically for the worse. <br><br>My wife and I were out for a walk in Old Town after Christmas Eve dinner. My wife is 8 months pregnant, so frequent bathroom breaks are a part of life. We walked over to the Paseo, bathrooms closed. From there, we walked to the small courtyard in between Sephora and Crate &amp; Barrel, also closed. After that distance of a walk and to no avail, it is now a bathroom code red! <br><br>We walk back out on to Colorado Blvd. and see The Cheesecake Factory is open. We just knew they&#39;d let us use the bathroom. No questions or doubts about it. <br><br>WRONG! (Slightly)<br><br>The time is now 10:30. We walk in and approach the host&#39;s counter were we are greeted by Joanna (I&#39;m pretty sure that was her name). My wife asks to use the bathroom and explains quickly that we haven&#39;t been able to find and use another. Joanna allows her to use the bathroom but only after making my wife feel stupid for asking by saying: &#34;But you know, there are public restrooms behind Sephora.&#34;<br><br>What!? Thanks for the unnecessary comment. WE ALREADY TRIED THAT! <br><br>Honestly, that was RUDE! Better to have said no and saved us the feeling of stupidity. <br><br>I was already planning on getting us a slice of cake, but now I felt obligated! <br><br>Not cool. I understand it&#39;s Christmas Eve, but there&#39;s never an excuse for such rude, poor service.

One of my favorite spots close to home when you want some close to home cooking. I think Friday and Saturday&#39;s  they should stay open later. Well it is what it is , you can never go wrong with the cheese cake factory. Good food and good service.

Ehhh.  Blah! This is the 2nd visit to this location. About 5 years apart from each. The staff was friendly enough. But much of our tableware, glasses and plates had stuck on food and fingerprints.  We had to exchange almost everything on the table. But worst of all after eating some of the food off the plate we noticed  the plate wasn&#39;t cleaned properly. So we basically ate off dirty plates. The appetizers were tex mex eggrolls.  (Tasted freezer burned). And spinach dip which was okay after adding more salt and pepper.  At least the chips were not stale and quite good. Hubby ordered enchiladas.. he said they were good up until he saw realized he was eating off a dirty plate. I ordered chicken parmesan &amp; pasta made pizza style. UmmmmmmmmNoooooòooooooo Take it off the menu. I ate once piece and sent it back. I didn&#39;t replace it with anything else at that point. I had seen enough. We finished our happy hour cocktails and left. I will not make the drive here again. I sure hope all cheesecake factories haven&#39;t declined the way this one has. NO Bueno

I love cheesecake - so I have to say I love this place! The service was great, food was amazing, their menu was so huge, it was hard to actually pick what I wanted to eat. My tip is to get a to go cheesecake to eat later!

Called to get an approximate wait time for a party of 15. The girl who answered said she couldn&#39;t give me an estimate till we get there!? Are you kidding me? Not going to take a family here with hungry kids for you to tell me the wait time is 2hrs! What a joke.

We were a party of 6 on a Monday night @ 7.30 p.m.....not exactly peak dinner rush hour. Our food took forever to arrive, and when it did, one order was incorrect (cobb salad instead of club sandwich). One friend received his food when the rest of us were half way through our meal.<br><br>The spaghetti carbonara was very dry and the spinach artichoke dip was cold with little melted cheese. My wife ordered the same 2 dishes at the Cheesecake Factory at Topanga and BOTH were excellent. I&#39;ve dined at many different CCF&#39;s around the country and count of them for a fine and very hardy meals but Pasadena was very disappointing. Sorry.

This place is the worst. I called in a phone order, with a guy named Sammy. He told me my food would be ready in 20 minutes. I work nearby so I walked over which took me ten minutes. So my food should have been ready, by half hour time. I arrive and this guy Sammy is scrambling to find my order ticket, turns out HE NEVER PLACED THE ORDER. So he apologizes a bunch of times because he didn&#39;t do his job correctly. And on top of that doesn&#39;t offer to get a manager to discount our entire meal. Maybe he didn&#39;t want to get in trouble with management for this huge mistake that was entirely his fault, so he doesn&#39;t offer to have a manager come and fix it. His apology should suffice right? No. It doesn&#39;t because I already waited a half hour for my food and then I had to sit in store and wait another 15 minutes to receive the food I was originally coming to simply PICK UP. Then I get back to my office, give my boss her food, which included a soup of the day that when I called was told that it was the &#39;Mexican Chicken&#39;, turns out it was clam chowder, MY BOSS IS ALLERGIC TO CLAMS. We call the manager of the restaurant to discuss all that has happened, he agrees to refund us because my boss starts to have an allergic reaction, but never apologizes for all that has occurred. I go back into the restaurant and the manager just gets me the refund, no trying to apologize for the terrible mistake. Awful service and I can&#39;t believe the manager wasn&#39;t even apologetic.
Execellent service!! They accommodated my special requirement. When the lasagne was dropped by mistake they gave us complementary soup and desert. The food was excellent!!!

We came here on a Wed around 4:30 pm for an early dinner.  We were seated within 10 minutes with great service and attention. The lunch menu prices were still good, but we all went for the regular dinner menu.  Again, I ordered the shrimp and pasta under 560 calories menu.  <br>My coworkers enjoyed their dishes and we were in and out under an hour.  This location is consistently great, food is always good and the customer service is always above average.

Everything you&#39;d expect from The Cheesecake Factory and nothing less. <br><br>We were seated immediately on a Tuesday afternoon, and were promptly given menus. The waitress seemed busy but was attentive when she possibly could. <br><br>Our first batch of bread was a little hard, but when we asked for extra bread it was warmed to perfection. <br><br>I got a lunch sized salad which was so large that I couldn&#39;t finish it. It was a luau salad which was fresh, still crunchy and perfectly dressed. The atmosphere was also very friendly, and we had a great time!

Maybe I should of stuck with the Cheesecake after all it is the Cheesecake Factory! I came here yesterday with a group of friends for lunch, I&#39;ve heard good things from other people. I ordered the southwestern chicken sandwich, it sounded really good. It came on a French baguette, the bread was so hard I couldn&#39;t even bite into the sandwich. I ended up just eating the chicken inside which was really good. I think if it was on different bread the overall meal would of been way better. Also the French fries were lukewarm they definitely weren&#39;t fresh. Other than that everyone else enjoyed there meal. They have so many items on there menu I am sure they have dishes that were much better than mine. I like the atmosphere expect it is smaller than other Cheesecake factories I have been to so it does feel a little more crowed in this one. I would give them another chance but maybe I&#39;ll stick with one of there signature dishes or something the server recommends!

Great food and great drinks! I had the skinny sangria and it was awesome. Our waitress was attentive and quick. Our party only shared appetizers, wish some were a little larger servings given the price but still very tasty! We had the Asian chicken tacos, egg roll platter, taquitos, and nachos. Highly recommend

I was sooo sad that they ran out of bread when I came :( that&#39;s like 95% of the Cheesecake Factory experience.. Nbd. I ordered the mushroom marsala and it was OK. I felt like the mushrooms were heavily sauces, so it upset my stomach a little. We got free lemonades, the male manager was so sweet! Don&#39;t like eating to big restaurants like these but it&#39;s a really good place for a meal out.

Love this location. Love going to this location for lunch, it&#39;s never packed. Service is kind of slow...that&#39;s minus one star. Love the food! My favorite...of course the bread, steak Diane, and chicken costaleta.

Came here for a quick meal after a long day. The food was cold, but only because the restaurant was so freezing! We were both shivering and our food got so cold so quickly. The food was average, I asked for my burger to be medium rare but it came well done which was disappointing. The service was slow  and our experience was average.

Perfect place to spend dinner or brunch together with your loved one. I spent my birthday dinner with my fiancee at here, it was great. I love the atmosphere and the food price range was fine.The location is bit odd since it takes some minutes to walk from the station (Del Mar / Memorial park) but I usually come to Colorado when I want to walk, so that is completely fine with me but some others might have problems.<br>Overall it&#39;s very nice place to go :3

This is an awesome location, and the service was almost really good! Our waitress Priscilla took our orders of 4 people, and from the start was messing up our orders. On my turn to order I ordered the jambalaya sub chicken with sausage, but she seemed to be very confused! Like how are you confused! So that was that! We ate our food and the food was excellent, then we got a new waiter named Steven and he was excellent! 10/10 it was at the end of the meal when we got our checks! Well, Priscilla messed up my order and charged me for extra extra sausage and my meal came out way more expensive then it should have! That was just a hassle! Steven handled it really well. Thanks cheese cake
I was ordering take out and Megan picked up. I was then told to &#34;wait a minute&#34; and I was left on the phone for 30 minutes. Did she die?

I stopped by earlier at the cheesecake factory and they had the most friendliest staff the host were very very nice and my server was %100 on point I tried the smokehouse burguer and it was the best tastiest flavorful burguer ever i believe this is the best restaurant I can ever imagine with great quality memorable food and drinks i&#39;m definitely coming back!

I live in Orange County and made the somewhat challenging trip to meet several friends at the Pasadena Cheescake Factory.  I have been to many Cheescake Factory over the years. <br>I want to give a shoutout to the Manager, Ryan.<br>I had a somwhat embarrassing situation when the soul of my shoe became detached from my shoe. There I was with every step flapping like a circus clown. I thought, okay by any chance could the Cheescake Factory have any glue? I asked the waitress who said she doubted it but said she&#39;d ask her Manager and lo and behold Ryan appeared. He knew where I was sitting  and said he&#39;d be back. Within 5 minutes Hero Ryan appeared with Glorilla Glue.  I held my dangeling flap while Cobbler/Manager Ryan glued it to the base of my shoe. Then he disappeared and returned with a rubber band in case the glue didn&#39;t hold. Well it did and now I&#39;m wearing the rubber band on my wrist, but will put it in my purse for, you never know instances..  <br>shout out to Ryan for his help and oh so pleasant attitude. <br><br>Who knows ladies it could be that your ready to have your baby, you stop at the Cheesecake Factory unaware and all of a sudden your baby wants to arrive, call &#34;Ryan&#34; if he produces Gorilla Glue don&#39;t put anything past him.

Was pretty disappointed with our experience, although I was pleased with how the manager handled things which is why I gave it such a high star rating (plus the food&#39;s taste was great). It took over an hour for our two meals to come out and our server, Ray, was very intimidating. He was unfriendly and unapproachable. He even told us half way through that he was going home for the night, we got a new server, yet Ray was still seen around the restaurant helping other tables for the next 30 minutes...? It was very confusing. After talking to the manager, Lawrence, about how long it took for our food to come out, he apologized profusely and gave us dessert on the house. I appreciated that he said, &#34;It doesn&#39;t matter how busy the restaurant is, you should never be made to feel that way.&#34; We will give this location one more chance.

Came here last week for lunch with coworker. Ordered off their skinnylicious menu and was good and wanted to come back this week again.<br><br>Last week (dine in):<br><br>Ahi Tartare - very small, one cup serving with 4 thin wonton chips (which is 2 whole wonton skin broken up, truly a single serving appetizer for one. <br><br>Firecracker Salmon - half the size, same flavor (oily)<br><br>Thai Chicken Lettuce Wrap - half the size of the regular thai lettuce wrap and is pre-assmbled - my fave and I will order this again if I come again (Yard house lettuce wraps are way better!)<br><br>Service - average (they had forgot to take out bean sprouts in my order when I asked but it was easily removed and brought back)<br><br>This week (take out) - Seared Ahi Tuna Tataki Salad - so not worth it! It came out to be $20 for a salad! Ridiculous! The tuna was not even fresh, and was a little tough, the three slices of tomato was huge and almost same portion as the green mix (which was tossed to seem like a lot, but it wasn&#39;t, I ordered a salad, not a tomato and tuna dish with side salad. I  should have gone to Kabuki down the street and got a green salad with seared ahi tuna for half the price!<br><br>Overall - cheesecake is overrated and overpriced. One good thing is their complimentary wheat bread.

If I could give no stars I would.<br>The service here is awful. I normally go to the Santa Anita mall location but happened to be near by this one. <br>1.I was here for dinner and no one ever brought the bread which is an automatic for any other Cheesecake Factory location. <br>2. No one followed up for refills or anything else, I never even saw the waiter after he took our order.<br>3. They took so long to bring us the desert menu that we didn&#39;t even want cheesecake after that. <br>4lastly they took forever to bring us the check and charge so we could leave .<br>Awful service.

Cheesecake Factory, are you the restaurant that people love to hate?  I could throw a rock from my cube at work and hit your front door, but my co-workers never wanna go here for lunch.  I would never throw a rock at you, btw.  I&#39;m your friend.  I wish I could eat lunch here more often, but solo dining just isn&#39;t as fun.<br><br>Let&#39;s face some facts, tho.  You&#39;re not exactly known for your small portions.  In fact, dining here is kind of like going on a calorie splurge.  There is a price to be paid for your yummy food, be it an extra mile on your run or more sit ups at home.  Good thing you have smaller lunch potions of many items.  Mrs. C thinks that your pasta Da Vinci (chicken, mushrooms, Marsala wine) is the bomb.  Your pizza &amp; salad for lunch is a great deal, too.  The chicken belaggio is my current favorite.  Some people say your tropical iced tea tastes fishy, but I actually like the taste, and you do a good job making sure it&#39;&#39;s refilled frequently.  Your servers are pretty good, too.  I&#39;ve rarely had a server mess up an order, hand me a hot plate, or perform any other waiter nono&#39;s.  <br><br>Please please check with me before handing over the last piece of Kahlua almond fudge cheesecake to someone else.  It&#39;s the only one I like!  Well, that&#39;s not true.  I like a lot of your cheesecakes, but that one is my fave.

A little bit expansive but foods are worthy. I got fried chicken pasta called Louisiana. Really tasty, chicken not juicy but nice. Try Mac n cheese burger next time heard very heavy.  Btw. This pasta was a tiny oily in the last bite

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory. I went because I had a gift card. I ordered a pizza and my friend had the lettuce wrapped tacos. I didn&#39;t like my pizza - it was hard and tasted too salty. My friend liked her tacos so I won&#39;t say the food is bad but maybe just didn&#39;t make the right choice. <br><br>Our waiter was not attentive, hardly came around and when he did he wasn&#39;t nice. However, we ended up with a waitress when he left and she was great. Another waiter came over with our bread and he was very nice too. Guess it was a hit or miss! <br><br>The highlight of the evening was the cheesecake I ordered. It was the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake and it was sooooo good. In that moment I wanted to try all of their cheesecakes! I recommend this place but maybe ordering something more eventful than pizza. And definitely recommend it for the sweets! Guess that&#39;s why it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory!

My boyfriend and I both ordered separate meals. He had pasta, I had the Korean style cauliflower (which was delicious!) and the avocado egg rolls. After eating, while waiting for our check, we BOTH started feeling nauseous. I have thrown up once, haven&#39;t eaten since that meal (which was my only meal of the day) I have no appetite, nausea, horrible gas out of both ends, and confirmed food poisoning. Would not recommend even though those cauliflower bites were damn delicious.

Both me and my boyfriend&#39;s favorite restaurant, love it here! Been coming to Cheescake Factory for years with boyfriend, family, friends and always enjoy every meal with great customer service! The restaurant itself has a cool ambiance with also a romantic hint esp if you are out with that special someone. When you enter the restaurant, they have in front showcasing the delicious cheesecakes. They also have a bar section just in case you don&#39;t want to wait too long for a table..that&#39;s more of the downside. <br><br>What to order...well, what I like to order.. <br><br>Appetizers:<br>Chicken Quesadilla :-)<br>Crispy Crab Wontons<br>Fried Calamari <br><br>Entrees:<br>Love the Miso Salmon!!<br>Shrimp scampi with angel hair..favorite<br>Cajun Jumbalaya (yumm!! Somewhat on the spicy side)<br>Shrimp Scampi w/ Steak Diane (mouth watering..)<br><br>Desserts: (if there&#39;s any room left)<br>Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheescake <br>Tiramisu cheescake<br><br>Plus, free bread and butter while you&#39;re waiting for your orders. Honestly, everything on the menu is delicious...the staff is friendly and knowledgeable..weekends and nights get very busy, but the waiter or waitress always checks up to make sure everything is great. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!!

Went here after shopping just for a breather and dessert. <br>There was no wait and the server was peppy and patient as we kept talking instead of looking at the menu.<br>We finally decided on the limoncello cake and apple crumble aka mode. <br>Both were perfect, delicious and huge! We should have shared! <br>But we took the leftovers home instead. <br>Love this place. Will be back.
FANTASTIC SERVER!!! On his game 24/7 very helpful and polite. Never had better service than this! (Ray P) THANKS MAN!!

This is place is too dark for my liking. I went there once with a friend of mine and the waitress is busy talking, with her peers, I have to wait for about 5-10 mins in order to get her attention. The food is extremely overpriced for its mediocre tastes. Waiting time is not very pleasant either.<br>I&#39;m not going back there!

Cheesecake factory is usuaply average but I came with my family, party of 7 on a Sunday. We were told it would be a 20 minute wait ended up being more like 45. We asked the hostess what was up after waiting the inital 20 minites and I was told out name had already been called which was a blatant lie as we were sitting directly infront of the hostess table and heard and saw everyone that was called. The hostess made excuses and asked us to wait another 20 minutes. After that 20 minutes went by I asked about a table that had not been cleaned or used for like 15 minutes. The hostess seemed astonished that she had not thought of that and had the table cleared for us.<br><br>The waitress seemed absolutely scatter brained and started arguing with my mother about the selections on the menu and possible substitutions. The food took another half an hour to come out and by that time we were full of bread.<br><br>The staff seemed frustrated and streched thin and well that makes for shitty service. The food is average nothong special about it, except for the grill cheese.

This restaurant is the best place for its Filet Mignon Steak even without the sauce! Although the place was understaffed and it&#39;s incredibly busy all the time (maybe not depending on what time you come). But their food quality and their choices. Worth the trip from Rowland Heights to Old Pasadena for dinner. Old Pasadena is the best place to go shopping, eat, and have fun in this area. So If anyone is reading this and are hungry for some food. Then head down to The Cheesecake Factory (P.S the name is confusing but it serves more than cheesecakes). So I hope you make the right choice.

Waits are usually long but we were like lucky to go on a weekday where we waited only 10 minutes. We brought three kids who enjoyed the kid&#39;s menu (macaroni and cheese, spaghetti, burger which includes a drink and fries) The adults ordered garlic noodles, jambalayan and ribs. The meals were all tasty and filling for lunch. We also had the calamari appetizer which was really good.
I can&#39;t believe they got rid of the luau salad!!! It was my favorite menu for over a decade :( please bring it back!!!

The wait was the usual 25 minutes for party of 2 on a Saturday night and they had a full house. <br><br>Sat us down on a wet table that smelled like the towel itself.   We had to dry the table ourselves. <br><br>The classic bread came out shortly after our order but it was warm and a bit stale.<br><br>I got fish tacos and I don&#39;t know what really came out but the fish felt like it had been frozen for years and processed. <br><br>Not sure what happened to Cheesecake.

On Sunday my order was taken and the food was good. Once my food was served, no one checked on me to see if I needed anything. Needed to ask for butter and jam since my toast was dry. This was brought to the table. No one ever asked me if I wanted another drink or checked in to see if the food was to my liking. Disappointed in the service. Took way to long to bring the check and then another wait before my credit card was returned. I liked the food but was disappointed in the service.

Came in at around 10pm on a Sunday night to buy a cheesecake. Stood in front of the counter for about 3 minutes to make my decision. Made a decision and stood in front of the register for about 5 mins. Watched the busboy clean their whipped cream machine for the whole cycle (7 minutes). NOT ONCE WAS I GREETED BY A SERVER, HOST, OR ANYBODY FOR THE ENTIRE 15 MINUTES. There was a server who looked like was off the clock and was talking on the phone looking at her cash out sheet. Right before she left and after she took off her apron, she called for someone in the back because there were guests out front. I left before anyone showed up because fuck that! I felt like an idiot standing there like I&#39;m some fucking ghost or something.

A lot of people hate on Cheesecake Factory and how corporate it is. But good food is good food, and I&#39;ve always liked theirs. The menu is huge, and the service is fast here. They even have a quite expansive &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu for those counting calories (I, on the other hand, have pretty much admitted defeat to fatness every time I go out to a restaurant like this. Especially when hungover). <br><br>I really, really liked my crab hash for breakfast, which was generous with the crab. I did not like my $4 warm OJ. My friends loved their southwest chicken hash, and chicken tacos. It was a nice, relaxed way to spend a Sunday morning. <br><br>This location isn&#39;t as pretty as the Brentwood or MDR locations. But holy crap, they make up for the lack of scenery with the gorgeous men they hire as servers. Both the single and taken ladies in our group admired the views the whole time. Thank you, CF HR person; it&#39;s obvious you enjoy your job.

Never been a fan of this chain but this location is fantastic. The food was amazing, service very good. I had herb roasted chicken with potatoes and vegetables and it was cooked to perfection. I dined during a weeknight, I would imagine weekends are very busy so be prepared to wait during peak times as it is located right in the heart of beautiful old town Pasadena.

Excellent and outstanding assistance by Adrion and MGR Sammy. These two gents make this the best Cheesecake Factory around. Truly made us feel at home for my daughters promotion celebration,<br><br>Thanks guys

not sure what&#39;s gone wrong here, but the Factory has typically been one of my most predictable and reliable restaurants IF you&#39;re looking for a broad mix of anything that&#39;s done pretty well.<br><br>but this last time was terrible from service to food.  i hope it&#39;s only location specific, but i&#39;ll hold off visiting any location for a while.

First visit...For starters we had the bread with butter. It was so good. The &#34;brown&#34; bread was very soft and warm. We ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and a ham and pineapple pizza. The sauce in the Fettuccine Alfredo was very bland we had to add salt and pepper. The pizza was good and the crust was REALLY good. For dessert we had the raspberry cheesecake and it had a chocolate crust that complimented the raspberry in the cheesecake. Jay thought it was a bit too sweet, but it was ok. Mon thought it was delicious! <br><br>Second visit...again they brought us some bread and butter for starters and it was really good, as always. Jay ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken with bowtie pasta. She didn&#39;t like the pasta but the chicken was thin buttery and had a crispy crust, Yummy! Mon ordered the Chicken Madeira and loved it! For dessert we shared a New York cheesecake with fresh strawberries on top. Mon: it was to DIE for! Jay: I can&#39;t wait to go back and eat some of that bread and butter and have some of that New York cheesecake melt in my mouth.

Always a great server and delicious food.. Let&#39;s not forget the awesome drinks!!! I always get the strawberry mojito.. Not on the menu but they make it and it&#39;s delicious!!!<br><br>One of my favorite restaurants!! :-)

It started out well, our table of five was seated quickly and our server was welcoming. We placed our orders. Our server returned with another in tow stating that he actually wasn&#39;t our server but the new guy was and had just been on break. That was fine, but after 20th minutes my margarita had not showed up and turns out the order had never been put in to the bar. No biggie, it got made. Then the food arrives and mine is a completely different entree than ordered. Again not a huge deal, when they switched servers things obviously got lost in the transition. In retrospect I should have taken the meal he brought as it was a better one than ordered. But I had ordered a burger. They offered a bowl of soup as I waited but then realized that a salad came with it and offered to bring that out as I waited. (Obvioulsy everyone else had their meals long ago) Finally my plate arrives...it&#39;s nicely presented, and as I ordered The &#34;skinnyburger&#34; I expect it to be a fairly small meal but damn if I can find any burger, I mean not even a slider. He brought me the bun and fixings but no friggin&#39; burger! Then my kids grab a menu to see if my skinny burger actually is even supposed to have meat. I said the original server asked how I wanted the  burger cooked! Its called a BURGER!  Anyway, the new server comes back, flustered realizing he had brought me the meat free bun and went to get a burger cooked.  It finally came back and as hungry as I was it tasted pretty good. Everyone else&#39;s meals were fine. I was not charged for the burger. I was surprised the manager, through all of the mishaps never came by to check or apologize. Big picture, we all ate but I wouldn&#39;t go again. Edit: After reading other reviews and seeing CF&#39;s repetitive and pointless responses, obviously this location needs a serious personnel and total management overhaul.

It has been years since I have eaten here. Man have I been missing out. Came and ordered a couple of dishes with some friends and not a bad dish was at the table. Grilled chicken and avocado club (incredible), sesame chicken (succulent), and chicken tostada salad (fresh and crisp). We ordered placed everything in the middle of the table and chowed down. Service was amazing. Cc was a great server. Attentive and pleasant. Come on down to Pasadena and have some food. I guarantee it will be good.

Went here on a whim after we found out that the place we originally planned on eating at closed earlier than we thought. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Blasts and a Pineapple Moscow Mule. My friend ordered the rib eye. The Mule was basically just Pineapple juice. No ginger and barely any vodka. The Blasts were basically just pure fried grease with barely any chicken or cheese, and the Buffalo sauce I think was just straight Frank&#39;s Red Hot without any butter or anything to cut it. Way too spicy and concentrated. I ended up with the worst acid reflux (which I&#39;ve never gotten) and my friend ended up in the bathroom right after we left with some really bad stomach problems. We also never got any bread. Other than that, the service was fine.

My boss gave me a Cheesecake Factory gift card so my husband and I went to the Pasadena location over the weekend. I believe, if you are in a place like this, you have to be very, very picky. It is not bad. But it is not what it portrays to be. Just think of it as a glorified fast food place. You are there for convenience, not for top-notch dining experience. These are not homemade cheesecakes so don&#39;t expect anything gourmet or grand. These are mass-produced desserts so I recommend going for the safe picks instead of going crazy with the selection and then get disappointed later. Because they&#39;ll taste like SUGAR. None of the real thing. The one cheesecake that stood out though was Lemoncello. Then their pumpkin pecan cheesecake was a safe bet.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend their lunch or other food selection either. There should be a real restaurant nearby. But if you are okay with faux restaurants, this is fine. And oh, parking is difficult to find in this area. There is a public parking nearby though. The one big plus in this place? Their customer service reps were great.

It&#39;s been awhile since I have been here. I remember the wheat bread to be warm and delicious. Came here for lunch on Labor Day. Did not have to wait to be seated. Service was really slow. We had to wait awhile before our waitress came to greet us and ask what we would like to drink. After that she disappeared and it took awhile before she took our order. I felt like getting breakfast and was happy to see breakfast items served all day. I ordered the breakfast brioche sandwich which has ham, bacon, eggs, tomatoes with a grilled brioche and potatoes on the side. My glass of water showed up and I noticed how dirty it was. There was so sort of greasy stain or sauce or something on the outside of my glass. That&#39;s just gross. Do they not clean their glasses?? The bread basket came and the wheat bread was as good as I remembered it to be. The food came and my potatoes were super crispy to the point I feel they were more burnt than anything. My husband loves the extra extra crispy so he was happy eating them. My brioche sandwich was just okay. The cheese was not all melty, the bacon was not crispy and it was more fat than anything. The ham flavor was just so so. Bummed about the breakfast sandwich. Will not be ordering that item. <br>Super noisy today and there were a few screaming kids to add to the meal. Our waitress was nice and she did come check on us twice and to fill the water cups. When we were walking out we saw lots of people waiting for a table. This place does get packed.

This Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena is terrible. The service is slow, my New York steak burnt, and not attentive. I&#39;ve been to other cheesecake factories in different locations and had amazing service and food. I don&#39;t know why this one is terrible

Can&#39;t really ever go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. Went on a Friday night and surprisingly only had to wait 10 mins too if even that. The food was always good and of course you have to have the bread.

I use to go to the cheesecake factory all the time, haven&#39;t been in months. Very disappointing,  I order the chicken and biscuits.......no flavor what so ever and the gravy looked like water. For a $18 dish the food should be amazing. I use to order this same dish before and it was 10× better. I think this will be my last visit for awhile!
Over all service was good cake okay not Wow!   Chain restaurant we all know they speaks for itself. Reasonable price.

Sat down as soon we got inside so as you can tell it probably wasn&#39;t as busy as usual. Took our order probably 10 minutes into us getting our table. After that is pretty much where the experience of cheesecake suprised me. Took about 40 minutes for us to get our food, only for me to find out my americana styled hamburger wasn&#39;t made correctly. So one of us were eating while the only other choice would be to wait another 20-30 minutes for another burger. I told them to double check the order they wrote, the order was correct so this would be the chefs fault. I also didnt like how the waitress didn&#39;t really know how to take care of the situation... Honestly expected more from a place like this

The food was ok but this is more of a review on our waitress Nikki Ross. I tend to have the worst luck when I go to restaurants. I can NEVER get a refill, always have terrible service, rude waiters and waitresses but I was blown away at the Cheesecake Factory. I had a date with my girlfriend here last night and Nikki was on it! She never let our cups go below half empty, brought our food out fast, and literally packed our left overs and had the check ready in under a minute. It was really amazing. My girlfriend and I were staring at each other like wow, this woman deserves a big big tip. It was my type of service. I was in and out. Thank you Nikki! Your manager should recognize you for your great service!
Ordered the chicken medalia and diane steak. Steak was cooked perfectly but the chicken was ok. Great service and drinks tho

Yikes! I dined here last night from 1030-1130pm. I wish that I didn&#39;t waste an hour of my life here. Ray, the server,  was unhappy and apathetic. He only smiled at the end and said something funny when we were paying. The food was awful. My friend ordered their cheese stick which she hated and don&#39;t even finish. I ordered the Nashville hot chicken nuggets and mini crab cakes. I love crab cakes, but these were greasy and not firm. I couldn&#39;t grab them at all. I put a lot of tartar sauce on the crab bites to get some flavor. The chicken nuggets came out late. They were the only thing that was hot, but the bottom side of each piece wasn&#39;t coated in hot sauce. The top barely had enough to get the red color on the chicken. I forgot to mention that the bread was cold and the butter was so cold that it wasn&#39;t spreadable. Overall, $43 was wasted on ok service and fast food quality good.

I&#39;ve been going to CF in greater LA area for a long time... when the nearest ones were in Woodland Hills and Marina Del Rey. So, I can say I&#39;m pretty familiar with their menu, quality of food, and expected level of service. <br><br>Everything from service to quality of food was wrong at this location which means there&#39;s a problem with management and training. <br><br>My party of five is not coming back here. Luckily Pasadena has many many other options and if I really want CF then I&#39;ll go to Americana in Glendale.

I&#39;ve been to this location a few times and both were different experiences. The first time my boyfriend and I went here was in the afternoon and our waiter was fantastic! He was super energetic, I&#39;ve forgotten his name. The good came out perfect and delicious. The last time we went was last night actually, around 930pm. It took about 10 minutes for our waitress to even acknowledge us. There was another waiter attending other tables constantly but ours only came a few times to check up on us. The food came out delicious as always!
No different from any other cheesecake factory around the nation. Food is adequate. Drinks or refreshing. The staff is the only gamble you will take eating here as he can change from week to week.

This place is going down hill fast.  The napkins at my table were dirty and so was the silverware.  The staff seems to have accepted that the restaurant is dirty and they do not care.  4 out of 5 times the silverware and/or napkins are dirty.  The location at Santa Anita and Sherman Oaks are much better.

I just typed an entire review without signing in first and now I have to do it again. :/<br><br>This one will be much shorter- !!!-<br><br>Came in at 3 pm for a late lunch. Off hours are the best time to come , there wasn&#39;t a wait.<br><br>The meal was perfectly acceptable, but had I waited an hour or more, not so much.<br><br>Bread and drinks came out pronto. Had a tossed Cobb, and club sandwiches for my lunch mates. Everything was great, fresh, large.<br><br>Waiter was fine, food a bit slow to come out, and there was a time when he went MIA, but thankfully he came back. Check was quickly processed, always a plus for me.

I preordered my friends birthday cake three hours ahead of time. When I came to pick it up they said they ran out. What? So they had to give me a smaller cake. Whatever. When I finally got the cake after the delay, they spelled the name on the cake wrong. Swing and a miss.

Sometimes the service is great, sometimes it&#39;s not. There have been times where they&#39;ve forgotten ingredients of things I&#39;ve ordered or forgotten what I&#39;ve ordered. The food is always great so I keep going back. Sometimes it&#39;s really busy and I understand but it&#39;s still not a good excuse. So my experiences average to a 3 start.

Disappointment.  I used to think they were really good .  But today I ordered chicken piccata and kids pasta for my son and both pasta tasted old.  Like yesterday old and reheated in microwave.  2 bites in, what do I find? A giant piece of plastic!!!  Probably saran wrap.  <br>So why 2 Stars instead of none? The waiter was really nice.  Told the waiter, he was very apologetic and offered free desert.  Made me feel a little better.  But seriously, you can&#39;t bother to boil noodles and need to microwave?!  My bill still ended up being $50 for microwave food.

Ive been here before and it was great. So i went again for my birthday recently. Our waitress was very nice, and I ordered the  lemon couscous chicken. It took about 30 mins for our food to arrive. And the table next to us got their food before us which I thought wasn&#39;t right. The food was really good but I didn&#39;t like how crispy my chicken was. It was like a deep fried fish. Not in a good way. It&#39;s a good thing there taking it off the menu.

Asian salad on the skinny menu. Really nice and the portion sizes are quite large so even though it&#39;s under 590 calories don&#39;t let that fool you! I could only finish half! Love loved it <br>Service was great and the cheesecake was even better

We came for an early dinner tonight. The restaurant had plenty of empty tables but they let the waiting area get completely full. It took 30 minutes to get seated at 4pm, another 15 before we saw a server, 10 for our drinks (and one glass was dirty), 30 for the appetizer and another 20 for our entrees. By the end of the meal, it was an over 2-hour event. The food was off tonight. We got the jambalaya pasta and the texture just screamed &#34;overcooked&#34; on every element. The shrimp and chicken were hard and dry, the veggies were way too soft and the pasta was mushy. We also had the ribeye steak because it was just one of those nights where you felt like ordering steak at the Cheesecake Factory. The meat was tough though cooked to our desired doneness. Our waitress was as nice as can be and these two stars are for her. I know she sensed our frustration. She kept apologizing but she was stretched thin at the start of the dinner service already. Poor girl. I know I&#39;m not going to be having a 5-star experience at a Cheesecake Factory and most especially not this location since I&#39;ve been here many times but tonight was just exceptionally bad. Next time, I&#39;ll just go to Mi Piace across the street, my favorite often-mediocre-service but always-delicious choice.

I have so many wonderful memories here. Staff here is friendly, nice, always willing to help. Unlike the other locations I went to, that offered me nothing but crappy customer service served with a side of bad attitude! (Arcadia - Santa Anita Mall and Brea just to name the TWO!)<br><br>Appetizer:<br>If you love, avocados as much as I do, then you will love Avocado Eggrolls. Just chunks of avocados in every bite. <br>Suggestion, if you get the Hot Spinach and Cheese Dip, don&#39;t get the small sampler potion, its not enough to go around. Always get the full potion. <br><br>Entree:<br>When I am here, I would always get the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta. Ooooh, so yummy, it is a must try! Always get the full/dinner potion, strongly suggested. Why you ask? Well, the leftovers taste just as good. So, it doesn&#39;t hurt to have some the day after or as a midnight snack, whatever works.<br><br>Drink: <br>Strawberry Lemonade is totally delicious and refreshing, served in a cold cup garnished with a sugar rim. Makes one all fancy for having one. And if you really LOVE it, you can take your leftovers to go too! They give you a to go cup and refill it as well. Such nice generous people.<br><br>Desert: <br>I know since its the Cheesecake Factory, I must at least rate a cheesecake. Well, I come to realize that, since I ate here so MANY times, I never really ordered a cheesecake before. Until sometime last year, when I was craving for some red velvet cupcakes. I ended up trying their Red Velvet Cheesecake. O.M.G! Yumlicious!  Taste just like a red velvet cupcake with a hint of cheesecake. Amazing right?!<br><br>Atmosphere and decor inside the restaurant is the same in all location. But like I said before, better staff better services. <br><br>Parking, since its in Pasadena, parking isn&#39;t always free. The parking lot off Green St and the De Lacy both offer 90 minute free parking. But this location, normally has a 15 to 30 minute plus wait time. They don&#39;t offer parking validation, and you are not able to make a reservation before hand.<br><br>God, leaving a review right now is making me hungry. Maybe I should come here for dinner later. Ha ha.

My family and I have been dining at this Cheesecake Factory for years. Its is Centrally located in the heart of Oldtown Pasadena where the hustle and bustle of shoppers and diners crowd the character filled streets.<br><br>Food: <br>With emphasis on &#34;value and portion,&#34; Cheesecake Factory does not fall short. Great for large groups. Trick is to order for the table. Ala-carte style. You&#39;ll be able to try everything. Everything is made to order. Tastes great. (salt really does wonders) something for every craving. Huge menu. They recently revived their menu. Pretty sad to see fettuccini and sun-dried tomatoes go. <br><br>Service:<br>We&#39;ve had many servers in the past but our latest would probably be the greatest. Nicky (not sure of the spelling) was one of the reasons i&#39;m writing this review. She is the Filipino lady that was assigned to our table. Need i mention she is probably the sweetest most sincere server we have ever come across. Food came out great. She was very attentive and made sure our dining experience was great. Thats the kind of service that brings people back to the restaurant. 5-stars for Nicky.<br><br>Good job Cheesecake Factory management! Kudos!!!!!!

NOT as good as the Arcadia location.  We went for lunch and the food was NOT good.  The service was great but the veggie burger was horrible, with old greens, water that tasted like it was imported from Tijuana.  I won&#39;t go back unless I need to use the restroom or someone takes me there for free drinks.

Went here on a Saturday for a birthday and the wait for getting menus, getting to order, getting the bill was absolutely ridiculous!! We were there until 11 pm when we got there at 8 pm because of how long it took them to come to our table. It didn&#39;t even look like it was busy. Will definitely avoid coming to the location especially on a weekend! Horribly slow service! In addition to the horrible service my steak was suppose to be medium rare and half of it was medium rare and the other half of the small pieces was rare. Do not recommend this location!

Terrible, ruined my Sunday evening. We arrived early, got seated right away because there wasn&#39;t any line. But we were waiting almost an hour for our food. The waiter said it&#39;s backing up in the kitchen. Who knows, he may have forgotten to put in the order? By the time the food came, the fries are soggy. What kind of service is that? Last time on another location, they mixed up my leftover with someone&#39;s left over salad! Oh! My.

these guys are super cool. very friendly staff. Peter was our server for the day. we were messing around with the host up front and made her tell peter we were very scary people. Peter was nervous haha. <br><br>we didn&#39;t want to eat anything heavy so caht ordered a margarita flatbread. which was honestly very small surprisingly! caht still shared her pizza and gave me a couple slices. I had the laulus salad (most likely misspelled it) this was honestly bomb ! it was so good and enough to enjoy with a person. <br><br>every was going good until they told me they didn&#39;t have the caramel sweet shake. but the Oreo milkshake was really good. <br><br>always fun visiting cheesecake defiantly give it a try if your around one.

Long wait, slow service, bad food and super noisy like a jet engine.  Couldn&#39;t hear across the table.  In response I don&#39;t think that I will plan my day around your restaurant, just won&#39;t be back.  What a stupid answer!

My husband and I were craving salads so we stopped by the Cheesecake Factory because they used to have amazing salads. He ordered a Cesar salad and I ordered a French country salad and added salmon to it. The salads took forever to come out and once they did, I asked the food runner what the hold up was and he explained that the first piece of fish was overly cooked so they had to fire it up again. Anyway, we had waited for so long as this point that I was already beyond annoyed. Then I hungrily dug into my salad and omg it was AWFUL!!! Omg awful so bad I spit out the super salty beet into my napkin. I let the server know it was gross when she checked on us and that I had waited forever on food already and so she had the manager come over. The manager was a lady named Loretta and she was WONDERFUL. I was so damn pissed and disappointment by the wait and the salad but she was soooo cool and understanding and comforting. She took the salad off the check and offered to bring out anything that sounded good to me. I thought about it and was over the idea of eating anything else but in the end I left pleased and impressed that Loretta handled the situation and my crappy attitude like a true professional. She&#39;s an exemplary manager and truly truly truly made the difference in my experience. The check was less than 30 bucks so it wasn&#39;t the money but it was her willingness and true care to make sure the guest leaves happy. No questions asked Cheesecake Factory Pasadena is lucky to have a lady like Loretta on their management team because had the situation been dealt with in another manner I can assure you I would&#39;ve left pissed and left 1 star. Loretta you&#39;re the real MVP, thank you for sending us off with a positive experience
Family&#39;s favorite Steak Diane, for pasta Chicken Alfredo and Chicken Madeira...Herb Crusted Filet Of Salmon...AWESOME!
We love this place, always glad to go. <br>Stuff is friendly, nice. Craig is A professional waiter, this guy knows his job, here earned 5 stars.<br> And dont forget to order avocado eggroll ;)
Food- love the warm brown bread, good many choices to choose from and always has to have cheesecake after.<br>Service- friendly service. <br>Price- reasonable price.

3 Stars<br><br>The Cheese Cake Factor is a nice place for a birthday, lady&#39;s luncheon, groups. Food quality is good, the main reason for the third star is for there desserts.<br><br>My personal opinion the Restaurant/Cafe is expensive and over price.

Theres nice parking on green street (90 minutes free) and Cheesecake factory is just a minutes walk away. <br>It&#39;s a big tight and crowded inside - esp during dinner time - and they dont take reservations, so try to beat the rush when you come here, since it is a very popular location and the wait time can get as long as 1+ hour. But the food is pretty damn good, and the serving sizes are huge. I usually end up only finishing half of the dishes. The service is great, and I never had a problem, and Ive been here frequently. A great place to come as a easy meal out with friends!

Just had lunch at this Cheesecake Factory location. We had to wait, but not too long. Maria B our server was so nice, helpful and accommodating. I got the tomato basil mozzarella on a thin crust. Perfect for a light lunch. The tamale appetizers were really good too! My husband ordered Jambalaya. He said it was ok. He said he remembers it tasting different/better. My 12 yr old son had the bang bang shrimp. He loved it. Couldn&#39;t finish it all. My husband is wearing a temporary ortho boot so he walks slow. A female manager almost rudely ran him down. I guess he was walking a little to slow. All in all this was a nice lunch outing w/ the family. I would eat her again only if everyone in my party wanted to eat here. But I wouldn&#39;t specifically go out of my way. Would I recommend to a friend? Sure, it wasn&#39;t that bad....

I just ate there tonight and I usually get the miso Salmon every time I go to the cheesecake factory and I think I got it there about three times this time my rice way too hard I still love the place don&#39;t give me wrong the staff are lovely but the cook should have known better with the rice I was very disappointed. :-(

First time eating at this cheesecake location and had a pretty poor experience. We sat at one of the bar tops and it took quite some time to be greeted as well as to order. We ordered a salad and the steak tacos. Took us 30 mins to get them. It&#39;s not like we had a difficult order or several items. After we ate, We waited yet again just to get a box, cheesecake and the check. To complete the whole process of checkout it took 15 mins. Ridiculous. This is the second time we eat somewhere in this area with horrible service. Pasadena restaurant customer service sucks... We won&#39;t be back.

Great service!  Me and my boyfriend came here for our first date 3 years ago and we might go back for our anniversary.  Love the cheesecake of course! <br>The food is always good and the service is always fast. <br>We will return soon!

the cheesecake factory is always over the to ,but my only complain is  in dinner time  [ always being at dinner in this location ] the wait time is 45 to 90 minutes.but the food and service is five stars

Maybe I&#39;m spoiled by the Cheesecake Factory at The Americana in Glendale, which is better than this one in every way!<br><br>I came here for Sunday brunch.<br><br>Pros: We got seated fairly quickly, in less time than they estimated for us.<br><br>The service was quick, and our waitress was generally very good and friendly and attentive.<br><br>It was my wife&#39;s Birthday and they put the piece of cake that she ordered on a nice decorated plate with her name written on it in chocolate, and they sang Happy Birthday. It was very well done, and that really made her day!<br><br>My wife liked her whole meal. I had the crab hash, which was very good.<br><br>The cons:<br><br>Prices just seem to be going up and up and up at this place.<br><br>I ordered a small $7 side salad (that should be the price of a large salad!) to have before my meal.
