What they brought to my table was this small, I mean puny little salad with wilted greens, and the entire salad could fit in the palm of my hand! I&#39;m not kidding, for 7 bucks! <br><br>The breakfast potatoes that came with my hash were dreadful! They looked like the cheapest deep fried potatoes that you could buy in the frozen section of a grocery store. They were basically little grease sponges! They were so greasy that they were translucent because of all the grease! And when you pressed on one, all the oil would ooze out! And those were the &#34;good&#34; pieces of potato! The rest were greasy little hard crunchy bottom-of -the -barrel crumbs that looked like they scraped off the grill just to make it look like they were giving you more pieces, but they were not even edible! And about half the potatoes were like that!<br><br>I asked the server that brought me the potatoes if that was how the potatoes normally are, or if there was something wrong with my particular serving, and he laughed and said yep, that&#39;s how they normally are!<br><br>The bagel I had was not fresh at all! It tasted like it was old and had been sitting around a while, borderlined stale.<br><br>Then when were were paying our check, we paid for part of it with a gift card. We gave the waitress the card, and she comes back saying the card  was no good and brought  us a bill for the rest of the meal. And said we could call the company and find out why it didn&#39;t work , etc., etc.<br><br>I knew the gift card was good so I told here to please try it again. So she goes back and tries it again and the card worked this time because she  punched in the numbers by hand.<br><br>Why couldn&#39;t she have tried that the first time it didn&#39;t work, instead of coming back to the table and embarrassing us saying it wouldn&#39;t go through and handing us another bill?

Cheesecake: Fantastic!  I don&#39;t think you could go wrong with any one you try.  I try a different cheesecake every time and have yet to be disappointed.  I love the macadamia one and the Reese&#39;s one.  Also, the red velvet was delicious, but you&#39;ll have to split it.  It&#39;s huge and extremely rich (&#34;that&#39;s what she said&#34;).  <br><br>Food: Yummy!  They have a great selection on salads and pastas and I like that they are offering low cal items now.  You&#39;ll want to save those calories for the cheesecake.<br><br>Price: A little expensive (one piece of cheesecake is about $8).  The bill for 3 was almost $100 before tip.  <br><br>Service: Excellent.  They are very friendly, attentive, and they have great break coverage.<br><br>Wait time: Not too bad.  Saturday night at 6pm waited only 10 min to be sat.  <br><br>Parking: HORRIBLE!!!  Valet is $7 (with validation, $10 without) and worth it considering the parking lots are $6.  I drove to one lot and it was full and to get to the next lot I had to wait forever at the stop lights and figure out the one way streets...nightmare...I should have valeted.

The Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena is always packed! Day and Night! If you can handle the wait, go right ahead. There&#39;s always shops on Colorado Blvd you can shop or bring something you can do for hours. If you have a choice, go to the one in Arcadia or Redondo Beach. For some odd reason this place is always always packed with people. They do not take reservations, they don&#39;t need to. Just drive by and look at the line. <br><br>Let&#39;s see, the food is awesome. I love the steak Diane with shrimp scampi or salmon. They have also have lunch specials around $8-12. They serve a variety of pasta, steak, salads, sandwiches, and of course cheesecake! Lots of non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks. The cheesecake is a must! Although its a bit pricey! (Around $5-6 a piece) <br><br>The service is typically good, the waiters are attentive and your meal arrives on a timely manner. <br><br>*Subject to change

Normally a fan, but not this time!  Trying to eat healthier and light, which this is not the place for that!  I ordered the Kale and Quinoa salad with shrimp.  First of all to add shrimp was $5 extra, and that got me 4 pieces of shrimp (what a joke)!  I know it&#39;s hard to spice up kale and get it to be enjoyable, and it definitely shows here!  If you want a bland insipid expensive salad get this one!

I only came here to write a review since we received a fantastic service performance when we were here. The waitress was really nice and she made us feel welcomed when having lunch here. She smiled and helped us the whole time, occasionally asked us to see if we need any time. The restaurant couldn&#39;t provide any better waitress out there I suppose. Although the food is not that exceptional or good or the ambience is a little too loud to get 5 stars from me (I ordered chicken salad and a slice of raspberry pie which you may wonder) , but that waitress would be the reason to make us come back another time!! We enjoyed our time here :D<br>Well done!!

Let me pre face this with the statement that I LOVE Cheesecake Factory, okay? I&#39;ve been coming here since I was 12 (it was a very good birthday). This review is just based on this one experience I had last night that was not consistent with the many times I&#39;ve been there. <br><br>Me and my friend sat down and waited a while for our unknown server to take our orders. No one came by and I had to flag down a random server to ask who it was. HE was gracious and offered to take our order and give it to our real server. Then our real server popped up and had the most uncomfortable gaze towards me that makes it seem like he was upset that I flagged someone else down? Not my problem. I give a nervous laugh and begin ordering a wine. He does not ask for an ID even though I begin to reach for my wallet automatically. I ask, don&#39;t you need to check my ID? He gives his uncomfortable gaze again and says sure and doesn&#39;t really look at it. <br><br>Food comes and my bistro shrimp pasta has major lemony taste. It&#39;s overpowering. My friend&#39;s rice was undercooked. <br><br>Throughout our whole meal, the creepy server did not check in with us once. He really made our experience totally uncomfortable. Dude, can you at least hide the fact that you hate your job?

Always good and reliable. Went to the Pasadena location for a business lunch and couldn&#39;t talk to clients due to music Being way too loud. We had to practically yell our order to the server. Please lower  the music a smidgen? Other than that great food and friendly service.

Three stars because it&#39;s too damn dark. Just kidding, but really. <br><br>The food was good, and filling.<br><br>Place was clean and the wait time was short, even for a Friday night. <br><br>Unfortunately, when it came to dessert time, &#34;Boxes? No.&#34; &#34;Dessert? Menu please?&#34; we asked our server KAREN C for a menu, and she said she would bring it in just a minute... Five minutes pass, nothing. A few minutes after that, she comes to our table and asks (again) &#34;Boxes? Do you want the check?&#34; And completely forgot the menus, so we paid and left.
Went in and the hostess was amazing. Waiter was great, food was awesome. I have no comlapins. I love eating there.

I&#39;m convinced that the whole Cheesecake Factory franchise doesn&#39;t really need to exist.  I&#39;ve been to two locations, and was not impressed either time.  Their lunches are fair, but not on par with their pricing.  Soups are too salty--and I&#39;m someone who likes salt!<br><br>The only good thing there is the cheesecake.  I like the Banana Creme Cheesecake a lot.  That&#39;s the only item I&#39;d specifically go to this restaurant for.

Came here yesterday with a couple of friends because they&#39;ve never had cheesecake factory before. I had the Chicken Alfredo and the red velvet cheesecake. I ended up with food poisoning last night and today. Not a great impression to leave especially if I brought new customers who say they were going to return but after my little incident they will never come back. Neither will I. One star for service which was alright.

I&#39;m assuming one CON about The Cheesecake Factory is the wait time. Since we were originally supposed to wait an HOUR to eat I guess it makes sense. However we found seats at the bar which will serve you full menu food items, so we only had to wait about 10 minutes. <br><br>I ordered the Americana Cheeseburger it was DELICIOUS! Instead of fries I ordered a side salad. Everything was really good. My bill was about $15 not too shabby for restaurant food. All in all I definitely recommend this place if you don&#39;t mind waiting or if you can sneak in a seat at the bar.

I have ordered take-out (both delivery and pick-up) several times from this restaurant and usually get the same thing; Sheila salad with either chicken or grilled salmon.  Its amazing, four out of five times they get the order wrong as if someone in the back doesnt know how to make the salad.  Once I ordered it and it didnt come with any tortilla strips or avocado.  The chicken varies; sometimes I get a whole chicken breast, other times I get it sliced, and occassionally I get it shredded.  Tonight, I have my boyfriend pick up the salad and once again, it doesnt have any avocado or cilantro on it.  The salmon was a very meager skimpy piece of fish.  Im done dealing with the Pasadena Cheesecake Factory.  Next time I&#39;ll deal with the crowd and go to Glendale.

Randomly stopped by tonight and the service was great. Had a terrible night prior to coming but our server Craig made our night. Just really wanted write to review to show him appreciation for just doing that for my date and me. Definitely was a great dining experience.

Great service all throughout!  Thanks for the wonderful experience with my toddler and infant.  We appreciate the thoughtfulness in the plate of bananas and bread for my babies.  We also like the sanitary lining for the diaper changing station. I had forgotten mines and that really came in handy.  The food was good.

This location holds a special place in my heart; its where me and my now husbands went on our first date. I always order the calamity,lemon picatta pasta , jack and coke and of course the cheesecake!!!

Honestly, I didn&#39;t want to come here for lunch. My friends and I decided on a shopping day in Old Town Pasadena and we were starving, but I really wanted to try something that wasn&#39;t as &#34;chain-y&#34; as TCF. Sure, there were lots of chain restaurants in the area, but are so many TCF&#39;s around the area, so I was hoping for something unique. But they didn&#39;t want to walk anymore, and one person who suggested to come here was soon followed by murmurs of agreement, so I had to come in.<br><br>Looking at the menu, I saw that almost 80% of the items that I wanted to eat could be homemade at home without too much effort. Salads, pastas, even dishes like Shepard&#39;s pie and meatloaf were things that I could make, so I really just didn&#39;t want to spend money on it, being the cheapo that I was. But I was hungry and didn&#39;t care, so I picked something that sounded simple yet delicious: the cashew chicken salad. It was a hot day and I wanted something light yet filling, so I was very satisfied when I got my food. It was the $10 lunch portion, which I expected to be tiny, since it was a &#34;smaller portion&#34; of the regular dish.<br><br>I loved the crispy tortilla chips, crunchy cashews, and the zesty but light peanut vinaigrette over the tender chicken and mixed greens. It turned out to be a great lunch.<br><br>One thing I really wished though was better service. It wasn&#39;t terrible, but I could tell some of the waiters/waitresses were tired of their job or just in a cranky mood. We are poor college kids, so you would expect us to gobble up the complimentary bread and butter and then ask for some more just a couple minutes later, but the lady just looked bored and annoyed at our request.

I like going to this location. (I like Old Town Pasadena overall.) This area gives me fond memories of when I was young and would hang out with my sister and older cousins (oh and the &#34;kuyas&#34;). So it already leaves a positive memory in mind.<br><br>So here&#39;s my mini review. The ambience is great inside. Service was wonderful. Food was delicious. I got the Chicken Piccata. Yum.<br><br>Parking is in the structure, but other than that, overall great experience.

I&#39;m a huge fan of Cheesecake Factory ever since high school (the 90s throwback days). I&#39;ve eaten at locations around the country. Some of my local favs are Woodland Hills, Marina Del Rey, Sherman Oaks, Beverly Hills, Brentwood, Atlanta downtown, Ceasars Palace Las Vegas... you get the point.  For some reason the Pasadena location consistently offers POOR service at the bar. In fact me and my friends agree they have the WORST bar service EVER!!  Both bar servers (two females) are the slowest I&#39;ve ever experienced. I can&#39;t fathom why, as Pasadena has one of the smallest bars 2/3rds the size of others. Their attitudes are lackadaisical equally matching their enthusiasm when it comes to making drinks.  It&#39;s takes them a minute to acknowledge new customers, which is a huge no no, especially when your basically face to face!  That&#39;s hospitality and food service 101!  Unfortunately, I am forced to return due to the fact that I&#39;m a huge Cheesecake fan and it&#39;s the only location in Pasadena.  I will add updates should the service ever improve.

I always love coming here. My favorite dish would have to be the steak Diane, $19. It&#39;s steak medallions covered in a sautéed mushroom sauce, amazing!!! Definitely gonna be coming back for some more of that!

One of the best places to go with friends, or a staple of going out with a date.   Prepare to look for parking when it gets packed since it&#39;s in the middle of old town Pasadena.   However,  the food was great and the servers were very attentive to refilling our drinks. Much so even checking up on us every now and then.  Be willing to try out new flavors with their entrees and possibly take a slice of cheesecake home,  you won&#39;t regret it.

We were trying to get into another restaurant, and did not like the wait, so we ran to the Cheesecake Factory and got right in; it&#39;s very rare to get seated so fast at any Cheesecake Factory.  The view was nice looking at Colorado Boulevard and the long line at the &#34;other&#34; restaurant, who just opened.  Our server was on top of her game and immediately served us our late lunch.  I had the roadside sliders because I was not that hungry, and sliders in general are great appetizers or something to hold you over.  The wife had the lunch special with soup and salad, and the daughter had some sort of pasta with chicken and tomato sauce.  All very good and satisfying.  One thing shared among all the CF restaurants is their fresh white and brown breads.  I hazard to say the brown is pumpernickel, and the white is sourdough, just guessing though.  This year, I&#39;m trying to cut back on butter, so I had the white bread with Italian Olive oil and balsamic vinegar, which satiated me and a tad healthier.  all in all, a very good plan &#34;B&#34; and we still had free parking left from the City parking structure...

Wow so dissapointed. Came here and they kept seating people who arrived after me and after 30 minutes i got fed up. I asked the hostess and she was like omg i forgot. No apology from her. Then she told someone to seat us in a small corner when there are booths of 4 for our party of 3. Told the manager and then manager got us a good table but table was dirty. So then we waited again. Then got sat and then 10 minutes later the server said did you guys get a menu? Im like no....this is a joke!
I&#39;m a Cheesecake Factory fan. I have been to many different ones in different areas, however this is the ONLY cheesecake that sits you very fast compared to others.
The food is delicious but they have terrible customer service. Yet the place is really nice and clean.

The manager that runs this place is full of shit. We ask for double servings of spicy chicken on our nachos and as the manager expedite she only gave us a serving of chicken while claiming she gave us two. She said for each serving of chicken she gives 7 oz per serving. Since we ask for more chicken shouldn&#39;t she give us 14 oz of chicken yet when we got our nachos we got maybe at most 4 oz. She tried arguing with us on how they measure every amount of meat that they serve. Yet, out of her own good heart she decides to not charge us for the chicken we order and that she promise for another 7 oz of chicken. As we got the extra chicken we ask for she probably only gave us another 3 oz. I&#39;m pretty sure we got less than 14 oz of chicken (more like 8 oz total that after she promise another serving of chicken) she dared charge us another $3. I don&#39;t mind paying for what I ordered but how would you feel if someone short change you. Such an unprofessional manager she argue with us and lied to our faces saying that she put double servings yet she didn&#39;t. I used to plan for meal servings and I guarantee you that we had at most one serving of chicken (7oz). To be fair if the manager was really sure of the serving size why not bring out the scale and if you are right I will pay for what I eat. If your wrong then you should apologize and not charge for the extra chicken. <br><br>We also ordered the egg roll sampler which was great because you get to try four different egg rolls. Avocado was the best but at the same time it hard to mess up with Avocado egg roll. It also hard to mess up with nachos. <br><br>If you are planning on cutting short on meat portions maybe you shouldn&#39;t tell people about the exact amount of oz you serve for your customer. As a scientist, we do conversion and weigh things on scale everything so I know I didn&#39;t get what I paid for. I been to this location before and I ordered the nachos and this was the first time I had such a bad experience. All it takes is just that one bad experience. <br><br>The nachos taste delicious but after that encounter with the manager and server they made me feel unpleasant and uncomfortable. I hate it when people straight up lied to my face. <br><br>Let&#39;s talk about customer service at this location. We had to flag our waitress 3 times to get their attention to get water or any sort of service. On the check they ask for 22% tip yet they didn&#39;t really serve us or ever once check back on us. How dare you ask us or demand us for tips when you didn&#39;t even do your job. This was at 5pm when there&#39;s many empty seats and it not like they were busy. <br><br>Another thing was when we ordered a key lime cheesecake to go the cheesecake tasted pretty old and stale. I would never come back to this location unless I have to and I would recommend people going to other locations. Worst service and food compare to other cheesecake locations by far. They deserve exactly 1 star because the food was decent.

Me and my boyfriend went last night as an early Valentine&#39;s celebration and the experience couldn&#39;t have been more amazing. The atmosphere was very serene and romantic, especially with slow songs playing and the mood lighting. Some people may find it a little dark for their liking, but I thought it was just right.<br><br>The fresh bread and butter they give you was a very good start to the meal. Once we had our fill, I ordered the Shrimp Scampi ($19.99) with strawberry lemonade ($4.79). The lemonade was some of the best I&#39;ve ever tasted. And the shrimp scampi dish had delicious lemon-y garlic flavor that was to die for. <br><br>The service is great as well. Our server was excellent and went out of her way to make sure we were enjoying our special night.<br><br>Of course the food is a little pricey, but for the amount of quality in the atmosphere, service, and food, it was well worth it.
They have my favorite starter dishes. Avocado egg rolls is so go. They have the great staff. American breakfast- brunch open much later. I love the way they cook.
Love this place and their food, it&#39;s always a long wait to be seated specially on weekends. My favorite is their pasta carbonara and the red velvet cheesecake

I had the bbq chicken salad lunch portion. It was huge! I didn&#39;t finish it and was way too full for dessert. I&#39;m not sure you can call it a low calorie meal.  Everything was fresh, avocado, tomatoes, greens.  It had only like 8 small pieces of chicken on the entire salad though.  The waiter was bubbly and very nice.
Food is obviously great! The costumer service at this locations needs lots of improvement.

The service was absolutely FanTasTic!!!  The food was perfect in every way.  I had the CAJUN JAMBALAYA PASTA.  Consisting of Shrimp and the most tender Chicken, Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a Spicy Cajun Sauce on Top of Fresh Linguini.  I just added crushed peppers because I like it hot!<br>It was delicious, just the right temperature, a nice size portion, it was served quickly and the dessert was sinfully delectable!  I had the KAHLUA COCOA COFFEE CHEESECAKE which I recommend!. Rich Brownie for the crust, Kahlua Cheesecake, Creamy Chocolate Mousse and Chocolate Ganache topping.  Their coffee is the perfect complement!  I give this restaurant 5 stars and a thumbs up
Friendly staff and the happy hour appetizers are large, tasty, and very reasonably priced. A lively environment.

This is a review on the service rather than the food (which is usually pretty good and consistent). During the holiday&#39;s, I visited with gift cards. When my meal was finished, I inserted two gifts cards to cover most of the food and placed my credit card in back of them. I unfortunately did not notice that my credit card was not returned to me. When I came back into the restaurant about 10 minutes later and explained the situation to the manager, all she did was advise me that her servers are always great about returning credit cards. At no point did she offer to look for it other than look through a few credit card folders at the station near our table. I must assume that if the gift cards were scanned and then tossed, my credit card would have also been discarded along with the gift cards?We left and had to report our credit card as stolen and wait 8 days for a new one.

not one to write a bad review based off one bad experience but I am so upset with the service my boyfriend and I received on St. Patricks Day. I come here all the time for yearsss, but this was just horrible. we had a waitress that literally disappeared after taking our order and she never came back the whole night. we had to ask multiple people to help us and it seemed only the bus boys were willing to help, thank you btw, but the servers were rude and did not want to help us. I understand they have their own tables to worry about but we were just trying to get a refill and our food. after we finished eating, we literally waited for about 20-25 minutes for our waiter to pop back in or something and at least bring us our check but still nothing and we could see her in the kitchen just doing nothing with her red sweater on already ready to go. I asked a server to please get our waiter for us and stillllll nothing. after telling ANOTHER server to get our waiter, STILL NOTHING. so even after the 25 minutes we waited, we waited about an additional 10 minutes for someone to come back until I had it. we grabbed our stuff and didn&#39;t even take our left overs with us since no one couldn&#39;t help us and we walked to the front to speak to the manager or whatever she was and a server stopped us saying we hadn&#39;t paid with another server coming right behind her to probably tell us the same damn thing. like umm no shit, we&#39;ve been waiting for our fucken receipt, we were walking up to complain to the manager who didn&#39;t do shit and only said &#34;I&#39;m sorry, next time you come in just let us know and we&#39;ll take care of you&#34; like you think we&#39;ll actually come back after that? hell no and you wouldn&#39;t come either if you received the same service?? Actually do something about it, that&#39;s so unprofessional. 1 star only because there&#39;s no option to put 0.

So I had had a really bad experience at a Cheesecake Factory prior to visiting tonight. But tonight changed everything! <br><br>First off, our waitress Katie was absolutely phenomenal. I had apologized for being in a rush and she catered to my need to hurry perfectly. All of our food came out quickly and hot.  We ordered the warm asparagus, the grilled artichoke, sliders, and the pear and blue cheese flatbread. All were amazing.  Not only that but she was on top of refilling our drinks and making sure we were okay. Will definitely be coming back and hopefully get Katie again. She truly sets the highest standard for service.

This weekend was the first time I ever walked away from this restaurant completely and 100% satisfied. Our server Erica G. was beyond outstanding! She was so friendly and had no problem helping us with any questions we had. Anytime I ever go to this restaurant the servers pretty much rush you out. But Erica was a complete profesional and gave outstanding service. Thank you Erica G. For such a great experience!

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory so many times but this visit was pretty bad. Don&#39;t get me wrong I love the food at cheesecake factory so many options and good for all types of food and they have an amazing selection. The reason I gave this visit a 3 stars because the service was really bad. Our server just forgot about us the whole time. I really wanted to leave no tip but that is really wrong. We finally got someone else to help us. On a happy note get the dulce de leche or the pumpkin cheesecake it&#39;s so good !

I had a special auntie-niece lunch date.  We went to Cheesecake Factory because my niece wanted cheesecake.<br><br>We ordered raspberry lemonade, fish and chips (for me) and Renee special (for sweet niece) and mango keylime cheesecake.<br><br>The raspberry lemonade was nice and refreshing with sugar coated glass rim.  I didn&#39;t see my favorite complimentary brown bread so I asked for it.  The waitress got me fresh new ones from the oven.  Yumm..<br><br>Fish and chips: it came with coleslaw and fries.  My fries were not greasy and tartar sauce was good.  The fish was just ok.<br>Renee special: turkey sandwich and mushroom soup.  My niece enjoyed both and she said that the turkey was &#34;FRESH&#34;.  She didn&#39;t like the salad.<br><br>We took the cheesecake home and ate it at night.  The waitress claimed that it was new and she liked it very much.  We didn&#39;t really like it.<br><br>Great and prompt service.<br><br>3 stars!!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is kinda yummylicious!!
One of the worst cheesecake factories. Nice staff, but food is definitely way below standard. Came out dry and bland, and the staff seem to be working hard but very unorganized
Love The Cheesecake Factory but I didn&#39;t like the orange chicken dish.   Not my favorite.
Great service and great food. Always on time and the servers are awesome. The Oreo cheesecake is my favorite.

I&#39;m a big fan of Cheesecake Factory, but this location was not up to par with the other locations that I have been to. The customer service was mediocre. It took 45 minutes for our food to come for a party of two. After having our meal and paying the check, we were waiting on our cheesecake slice that we ordered to go. 25 minutes almost 30 minutes later, with no warning it would take so long, our server came by with our cheesecake and had given us the incorrect flavor. By the time we realized, it was too late. Very disappointed in the customer service at this location. I don&#39;t see myself returning to this specific location.
Food is great. They have a skinny menu and happy hour is always clutch. The bread prior to the meal is delicious. Food is a little greasy though.
Good service decent food. Always order the lunch or skinny list menu as portions are too big on regular menu. Love the free bread butter.

We&#39;ve given this chain 3 times and ever time we are disappointed<br>With the quality of the food and extremely overpriced even for the cheesecake. Food was terrible cheesecake nothing to rave about and it was pretty dirty even our napkins. Will never come back.

Came here on 7/24/16 to celebrate a birthday. It was later in the evening but was still packed. Wait time to be seated was under 10 mins. Our server was Leonor. Her customer service was awesome. Very soft spoken and polite. Although we were stuffed from diner she still brought out a small ice cream and candle. Very nice and thoughtful. The good is always great. It came out in a reasonable time and was still very hot when we began to eat. Overall a great night we&#39;ll definitely be back. Oh and the mac and cheese bites are off the charts. Should&#39;ve got some to go.

Absolutely terrible service today. I called at 11:20am to make a to go order. The girl at the front desk tried to tell me they didn&#39;t open until 11:30am, when I know for a fact they open at 11:00am as I go there all the time and the posted hours say the same. She then said the order couldn&#39;t event be placed at the time as the bakery computer wasn&#39;t turned on and I should call back at 11:30. <br>I then walked by the restaurant and saw people eating inside. Really???<br>Thankfully Louise&#39;s is across the street and has better service. <br>#GoHomeCheesecakeFactoryYoureDrunk

I&#39;m not the kind of person that easily goes and puts a bad review for any little thing! But last night I had the WORST experience ever.... <br>Yesterday I had a very negative experience showing some friends around from Guatemala to a nice restaurant such as Cheesecake. First we were denied the ability to purchase alcoholic beverages simply because of the origin of  our ID&#39;s all 3 of us being from Guatemala. This is the first time we have ever been denied the right to consume alcohol because of the origin of our ID&#39;s we are all over the age of 21 and I have had no issue before anywhere proving my age with my ID from  my country Guatemala. After the waiter had denied our ID&#39;s to validate our age  we asked for a Manager which also rudely confirmed the same and that it&#39;s the law that they don&#39;t accept ID&#39;s from the country of Guatemala to confirm legal age to drink. Even after the manager pointed out in a very rude way simply cause we were &#34;Guatemalns&#34; we still were planing on having dinner. After he just left and just left us there for 20 mins with no follow up no waiter to come and assist us so we just took of and left. I ask to speak to him again before we left, at no time we had an apology from him, and still was really rude. I don&#39;t think someone before made us felt that bad and that &#34;excluded&#34; just cause of the fact of our origins... This is the last time I come to Cheesecake factory because of this racial matter and disgusting rude customer service and the last time I want to take friends from out of town to a nice restaurant such as Cheesecake. We all fell ashamed and embarrassed all because of this.

This restaurant was very welcoming. The servers were very friendly and courteous. I came to have dinner with my boyfriend in the evening and we were glad to receive great service because we had recently gone to a Cheesecake Factory location in Marina Del Rey and the service we received there was not pleasant. The food and drinks were great and I definitely recommend this location.

YUMMMMMM mmmmHHHMMM.... There is so much goodness to speak of when thinking of The Cheesecake Factory. I went here specifically for the cheesecake and man I wasn&#39;t disappointed. I had the Dulce de Leche cheesecake and it was the moist-est (i hate using that word), most fluffy, and textured cheesecake I had in while. The graham cracker crust perfectly complemented the cake so I i fell deeply in love with my cake/pie/ (idk if cheesecake is really a cake or considered a pie ??)   I was contemplating giving this place 4 rather that 5 stars but the mimosa I had here just tipped the scale. It was just amazing. Sweet, Minty and strong. The perfect combo for a drink. And the mint leaf was pretty I  wanted to put it in my hair :X

This place is the most beautiful view and great meal but I give the costumer service great but in December 31 2016 a waitress was the most laziest waitress I have ever seen in my live my father had to go out to get our drinks and to come back and that lady is a greedy waitress because she only comes quick for tips like why but besides that I like this place

I love the brown bread that they give you when you sit down, it has a slight sweetness to it and because it is brown I like to think it is healthy.<br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls - these are really good but totally fattening, but they are great for sharing<br>Chinese Chicken Salad - the salads here are ridiculously huge, but it is pretty good and definitely very filling if you can even manage to finish it<br>Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms - this is my favorite dish at Cheesecake Factory, I love the combinations of the marsala sauce and the chicken, I could probably do without the cheese that is on the chicken but it the flavor is fantastic, and of course the giant heaps of mashed potatoes are always welcomed since my grandma loves to steal them off my plate<br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - I am always in search for great pasta, and this is their most popular pasta dish, but I found it to be really dry, the flavor is nice but the dryness made me really thirsty<br><br>My family loves the White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake (I am not a cheesecake fan since I find it to be too rich) and always asks for extra raspberry sauce on the side.<br><br>The one thing I don&#39;t understand, is how they don&#39;t take reservations. It seems kind of ridiculous but if you have to deal with a long wait, Old Town is not a bad place to do it, just put your name down and go shopping.

This is your typical Cheesecake Factory. When you order food it&#39;s going to be consistent with all the other stores in the chain and the service is going to be good. We ordered prime rib and a Mexican salad and it came exactly how we expected. <br><br>I was impressed with the service here, especially considering we arrived an hour after the BCS Championship ended and the place was slammed. The staff was prepared and ready for a barrage of people - and they handled it well and maintained excellent service. Nice job management.

Why does it takes so long to be seated (when the restaurant is half empty), and soooooo long to get food? Poor management is why. They always seem short staffed on servers and cooks. More than once I&#39;ve heard them blame delays on not having enough staff on that night. Seems to be a problem common throughout many different branches.

Came in on a Thursday around 2p.m and it was still a pretty decent sized lunch crowd. Good thing was that it was just my friend and I so we didn&#39;t have to wait long.. We got seated within 5 minutes and that was when it went downhill from there. I always give restaurants the benefits of the doubt because I too am in the Food / Beverage Hospitality Management field. 10 minutes passed by and I didn&#39;t mind because I still haven&#39;t made a decision on what I wanted but my friend came in starving. Another 10 minutes passed by and my friend was slowly getting ticked off so she flagged a random server down. I&#39;m not the type of person to do that because it was understandable since it was busy.<br><br>Our server came by and asked what we would like to drink. Once our drinks were placed, she asked if we wanted Bread and Butter and we politely said yes and told her that we were also ready to order. My friend got a Mushroom Burger and I got the Parmesan Herb Crusted Chicken. 15 minutes passed by and my friend started getting grumpy. She flagged down a random server to check up on our food because our server was no where to be found. 10 minutes later, the person we flagged brought our food out. Boy, were we hungry. My friend asked her for burger medium rare and it came out well done and cold, and my green beans were way undercooked, it was rubbery and it had no flavors, but to be honest, we were too hungry to say anything. The bill came and we still left a 20% tip despite of the downfalls. Not sure if i will come back though because this is my third time to Cheesecake Factory, and all three times, service is just bleh.

Came here with a group of co-workers recently, and the service was pretty slow and spottingly inattentive at times.  They didn&#39;t give us bread for the longest time.<br><br>I ordered a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; Asian chicken salad (hold the chicken).  I don&#39;t like when I see these gimmicky names for &#34;weight-loss&#34; foods, but my choices are limited here with my food intolerances/particulars, so I went with it.  The salad had good flavor, and the lunch portion is not as big as the dinner one, so it wasn&#39;t crazy large.  Still, I had enough to take home for another meal.<br><br>Overall, I know why this place is popular, and I would come back again.  Their menu is huge, and the cheesecakes are huge and look divine.

This. Was. Painful. We came on a Saturday night at 6:30. I totally understand that this is a high demand time. I was expecting a wait, especially for a party of 7. However, we waited for everything. 40 minutes for a table, 20 minutes for our drink order, 35 minutes for bread to the table, our waters stayed empty, and we had to ask for our check before we were done eating just in hopes we&#39;d get it before 10 pm. So slow and very unattentive service. The food was quite good and everything was prepared as requested. That was the only positive from this dining experience.

Worst experience here ever i usually get the herb crusted salmon but never have i gotten it at this location the first plate i got was cold the second plate was warm but it was flavorless by far the worst experience i have ever had at a Cheesecake Factory and the manager was not very helpful at all

Came here for dinner with a friend as he had been wanting to come because he is a huge fan of The Big Bang Theory. <br><br>The hosts and waitress that assisted us were very personable, friendly and on top of their game.<br><br>The three star was for the food.... The chef&#39;s need some guidance because my tostada salad lacked chicken and I felt like I was on a scavenger hunt for it... no bueno...<br><br>I explained this to the waitress and she removed it from the table, offered if I would like to order something else but at that point my hunger was over.. She was very kind to inform the manager and it was removed from the bill....<br><br>I would return in hopes for a better meal experience...<br><br>5 star for the customer service though!

came for lunch, and must say getting there at 1130 was  agreat idea.  The food was prepared and served quickly.  the service was on point.  could not have been better...which is how a meal should be.  no problems. <br><br>nothing special just good food, good service...<br><br>much appreciated

Ordered a club sandwich and they are out of turkey wth! Takes forever to get your order and it&#39;s not busy . 2 o&#39;clock in the afternoon!!! Very annoyed with the service !!!! Worst cheesecake around

It was a Saturday afternoon. The wait wasn&#39;t bad at all, I ordered the meatloaf which is always good, my friend ordered from the &#34;new&#34; menu, a single page of items not on the regular (very extensive menu) It was described as  a steak sandwich on a  roll with caramelized onions (some other stuff) and au jus- <br><br>My friend asked for the onions on the side and when the meal finally arrived, the waiter told us &#34;Sorry, we can&#39;t put the onions on the side, until Monday, it has to go out just EXACTLY as it is described&#34; well, it would have been nice if he had told us that when we ordered it instead of when he served it- Our drink order took over 20 minutes to get to our table, and we barely got it before our meal..Additionally, the bread was beyond &#34;Crusty&#34; it had a crust like concrete, but  of course there was the au jus to dip it in.. well, except for the fact that the au jus was served in a teacup, whose diameter was about 2 inches smaller than the sandwich, so you could not even dip it into the au jus...<br><br>Not a very successful menu item, and please, Juan, when your customer orders something (like onions on the side) and you cannot do it, please let them know BEFORE you present them with the dish- It could be that they have an allergy !

Love this place. Service was friendly however food always takes a long time. If you want a dinner that you can get in and out quickly, this is not the place. Food is good, just plan to spend a couple hours min there.

Our third visit to this location and certainly not as impressed on this visit as our last. The beet-goat cheese salad was still excellent, the spicy chicken chipotle pasta was more dry and chicken was sparse and not as tender as before. Big disappointment was that the salad and pasta were served to us at the SAME time. When I asked why it wasn&#39;t brought first, I was told it was ordered and came up that way! Shouldn&#39;t servers know how to place order so salad comes up first? Had no problem last time. Also, tables are placed so close to one another (busy place &amp; lots of people) that when the table next to us was served, the server&#39;s derierre was 2 inches from our table!! Seriously! Not impressed this time.

Ok! Last night after a late-ish meeting a group of us decided to indulge in a little cheesecake. Apparently they were having a special event in which their cheesecake was like half price or something, we get there &amp; as we expected we had to wait but while we were waiting we bumped into a friend of a friend &amp; started a conversation. We wound up inviting her to the table.... That&#39;s where the good times ceased! Our waiter came to introduce himself &amp; take our drink orders &amp; proceeded to tell us that it had been a long day? &amp; that most of the menu items were not going to be available if we take long to order? He then returned with a hand scribbled list of cheesecakes that were unavailable now!<br>(Oh did I mention that he told us that he was supposed to take his break but we had been seated...was it mentioned that he was like that peanuts character with the cloud following him? Insert here.... The cloud of tobacco smoke) <br>While I was sitting there I was like....? Is this really happening? OMG!<br>Needless to say, I opted out of the desired cheesecake indulgence &amp; I just wanted to leave! I used to eat here with friends quite often. I will seriously have second thoughts about visiting this location the next time.<br>It&#39;s really a sad thing to see Pasadena sink into a mediocrity!

I called in an order over the phone and was told it would be ready in about 20 minutes. I walked into the restaurant 35 minutes later to pick up my order. There were two people making what looked like coffee and never turned their back to help the couple that was standing in front of me. Five minutes later someone walks up and helps the couple and walks away when I was clearly standing behind them waiting to be helped. Another girl walks in approaches the counter and the lady behind the register helps her instead of me. At this point I&#39;ve been waiting 15 minutes to pick up an order that was placed 50 minutes prior to me walking in. Three waitress approached the counter and started taking to each other. When asked if they could help get an order they said no the cashier has to take care of it. Finally one of the guys making coffee turns around and asks if he could help. Not the best customer service or sense of urgency I&#39;ve seen. I&#39;d understand if the place was packed but waiting almost an hour for a slice of cheesecake and chicken strips is kinda ridiculous.

Came here on a date and was attended by Craig whom was our waiter, Craig may I add was the worst waiter I had at an establishment like this. This is supposed to be a high respectable restaurant and I&#39;ve had better service at Chili&#39;s. Craig had to go on his break (eye roll) and introduced Justine who was so much better! She made me feel better about eating here and had the best smile and great customer service. So if you come here and you may happen to get Craig as your waiter, tell him you&#39;ll rather get Justine, someone who is there for the customer. Thanks girl you made my night better
False advertisement. 50% off cheesecake,  one slice per person,  dine in only.  When I get there,  got a table and wondering what&#39;s with the crowds at the front.  There is take out......omg

FINALLY popped my Cheesecake Factory cherry....our Waiter was wonderful, fast &amp; friendly oh &amp; honest...we asked his opinion on Sweet Potato Fries &amp; he said, &#34;i&#39;ve had better, but they&#39;re good&#34; so, we passed on them. But I tried the Macaroni Cheese Burger (burger topped with Mac &amp; Cheese thats breaded &amp; fried &amp; then topped with cheese sauce) I LOVED IT!!!! We managed to save room for dessert &amp; got the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cheesecake, simply put....its AMAZING!!!! <br>P.S. 1 star is missing for the rude bitch who took over our table when our waiter went to lunch!!!!
When will they realize they need to hire more staff. This may be one of the worst ones for service. Stop being cheap - hire!

I came here with my girlfriends family as it was their last day in town and wanted to eat since we where coming back from griffith observatory. We decided on cheesecake factory since they have never been. We arrived at 8PM and there was a 15minute wait on a Thursday night (not bad!) <br><br>We sat down and had a great view of Fair Oaks from our table. We all were pretty hungry and they gave us fresh bread that was really good. The brown bread is amazing!<br><br>When our food arrived it all had great presentation and was large portions. I ordered the chinese chicken salad and that was very filling and tasty, with nice zesty dressing. My girlfriend ordered sausage and ricotta flat bread, she liked that as well and it came out on a cutting board. Her parents ordered pasta dishes one was shrimp scampi and the other was garlic farfalle chicken pasta. They both loved it and said that it had great flavor. <br><br>I gave this a 4 star because the food was good, however its a chain restaurant and the server was late at refiling our drinks and refilling the bread. <br>We had a very enjoyable night at cheesecake factory. They liked the atmosphere and the food was great!!

I&#39;m a a big big fan of the Cheesecake Factory and an especially big fan of their well mannered martini but I don&#39;t know what happened yesterday. I had the worst martini. First of all my not so well Martini came with regular olives Instead of their signature blue cheese stuffed olives. I was finally able to flag the waitress down and before I could say anything she said &#34;oh yea I forgot your beau cheese olives.... She then had the audacity to bring me a small plate of blue cheese that she expected me to stuff myself....really? Who does that? I told her that I just wanted her to take my drink back and serve it the way I&#39;ve had it a dozen times before.... She took it back and returned with the same drink but put the right olives in. Unfortunately I will never return to that location again. Something is definitely wrong with the management!
I like this place, with nice view on the shopping street!  You can relax from the busy day!  I get to have a free loaf of the wheat brown bread every time i leave hehe...

I have been to many Cheesecake Factory locations. I am from Indiana and we have one there I&#39;ve been to one in Chicago and now Pasadena. I came here with a client from work and my friends ordered a harvest salad that comes with some type of special dressing they kept telling her that it wasn&#39;t a special dressing. It was an awkward moment between the manager &amp; her. Typically the customer is always right but not here. So tonight my daughter turned 11months and we decided to come here now granted it was 9pm and they close at 11pm. I typically order the Louisiana chicken pasta (never lets me down) but i tried something new the zesty lemon chicken which comes with mashed potatoes and carrots. My plate comes and it LOOKS delicious the chicken www great moist and tender the mashed potatoes were dry. Almost as if it is the last bath for the night and they aren&#39;t making any fresh. I send them back and ask for green beans. The green beans come out and they are burnt there is a puddle of brown oil at the bottom of the plate. There was literally like charcoal flakes on the plate. So the waiter who I must say was amazing went to get the manager. She came over and asked what I was having and I told her my issues with the dry cold mashed potatoes and now the burnt ass oily green beans. She persisted to tell me &#34;that&#39;s how we cook our green beans&#34;  so you mean to tell me you purposely browned this oil and made sure they were burnt with no flavor other than hydrogenated oil. That was done on PURPOSE. B#%^ please quit diffusing responsibility and own up to the fact that this is wrong. I subconsciously felt that she thought because we were black we wanted our mean competed but that is my own personal feeling. So I asked her to taste them she looked at me like I was asking her to drink polyjuice potion. So you will serve these green beans but won&#39;t eat them  *mental note made* so I asked her &#34;are your green beans cooked in oil or butter&#34; my thought process was if the skillet was too hot the butter would brown hence for the murky substance at the bottom of the plate. Logically speaking. She leaves the table and returns and says &#34;Oil&#34; so now I&#39;m like that&#39;s some dirty dark oil to be cooking my green beans in. She apologizes &#34;for me expecting something different&#34; which is a slap in the face offers us a dessert which I turn down and dismissed her. Her attitude was that of woman who has been beat up by life and I&#39;m just another problem. She seemed bothered that I was bothered by my food presentation. Lady this is your JOB to manage this restaurant fix complaints. So our waiter is comes back and ask if we are getting a free dessert I said now he said &#34;why not&#34; lol so we got a strawberry cheesecake. <br><br>Positives <br>-my daughter loved it<br>-my chicken was great<br>-stroller parking

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints, whether it&#39;s Las Vegas, New Jersey, or California, the food is consistently delicious, service is fast, and portions are big. My go to dish here is their Jambalaya with pasta. I always get extra sauce on the sauce.  I can never finish this dish in one seating. I either share it with my hubby or have left over for my next meal. I also love their tex-mex egg rolls and their seared ahi salad, The dressing on the salad is delicious and goes really well with seared ahi.  The cheesecakes are of course delightful, scrumptious...awesome. I love the red velvet, strawberry, godiva chocolate, dutch apple caramel streusel.  Occasionally they offer a white chocolate blueberry truffle which is light and delish. I&#39;m looking forward to my next trip to the Boca Park Summerlin location this Saturday, 7/30/16, to celebrate my dad&#39;s birthday and national cheesecake day.

We were there on Aug-27 around 1:30-2pm. The wait line was reasonable in that location, so I would rate than 4 stars (but still be waiting for 30 mins). However, the service got knocked down anther star because the person provided pretty poor customer service. We would have to try to find our waiter but he was no where to be found. He did not seem pleased because we did not order any appetizers or drink to begin with (we ordered some drinks for the kids only, and for adults, we like water since we already had some sodas at home before we came). <br><br>Anyhow, would I come again this location? Most likely not.

Cheesecake is awesome for desert and dinner to if you want to do everything there.  My friend I ate at a nearby restaurant in Old Town Pasadena and wanting something decadent and sweet, Cheesecake Factory was the answer.  The Old Town Pasadena location can get crowded at times especially on weekends but the wait is worth the wait.

I recently got take out from here and ordered the chile relleno burger (medium). I tried this at the Santa Anita location and loved it. The person who rang me up was super friendly but it did take about 20 minutes since it was a busy Friday night. When I tried it, it was nothing like the one in Arcadia. The patty was overcooked, almost char and dry as heck. The bun and other ingredients were decent and about the same as the last time I had it but there was less tomato sauce. I could of really used the tomato sauce cause of the dry patty. I&#39;ll definitely go to another location to try this burger again.

Had to wait 20 min just to put in an order to go...n there was no one infront of me..but a white lady comes in and they helped her right away n yet im still waiting...Horrible service asked the front girls in the front for help and they just looked at each other all dumb.. Nevermind coming back agin..  Horrible customer service

Awful. I had to send back my appetizer of grilled artichoke because only goats and chickens could have eaten it. So undercooked as to be embarrassing. My dish of fish tacos was just odd. The tortillas were radically undersized. Your supposed to get a whole evolution of flavor and mouth feel out of a taco impossible since you had to take most of it out with a fork that was badly bent in my case. I have never had a street or truck taco that was such a joke. Attractive as it all was flavor counts too. The rice served with it was apparently drizzled with 40wt motor oil. I know what that smells like having an antique car. It made me ill. I never had this kind of atrocity at any other location. I had a great experience three times in a row at the one in Cucamonga. All of the restaurants out their are superior to anything in Pasadena once a foodie paradise. My kids barley at half of what they were served. They always finish what I make them and they go get more. Shame on this location. Waste of my money and worse my time.

I&#39;ve never really had an issue with Cheesecake Factory except for the long lines and the menu. Why does every restaurant have a long line? Is the food really that good? And what&#39;s up with the menu? So many freakin&#39; choices. It takes me forever to decide what I want because it&#39;s like 23 pages. <br><br>OK enough with my rambling. We came here for a late happy hour after the book signing at Vroman&#39;s and discovering El Portal (our original plans) was closed early. Bummer. The appetizers we got were so-so. The taquitos were actually OK but the avocado eggrolls were cold; the drinks however were pretty good so at the end of the night I was just happy to spend time with friends vs the subpar food. Oh well. At least there was a parking structure nearby that made things a bit convenient. <br><br>And what&#39;s up with seating families with kids at the bar area? We couldn&#39;t engage in conversation like we wanted to because we had to be sensititve to the family. Boo.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, and usually have a great experience when dining here. However, last night at this location I was very disappointed. Our food was delayed because according to the manager one of our party&#39;s food was not made at his standards to be sent out. Not a problem. However when our food finally came out both pastas that we ordered were hard and dry as if sitting under a heat lamp for an hour. The noodles and shrimp were over cooked and &#34;chalky&#34;. In an attempt to salvage the pasta we asked for a side of alfredo sauce. This never ended up coming out. After sitting there waiting we ended up just returning the food, paying for our drinks, and leaving. The manager never came back out to check on us, and the only thing the server could say was sorry that the extra alfredo never made it out.

So i keep thinking someone from the cast of Big Bang theory will walk in but alas no. Came here one Sunday really late with my girlfriend and had the most marvelous experience thanks to our server Dale. He was attentive to our needs and personally handled our requests. He is the best and he was an added delight to the overall dinning experience!

I&#39;m here with my girlfriend and our waiter is AMAZING!!! Dale was fantastic. He was very attentive to my allergic needs, food choices, and spoke to the chef on my behalf. I hope that the manager reads this and knows what a wonderful employee he has. Thank you Dale!

Although it is not gourmet food, the lettuce wraps are always delicious.  My wife had the lemon coucous which she really enjoyed.  The lemon raspberry cheesecake topped off a great evening out.  The staff was friendly and service excellent..

I must admit that I&#39;m not a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory.  The menu is just insanely way too much variety for me and the portions are way too humongous for me.  And I must admit, cheesecake is probably my least favorite dessert along with flan.<br><br>This past Friday I decided to take my Mom to lunch and the Norton Simon museum and since The Cheesecake Factory was on the way to the museum on Colorado, I decided to bring Mom here for lunch.<br><br>We were seated by our friendly hostess right away since we were early enough to avoid the lunch hour rush.  Our waiter was also very friendly explaining the specials of the day and bringing to the table freshly baked, sliced and warm squaw and sourdough loaves.<br><br>Mom decided on a half sandwich (which she opted for the turkey), soup (which was clam chowder which was the d&#39;jour for the day) and salad, and I ordered a lunch portion of the cabo (?) salad.<br><br>Service was fast and very friendly.    Mom wasn&#39;t a big clam chowder fan but thought her soup was good.  Her salad was just way too big for her to even make a dint out of it.  And she ate about half of her half turkey sandwich.  She thought the french baguette roll that her sandwich was on was a bit tough for her to chew...although that maybe due to the age factor (to be polite to Mom).<br><br>My salad was good and also huge.  I&#39;m glad I got the lunch size portion.  My salad had corn, black beans, romaine lettuce, red onions, diced chicken breast, tomato slices tossed in a chipotle dressing and topped with corn tortilla strips.  It was good, although for my taste I thought they over did it with the dressing.<br><br>Our service was very attentive and friendly.  Our waiter made sure that our lemonade and Arnold Palmer&#39;s were filled throughout our lunch.  We were way too stuffed for dessert.  Which is always the case when coming here.

I came in today for a slice of Key Lime Cheesecake to go. The $8 something price was a bit much but the cheesecake was as good as I remember. Service was speedy and the staff up front were friendly and kind. So, if you are ever in the mood for Key Lime Cheesecake in Old Town Pasadena swing by. I only wish their slices were a bit bigger considering the price. Oralé Namasté.

The Cheesecake Factory is a standard restaurant with many varieties of food. I feel like I come here only if we can&#39;t decide on a place to eat. Given the many options to choose from why not? <br><br>I recently was introduced to the Chicken Bellagio and I think I&#39;m going to be coming to Cheesecake more often. This is the best dish that I&#39;ve had at Cheesecake. Yes, they have the farfalle pasta, jambalaya, pizza, sandwiches, tacos, etc, etc.... but damn why was I so late to try the Chicken Bellagio? Well anyways, you have two slabs of breaded chicken breast topped with proscuitto and arugula served with basil pasta. Huge portions, enough for two, and my this is an excellent dish. I&#39;m impressed Cheesecake!<br><br>Usually Cheesecake Factory is crowded, the lines out the door. I found an easier way. Just go to the self-seating bar area. You still get the same dine-in experience. You have alcohol right in front plus TVs. Good option if it is just two or one.<br><br>-Give it a try!<br><br>P.s.: service was excellent!

I normally have a decent experience at every Cheesecake Factory that I&#39;ve visited. (Pasadena) Tonight was just unsatisfactory and this is why. Our main entre arrived way before our salad and appetizers. Waitress never apologize for the awful mishap. Never ask if we wanted more of the beverage we were drinking. I could go on and on about the unsatisfactory service we received but I need to go to sleep.  In closing for you guys to charge such high prices on your menu. Service shouldn&#39;t have to be compromised.

Look, you know what you&#39;re getting with the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Generally decent service, so-so food, and some decent sweets.<br><br>Walked in at 12:10pm during a recent lunch rush.  I lucked out on parking and they were able to immediately seat me, despite every other restaurant in the area turning me away.<br><br>Service and food were decent, and they kept the drink refills coming.  I grabbed cheesecake for carryout and loved that it was at the perfect temperature.  It was still cold enough that the cheesecake was all in one solid piece and not soupy and draining away.<br><br>A-Ok for this place.

Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory?!?! <br>The Cheesecake Factory in Old Town Pasadena is huge. I&#39;ve never and to wait more than 15 minutes, regardless of the size of my party. The bar area is pretty large too and they have a happy hour during the week! Service is always good and with a menu that large you&#39;re bound to find something you love,

For bakery take-out service only: I ordered a cheesecake last minute from this location, and the workers were more than helpful in accommodating my request. I called at 4:00 to have it picked up at 6:00. They defrosted it for me, so we could enjoy it after dinner.<br><br>As for the tiramisu cheesecake... It was amazing. Buttery tiramisu! What could get better?! The Birthday Girl LOVED it, and that made it worth every penny ($25.95 for the 7&#34;, to be exact).<br><br>The vanilla bean cheesecake is the other favorite (although those are the only two I&#39;ve had and loved)... I bet the rest are outstandingly delicious too!

Probably one of my favorite cheesecake factories that ive been to. The service is very good they are extremely friendly and helpful. Fast service we sat down instantly, ordered and got our food very quick. The pizza was nice and hot and delish, the salad was huge and yummy, and the spring rolls i got were the best spring rolls I have ever had no lie!

You can&#39;t really go wrong with brunch at the Cheesecake Factory. None of the brunch items are spectacular, but you can at least expect a heaping portion of pretty decent food. <br><br>The French toast and Belgium waffle was particularly good....especially drenched in their maple syrup. The crab hash comes with your choice of mash potatoes, fries or diced potatoes.  It was good overall, but a little too heavy in hollandaise sauce and oil.<br><br>This particular location in Pasadena is always packed so don&#39;t come when you&#39;re starved!
This location is a bad Cheesecake Factory restaurant, very disappointed of there customer service and They are slow in serving. Go to a different location.

Fast service, short wait (on a Saturday afternoon), nice waitresses, roomy and large location. I give it four stars instead of five because they don&#39;t validate parking structure tickets<br><br>As an overall mention, their brunch is NOT GOOD. I had a combination of four different things and they were all bad. :) El torito&#39;s is better.

This is the first place that gave us great seating! I&#39;m tired of being put behind pillars and next to bathrooms. We were seated in a window on a cozy little table for two. There was as lot going on outside. It was a nice view. <br>The waitress was exemplary! She sounded as if she was born a waitress. I forgot to get her name. In case this counts, we were there around 11pm on Friday 6-12-15 Memo table for 2.<br>I hesitated to try this place for so long because all I heard were stories of high prices. We ate for under $15 each meal. We ordered one drink called the Whisky Smash...BOMB! Perfect blend of liquor and flavor! But that little cup was $11. Say la veee (how ever you spell it, you know what I mean!). It was nice and my husband keeps talking about going back. WOW! I love this place!<br>I would have only removed half a star if it were possible. A large family walked in behind us and literally shoved us aside as they rushed to the counter to check in. We waited around 20 minutes for seating.

I&#39;ve been here twice<br>The services were great!<br>But!!!<br>The first time I had a pork chop, and I got the plastic in my food...<br>The second time I had the fried avocado as my appetizer, AND I STILL GOT THE PLASTIC in my food...<br> <br>Again, tasty food and great service<br>JUST NOT THE PLASTIC AGIAN PLEASE!!!!!!!!!
One of the best dinner of my life and at a reasonable price. I had a waitress named cittali she was very nice. It was a good place to eat and bring my family.

If you go to a Cheesecake Factory, there is a certain standard level you expect the restaurant to meet in terms of decor, food, and service.  I would have to applaud this particular CF location because they get just about everything right, and there&#39;s nothing different about my latest experience here than any of my other visits to the many CF locations I&#39;ve been to, both in SoCal and elsewhere.<br><br>This place is great when you&#39;re just not very picky and are hungry and maybe have some friends or family with you.  Their extensive menu with satiate any appetite (as long as it&#39;s a big one), and they have some pretty decor inside.  The waiters all wear white and long aprons -- something out of a culinary school, it would seem like.  The food is pretty much the same if you order the same few plates every time (like I do) and can compare between locations.<br><br>One thing that did irk me a bit is that at dinner last night, I had ordered a split bubbly with two glasses -- my husband and I are closing escrow on a house and wanted to celebrate -- and after ten minutes, our waitress came by to inform us that they pulled the bottles out of storage and that they &#34;can put it over ice for us, or did I want it at room temperature?&#34;  Room temperature?  Really?  Has anyone ever requested sparkling at room temp?  A very, very odd inquiry.  I ended up cancelling the bubbly (even if over ice, it would take a little bit longer, and we were both dead tired by that point) and ordering a glass of white wine instead.<br><br>When we had finished dinner and needed our check, it was a bit difficult to flag our waiter down.  And, when the check was brought to us, the bubbly was still left on the bill, so we had to ask to have it removed.<br><br>All in all, an okay experience, one that I would expect from a CF.  But last night was a bit frustrating, which shouldn&#39;t happen on a night we wanted to celebrate.
Reason for 4 stars is that they have a great selection of food. Seems like lunch hours is the best time to go without having to wait too long.

Ordered shepherd&#39;s pie $13.95 and a peach mimosa for lunch. Shepherd&#39;s pie was swimming in grease. I took a napkin and after unsuccessfully being unable to remove enough of the grease to continue eating it, I asked the waiter for help. He took the dish away, and had the kitchen prepare another shepherd&#39;s pie. After another 20 minutes, a nice man (a manager I presume) brought another order. It was not greasy-- but the potatoes were lumpy!  I ate it and paid up and left. $29.00 for two lunch items-- not good.
There was a spider in the food.!!! There was a freaking spider!!!!!!! They did nothing.! Oh that manager was a bitch. She was being condescending and not helpful at all.  She said &#34;Oh well.&#34;

As a huge fan of The Big Bang Theory, I had to come in this restaurant at least once. The real Cheesecake Factory of Pasadena has really nothing to do with the show, but it&#39;s so much better ;) we had Sheldon&#39;s BBQ burger (which was delicious and soooo well served, with crunchy thin fries and good sauces) and a slice of cheesecake. I chose the strawberry classic one, my husband the Oreo special. And they both were AMAZING. We had a great time and the staff was very nice. Great place!

A Friday night on Colorado and NO wait? Especially on the weekend before the Rose Parade? Is this possible?<br><br>Yes, it was. We were seated immediately after drooling over the cheesecakes and debating whether to sit and get cheesecake.<br><br>Too bad that the birthday cheesecakes weren&#39;t free. :( Can&#39;t have everything...<br><br>It was quite amusing to watch Pasadena&#39;s finest catch sucker after sucker.
Stop in today for quick bite and desert service was great prices were ok for what we order can&#39;t complain

Covenient to-go parking in the fair oaks parking lot (Schoolhouse) on Colorado/Fair Oaks<br><br>They do a good job of fulfilling special requests<br><br>Food is consistent and tasty and now they have GF and skinny options

Come to this place if you ENJOY any of the following:<br><br>- waiting in line for half an hr to be seated<br>- pay shit load of money for crappy food<br>- stuff yourself with large portions of overly greasy food<br>- having to listen to the pretentious bitches sitting in the table next to yours bitch about her nails and hair

Been coming here for years and all the hassle of waiting can be much but the food is worth it. The service is great once you pass the man made gate of waiting patrons. <br><br>The food is great and the drinks are even better. It&#39;s the busiest Cheesecake and the tables are a little too close. <br><br>Even though it&#39;s one of my favorites, I can only give it 4 stars for the behavior of people that take your name and the unkempt restrooms.
Great Calamari and Seared Ahi tuna salad! Waitress saved us from the bread...good service!

Nothing can ever go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. Came here with my fams and was seated in about 10-15 minutes. There were so many selections to choose from and I just wanted to eat everything! I end up choosing the Pasta Da Vinci and it was pretty damn good! I was just gonna end my dinner like that, but my big got me a Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake and HOLYSMOKEE it tasted so damn delicious that I shared some with my brother and my boyfriend(:<br><br>I went back a week ago to grab some cheesecake and ordered the Red Velvet cheesecake again and damn, it feels like we were meant to be. HAHAA. The white chocolate flakes on the outside is was explodes like a orgasm in my mouth!
I like this location. It&#39;s rarely crowded and we usually get seated fairly quickly. The food and service are also up to par !

The one star is for the decor.  The only thing Cheesecake Factory has going for it.  We were only looking for a quick bite to eat last night but it seemed like fate just wouldn&#39;t allow it.  We first got seated under the A/C which felt like sitting in a refrigerator. I wanted to ask to move but we sat there... waiting...waiting... waiting. Finally, being that it was so late I figured we could grab another booth in a warmer area, I got up and moved to the same size booth with my wife.  All of the sudden within minutes the host shows up telling me &#34;this section is closed&#34;. I asked him to get the manager and he went off to get her.  He came back and said she was too busy with an employee right now.  He offered to move us to another booth and I reluctantly excepted.  There we sat waiting again. The place seemed to have enough staff to run a good operation but the only one&#39;s who se med to be working hard were the servers.  I have worked in this business 20 years and I work in what I would call the best restaurants in Pasadena if not Southern California.  Maybe I&#39;m bias but I usually way over tip and truly enjoy good service.  Mind you the manager still hadn&#39;t come to my table. We finally ordered and at this point I just wanted to leave.  The food finally showed up and they placed a burger in front of me I would even feed to my dog. The bun was made from that brown bread with the oatmeal on the outside and i pretty much choked just looking at it. I could basically smell how dry it tasted.  I showed the waitress and she even agreed it usually comes out on a sourdough baguette.  I gave it back to her and when it returned it had obviously been sloppily re-stacked on the sourdough bread.  A slimy tomato was hanging out the side and there was a new slice of cheese thrown in there. (Not even melted). By this time the meet was cold after one bite I had had enough.  I told the server upon her asking me, &#34;I don&#39;t want this&#34;. She said she&#39;d make sure it was taken off the bill.  All of the sudden a manager shows up and states, &#34; I understand you had an issue with a burger?&#34; I told him I had asked to see a manager about an hour ago and I was told they were too busy.  I also told him their is nothing he could say to me to change the impression I got from this Cheescake Factory.  It amazes me that people eat here.  It is amateur at best.  There is no sincerity and everyone follows protocol like robots.  I should ha e gone to Coco&#39;s which was one of our options at 9:40pm.  If you&#39;re open until 11pm you should act like it.  I will never step foot in another Cheesecake Factory in all my life.  I feel sorry for the servers too it&#39;s a shame because to be honest the potential is their just not the compassion for wanting it.

Came here at 3pm on a weekday, wasnt too busy so i expected better service... and i was surprised that the food they served us was cold, i ordered mac n cheese &amp; fries for my toddler, fries were cold, ordered coffee...cold and when i asked for a hot cup of cofee i was told its because i have to wait 5 minutes for a fresh cupso if i just ordered a reg cup it would be  a cold cup of cofee??? Even the bread they gave us was cold I can understand if the place was full and busy but it barely had anyone that afternoon. I gave the place 1 star cause i cant give it a lesser rate, sorry this place wasnt like it used to be, not comin back
I was at this place again a few days ago. I must say, our server Vanessa the redhead was wonderful! Please give her a raise! She&#39;s so friendly and her customer service skills are amazing.

I&#39;ve been here once before a long long time ago to dine in but this time around I ordered for to go.<br><br>The Asian wrap is not bad.<br>The cheesecakes will induce a diabetic coma.<br>The sweet corn tamales are surprisingly tasty.<br>The lunch size dishes can be ordered 7 days a week<br><br>Will I be back?<br>Reluctantly yes. This is my brother&#39;s favorite restaurant. So when it comes to a free meal this not so bad of a place to get something pro bono

I&#39;d recommend another establishment for brunch/lunch next time around.  We arrived relatively early and wait was less than 5 minutes.  Had the bruleé french toast with ham.  Got the runs afterwards.  Very unpleasant.  Next.

My friend and I had thee best experience! From the prompt seating, to the delicious food dropping in an efficient time and excellent service. We had a great start to our evening, couldn&#39;t have been better.

Saturday nights are BUSY! We decided to take the risk and get a table anyways; I really wanted the Orange Chicken! Our wait was 45 mins and we ordered immediately, I mean, if you&#39;ve waited that long, you might as well know what you&#39;re going to order! <br><br>BEST ORANGE CHICKEN FROM ANY CHEESECAKE I HAVE EVER BEEN TO! <br><br>I also spilled my strawberry lemonade all over the table and the staff was very friendly and understanding! A manager cleaned up the mess and did not charge me for the extra refill! I can definitely appreciate good management and it should be recognized. At least the two people who took care of us (manager and waiter) were very friendly.

Great service!!! I go to this location all the time I love their menu. You can order anything and it is amazing!!! I especially love their hazelnut crunch cheesecake a new arrival in their already delicious choices<br><br>Always a great time and good food. And oh love their  bread and butter

Came for dinner with my wife today. We really enjoyed our meal, dessert and Service. The restaurant Manager and Servers went above and beyond to ensure we had a wonderful dinner.  Thank you Cheesecake Factory, looking forward to our next visit.
Food 4.5/5 <br>Service 5/5<br>Parking 3.5/5 <br>Ambience 4/5<br>I only visit for cheesecake cravings<br>Other food options are decent.

Cheesecake Factory is a fantastic chain which offers nearly unlimited options of food and drinks. Although the primary type of food is more American style they also have a variety of options from different spectrums. <br><br>Since the menu is over 20 pages long here are a few items which are great (from appetizers to desserts): Thai Lettuce Wraps, Factory Nachos, Factory Chopped Salad, Baja Chicken Tacos, Fish and Chips, Four Cheese Pasta, Steak Diane, Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake.<br><br>This location is also very good. It is a decent size and is not very cramped. The service is also very good and if you need help when your waiter isn&#39;t there you can ask anyone. While I was here there was almost always someone walking by I could ask for whatever I needed.

Food was very delicious and tempting as I wanted another plate to take home but was to full to even smell it. The reason I gave them only three stars is the bad customer service and the  speed of service. Over all it was ok  but adjustments should be me made in order to satisfied all aspects of WOW service.I will come back but for today you guys get three.

My wife and I had been coming every weekend the past two months since we were obsessed with the shrimp rolls and miso salmon.  Today (2/27 11:30am)  I decided to try the Filet Mignot which I ordered medium.  The first one comes almost fully cooked, I showed the waitress who took it back to the chef.  After a extra 20 minute wait, which I don&#39;t mind as mistakes happen, the 2nd one I get is almost no different with virtually no pink, I attached a picture for reference.  At this point it had been 40 minutes since I ordered and was starving so I just ate it.  The waiter and manager was nice though so I gave a extra star for this review.  They offered free soup or salad which I declined as I wasn&#39;t looking to get anything free, I paid full for the steak as well.  But I did tell the manager to make sure the chef is trained on this, it&#39;s either laziness or pride that stopped him from getting the 2nd attempt correct.

We have these in New York where I live, but this location was quite exceptional for two reasons. <br>1. The wait and lines are usually out of this world for any location, even though it seemed like a lot of people were waiting, we got seated in less than ten minutes. <br>2. My boyfriend and I both ordered the flavored lemonade which back home is not free refill, but here it was!
