The waitress came and grabbed our cups quickly without saying anything and brought them back filled, we gave each other a look because we thought she was being sneaky to charge us, when the bill came there was no charge! Love it!
SPAM in their menus.<br><br>Weak sauce.<br><br>Salty.<br><br>The cheesecakes suck.

All my friend and I wanted was coffee and cheesecake. We were seated quickly and then forgotten, in the restaurant for over an hour for...that&#39;s right coffee and cheesecake. Granted, the restaurant was a bit busy, but not to the point that it should have taken almost half an hour for us to order said cheesecake. And our cafe mochas were served to us in glasses...which gave us the impression that they were cold drinks. They were not and my friend was stunned when taking a sip. All in all, not a pleasant experience. 2 stars for the fact that my cheesecake was really good.

I HEART YOU CHEESECAKE FACTORY.....<br><br>I am a very picky eater and I can always find something new on the menu to eat. I love the food, the setting and the staff. It does at time get really crowded in there but that only because their food is so wonderful and I always go back....<br><br>I have been to most if not all the locations within my area. I only wish they made the place a little bigger. Some of my favs off the menu are......Spicy Cashew Chicken, avocado rolls-loveee this, Hot Spinach and Cheese Dip, Crispy Chicken Costoletta,   Crusted Chicken Romano, Chinese Chicken Salad, and love the drink Georgia Peach........<br><br>I highly recommend everyone to go and at least try it out.

Floor plan is a bit cramped, had my not so comfortable chair bumped 3 times by the staff. Cleanliness was just average. Food was really good, had the bacon cheeseburger, a chicken caesar salad, and the jambalaya. Everyone in my party enjoyed the food and cheese cake. Go for the food and keep in mind the ambiance is below average. Prices seem fair for the quality and quantity.

Food was decent but their valet is sketchy. We used their valet and were not told of the hours or that they would abandon our car on the street after a certain time. When we walked over to retrieve it, no one was there and we waited a good 10 minutes until someone else came up and charged me extra because I had surpassed the time that no one had told me about. They were not from the original valet company either. Very &#34;professional&#34; in my opinion... I would come back for the food but would not trust the valet.

Not happy with being served old wings... <br>Even the server was disgusted. It smelled so bad, shocked that no one took notice prior getting to table<br><br>Probably never good back<br><br>Called restaurant next day, because night before  manager was no where to be found. <br>They said they will send a gift card. It&#39;s been 2 weeks... No gift card

The service here SUCKS!!!! I will never go again. I went there because I received a gift card. We were seated pretty quickly, mainly because it was a Tuesday night and pretty slow. We received the menus quickly because the hostess was the one that had them. We all sat down and waited and waited and waited. Finally, the waiter comes to take our drink orders, most of us got our drinks but the kids did not, we had to remind the waiter, after we received our food. I ordered the kobe burger, medium, with fries. I got the burger, it was well done, told the waiter and he said that he would tell the manager, nothing happened. The runners said the fries would be right up because they are making them hot. Well I was pretty much done with my burger by the time I received my fries, yes, they were hot. So, we decide, don&#39;t know why, to order dessert. I ordered the &#34;hot&#34; chocolate and a couple of my friends ordered cheesecake. Again, we waited and waited and waited. We were going to leave then finally my &#34;hot&#34; chocolate came, it was luke warm near cold. The kids were asleep so we had to get a box for their cheesecake. Mind you, the restaurant was empty. Not sure but for some reason when restaurant is empty, the service is slower. Again, never going back to this location. They always have bad service. First time, I think I ever did 10% tip, probably shouldn&#39;t have tipped at all.

My Bellagio arugula chicken is always to die for-hunny loves his orange chicken and brown rice, Gordy, peanut, Rari and posh love variety...and the blue cheese here is my favorite of all restaurants- We always want to have desert, it never happens...just to full and can&#39;t torture myself-always left overs to take home...lots of food, exceptional service, affordable.every plate I&#39;ve had here never a disappointment

I decided to have lunch with one of my friends here because they have a lunch special deal. We arrived around 12:30pm and got seated right away. There were a lot of business professionals working in Pasadena there for lunch.<br><br>My friend had the pizza and salad lunch combo. It was a great deal at $11-12 for a personal size pizza and a garden salad. She had leftovers.<br><br>I ordered the lunch-sized salmon at $13.99. At first I thought it was kind of pricey but the piece of fish was huge! I opted for the miso salmon and it was delicious. It&#39;s served on a bed of white rice with special cream sauce and miso reduction and some snow peas.<br><br>The biggest complaint I have is around the wait. We waited almost 20 minutes for the food. It&#39;s a good thing they brought us some bread to chew on while waiting because we were starving. There are also a lot of servers working but when it came time to pay we couldn&#39;t find anyone to help us. Our server was very nice though.

I love cheesecake factory. I know it&#39;s a chair and serve commercialized food...but it&#39;s always so consistently good. And huge portions so you can share or  save leftovers for later. I can&#39;t exactly name one dish that stands out because they are all very good. Seating at this location can be a long wait though so make reservations. Parking in structure.

Cheesecake factory rocks.  I&#39;ve never had a dish that I didn&#39;t like.  Service is always good and food quality is just amazing.  This location I frequent a lot since I live down the street but even when i&#39;m on the go and I need the food as take out they&#39;re super quick and never mess up.  Service he is always good too.  My favorite dishes are the Pasta Da Vinci, asian lettuce wraps and the jambalaya dish.  SO GOOD!!  See you guys again...probably tonight.  lol

wow i can&#39;t believe i haven&#39;t reviewed this place! i really like this particular location becuz i like to sit by the window and people-watch (especially during the holidays) and chow down with a brewsky after a long day of shopping in old town! all their food is the same everywhere so i won&#39;t get in to any of that here.

Decided on a whim to come in because we were just down there street picking up our macbook.  We were delighted when we walked by and saw llwnty of empty tables and when we walked in there wasn&#39;t anyone waiting in the lobby.  Buuuuut what we didn&#39;t like is that after checking in and the girl telling us it &#34;would just be a minute&#34; and waiting about 5 minutes in the lobby we walked out before even being seated because if we couldn&#39;t be seated in a timely fashion l we didn&#39;t want to chance the service.  Sad because I was looking forward to getting a slice of my favorite cheesecake to go.  Oh well, I just take it as a hint from the diet gods that I should be eating any cheesecake.

Our food was awesome! Came out hot and very delicious!! The reason for the 2 stars, we had the worse waiter in the world. Forgot our order multiple times, had to back to table to be reminded what wet ordered. Got our dessert order wrong, by then we just wanted to leave and took what was served to us.

The Cheesecake Factory is a well oiled machinery that serves corporate approved food.  My daughter likes to go here.  She usually orders the rib eye bloody.  I order the arugula salad, which is the best arugula salad by far.<br><br>The cheesecakes are huge!  And yes, they are very good.

Worst experience. The bread was burned, the butter was curdled, wait staff slow and inefficient. The server got one of our orders wrong and we had to wait a long time and there was no apology. The apathetic server also had a bad attitude. Not up to Cheesecake Factory standards.

I love going to this place!  Always fun and a great stmosphere!  Very trendy!  You can get drinks at the bar while you wait for a table.  The wait is pretty long if you just walk in.  Although a select few dont ever wait.<br><br>The food always tastes great and is always in large portions.  Recently tried there buffolos wings covered in a crispy fried wrapped and I have to say there were GREAT!  <br><br>And of course their cheesecake list goes on forever.  Every single one that I have tried has been the best ever!!  A must have when you come to the cheesecake factory!!
Really love their corn cakes; they makes a rough day sweet. This location is always on point but I take it to go because they are always packed. (Good sign)

I came on Sunday Evening the weight wasn&#39;t long. But as for the food it was nothing to write home about. Our waitress forgot about us of took her 20 minutes to take our order. We finally received the food it was Luke warm nothing was hot. My friend order chicken lettuce wraps that was not worth the price. They gave little pieces of romaine lettuce instead of big butter lettuce. My other friend order jumbalaya pasta also luke warm the presentation did not look nice and the pasta was a big ball of noodles with a bunch of cayenne pepper all over the plate and food. The waitress went around offering every table around us Parmesan cheese and did not offer my friend any with his meal. The prices are to high to just serve ok food. The quality of cheesecake factory is a lot different now.I think I would only come back for dessert I was not happy with my dining experience.

Food is pretty good here but I must say I come here mainly for dessert. After finishing off my jambalaya I was pretty full but I can never pass on a good cheesecake. Had the white chocolate cheesecake and was very pleased with my choice. Their cheesecake is definitely on the heavier side. Going to have to work this off at the gym later lol. Service was not too bad. We waited 20 minutes for a table and about 10 minutes for our server to come by to take our order. Food was perfectly prepared and very tasty. Took a while for our server to bring the check though. They can get pretty busy here for dinner.
Our waiter, Juan, was the most energetic person I&#39;ve ever met!  He&#39;s so good at his job.

I wanted to give thanks and acknowledge Adrion Smart--in my opinion one of the best servers I have experienced at The Cheesecake Factory.  Although we had some challenges with our food, due to the kitchen and not Adrion.  He continued to try and correct the problems to our satisfaction.  He went above and beyond to make it right and we probably would not be coming back if it was not for Adrion.  His attentiveness, care, concern and dedication to WOW-ing the customer is a testament to his character and commitment to deliver a memorable experience.  Thank you Adrion for caring and making a difference.  If you are in the area and dine with TCF--ask for Adrion!

We came in with a party of 6 on a Monday night and were seated immediately. The food came out fast, our server was constantly refilling our water, and she brought the check out quick! I had the carbonara and it was delicious. The dulce de leche cheesecake is always a favorite of mine too. Thanks again to Erica P for being an awesome server! (:

Wait time is not long if you go during non-peak hours.  The service is fine and can be awesome depending on who you get as your server.  Their pastas are good but are really greasy and oily so you can get sick of your plate really quick.  Good menu though.
Decided to stop by for late lunch. Food was very good. Always helps to go early or avoid the lunch hour rush. I didn&#39;t finish my food and my waiter was kind to offer a box before I could.

Love the location of this restaurant. Right in the middle of Old Town at Fair Oaks and Colorado. Whenever I come here I always like requesting the seat along Colorado Ave.  Great area to sit if you like to people watch. Last time I was here I tried their turkey burger on their healthy menu. Since I was going to indulge in some heavy cheesecake later, I decided to go healthier for dinner. Surprising the burger was pretty tasty. Every bite was juicy and full of flavor. Finished the whole thing! Would definitely order this again. For dessert I had their amazing Godiva Cheesecake!! Always a must! I left completely satisfied. Service was great. Never had a bad experience here. They are pretty strict with carding so do not forget your ID at home like my friend! She unfortunately could not order a drink all night. On weekends be prepared for long waits. No reservations. Just walk ins.
Service in the bar area was awesome.  Our server was friendly and gave great recommendations.  The mojito I ordered was nice and strong.

Came here Saturday night to have a girls night. My cousin has always sworn by the mojitos made at Cheesecake Factory so we decided to give them a try and ordered 5 passion fruit mojitos. When we tried them we noticed that they were way too sour and tasted more like a lemonade with no sugar. We contemplated wether or not to say anything but taking into consideration that the drinks here or not all that cheap we told our waitress. The waitress was really nice about it and said she would talk to the bartender. When she came back she told us not to move from our seats because she was going to collect our drinks and put them out in the same order, we then watched her take the drinks back to  the bartender who just poured dash of some syrup or juice into them? No new drinks remade? Thats when decided to tip for the bread we ate and leave. My complaint here is mostly in regards to the bartenders poor service. We let the manager know on the way out and all she said was &#34;oh sorry&#34; usually good management will offer if they can do something or find a solution to fix the problem but nope nothing was offered. We won&#39;t be coming back again.
good food, with a huge menu, a little loud for my liking but overall a pleasant experience.

Went to have lunch on a weekday, after a doctor&#39;s appointment. Because we were starving, we immediately ordered the appetizers and entree all at the same time. Soup in a bowl came quickly, but 30 mins passed, no entree came. The server was nowhere to be found. When he finally showed up, we asked and he said he&#39;ll check. Another 15 mins passed, and we saw him on the computer monitor with what look like several bills, typing on the monitor frantically. When he looked in our direction, we waived and asked again for our food. He ran to the kitchen, then came back explaining he&#39;s actually in training, and he&#39;s sorry our order did not go thru in the kitchen. WHAT?! 45 mins and this was just realized now?! Granted he was a trainee, but what about his Trainor? Who checks what the trainee is doing? We told the server we cannot wait anymore and his manager should manage and train better!

I have been a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory almost all of my young life. I have never had a bad experience, until recently. The menu has been changed in the past year, and I&#39;m still trying the find an entree item I like through trial and error. The one item that has never failed me is their fried macaroni and cheese balls. So I was extremely disappointed when at 12:30 on a Sunday, my party and I were told they were completely out of macaroni and cheese balls. We were so disappointed that we actually left and went to the Arcadia location. I would have loved to give them 5 stars, but I have to lower my rating due to them being out of a hot ticket item very early on a weekend.

I haven&#39;t officially had a full meal here but I&#39;m betting good money  that the food is exactly the same as the other ones. Talk about consistency in formula. However what makes a cheesecake factory different from one to the next is the locale, ambiance and people. Great locale in Old Town Pasadena.  <br><br>My ex-gf and I however did have cheesecake and Guinness after watching fireworks from town instead of going to the Rosebowl. Hit the  spot for late night  booze and munchies.

The cold raw spinach on the side of GF grilled salmon came with a big chunk of butter in between! Quite gross. When questioned, the waiter said that the spinach and the butter are stored next to each other and a piece of butter has fallen in the spinach offering no apologies.

Where&#39;s Penny? Doesn&#39;t she work here? Is it her day off?<br><br>Thank goodness for the metro gold line because nowadays it&#39;s so fast and fairly cheap to traverse from East Los Angeles to Olden Pasadena! I know that for a fact since today I decided to try it out and to my amazement, everything paid off. <br><br>Of course this is the same CF where Penny works in The Big Bang Theory so I was eagerly excited to step inside but where were the yellow shirts and blue pants as portrayed in the sitcom?! I was deeply disappointed to see the servers dressed in white &#39;doctor&#39; clothes. <br><br>As for the food, it took over 30 minutes to obtain our food which I might say it&#39;s the longest I&#39;ve waited for restaurant food but everything was dispelled as soon as my BBQ Chicken Pizza arrived and my-oh-my was it delicious to the bone! I almost ate the entire pizza which I&#39;m very proud of but sadly there wasn&#39;t any room left for their famous cheesecake and I wanted some ever so badly. Next time I&#39;ll make sure to order a slice to quench my wonder.<br><br>All in all, I was very pleased with the food and the prices and would definitely eat here once more (only if Penny is my waitress - don&#39;t worry, I&#39;ll leave a good tip).

This place is hopping! The dance floor is spacious and the DJ plays a good mix of top 40 and blackened death thrash goregrind doom core.  The audio animatronic bathroom attendant was a nice touch (so futuristic!) and the fact that you had to beat the high score at Galaga in order to qualify for the appetizer menu was something that I had not yet experienced. I agree that not everyone should be allowed to just order buffalo wings without having earned that right by proving their skill at nostalgic games from far better days. The only complaint that I had was that it seemed a bit counter intuitive to have to put on your skates before being allowed into the elevator which took you to the second level rink but once I got up there and saw just how awesome the light show and fog machines were, it made it all worth the falls and minor bruises. The fact that you could either exit the venue through the (well designed and aesthetically pleasing) front door or water slide located on the balcony just goes to show you how far ahead this place is to other similar establishments. Fortunately, I always pack an extra pair of trunks when heading to the Factory. Insider tip, if you want to be cool then you must know that nobody calls it by its full name. Drop the word Cheesecake and join the hip crowd by just referring to this place as The Factory. <br><br>5 stars all the way!
Love love love whenever my hubby and I go on Datenight this is the spot food is amazing and great customers service

Like a familiar old friend, having Cheesecake Factory in old town Pasadena provides such comfort that when you run out of food ideas you can always go there for some sure wins. I was going to get the Cajun Jambalaya as I always do, but decided to give Miso Salmon a try. The dish looked so  yummy in some Yelp pictures. And I was not disappointed! It really lived up to others&#39; raving reviews! Compared to Roy&#39;s miso fish dish, this one is just as tasty and it is more reasonably priced - $36 vs. $20? Cheesecake Factory wins this one! Of course, I cannot end this review without talking about cheesecakes. Today I tried the Chocolate Tuxedo Cream cheesecake. Layers of chocolate and vanilla plus cheesecake was simply delicious!
It took 40 minutes to get some spaghetti and meatballs and one of the meatballs was cold. Pick your game up Cheesecake Factory!

Stopped in to this new - for - us location of Cheesecake Factory.  Familiar with the menu and expectations,  but happily surprised at our experience. <br><br>I can&#39;t even remember the name of the server that we originally had...don&#39;t know if he went on break or was cut, but it didn&#39;t matter.  He introduced Melody to us and after taking our initial order, he was gone and never seem again.<br><br>Melody seemed to have psychic powers of what/when/how things needed to be.  I can&#39;t remember the last time I was anywhere but the bar at any Cheesecake Factory and not having to chase a server down for a refill.  Melody wouldn&#39;t allow a drink to go dry if her life depended on it.  She was attentive to us and all her tables and gracefully attended to any/all requests.<br><br>She was charming and engaging, yet not obtrusive.  She has risen to the top of favorites at any CF location.  Melody&#39;s service made up for whatever his name was and the lack of engagement by the hosts.

My experience here is actually similar to the other negative ratings. I actually enjoyed that they offered such a broad menu. Chain restaurants generally don&#39;t specialize to begin with, and OTP has always been rather crowded anyway.<br><br>However, the gripe I have is with the food itself. The portions are way too big and this place leaves me nauseated for some reason. At first I thought it was just me after the first time in Arcadia, but nope, happened after my visits here too. I don&#39;t know what it is, even eating salads makes me queasy. Their food is oily and gross after the first couple bites.<br><br>Finally, they do make good cheesecake. There&#39;s enough variety to try for awhile.
What a disappointing experience....I wrote to corporate, so you know how to get a hold of me.

We came to celebrate a birthday.   There were  15 guest.    We waited for over two hours.  Then told that only 10 could be seated the rest had to wait.   The manager dangled free appetizers and that never happened.  $8 parking for nothing. We left why give them anything we got nothing!

Three words: lemon meringue cheesecake. It was absolutely amazing- and half off too because of the national cheesecake day special. Service was good. The dining area was practically empty (it was around 1020p when we arrived)
I order the same item each and every time, rotisserie chicken with mashed potatoes. The wait time can be a little gruesome, but always worth every bite!

Came here with dad for mothers day after orchestra after scouting around what to eat at old town pasadena. After seeing all these tricked out bentleys and rolls royce. I was so hungry i got the 4 cheese after munchin in asian lettuce wrap and some good salad. Dad got a steak and salmon to go. What a good night :)
My experience here is always great . I had the perfect date night. Shout out to our server Shannon who was the sweetest ! :)

I&#39;m already not the biggest fan of the Cheesecake Factory.  My friends used to drag me to the one in Redondo Beach after dances like Winter Formal and Valentine Royalty.  My friend and I once had a fight with our dates about who would pay the tab (the guys wanted to pay for us, and she insisted that she pay her own way, because she was an independent girl who would not take charity from any man, and because I was young and impressionable, I followed suit).  We ended up leaving a $50 tip, because everyone paid (the guys for themselves and us, and us for us).  <br><br>How stupid.  <br><br>Now that I&#39;m older and much, much wiser, I wouldn&#39;t dream of denying a man the satisfaction of paying the bill.  Hey, I welcome it.  Come on guys...I don&#39;t say no.<br><br>Anyways, now that that little plug is out there....I had a bowtie pasta dish at the one in SF, which has a wonderful view from the balcony (making it about worth it) that tasted like crap.  Diego and I went at the Block after the last Harry Potter, and he loves the place.  He swears by the chicken chop, which honestly, wasn&#39;t all that bad.<br><br>So, Saturday night, we&#39;re in the car and we can&#39;t figure out where to eat, when suddenly, Diego yells out &#34;CHICKENNNN CHOOOOOOPPP!!!&#34;  I&#39;m like, dude, calm down, and we proceed to Pasadena.<br><br>So the wait is ridiculous.  It was 6-something, and the girl says 10 to 20 minutes, which is okay, except I hear people mumbling around me that it&#39;s 10 to 20 minutes their ass and that they&#39;ve been waiting more like 30-40 minutes.  <br><br>This is not a good sign, because we have somewhere to be by 8, but I think we have enough time, and regardless, Diego is out parking the car and I forgot my cellphone in the passenger seat.<br><br>After about 30 minutes we get seated.  Lo and behold, there is no longer any chicken chop.  So that was the ultimate disappointment of the century for Diego.  After crying for a good ten minutes, he ordered the chicken and biscuits, which were only okay, and I got the chicken medallions, which were dry and stuck to the hot plate.  The spinach was literally dessicated against the white plate as though a leaf pressed in a book.  Blah.  Moreover, it took them ALMOST AN HOUR to give us our food.  This was totally ridiculous, especially since we were in a rush.  I wanted to order dessert, but we just didn&#39;t have the time.<br><br>Oh, and Diego knocked his water over, and this manager lady was all over us, apologizing up the ying yang for like five minutes.  Then, when Diego explained it was his own fault, *poof* she was like &#34;see ya!&#34; and left.  I thought that was lame.<br><br>Probably won&#39;t come back here anytime soon, especially since Diego&#39;s menu item has been extricated.  I absolutely adore their white chocolate raspberry cheesecake, but you can get that frozen at Costco, along with three other flavors (12 slices total) for $20, so it&#39;s no biggie.

According to a waiter I chatted with on one of my periodic visits, their most popular dish is the Chicken Madeira.  And it just so happens that&#39;s what my husband and I almost always order.  That one item on the menu keeps bringing us back for more and more.  The slightly sweet Madeira wine sauce has mushrooms in it and we always ask for an extra side of the sauce so we can eat it with the mashed potatoes.  YUMMY!  Try it if you haven&#39;t yet.

Very nice place for a nice evening with my friend.<br>We came here on Wednesday night and had a great diner and our waitress was really nice with us. [Joe]<br>She was cool, relaxed and not pushy on selling.<br>I like the atmosphere and the service was great.<br>The food was well prepared and I had my glass of wine as always.<br><br>What else can I ask for for such a nice and enchanted evening.<br>Will definitely go back.

I like The Cheesecake Factory.  I don&#39;t think I have ever had a bad meal here.  I enjoy their salads, small bites and specialities, etc.  <br><br>This is mainly to review the service of this branch and etc.  We came here on a Sunday afternoon and didn&#39;t have to wait too long for a table.  That was a plus.  There was this crazy lady though that got all up into the hostess&#39; business.  She was one angry lady, I  don&#39;t really know what crawled up her butt, but she needed to calm down.  <br><br>This place had a strange smell though, that was unpleasant and resulted in their 3 star rating.  Our waitress was nice and the food came out hot and fresh.  This place could improve by making the place smell more inviting.

This is a different than most Cheesecake Factory as it is not in the mall and means parking is difficult to find. I love their four cheese pasta with margarita and chessecake for dessert. This is location can get fairly busy. But it is still better than wait-time at other locations.

I don&#39;t like chain restaurants but I had a gift card. We sat in the bar and it took forever to get a waiter to even look us in the eye so we could kindly ask for the table to be wiped down. I know they all saw us standing next to the only open, messy, table in there but clearly were too busy to stop and ask if they could assist. <br><br>We finally sat and our waiter was nice but she put our silverware right on the table top after it had been wiped down by the busser which was gross bc i was a server and I know how those towels are.<br><br>She also forgot to give us napkins. When she took my order, I told her what I&#39;d like and added a glass of wine, and after she took my bf&#39;s order she scurried off.<br><br>We waited about 15 minutes for our drinks (a glass of wine and a beer) and I finally asked her when they were coming she ran stared at me questionably and realized she forgot about them and ran to the bar which was where they were sitting. We got our food almost immediately after that which sucked...<br><br>The guy who gave her a break was a better server than her.
Great food and service. Came today for the avocado appetizer that was delicious. Had the surf n turf too and for dessert had the cheesecake

Always like coming here to satisfy my cheesecake craving. They have a whole menu devoted to all different flavors of cheesecake. Always takes me a few minutes to decide because they all look so good!! My favorite is the banana cream or the Godiva ones. This location is conveniently located in the middle of old town near Colorado and Fair Oaks.  I always try to get a window seat along Colorado Ave. Great place to sit for people watching.

Food was very good. We were seated quickly.  Only negative  was our server. Apparently she snaked a table from the other  server and they were arguing about next to our table.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!  And she was short with us and very inattentive. .

Food is great if you&#39;re not counting carbs. Everything has carbs!!!  Their menu is extent, but not great if you&#39;re counting carbs! I think they should include items in their menu that are low in carbs. I&#39;d come more often. Other than that, it will be a while before I come back. It&#39;s all about the carbs, carbs, carbs.

Service was absolutely the worst, my friend ordered a salad that was about as dry as the desert we live in.  Our servers name was Christi and I can say she is one of the reasons I won&#39;t be coming back.  I think she stopped by our table a total of 3 times throughout the whole meal.  I won&#39;t say say that I won&#39;t be going to the cheesecake factory again, but It definitely won&#39;t be this one i go to.

Father&#39;s Day is always going to be a day with crowds of people flocking to restaurants to eat, and yesterday was exactly that. Crowded. Pasadena is a great place with lots of different people coming to shop and eat and The Cheesecake Factory is smack dab in the middle of all the activity. The wait was about 30 minutes for our party of 6. Once the hostess sat us our server Sunny came over to greet us and describe the menu and bring us some of that warm bread and butter! Once we ordered the food came out shortly there after! I ordered the chicken and biscuits with mashed potatoes and broccoli and I must say this was quite good! The biscuit was warm and soft on the inside and slightly crunchy in the outside. The potatoes were flavorful and the broccoli was perfectly steamed. The chicken needed a bit of salt for my taste buds but was still a good eat. I sampled my girlfriends chicken enchiladas and her fathers fried shrimp and they were both very good! We got a triple chocolate cake to go and omg was it great! All in all I will be back!

I came to this location with my mother. Our waiter was probably the best we have ever had. When coming ask to sit in Joshua&#39;s section! He&#39;ll take care of you. He was very friendly, polite, and attentive. When I ordered a drink he noticed my birthday recently passed and he brought me a cheesecake with a candle and everything! Great job, Joshua! You made me feel very special.

Had a party o f 21 during lunch hour. Service was great. Fast. No super long waiting for food. Bread was served right away. Food was delicious. I had the lunch special....can&#39;t remember the name of it. Came with soup, salad, AND sandwich! It was a lot of food for me and everything was fresh! Love their homemade calm chowder! Only hard part was finding parking. Even the structure across the street was packed!

The Cheesecake Factory has some of the most delicious cheesecakes you&#39;ll ever taste. They have so much flavor. You should try the banana cream cheesecake on your next visit. Just talking about it makes me hungry!

How can anyone not like the cheesecake factory?! You don&#39;t need to read the reviews to know it&#39;s DELICIOUS and CHEAP! :) I&#39;d rather come here than Denny&#39;s, same price for better quality! (and Free bread, me likes free bread.)
Really a good place to have dinner. Love the desserts !<br>And the servers are amazingly polite !

OMG how can this be on a day like this and the time???? jam pack<br>i figure it would be on a weekend not a weeknights.<br><br>after a long day of BS and meeting came by here go to enjoy dinner, when i show up wow!!! the long line i figure I&#39;ll just enjoy my meal at the bar,  i head over there and man.... so many people drinking and waiting for there table. sat down and order my self a drink and appetizer.  it sure too a while and the food came out it was not hot but it was warm. I&#39;m still okay with that.<br><br>while eating my meal I&#39;m getting jab from the crow,  people eyeballing my meal while they waited. this was not a good feeling. like i said the bar is pack from people waiting to get there table. well my meal didn&#39;t last long and i was not full so i diced to leave.

Celebrated my mom&#39;s birthday here tonight! It&#39;s usually pretty packed during its busy hours on Friday nights and on weekends, but there&#39;s practically no wait on a weekday.<br><br>Between the three girls of our family, we ordered a BBQ Chicken Pizza, a Shrimp Angel Hair Pasta and a slice of Red Velvet Cheesecake. I&#39;m not a pizza person, but I thought the pizza was very good. The crust was sweet and the taste was flavorful. It was great. The pasta, however, was just mediocre. I felt like it was a bit overpriced for just diced tomatoes, some pasta and five jumbo shrimp. And the red velvet cheesecake never fails. I&#39;ve ordered this every time and sometimes just for to-go! It is a must, but who am I to say anything since it&#39;s also the only one I&#39;ve tried. I&#39;m extremely content with the cheesecake, although it puzzles me that the size of it varies depending on what day you go? (I can&#39;t exactly figure it out). <br><br>Take advantage of the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu, because some of that stuff is good and pretty healthy. It will lessen your guilt when you indulge in your cheesecake. I recommend the Turkey &amp; Avocado Sandwich.<br><br>The complimentary bread is really good, but especially the brown one. I always ask for seconds. The service was decent and the waiters gave my mom a complimentary ice cream sundae and a little birthday song, which I thought was sweet.

This Cheesecake is in the heart of Old Town and is ALWAYS packed!!<br><br>But if you come at Happy Hour, its not that bad.  ;)  They have a pretty good Happy Hour menu and drinks.  Love the wheat bread that comes out :)<br><br>We used to come to this CF before the Santa Anita one was around.<br><br>It is a pretty decent sized location at the corner of Fair Oaks and Colorado.  They have pretty nice windows so people can walk by and see what you&#39;re eating.  :P<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t choose this CF but they do have some awesome awesome cheesecakes if you just want to pick it up to go.  Enjoy!

We ended up eating at this Cheesecake Factory because we were in the area. It was a saturday night and the place seemed pretty full, but they gave us a table as soon as we came in. The waiter was very nice and pleasant. The lighting at this chain of restaurants is always very low but I took out my iphone and used the flashlight lolol I ended up trying something new while my husband got what he usually gets, The Bang Bang Shrimp, which according to him is always delicious. I ordered the Chicken Katsu which was very good! I would go back there just to have it again. Essentially it is a breaded chicken breast fillet but the accompanying spicy miso sauce gives it just the right flavor. The breading on the chicken was not moist or wet which is always a concern for me, so A + on that! As far as the regular wait for your food we were very happy overall!

Remember when you could walk into the cheesecake factory, be seated quickly, and be able to order your food and it was good?<br><br>Yeah, me neither.<br><br>We saw that the bar was empty so we stupidly thought the bartender would - you know - help us. Sadly blondie boy was too busy twiddling his thumbs and looking at the drink menu to want to serve us. Sure he looked at us for a split second about 20 times - long enough to let us know he knew we were there, but not long enough to grab his attention. After about 15 minutes we took off to Saigon Noodle, where we were immediately seated and had our food within 10 minutes (and it was full). <br><br>So in closing, #$%@ you blondie boy. Whatever the hell your name is. You&#39;re a g&#39;damn douchebag &#34;bartender&#34; who probably can&#39;t get a better gig due to the lack of serving skills.<br><br>Or maybe you&#39;re just a moron who can&#39;t handle writing down a lunch order.

Everything we ordered was great (zucchini fries are amazing, and the salad was fresh) but what REALLY made our night was our server Kourtney H, and that&#39;s what my 5 stars is for. She was attentive, friendly, GENUINE, not intrusive and knew her stuff. I&#39;m sorry if any of this sounds like hyperbole when it&#39;s not intended to be anything but a statement of the facts - she&#39;s a treasure in The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s front-of-house team because she&#39;s what every server should be.
I came here in hopes that Penny or Bernadette would be working, but neither were. Other than that, everything was great!

The food is okay, our server was very friendly and attentive. however I couldn&#39;t help but feel the menu and the whole dining concept is outdated. the cheesecake wasn&#39;t even fresh.  overall it was an okay experience, but nothing to recommend as a must try.

I absolutely love their fried zucchini! The portabello fries and fried avocados are also mixed in this great big bundle of happiness!! This is so far my most fairies dish. I am very glad the made it :) thank you so much!
Desserts!  So good...Cheesecake Factory lives up to it&#39;s name with it&#39;s 40-something cheesecakes.  I liked the Rocky Road Sundae, mmmmm...still thinking about it, and I ate it last week!

Well to start there wasn&#39;t a wait to get seated however the food took forever to come.  The complementary beard was hard and when I looked at other tables they got three pieces of bread while my table only got 2. Overall I feel like their quality went down and everything seemed smaller.

Went yesterday.  VERY-VERY Disappointing~ First of all,  II get seated in an area that  was right infant of all the air condition vents for what seemed to be all the restaurant.  WE were Frozen when we left.  THEN  I get put in the new waitress section.  Although,  I must say she could teach the dumb girl that reached over our table to shred the cheese TWICE hovering her arm over my daughters  food.  VERY RUDE &amp; INAPPROPRIATE.  No clue who that girl ( Not our waitress food runner maybe) was but,  brown hair very thin &amp; RUDE! The Icing on the cheek cake was the large black hair entangled on one of our pasta dishes.  It was totally disgusting! But, what could we expect when the FEMALE MANAGER COMES UP TO OUR TABLE, DOESN&#39;T INTRODUCE HER SELF, BENDS DOWN AND STARTS TALKING TO OUR GUEST ABOUT THE HAIR IN HER DISH. HELLLLLLLLLO! NOW, I understand why this place gets 5 stars for rudeness! Introduce your self,  or wear a suit and name badge instead of  house wife t-shirt and sloppy slacks.

This place obviously is pretty famous but that shouldn&#39;t mean that your food should be mediocre. I ordered the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp and chicken. It was really good but honestly I&#39;ve been to a smaller Restaraunt that served it just as good. I also tried the salmon there but I felt it needed a little bit more flavoring. Maybe I&#39;m just being a little picky but its what I thought. <br><br>Overall, the food was delicious but could of been better! <br><br>The serving sizes are great though !!!!

I came here to celebrate finishing up a job interview and unfortunately forgot my ID. Was refused service, not only that it was too much to speak to a manager. Terrible service. I&#39;ve never been to a restaurant and treated in that demeanor.
We had great service by our waitress November. She kept checking in with us and we received our food quickly. We would definitely come back again.
Came to this specific one because of The Big Bang Theory. Same as every other one. Nice area. Food was good. Service a little slow, but it was very busy. Bathrooms were clean.

Both service and food were 5 stars tonight !!! Thank you nicki ( best server since I&#39;ve been coming here ) kudos to the chef ! Ordered the  bang bang chicken and shrimp  along with Chinese chicken salad !! So delish!!!!!
Crispy Cuban rolls from a deep fryer in the kitchen of heaven. I order them with some serano chilies to make the AMAZING.

Yuck.  I&#39;ve come here several times at the suggestion my American friends and have since never come on my own volition.  So unhealthy and I don&#39;t understand the dishes that they serve here.  Thai fusion tastes weird.  Italian is not real Italian.  Everything with any kind of ethnic angle to it is like some weird American caricature of its original idea.  For the price here I&#39;d rather go elsewhere for some actual good food that won&#39;t also give u a heart attack at the same time.

I really love coming here for their guacamole (yes, you read that correctly) and of course a piece of cheesecake. I was pleasantly surprised when the guacamole I ordered was super fresh, lightly spicy (which you can change) and citrusy!!! Service is whatever; but who cares! Lol... I love this snack!!!

Emboldened by my positive experience in Glendale a few days before, I wanted a repeat for Sunday brunch in Pasadena. Sorry to say, this time around, the food was terrible - same dish - but... The fish was passé and I felt nauseated. Even the mash potatoes were atrocious.

Awesome service , never disappoints ! Food okay , bread fantastic! Cheesecakes outstanding! Overall Pasadena you are my fav ! Americana or Pasadena ? PASADENA it is ! Great staff ! Great place keep it up !

This is my I don&#39;t know where to eat restaurant! But their food is always great! Services depends, I&#39;ve had really good experiences and some bad ones too. Make sure to try the stuffed mushrooms and texmex egg rolls! You won&#39;t be disappointed !

I always love this place. I LOVE the skinnylicious vegetable salad. I went there and met a couple of friends. The waiter was prompt and the food came quickly. I love the ambiance here: the lighting the atmosphere. <br><br>Food was amazing, the bread fresh and the service very prompt. Their veggie salad is better than most vegan/vegetarian places.

Last night me and my family had a terrible experience at the Pasadena Cheesecake Factory.<br>Where do I start? The service started out with a snag when ordering the drinks and food, and  when the first order of drinks came, one of them had a gnat in it.  So it was taken back for a re-do, (now here is where the service went down hill)  the replaced Cadillac Margarita came and there was no Grand Marnier in it (one of the ingredients for a Cadillac) and was told it was.  I guess for someone who has ordered this drink on many occasions wouldn&#39;t know. Really!!! Now one of the night managers comes over to explain how measuring for drinks works, now mind you time is ticking and the first waiter never came back to our table to inform us of the status of our food order.  It took over 45 minutes to get our food and another waiter comes over to ask if everything was okay, not knowing that he has replaced the original waiter. This is when we find out that our original waiter has gone home sick with no explanation until we inquired about her.  Now to top it off there was a total of 6 drinks ordered and we were charged for 7. Oh! the waiter has the audacity to bring the bill and draws a line where the tip amounts are located to 15% as if he or the sickly first waiter deserves a tip.  THE NERVE!!!!!<br>It will be a while before I visit this location again and usually when I experience bad service I don&#39;t return and spread the word not to go unless you want bad service.
Honestly, the Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena is by far the best one I&#39;ve been to. Always fresh food that tastes great and the service is consistently on point. Always love coming here.

I went here with a few girlfriends on Saturday night and I had a really good time. For starters, they don&#39;t take reservations and for a party of 4 we waited over an hour just for a table even though they said it would be a half hour. It was busy and people were crowding around the tiny hostess stand bumping into me and other people left and right. Really, all this fuss for Cheesecake Factory? I was busy talking to my friends though so it didn&#39;t bother me too much.<br><br>Anyway, our servers name was Josh and he was so sweet and attentive. He didn&#39;t make any mistakes and he brought everything out in a timely manner. I even spoke to the manager to tell him how good the service was. I ordered the four seasons pizza (I think thats what it&#39;s called), and it was okay, nothing out of this world but still yummy nonetheless. Portion sizes are huge here too, I only had a slice and a half and I was done, but then again I eat like a little birdy! It isn&#39;t my favorite place, but the ambience  was really nice and I&#39;d come back if I&#39;m in the Pasadena area.

consistently good, consistently good service, consistently irritating to find a parking, but due to consistently good food and consistently good service I deal with it!<br>Great place to go with kids!!!!!!

Was there last night and the service was terrible. After bringing me a tiny piece of fish on my taco, I called the manager over and she had such a bad attitude. The piece of fish was the the size of my pinky and about two inches long and she made it seem like it was my fault. I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake for years- never have I experienced this.

Had the best time celebrating my best friends birthday with Catherine of the Sea, Vanessa with a V, and PJ of the stars. And they made me feel like a superstar  . Thanks again! Best Ice cream ever!!!!

First let me give a shout out to MELODY... She gets TEN STARS! We always try to sit in her section because she had such a warm and cheerful personality and always makes sure we have the best experience possible. <br>I&#39;m going for 3 stars because no matter what I try here in rarely impressed (the Thai glazed salmon is a must though... And I&#39;m not a fish person). The hosts and hostesses are always SO UNFRIENDLY, and there isn&#39;t great consistency with the food and it is often bland, overlooked or stale. Somehow we end up here every other month or so because of the variety of food (there&#39;s something for everyone), but I&#39;m quickly reminded it&#39;s just not worth the hype. I&#39;d say I rate other CF locations about a 3.5-4/5, but this one is only getting three for the service of ONE individual (like I said- horrible host situation and other wait staff). <br>Pretty sure we&#39;ll be phasing this one out now that we&#39;ve discovered that &#39;lette macarons across the street is more satisfying for desert!

Naked in restroom!! I have never given a review before. I was always the one looking at other people&#39;s review deciding whether to visit the restaurant based on their reviews. Well unfortunately, this experience was bad enough that I felt compelled to review.<br><br>Strike One: The waitress made a mistake on my order. I ordered a Hawaiian pizza and instead of a Hawaiian pizza I got a &#34;white pizza&#34;.  (No big deal, everyone makes mistakes)<br><br>Strike Two: My daughter, a toddler was getting hungry and frustrated after waiting for our pizza.  The waitress brought me back a pizza with chicken and barbecue. Not Hawaiian as ordered ( )<br>(Ok I could deal graciously with two mistakes. <br><br>Strike three:  we got the Hawaiian pizza after the third attempt but third time was not a charm. I am sorry to say it was not very good. It tasted as though it was rushed through the cooking process. However, I could handle all this... (here comes the doozy)<br><br>After eating I took my three year old to the restroom and only to be surprised by watching a NAKED person (yes!!!! Naked No socks, shoes , underwear, COMPLETELY NAKED giving themselves a country bath in the restroom!) <br>If you do not want to explain to your toddler why the pizza keeps disappearing, why there is a naked person in the restroom, or why there is an overwhelming and lingering stench due to homeless infiltrations screaming obscenities after being asked to leave (After we alerted the staff) Then do not come here. I used to visit on occasion but I will not be coming back.<br><br>With all that being said I have to say that they were &#34;nice enough&#34; to comp my friend her salad though... Nothing from my bill hmmm.... Disappointed

Had lunch yesterday and as usual it was a good experience, we were <br>fortunate to have Kimmie as our server.<br>Being in a position to be the face of the establishment could be the worst responsibility ever! And then there&#39;s Kimmie she was so pleasant, smiled,<br>and friendly! Hopefully when we return she will still be there.

Wow seriously everytime I come here I can never get decent service. Came here to just have some lunch with my mom, &amp; we waited about 5 minutes and we got seated at a dim small booth so we asked the hostess (who seemed nice enough in the beginning) her name is (marquee)if we could sit at the booth right near the window. &amp; when we got to the booth near the window it was a little too small for us, so we asked if we could sit at the bigger booth literally right next to it, and she gave off this loud sigh the first time I asked to move and by the second time she even gave off an even bigger sigh and rolled her eyes. Are you freaking kidding me?! It&#39;s just 5 steps, I didnt ask to be moved around the whole damn restaurant. Ridiculous! That had already ruined my meal to the point where I wanted to eat somewhere else but I didnt, &amp; I wish I had.

Probably the worst service I have ever received from this resturaunt. Wait time was an estimated 35 min for 6 people, and it ended up being 50 min. Parties of 5 got called and we where there and they wouldn&#39;t give us their table even though we where the only ones waiting. The host was rude and very unfriendly when we asked how much longer because we had been waing for 50min already. The manager came up and asked what we where waiting for because he had seen our group waiting for quite some time, then 2 seconds after he talked to host he called us and seated us himself. After explaining what happened, he spoke with the red headed host and offered us free appitizers. Overall not a good experience and the food wasn&#39;t that good.

This location sucks.... Its tuesday afternoon so why am i waiting over 20 minutes for a table for 2 people!!!! Im so mad i dOnt even care how the food is to wait to write this review..... And u never notice things until u r waiting..... The servers uniforms are all white, white pants, shirt, aprons... So why are their shoes so filthy and disgusting.... All of them are nasty and not white they are all black and grey and look really disgusting.... I am defintely not coming back... Im only still here because my bf wants this, but i already told him we are never coming back ever again!!! Its horrible!!!! Oh and i just asked whats the hold up, they said because the other tables are closed off and they dont have enough staff to serve them. So us paying guests have to wait for them to open up a table

I&#39;m a regular and come once a week for mostly lunch.  <br><br>Service<br>First and foremost this is where they excel at this location.  They have consistently excellent service.  When there is a problem a dish they are very quick to correct the problem and offer comps (like taking off the dish or giving you free Cheesecake).  <br><br>To compare and contrast, the Arcadia location&#39;s service is no where near this attentive.<br><br>When they are accepting applications for servers, which is only a couple times a year, I&#39;ve been told they receive hundreds of applications and only choose a select bunch to become servers.  I think their service is largely credited to that process.<br><br>Food<br>Being a regular, I cycle through my favorite dishes and they are consistently good and served freshly made and piping hot.<br><br>Recommendations:<br>Snack Plate: Fried Zucchini  <br>Soup: Wednesday&#39;s Baked Potato Soup (order extra hot)<br>Appetizer: Fried Mac &amp; Cheese<br>Mains: The Pecan Crusted Cat Fish (this is an off the menu special)<br>Chicken Bellagio (tender breaded chicken filet over pesto marinated spaghetti )<br>Pasta Da Vinci (their most popular pasta, sweet sauce, tender chicken)<br>Herb crusted Salmon - lunch portion is very generous...order it with broccoli instead of asparagus <br>Skinnylicious Menu: Taco&#39;s plate (chicken) fantastic, light, healthy<br>Cheesecake: Red Velvet, Pumpkin (seasonal), key lime<br><br>The Bad<br>This place doesn&#39;t take reservations and gets so busy its frustrating.  Even on weekdays, you need to arrive around 1145 for lunch service, otherwise you&#39;ll be stuck waiting 20+ minutes.  There are special deals maybe once a year here, so you&#39;ll always be stuck with their semi-high prices.  <br><br>Overall<br>Great spot for date night or the family or a business meal as long as you come early.  Good quality, consistent food.  Impeccable service.  A+

I&#39;ve been to this place once...or was it twice? I can&#39;t remember, it&#39;s been quite a few years. From what I do remember though, eating at this restaurant was positive. The food was delicious, the employees were friendly and professional, and the setting was clean and elegant. We sat against the window which was neat because we could people watch as we ate. :) <br><br>I&#39;d eventually like to go there again, and if I do I&#39;ll make sure that I update this review.

I&#39;ve been to several of these places.  Maybe it&#39;s due to the abundance of food options nearby, but this location had us seated within 5 minutes on a Friday night.  AWESOME!!!!!!<br><br>Beyond that, it&#39;s like any other Cheese Cake Factory, good service, good desserts, and food that can be hit or miss.  My spicy cashew chicken was very good though.
I love this place..service has always been on point. The calamari is sooo good!! Great customer service! My waiter was very attentive and made sure I had everything I need.
Jerry is the best bartender ever.......<br>He is always very very busy but makes you feel at home....<br>If you want a real great Lemon Drop...he is your guy...

I don&#39;t come here often but when I do I usually order the Cajun jambalaya.. It&#39;s the OG dish, still da shit after all these years..  Vanilla bean is also one of my old time favorites.. Love chain restaurants only cuz u can expect their quality to always remain the same

The reason:<br>I don&#39;t come here for their cheesecakes or desserts but I come here for the awesome Jambalaya Pasta! When it comes to Cajun, and of all places; a chain like Cheesecake would probably be the last place you&#39;ll think of. The trinity of flavors that was known for Cajun Jambalaya are all here, with the dish being very well seasoned and boldly flavored. While its authenticity might not be comparable to the great folks down in the great Bayou of Louisiana but they seemed to have done an excellent job fusing it with linguine pasta instead of rice (which I&#39;ve substituted a few times depending on my mood). This is the ONLY thing I crave from their menu! <br><br>The place (caution):<br>I lost count of the number of times I&#39;ve eaten here, and every visit has always been great. With that said, the food and service was also excellent...BUT...the water supply from this old building is contaminated due to old rusted pipes! The last time I ate here, I ordered a Jack &amp; Coke and gotten very sick after a few hours with bladder infection. It got worst the next day so I had to see a doctor. He gave me a shot and prescribed some antibiotics and the problem went away. The city of Pasadena had actually brought up this issue to the restaurant and I hope they addressed it.
Omg juan v. at the bar. Ive never had such a great night at cheesecake factory then the night me and my friend had sitting at the bar with juan having martinis. He funny personal and overall amazing.
One of my friend baught a tiramisu cake and Mexican chicken pasta . Outstanding flavor and taste .

when are they going to close this place?<br>we have been suffering under the yoke of their oppressively mediocre food for more than a decade.<br><br>i mean seriously. close your doors and go away. we don&#39;t want you.

After last weeks disgusting display of salmon at Celestinos italian restaurant on Lake Ave in Pasadena, I was apprehensive about ordering it here at the Cheesecake Factory. Well, let me tell you, the &#39;chef&#39; from Celestinos should come here to learn a thing or two. My grilled salmon was marvelous, as was the steamed broccoli and mashed potatoes that accompanied it. I will definitely be coming back and I&#39;m so pleased to have found something so delicious at a restaurant I thought I would never like.

hhhhmmmmm! Let&#39;s see... what are the things that I love about the Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>Too many to list but here are a few:<br><br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Lettuce wraps<br>Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp<br>Miso Salmon<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich<br>Apple Martini&#39;s<br>Bikini Martini&#39;s<br>Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake<br>Dulce de leche Cheesemake<br>Upsidedown Pineapple Cheesecake<br><br>and last and definatelt not least:<br>Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake<br><br>Sorry... that is a short list since the menu is HUGE and all delicious!

The thing I like about the Cheese Cake Factory is their wide selection of dishes.  There&#39;s something for everyone.  Last week I came to this location to take my wife&#39;s cousin out because she just started school at APU.  We came on a Thursday afternoon around 2pm so we were seated immediately.  Our server was very polite and had a great disposition.  We started off with the calamari appetizer which was delicious and along with their fresh baked bread.  For our entre we had the miso salmon, chicken Madeira and the chicken avocado club sandwich.  Everything came out great and we very good.  For dessert we had the Hershey&#39;s triple chocolate cheese cake and the pumpkin spice cheese cake.  <br><br>Overall great meal and great atmosphere here.

I will admit, the only and main reason that I came in here was because of my love of the Big Bang Theory TV show.<br><br>Yes, I said it. That&#39;s the only reason i went here. <br><br>I was curious mostly because I wanted to compare the differences and maybe, just perhaps possibly maybe there might be the scant possibility that the show is real and that Penny, Leonard, Sheldon, or any of the other characters on the show might be here.<br><br>They, sadly, were not. )c:<br><br>The super hot hostesses (gotta love LA for attracting all the wannabe models and actresses who make up our lovely city&#39;s restaurant servers, good luck to them) said that there was a wait for any tables and thatthe  bar was available, and since I was a(*cough* loser*cough*) alone, I thought I&#39;d get a burger. <br><br>Bartender was cool, he was really friendly without really talking to me. the burger, was just a burger. My bill with a beer and tip was like 22 bucks. That&#39;s one expensive burger, but whatever, it&#39;s a high profile place in a high class city right on the tourist strip. <br><br>that&#39;s all I can say about that.  I&#39;m not a fan of chains in general, so take it with a particle of sodium chloride.<br><br>(do you know how hard it was to avoid writing this in the tone of Sheldon?)

We normally go to the Cheesecake Factory but this one in Pasadena was truly a disappointment. The food is not consistent with the other restaurants in the chain. We ordered edamame as an appetizer and when it was served there was a piece of linguine pasta sticking out from the bowl. The server didn&#39;t even noticed. When we pointed it out to the server, she took it back in the kitchen and after 5 minutes served us the same bowl without the pasta. She didn&#39;t notice that my husband had left a piece of shell in one of the corners and the same piece was there when she brought it back. Very disappointing. My husband ordered a Tuscan chicken that was supposed to be less then 590 calories and the chicken was swimming in olive oil. He had the same dish before and it definitely didn&#39;t appear to be that way. My son ordered chicken Marsala and he found a carrot together with the mushrooms. Don&#39;t know how it ended up there. He was offered Parmesan cheese on his chicken Marsala meanwhile my daughter who ordered pasta with marinara sauce wasn&#39;t offered an ounce of cheese. Utterly disappointed by the all experience. Definitely a no no in Pasadena!
The Cheesecake Factory is good it has good cakes cool right they even have good food.And the walls are great even the silverware is good cool right I like the place is big.
They don&#39;t take reservations. 1.5+ hrs for mediocre American food.... It is not worth ur time.

We ordered Thai chicken pasta and seafood jambalaya and red velvet cheesecake for dessert and I mean everything is so good.  The waiter we had he is so kind with good manner always smile.  Excellent atmosphere especially located at old Pasadena with valet parking

I was seated within a few minutes of checking in with the hostess. The place was clean and nice, but unbelievably dim. They are taking energy conservation too far; there was barely enough light to read the menu.<br>The food was good. I had the Samosas and a slice Tiramisu Cheesecake. Samosas and the dip it comes with was very good. Tiramisu was also good. Still love the complementary rye bread. If I wasn&#39;t there with other people, I would have no problem hogging the bread all to myself.<br>I like that this place did not charge extra for splitting the check, though that&#39;s should be the norm.<br>The waitstaff is very courteous and will say goodbye to you as you leave. <br>I wouldn&#39;t mind coming back, but I would do so during the daytime and ask to be seated by a window, or I would bring a flashlight to read the menu.

I love and hate this place.  Parking is an expensive pain in Old Town Pasadena.  Aside from that, this is a prime location on the corner of Colorado and Fair Oaks but it&#39;s not as large as some of the other locations.  This is a great place to eat and people watch.  It can get pretty corwded at times.  The menu is insane as there are far too many items to choose from.  Their portions are great for sharing or left overs.  Generally, there really is no room for cheesecake after a meal here.

I have no problem waiting in line for 60 minutes to get seated... when the food I wait for is delicious and tempting and unique. <br><br>Why there is always a crowd, and a disgustingly long wait at the Cheesecake Factory, is obviously a mystery to me. I have observed this problem at all Cheesecake Factories, but the Pasadena location is hands down the worst.  Friday or Saturday night? Forget about it - you might as well pack a portable DVD player and watch a movie if you plan to enjoy your night.<br><br>Spaghetti? Tastes so normal, you might as well make it at home.<br><br>Salads? The only special thing is the size.<br><br>Cheesecake?  If you like cheesecake, then take it to go...<br><br>Nothing, and I mean NOTHING at the Cheesecake Factory is delicious enough to warrant the wait.<br><br>...Not even the avocado egg rolls!

Great Location, in the heart of Old-Town.  Not for the weary, as it gets SUPER-PACKED after 6pm or so, its one of the more popular places in Pasadena.<br><br>I usually find myself going to the bar for seating rather than waiting 30-60minutes for a table or booth.  If your date is cool and not a total jerk, he/she will not mind.<br><br>My 1st suggestion: Chicken Madera...almost the only thing I eat there anymore, and I don&#39;t even like mushrooms.<br><br>My 2nd suggestion:  Park in the parking structure located behind Kenneth Cole off Colorado, they have free 90-min parking and there&#39;s always room.
What&#39;s not to like?<br><br>Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp - awesome!<br>Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake - awesome!<br>Everything else - awesome!

So last night, my sister in law and I decide to go to Cheesecake Factory, since we had the kids with us. And they had kids menu. <br>First of all service was horrible. Slow and not friendly. <br>We sat without menus, we kept on trying to call a server, to bring us the menus, since the kids were starving. <br>It took a long time for the server to come, and then from the hostess to bring us the menu. <br>P.s. I also to go food to my husband. <br>Today, I wasn&#39;t feeling good. And texted my sister in law. Found out she also had the same symptoms I had. A bit odd. But not odd since, my husband also is facing the same symptoms! <br>My sister in law called the establishment, talked to the manager Tamra... <br>To find out if the food was expired, or maybe if the food got contamined. No apologies, or questions asked. The only thing she did was get her info, and right after hang up. <br>As a huge restaurant chain like CF I would think they put more attention when hiring managers, not random people that lacks any kind professionalism, and responsibility towards customers. <br>-0 stars

Great friendly service by the staff every time I come here ! Wait time was not too bad for a Saturday evening, which is surprising. Only had to wait for 5 minutes before getting seated. I recommend trying out the Chocolate Raspberry Truffle cheesecake for dessert
This is a review for the Shrimp Spring Rolls - Simply the Best!  <br><br>This is the only reason I go to the Cheesecake Factory.  I usually phone in my order and just pick it up at the counter.

Nice place. Was crowded around 3 pm. They said they will seat us in 15 mins but they did it in less than 10 which was good. It took them around 10 mins to get us the drinks but when we switched tables and changed waiters the other guy was very fast very social and served us a good lunch. I asks for a big burger and they got me one that I wasn&#39;t able to finish! The tucsido  cheese cake was more than amazing
Ehh<br>More vegan gf options i think

Patrons are playing into the hype without knowing it.  The only reason people come here is because they automatically assume that long lines = great restaurant.  Not so, about the food at least.  The service is great, they invest more money into employee training than any other chain...I think.<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake Factory three times and every single time the food was crap.  This herb-crusted fish thing isn&#39;t supposed to be a tarragon wasteland and it&#39;s dryer than the fucking Sahara.  These mashed potatoes aren&#39;t supposed to have a layer of crust, this ain&#39;t a godam creme brulee.  Fuck, not this again, this pasta dish is dry.  This makes no sense, it&#39;s drenched in a marinara sauce.  ok, I&#39;m cool now.<br><br>Bitches.

Ok, to be fair........They saw my complaint (Thank you, yelp) contacted and sent me a gift card and letter of apology to try my experience again. The corporate office also called me to make sure I was doing alright. <br><br>I went back yesterday for happy hour (which was very empty, probably because of the 4-6pm short time frame) I took a friend and we enjoyed our drinks very much...really tasty mojitos that actually packed a punch. The kind that sneak up on you. <br><br>I stayed away from the chicken this time, no meat at all actually. I&#39;m not risking being sick to my stomach for a week (!!!) again. For $5 at happy hour you get a really big serving of guacamole that they make freshly, it&#39;s probably the best deal they have. The corn tamale cakes were OK, a little mushy, not like the ones you can get at El Torito...the sauce that went with them was really zesty. The Thai noodle salad was decent.<br><br>Service kind of sucked. We waited about 15 minutes before a server came over finally to take our order. While they were pretty empty. Go figure?<br><br>I still won&#39;t be back per my own suggestion, but I guess they&#39;re ok in my book.
Carnitas chilaquiles ! Look good but dont get them. Stale chips and flavorless carnitas. Get the salad.

Seared Tuna Tataki Salad with dressing on the side. MmM mMm MmMmmM! It&#39;s one of my favorite salads in the whole world. Yes it&#39;s at a chain restaurant but you can&#39;t help what you love. Lily got some luau/lalu/lulu something salad and I was like What the heck!? It was huge and had wontons!!! mmmMMmm. Wontons are the devil.<br><br>We had our salads, got some Peach Bellinis (which are ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!), shared a few bites of the 30th anniversary cheesecake (cheesecake + chocolate cake: zOMG), and got some coffee. What a great meal! It was a great girls night out. We even got into a man bashing session with our waitress!!! hahahahhahahaa. Women unite right? Can&#39;t live with them but can&#39;t live without them. Men. :)<br><br>Peach Bellinis are calling my name! I can hear it!<br><br>:)

I love the Cheesecake Factory for their consistency in food.  But over the years, I haven&#39;t craved to dine here in a long while.  My little diva niece loves cheesecake, so we had lunch here the other day to satisfy her appetite.  <br><br>Thai Salad: skip it! I just wasn&#39;t feeling this dish.  Cold noodles and mediocre flavors.  I can do without.  <br><br>Steak Diane and Shrimp: I loveeee the sauces on this dish that compliments the dish very well.  I would have licked the plate if I was left alone for just one minute haha<br><br>Vanilla Bean Cheesecake:  My niece picked this.  The verdict: definitely worth the calorie splurge.  It had 3 different textures in this one slice that makes it unique.  It was perfect for sharing and not too sweet.  My sister who is not a cheesecake fan even liked it.

This isn&#39;t exactly my favorite Cheesecake Factory to dine at because of parking and the usual long long long waits during certain times and days of the week.<br><br>But  I fed myself one of my favorites, Crispy Chicken Costoletta, and I was happy.

Yes the wait is Horrible...<br><br>Yes its another restaurant chain....<br><br>Yes there are cute waitresses here.....<br><br>Oh wait....<br><br>But hey you gotta just love Cheesecake for what it is.. I like the Pasadena location. I&#39;ve been here MANY times (too much I guess) but I&#39;m never not satisfied.... Yeah you can complain about the wait, then you should call in reservations like I always do cause you KNOW this place is always packed...<br><br>The food... Good, some say great, some say bleh but I say good. I&#39;ve had my fair share of the good the bad and the ugly here, that is why I stick to my usually: CRISPY CHICKEN COSTOLETTA (Chicken Breasts, Lightly Breaded and Sauteed to a Crisp Golden Brown. Served with Lemon Sauce, Mashed Potatoes and Fresh Asparagus) Yeah, that&#39;s right.. I just described the dish, you like you&#39;re drooling over it right now... <br><br>I&#39;m always pretty satisfied with the service here, and they are usually very attentive.. On top of that this Cheesecake Factory is located in the center of Old Town Pasadena.. So when you finish your meal, take a stroll, walk off that Chicken Costoletta and have a cigarette.. Cause that&#39;s what I do.

Nothing quite affirms my suburban middle class American experience like eating at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Typically packed because their locations are brilliantly plunked in the middle of a mall parking lot, the ambiance is dimly lit and chaotic--who needs to relax, after all?  Let&#39;s just keep it moving, people. KEEP IT MOVING!<br><br>While perusing the menu, I&#39;m interested in so many bland Americanized dishes, but I&#39;m also sidetracked by the sudden urge to shop at Chico&#39;s and buy a Benz.  Where could these sudden urges come from?<br><br>Well, never mind, I&#39;ll just go with the chicken pot pie and bottomless Coke.  After all, I have an appetite fueled by consumerism and everyone knows shopping is like exercise.  BRING ON THE SATELLITE-SIZED PLATE O&#39; GOODNESS!<br><br>It&#39;s so comforting to know that I can get this consistency all over the nation, too.  When I feel like branching out, I&#39;ll head to the Olive Garden.

I came here with my girlfriend for a quick bite to eat service was okay ... Now here is my issue my pit beed deep was really raw and hard to chew and the dip I received for the sandwich was cold although I did appreciate the staff the manager was very kind and replaced my meal swiftly

I had such great service here and at the location in Arcadia! Our server, I think his name was Josh, was AMAZING! They were so quick and prompt, me and my family really felt special! They were out of mashed potatoes and came running out offering us anything we wanted to replace it! On top of that they gave us the mashed potatoes about 20 minutes later when it was ready, and on top of THAT they gave us free cheesecake! Wow that&#39;s what I call fantastic service! The Arcadia location service was also amazing! Great food as well, just a little bummed that they changed the veggie burger recipe since that was my favorite thing on the menu!

Thank you Cheesecake Factory Pasadena. You never let us down, we always leave full and happy. Amazing you can have such a large menu and still have everything come out great!<br><br>Seriously food lovers, whats not to love here? Perhaps the long lines but hey any good establishment has that problem. I give these guys 5 stars for being so damn consistent over the past decade.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake.  I don&#39;t know where else to go and find such a variety of cheesecake.  I love the lemon raspberry and I usually hate raspberry cheesecakes.  The Tuxedo Cheesecake is just to rich and sinful for words.  <br><br>Yea, the wait.  I don&#39;t find the food worth the wait.  I am probably emotionally scarred since the one time I did pay my dues and wait a sickening amount of time, I ordered the Thai pasta. Some sort of Thai dish.  Terrible.  But I blamed myself. What was I thinking ordering Thai food at an American restaurant?  My bad. <br><br>I have since found Avacado Rolls, Fire Roasted Asparagus, Portabella Burger, Chicken Tostada, Eggplant Sandwich.  And ONLY if there is no wait. AND ONLY if we are getting Cheesecake to go.  <br><br>We came for breakfast once, and it was pretty good. Think the man got breakfast burrito and I had artichoke omelette.  But not much of a breakfast variety if you are into breakfast.

Went to this Location on Wednesday nite....They put us at a small table next to the window though....I&#39; d rather have a larger table as Im 6&#39;3&#34;...A pair of ladies came in and wanted a larger table too in the middle and the hostess was rude to them in my opinion....Guess its a mgt thing....I suppose Ill return to the Arcadia location for my next visit.....

Great food, huge portions, endless menu, fantastic service, great atmosphere. <br><br>I wasn&#39;t thrilled with the small piece of chicken that came on top of my pasta, not cut into smaller pieces at all.. just one big chunk.  The chicken had the bone in it, and lots of skin.  I figured it would be a boneless skinless chicken breast.  Surprised that you pay $3 to add it to your pasta, and that&#39;s what you get.  Didn&#39;t fit with the quality of the other ingredients.<br><br>I&#39;m very picky, and my order was fairly complicated.. I told the waiter he would get it wrong if he didn&#39;t write it down.. and sure enough, it came wrong.  It was entertaining though.  He swore he entered it correctly and they just made it wrong.  It literally took them about one minute to have it corrected though, I didn&#39;t mind.<br><br>Parking is definitely a bitch, but that&#39;s downtown Pasadena for ya.

I love this place! My family and I come here all the time! Service is fast and friendly! We love the Mac and Cheese Balls to start, add the bread service and we are in heaven. I always get the Miso Salmon, my favorite!

I have this theory.   Considering the enormity of the menu at Cheesecake Factory, yet the complete generic-ness of it, I have a theory.    While the business briefs may not support this,  I believe that there is in fact some mega-restaurant corporations (full of old white guys with no taste buds) that owns all of the major mid-level national chains.  When I say mid-level, I&#39;m talking Friday&#39;s, Applebee&#39;s, Chili&#39;s,  Outback, Olive Garden, PF Changs, etc, etc, Longhorn Steakhouse....Don Pablos...you get the idea.  Anyway, this evil corporation owns &#39;em all.   When trying to come up with the Next Big Chain Restaurant some executive at this corporation had this idea: <br><br>&#34; Why don&#39;t we open a restaurant that offers all the favorites, and some not so favorite dishes from all our other restaurants, that way we don&#39;t have to come up with ANY new ideas - we can put ads in the menu so we don&#39;t have pay for any thing, either&#34;.  <br><br>Another taste-budless co-worker replied, <br>&#34;This is a GREAT idea, but we need a hook...hmmm&#34;.  <br><br>Yet another replied &#34;I got it!  We&#39;ll package it all up with 8 gajillion different types of imagination-less cheesecake.  People love cheesecake, almost as much as they love crappy frozen yogurt from TCBY.&#34;<br><br>And thus, yet another boring over-crowded, personality-less, you don&#39;t matter, eat your food and get out, chain restaurant was born.  At a subsequent meeting:<br><br>Old executive, &#34;We gotta make this place stand out.
