I know, we won&#39;t make the wait-staff wear flair, and we&#39;ll plop our over-bloated asses next to every mall from Augusta, ME to Los Angeles&#34;<br><br>I really don&#39;t like this restaurant.  After my first visit, I&#39;ve only gone back to compromise with friends.  The food isn&#39;t even worth reviewing since they have literally ripped off every chain restaurant in the book - hell, they even have White Castle Sliders as an appetizer!?!<br><br>As a final aside, someone, who&#39;d worked at an Applebee&#39;s, once told me that you didn&#39;t need a knife to be a chef there, you could do it all with a pair of scissors.

Made it through the holidays and we are cashing in the gift cards...last one left.. Cheese Cake Factory.... <br>Yikes.. 30 minute wait..<br>crowded foyer and noisy<br>seated in the bar area, so close to another table that I could hear the person next to me chewing their food.(gross)<br>ordered Kobe steak burger and it took 40 minutes and two apologizes to get to our table.<br>If you like a cafeteria type location , then this is your spot..<br>I will never return...<br><br>Restrooms clean

You always know what to expect when you go to Cheesecake. An over the top menu, monster portions, and decent food.<br><br>The garlic noodles with asparagus, tomato and chicken was ok. The chicken was just overcooked. Next time I will try it with shrimp instead of the chicken.

Here is my take of the place:<br><br>I hate all the people who take up sidewalk waiting outside. As if they own the spot and won&#39;t yield to people just passing through.<br><br>The wait. Why...<br><br>Avoid the line and go to the bar area. It&#39;s a pretty good size and you can order from the full menu there. <br><br>There are two things I will go there for: their chicken salad sandwich (such a good deal: $8 for a LARGE, generously loaded sandy plus awesome side salad) and the chicken madiera.<br><br>Oh, and the cheesecake is good. But I only crave those like....once a year.

Came here to meet my friend for lunch on a baking hot Tuesday. Not being familiar with Pasadena, I parked in metered parking about a block away and walked. Oh well.<br><br>our waiter was very attentive but didn&#39;t crowd us.  Wasn&#39;t very busy at all, but seeing as it was the middle of the week that makes sense. I got the sundried tomato and chicken pasta, my friend got the burger. My pasta was fine, my only complaint is that it didn&#39;t have a whole lot of chicken in it. I would of got dessert but it was so hot I didn&#39;t feel like eating too much sugar.<br><br>If I lived in Pasadena I would probably come here more often, but the Sherman Oaks location is closer to me.

I&#39;m usually skeptical about chain restaurants but this one is just wonderful. I love their Moroccan chicken. The ambiance is comfortable and the service is always nothing short of friendly and accommodating.

I can&#39;t believe this place is always packed during dinner and lunch! Seriously if you are in Old Town, there are soooooo many other places to choose from..why settle for cheesecake factory? The food is overpriced for its quality and the wait is ridiculous. The only reason i end up at this place like once a year, is because one of my friends really wants to eat there. I have also been traumatized by the stories I have heard from people who used to work there..let&#39;s just say the food has some extra ingredients that aren&#39;t included in the menu -_-.<br>The only reason it gets two stars is because of their cheesecake and strawberry lemonade.

We&#39;ve eaten at several different Cheesecake Factory restaurants over the last 20 years, including this one. But this particular day was not a good experience. There were 4 of us. The pluses: wait was not too long, surprisingly, since it was 1 pm on a Saturday, and the server was personable when she first came to the table. The negatives: We asked for the soup to be served while we were waiting, but it was delivered about one minute before the main course. Unfortunately the 3 other people at our table received their meals way before mine and were half way through eating before mine arrived.  No apology. The server came back one time to top off our water and didn&#39;t bother to ask how things were. Our plates weren&#39;t cleared until she decided she needed the table.  The salads appeared to be adequate but the pizza I ordered was disappointing. The crust was thin and flimsy, and the toppings very sparse.  Next time I think we&#39;ll drive further and go to the one in the Grove or the Americana.

Service was so bad here, I had to wait 20 minutes to be served. I sat there and waved some waitresses, but got ignored for the longest time. The table space is so small and the place is so dark. Kind of overpriced for just whatever-tasting like spaghetti.
Really nice good and large portions, kind of dark thought, they could use some more lightning in there. Serve was really good as well.

* Service: our waiter was very courteous, cheery, and helpful<br>* Food:<br>* Bistro shrimp ($17.50): usually my favorite dish at CF---but NOT yesterday. the noodles were hard and the entire dish was bland.<br><br>* Happy Hour Speciail: $5.00 4pm-6pm.<br>-- Avocado Eggrolls: delicious--especially the dipping sauce<br>-- Petite pizza(roasted pears and bleu cheese): ok.<br>-- Arugula Salad: too bitter.<br>-- Fried Mac and Cheese: heart-attack balls! good, but can only have one, since it&#39;s so rich and FRIED.

I might be a little biased here, as I&#39;m not a huge fan of most chain restaurants, but seriously...if you&#39;re commuting from great lengths away to visit Old Town, why choose this place? There are plenty of other great non-chain restaurants that deserve a taste.<br><br>My first and fondest memories of Cheesecake Factory was on the top floor of Macy*s in SF, a good 8 years ago. Ever since, Cheesecake Factory had never failed to disappoint me. We came to the Pasadena location a few years ago for a friend&#39;s birthday (an obligation if you&#39;d ask me) and the lobby was crowded to the max. There were people waiting outside as well and even though we had a reservation, we still had to wait with the rest of the folks. You&#39;d think it&#39;s a fire hazard or something.<br><br>My friends ordered the Vietnamese Spring Rolls. The price was ridiculous. If you want good spring rolls, you go to the dirty hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese restaurants in Westminster or &#34;Golden Deli&#34; in San Gabriel. You&#39;ll be paying for double the amount AND taste but minus the over-inflated price. <br><br>I tried the teriyaki salmon and it was dry as a brick. For that price, I&#39;d much rather go to a Japanese restaurant where they make it much better. <br><br>I guess the cheesecake is pretty good, although more and more patisseries are coming up with better ones. If you really want to come here, just order the cheesecake to-go and leave as soon as you can wiggle your way through! <br><br>Instead of eating mock-cultural food, go to the actual restaurants instead, where you get much better tasting food. There&#39;s no need to fall into this Old Town hype.

I only went beacuse I HAD to. It was for a co-worker&#39;s birthday, and they didn&#39;t ask me for any brilliant and culinary insights. So we end up at Chainstorecake Factory. After a delightful 50 minute wait, standing on faux-marble, we are taken to our table by what appears to be a Junior High scool aged student. Poor girl. They better be paying her at least minimum wage.<br><br>The kicker was our waiter, who obviouly thought he was the most gorgeous man to rove the planet, and wanted to make sure that we thought so too. I&#39;m all for a flity waiter, after all, it can be fun - and lead to fun things, but this guy was way too into himself. Funny thing is that I&#39;ve seen him around the bars over the past couple of years, and has got quite the reputation about him. Let&#39;s just just say that I know things that I shouldn&#39;t repeat here on yelp! All that to say, as hot as his body was, his attitude ruined it for all of us. <br><br>We still tipped decently though, because we are good at heart - and I don&#39;t wanna be an ass right back.

When you tell your server that your dish was not cooked properly, what is  it exactly that you would expect?<br><br>To have the server ask if you want to take it home in a box? ummm what part of &#34;it&#39;s not cooked right and the cheese is cold&#34; do you not understand? I mean if I didn&#39;t like it the first time around, perhaps if I took it home with me and looked at it and thought about it I might enjoy it more in a few hours?<br><br>my quest to find the perfect cheeseburger was waylaid by a stop at the Cheesecake. I brought my roommate here for a roommate date on a gift card. I&#39;m not sure I&#39;ve ever eaten at a Cheesecake Factory before. And I sincerely hope I never have to again.<br><br>Beer list, meh. Wines, errr. I suppose there is a reason I am a regular at Smitty&#39;s rather than Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>At any rate, the server said he would take the overcooked miniscule piece of meat to his manager. ok, and to what end? nothing. no refund, no nothing.  Cheeseburger? This was the &#34;Factory Cheeseburger&#34;. Wow your signature burger is about 1/8;b of overcooked salisbury steak. with a nasty underripe tomato and cold cheddar cheese. I am so nonplussed by my experience, that even though my roomie&#39;s dinner was excellent, it matters not.<br><br>So let&#39;s chat about some french fries, shall we? Honestly, when it comes to fried potatoes I am not that picky.  McDonald&#39;s makes better fries than Cheesecake Factory.  I mean really, you have like 8 burgers to choose from on your menu, and your fries are not even as good as Ore-Ida. <br><br>This is a great place for people who like tons of rich food. Like portions enough to kill an elephant. Unless you order the signature burger, which is all bread, and a speck of meat. Even the tomato is bigger than the meat.<br><br>Sooooo. Never mind. I am wasting my time even bothering writing so much about this place. Please, I&#39;ll pass. If I want dessert, I&#39;m going to POP.  If I want dinner, anywhere but here. Even McDonald&#39;s for some fries just so I can remember how good frites taste again. Seriously.<br><br>OH and they do not validate parking.
So they took the only good thing off the menu. The pretzel crusted chicken was amazing. I came in once a week for it and now it&#39;s gone. Guess I won&#39;t be going back.

I have been to this location a few times. I&#39;ve also been to the one at Westfield Arcadia and the Americana. This to me is the least crowded location. Plus they have been the most consistent with food and drinks. Point and case. I&#39;ve order the vegan salad and the Georgia peach from all locations. At the Americana I was only provided one type of dressing for my salad, the second time.I met friends there I was given 2. At Westfield Arcadia I asked how many dressings am I getting with this salad and the waitress told me 3.  But Pasadena they have always consistently given me 2. Not a huge deal except when I got three ot sure tasted like i got double dressing of the same kind. On to my drink. I have to say I do love Grey Goose mainly because I don&#39;t get hangovers from drinking it. I&#39;m a lightweight to begin with so one good drink is all I need to be feeling no pain. Well you would hope that when you ask for Grey Goose you would get it. Didn&#39;t happen for sure at the Americana but was told it was but my bill didn&#39;t reflect it.... worse yet I had a hangover the next day. Besides being consistent with the above mentioned this location has been pretty consistent with other food items like their bang bang shrimp and chicken, providing a bread basket, their chicken and biscuits, stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, Madera chicken and of course their desserts. So by choice, this is the location I would choose to go to if I had to go to a Cheesecake Factory. Not a bad locations since it&#39;s in Old town Pasadena. You have a lot of other spots to eat around there so don&#39;t think the Cheesecake Factory is the only good eats you&#39;re going to stumble upon!

There&#39;s nothing wrong with the Cheesecake Factory.  The food is fine, the service is good, parking in adjacent lots isn&#39;t too bad.  It&#39;s just not my favorite place in the world.  That being said, I tried a sample of the Peppermint Bark cheesecake, and that almost got them an extra star - phenomenal!  I had the mac &amp; cheese burger, and I had no complaints, but it wasn&#39;t as exciting as I was hoping.

The wait is horrible. You put your name on a list and wait to be called. You go up to the hostess and let them know your name is called. They say ok and then take another group back in front of you. Tell you they &#34;messed&#34; up and that you will be taken care of shortly. That means another thirty minutes.<br><br>An hour wait isn&#39;t worth the cheesecake especially when you can buy it at any grocery store now. Ironically that makes more sense. <br><br>The garlic mashed potatoes are nothing to be impressed with because I can make those at home better any day of the week and I do for the children. <br><br>I will give them credit on their chicken pot pie. It isn&#39;t kid friendly which isn&#39;t exactly a plus for me.

If you&#39;re here for cheesecake, as promised by the name, you&#39;ll be happy.<br><br>If you&#39;re here for a nice meal, try elsewhere. Pasadena is full of delicious places at reasonable prices, if you only know where to look. For starters, avoid tourist-packed Colorado Blvd and typical chain restaurants that you can find at any other city. When you&#39;re in Old Town, go for the hole-in-the-wall places that you won&#39;t be able to experience anywhere else.<br><br>Don&#39;t get me wrong... when I first moved to Pasadena, my friends and I went here often. We hadn&#39;t yet discovered the joys of little restaurants and kept Cheesecake Factory as our default.<br><br>One day we ventured into Mi Piace right across the street, and found that for the same prices we paid at Cheesecake, we could have quality food and service... haven&#39;t turned back since.<br><br>It was nice while it lasted, old friend, but I&#39;m done with you for good.

So good,<br><br>I hate all my friends right now for never telling me how AMAZING the food and service is here.<br><br>I can&#39;t wait to go back for more!!!<br><br>Are server was Samantha, she was a delight so helpful and not at all super hovery ( I know not a word but u know what I mean).<br><br>I was expecting a long wait time but was seated right away.<br><br>All in all huge serving fast service and the food is TO DIE FOR!

Our server seemed to have a problem differentiating between morning and night.  When he came to our table, he asked me and girlfriend, how are you two doing this evening?  Um, it was Sunday morning.  <br><br>Girlfriend and I came here for brunch by chance.  We didn&#39;t know how busy they would be since there&#39;s usually a line out the door, but we lucked out and were seated right away.  She ordered the hamburger and I ordered a 1/2 size of the santa fe salad.  The 1/2 size was huge and I couldn&#39;t finish even half of it.  It was decent, though.<br><br>We were so full from our entrees that we had no room for cheesecake.  Oh well.  Now we know that Cheesecake Factory&#39;s entrees were meant for sharing.  At least in our case, anyway.
The habachi beef tasted awful... Like cow on road kill.   Warm beer yaik!!! Worse cheesecake restaurant everrrrr.   Never coming back.

Ah The Cheesecake Factory, good old place to hang out with friends and family for any occasion.  The food is good, but what is up with the wait times during dinner time.  I really want to go back to you guys at Cheesecake Factory, but you guys make it so tough to even get seated.<br><br>The good side -<br>1 star for good food.  My favorite dish is the chicken madera.  A wonderful dish.  2 grilled to perfection chicken breast, asparagus on top, with bacon, with mashed potato on the side with the addicting madera sauce.<br>1 star for the friendly service.  Staff are nice and the server was knowledgeable about the food.  Thanks for recommending the chicken madera.  I am a fan of that dish for life!<br>1 star for cheesecake.  Very good cheesecake.  Order if you have room for dessert at the end of the meal.<br><br>The Dark Side -<br>0 stars for no validation, bad parking, and wait time.  I have gone to the Pasadena location and the parking lot are always full so I end up parking a mile away around the residential area and hike over to the Cheesecake Factory.  Lastly the wait times.  Each time I have been there the wait time has been anywhere from 45 minutes to an hour.  I even tried to go to the Glendale location, but that was a 1.5 hr wait.  If long wait times are the intended Cheesecake experience, you guys can keep your cheesecake.  I can probably make my own Cheesecake with that amount of wait time.<br><br>Bon Apettit!

Skinnylicious Menu is a great solution to the massive amounts of food portions that this place pushes down the gullet. <br><br>We had the Shrimp Salad Rolls, Green Tea, Edamame, and a MASSIVE salad (unintentionally massive) I think. <br><br>The server was super-excessively nice, the bathrooms were clean, and the view of the dudes chasing people to sell roses was prime. <br><br>Pasadena is a neat town.

RUDE PERSONNEL AT PASADENA CHEESECAKE FACTORY<br><br>I went to the Pasadena Cheesecake factory for lunch in mid-day, and there were very few occupied tables there. I was seated in the area to the left, by the window, after you enter.<br><br>After 15 minutes, a group of 5 people were seated (by the waiter) immediately next to me. (At that point, no other table in that section was occupied, so it seemed strange to me that they would be seated *right* next to me.)<br><br>Those 5 people were seated at a table of 4, and an extra chair was brought in to accommodate the 5th person.<br><br>As I was finishing my lunch, one of the people at this closely-seated next table, accidentally toppled the pitcher, and splashed water all over me.<br><br>Accidents like this happen, but what is important is how the manager handles the situation.<br><br>I told the manager (I believe his name was Kevin: Tall, blue-eyed guy) what happened and told him that such an accident might not have occurred if this table of 5 had not been seated directly next to me, when all the other tables in that section were free.<br><br>Instead of apologizing, the manager was extremely rude.<br><br>I asked to talk to the general manager instead. The general manager (a slightly overweight guy, whose name I forgot) came, understood the situation, and apologized.<br><br>I am writing this review because I was badly treated by the first manager (tall, blue-eyed guy) who raised his voice when he was speaking, and overall was very rude.

For a Cheesecake Factory, this is probably as good as it gets. A couple stories and on a busy intersection in Old Town Pasadena. This particular location is so popular that I and my friends had to wait 2 hours to be seated.<br><br>So what&#39;s a group of friends to do when you have two hours to burn? Drink at the nearest bar, of course! So naturally, we wandered across the street for a little bit and found a sports bar showing the NBA All-Star game slam dunk contest. We chilled on some beers and watched a little bit of the contest before summoning up the wherewithal to go back and check to see if &#34;Jason&#34; had been called.<br><br>Not yet. So we hung out outside and stood on the intersection and got in hundreds of people&#39;s way. It&#39;s an incredible way to people-watch. A cold night usually makes people dress up more, and seeing some of the ladies display their cold-time clothes can be impressive. Remember, we don&#39;t have winters in Los Angeles.<br><br>Once we actually did get called, I remember having a nice window view of the same intersection we were standing on earlier. It was rather impressive at night, seeing the people populate that area and staring at you eat. I got the steak diane, another trusted and true choice and some more beers. I started hitting on some tannish looking girls sitting at the table next to us after throwing back a few. Never talk about the other person&#39;s exotic race, unless they bring it up. Otherwise, you just might look like a racist.<br><br>I think we left there pretty buzzed not only from what we drank at restaurant, but from also the sports bar from earlier. It&#39;s a good way to make a trip to another ordinary restaurant more memorable.

I don&#39;t often go to chain restaurants but I am so excited to report that this chain really left me feeling impressed w/their breakfast!   Great friendly and speedy service, great food (highly rec&#39;d the huevos rancheros!) and great location!  <br><br>Don&#39;t really rec&#39;d corp chains but I&#39;m pretty sure I&#39;ll be back!  Dang, that breakfast menu looked soooooooooo good!  :-)

I HATE THE LONG WAIT!!!<br><br>all i want is to walk in a restaurant... get seated within 5 minutes and  order my food right away...<br><br>the wait here is ridiculous... <br><br>the food was good... they always deliver despited being busy every time...<br><br>so if you got too much time to kill go here in peak hours and start waiting in line... and eat slow...you&#39;ll spend half of your day here...

Okay, after that HORRIBLE time a few weeks ago at the Bella Terra Cheesecake Factory in Huntington Beach. . .I was hesitant to come here.<br><br>I shouldn&#39;t have been.  The miso salmon was flaky, moist. . .and had miso PASTE on top!!  Which meant it was floating on my tongue in an explosion of sweet, salty, tangy, and well, miso-y.  The spinach was drained properly. . .and it was just absolutely how I remembered Cheesecake&#39;s miso salmon to taste like.  My mother got the pasta da vinci. . .it was absolutely delicious.  The sauce was creamy, the pasta was al dente, and the chicken was moist (if a little bit on the big size).  My dad got the cheesesteak sandwich. . .he liked it though I didn&#39;t try it.  My parents dug their fries. . .they said it wasn&#39;t greasy but still very crispy.<br><br>What sucked about THIS Cheesecake versus the one at Bella Terra was that the service was pretty bad.  The bread came out late. . .and even though we were seated swiftly. . .we waited for almost 40+ min. before our food arrived.  So. . .do I come here for bad and slow service but good food?  Or do I go to Bella Terra and get served crap but with smiling, happy, and accommodating waiters/waitresses???<br><br>Why can&#39;t I have it all? (I think this combination only exists at the Bev Hills location, cos let me tell you. . .the one near Westwood has a fleet of ATROCIOUS waitstaff). Unlikely it seems. . .the food and service at the Cheesecake Factories are VERY inconsistent.

This was one of the worst service experiences I&#39;ve had this year. I&#39;ve been to many other cheesecake locations and Pasadena is by far the worst location/experience ever (on Wednesday July 24).   There was no wait when we arrived tonight, which I thought was strange but nice.  It&#39;s the first time I&#39;ve not waited.. but now I know why...management, staffing and service is pretty bad.<br><br>First, our physical menu was dirty (eg, sauce spilled over, dirtied our hands). And then we waited 20 minutes just to order.  We kept looking out for our waiter and he disappeared and re-appeared just to serve other tables, I think perhaps there was a lack of staff or poor coordination so it may not have been his fault.  The tables here are darker, which made it hard to read the menu, other Cheesecake locations have candles and this is never a problem.<br><br>Now, the waiter had misunderstood our order even though we repeated it twice to clarify, and when the dish came out, one of our group informed him that the dish was incorrect, he blamed us, claiming that we told him wrong. That is a big no-no for any restaurant. The rest of our party heard it correctly so for this one waiter to claim that WE were wrong when it was HIM, this was totally inappropriate to shift blame to the customer.<br><br>Also, water should be filled without our having to ask, but we needed to ask a staff after 1 hour of no water-filling and that was annoying. Perhaps this again was a staffing issue.  Poor resource management and/or poor operational systems.<br><br>For the food, all of our appetizers and entrees including the avocado, corn dogs, pizza, all good.  Didn&#39;t have much problem, though it just didn&#39;t taste as good as we&#39;ve had at other locations.<br><br>Poor service really ruins the whole eating experience.  I have been to other cheesecake factory locations at least 30 times, and always trusted I would be treated well, but this is the first time when I now question whether all Cheesecakes are the same.  This one obviously was below average, but I would probably be willing to give it one more chance, if I had no other choice.  Since I think it may have been a one-off terrible night, I will be a bit more general in this review, but next time I&#39;ll be more detailed and specific with manager &amp; staff names.

I hate the lines outside on the curb this place creates, but the menu items are decent and all.<br><br>Here are my top picks, try:<br><br>Chicken Medallions<br>Vegetable Salad <br>Banana Cream Cheesecake<br>Raspberry Mango Smoothie (non alcoholic)<br><br>Recently they have added a small bite list to their menu and it it has made all the difference!<br><br>I highly recommend the Tuna Tartare and Arugla Salad:)

Its called the Cheesecake Factory but I never get the cheesecake here.  I feel like someone who goes to Starbucks Coffee only to order the green tea.  <br><br>The food is ok here. The best dish is the Mediterranean Mahi Mahi which is probably on the menu but can be ordered upon request.  This place really deserves only 3 stars but it was my girlfriend&#39;s favorite restaurant at the time I started dating her so it gets a bonus star.<br><br>On a side note, the parking in Old town is a hot mess. There is one garage that gives 90minutes free so be on the look out. I think  I got my car keyed in one of those parking structures too! lol good times....

.., came here on a date w/ my gf Diane not too long ago. We were looking forward to eating here because we love the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>This time however was somewhat dissapointing to me. I was feeling quite carnivorous at the time, so when the words, &#34;Kobe Burger&#34; came up on the menu, I had already made up my mind. Diane went w/ their Thai Lettuce Wraps which also sounded pretty tasty.<br><br>Our server that night only came 3 times: <br>1st- to take our order<br>2nd- to ask us if we wanted anything before our meal?<br>3rd-to give us our food (then she diassapears)<br><br>We had to flag her down just to get our check. I know it was a busy night, but once we received our food, we were forgotten about. I wanted a refill too! Diane&#39;s Thai lettuce wraps were delicious. My kobe burger however, was pretty lame. It didn&#39;t even taste like &#34;Kobe&#34;. It just tasted like a regular burger, yet surprisingly a step below fast food flavor. I felt I overpaid for that burger, I only ate half then I was done with it. It wasn&#39;t appealing what-so-ever. <br><br>Afterwards, we finished things off w/ a tiramasu cheesecake! It was f*cking fantastic! I wish I would have just ordered the Cheesecake instead of my my meal :-( . The Thai wraps that Diane had ordered were really good as well. All 3 of  these stars go to their cheesecake! Service didn&#39;t really stand out for us this time, maybe next!

Just when I had a good streak.... ok I have good reasons for this particular one.<br><br>Just to be clear, I actually like cheesecake factory. For a chain restaurant it&#39;s pretty good. Food, drinks, service are decent and I do have a special place in my heart for this chain. I would be giving the cheesecake factories I&#39;ve been to at least 4 stars.... just not this location. Here&#39;s why. <br><br>Food. The taste of everything overall wasn&#39;t as good as the others. Example, I ordered the ribeye with fries, the steak itself was cooked to my liking, so bonus points. But it was too salty, and I do have a salty pallet and don&#39;t mind salty things. But in this case it was too salty, and you know it is when a guy who likes salty things says so. When I got the fries, I actually in my mind, and verbally, said &#34;noooooo.&#34; Like Luke Skywalker finding out Vader is his father nooo. Because the fries changed. Not sure if it&#39;s this location, or they changed everywhere, but the fries are no longer skinny and crispy. They are the fat fries that everyone serves. Not that I have anything against fat fries, they are still good, but the skinny fries are what made them unique because not many places have them. It sounds like a personal gripe, but I wouldn&#39;t have mind if they tasted good.... not really. They tasted they&#39;ve been sitting under the heat lamp for a while. <br><br>They gave me a couple onion rings with it, which was nice, but most of it was batter. How much, like a legit inch of it. If you like that kind of thing, hey go it, but i like tasting some of my onion in my onion rings. If there is too much batter it&#39;s not balanced and the flavor is too overpowering. Also one other minor gripe on food, depending if you want to view this as one or not, the the ketchup taste like one of those knock off want to be ketsup. You know when Mr. Burns was at the grocery store and couldn&#39;t pick between the two bottles... yeah it was like that. It could be home made, idk, but if it is.... it needs work.<br><br>With that being said, I would have given this a 3 star if it weren&#39;t for 1 other factor.... the service. I read other reviews and yes service here sucks. The waiters and waitresses were nice don&#39;t get me wrong, but they sucked on everything else. They checked up on us once after our food came out, and only because we looked depressed and upset. Because of that we didn&#39;t get refills on drinks, extra sauces we wanted, extra plates, etc. I think the manager checked up on us also, but also only because we had our heads down and looked disapointed. I was gonna say because we came during closing time, so I would understand if they wanted to pack up or they were just tired. But after seeing what other people said.... yeah it&#39;s not just me. <br><br>Again, I actually like this chain, but this one really needs work. I&#39;m willing to give it another shot in the future, just be aware this wouldn&#39;t be my first pick as of now. With being in downtown pasadena surrounded by other good places, it&#39;s really hard to pick this place if i know i can get better on food and service. 2 stars.

If you talk smack on this place I&#39;ll slap you. Its overindulgence galore and whats not to like about cheesecake? <br><br>This is a mom and me place. We pretend we are being healthy and order salads. Then we gorge on the molassas bread and split a cheesecake - you know the 6 carb one with splenda.

Your average Cheesecake factory with, of course, good cheesecake selections.  Ones that should soley be your reason to go in unless you want to stuff yourself in addition to food.  One slice will make you full.<br><br>My friends boycott this place because I guess they feel it is overrated, and it is.  But that doesn&#39;t mean they don&#39;t have ONE good dish.  In fact, they have several.<br><br>For seafood pasta lovers, their SHRIMP SCAMPI is the best I&#39;ve ever had.  Cooked with garlic (with actual chunks of garlic in it), a sauce to die for, and jumpo shrimp is complemented with angel hair pasta.  The flavor is incredible.  GOOD CHOICE.  Will make you full ... not expensive.<br><br>Another good choice for people who want to eat light ... their chicken salad sandwich is a killer too.  The bread is toasted and buttered, salad have almonds in it ... Great choice to share between two people because one peice is very big.  Complemented with a side salad that is REALLY good too.<br><br>For appetizers, get their shrimp popcorn.  And their strawberry lemonade is good too.  I am making myself hungry now at 9:40 a.m.<br><br>If you are allergic to seafood, I am sorry that this won&#39;t help you very much in your own personal choices.  And I am also sorry that you won&#39;t be able to try these great dishes.<br><br>[stars and comments are subject to change with each visit (^_^) ]

Alright, I know this was the place that was cool when you were in high school, and as uncool as it might be to admit it, I love it here. There&#39;s always a line, but the food is consistently good, the portions huge, and the cheesecake? Well, I don&#39;t like cheesecake, but I love this stuff. <br><br>I used to mess around and order a bunch of things, but I&#39;ve learned it&#39;s all good and  now just stick with what I love - the salads, especially the Chinese Chicken Salad. My boyfriend usually split the dinner sized one since they are way too big to tackle alone. <br><br>Appetizers a good too if you&#39;re with a crowd. I say go with the avocado egg rolls: rich, crispy, creamy and sweet. Yum!<br><br>Bar drinks are okay, pricey and kinda weak given the big glasses they come in. I&#39;d take the sober route and order a lemonade. It comes in a big frosty mug rimmed with sugar... sweet and sour!<br><br>I made the mistake once of looking at the nutrition values of the cheesecake and I&#39;ve had a hard time not feeling guilty with every bite since then, so I only save it for special occasions (don&#39;t worry, I won&#39;t ruin it for you!). But like I said, I don&#39;t even like cheesecake, but every now and then I just can&#39;t resist theirs, it even makes it worth the gross indulgence.<br><br>Always a good standby when I&#39;m with my family because there is something for everyone or if I am just craving a meal I know will be good. It&#39;s hard to go when you&#39;re starving because you&#39;ll most likely have to wait (unless you can snag a seat at the bar - lucky!) but trust me, it&#39;s worth the wait.

Food was ok.  Service from the bar staff was horrible.  In particular a gentleman bartender who was African America with a shaved head, if there are any management reading this.  Very immature service, more worried about his life then serving ours.  <br><br>Location is perfect and food was served at a time of 30 minutes, giving us plenty of time for conversation.

I love food...and it&#39;s close to my house so I would recommend that if anybody wants to eat here then go early!!! Go during the week...WEEKENDS it&#39;s packed!!! You&#39;ll be waiting for over 2 hours on the weekend...HATE IT!!!<br>Food is great! Salads are great! Deserts are great! The food is a good amount! You&#39;ll have left overs to take home! =) That&#39;s what I love....! <br>Pricing is good...not expensive . This is a nice place to have nice date or family night...Then you can walk off that cheesecake by walking around....they have great stores to just look in and be nosey! =)

You start by walking past the hordes of kids, grandmothers, mothers yelling at kids, waiters and hostesses barking orders at such earsplitting levels it feels like an AC/DC party hosted by a middle school punk rocker hoping to start a band in his garage. The cherry on the sundae is the music, which is mercifully drowned by the patrons&#39; squeals.<br><br>Then you sit down. The menu isn&#39;t a menu - it&#39;s a binder of about twelve pages, not including the pages devoted to the weekend family packages offered at the Palms resort. In the &#34;menu&#34; you&#39;ll find ungodly concoctions that taste and sound like a Steve Martin comedy made for Showtime. &#34;Tex Mex Eggrolls&#34; &#34;Buffalo Blasts&#34; &#34;Roadside Sliders.&#34; <br><br>A soft drink comes in cups that rival a 44oz Double Gulp Jug from 7-11. Refills are included.<br><br>The main courses then. From what I tasted: Thai Chicken Pasta - an almost vile pound of food on your plate - heavy on peanuts, sauce, and oil, something a replacement chef at TGI Fridays can toss together with both eyes closed.. The orange chicken arrives with the pieces of chicken gliding and glistening on top of one another, an artery clogging mound of overglazed, oversweetened batter.<br><br>The cheesecake is good though.

I have mixed feelings with this particular Cheesecake Factory. I know that it depends on the individual workers, etc. but I feel that I had a fairly inconsistent customer service satisfaction at this place. There were times when the waiters/waitresses were absolutely curteous and had gone the extra mile for service, while there was a time when I had a grumpy and snappy waitress... which is not professional. The food at this particular Cheesecake Factory is pretty good. It is a go to place when I&#39;m out of ideas.
Not the most creative menu, but a wide variety of solid dishes. <br><br>3.5 stars

This place has a book for a menu. It&#39;s great if you know what you want to eat, but for people like myself...it&#39;s quite a difficult task when you can&#39;t make a decision. But so far, everything seems to be good (knock on wood)...except for the Shirmp Spring Roll appetizers. With about 2 small size shirmps, it&#39;s definitely not worth the $8!! The Calamaris, however, have a better reputation. <br><br>Definitely do not forget to order a martini or 2! They&#39;re quite good here! Happy eating and drinking! :D And if you have room, Happy desserting!...cheesecake of course!

I don&#39;t understand what all of these prancy queens are bitching about... lines are too long? Burgers aren&#39;t made right? They sold your favorite cheesecake? GET OVER IT. You came to a freaking restaurant that is visited by probably 1000 people a day, and you expect them to gourmet make your burger and save a cheesecake for you? Seriously? You&#39;re freaking ridiculous. Go run with scissors.<br><br>The place is FANTASTIC. Theirs salads are unique, the appetizers, the entrees, wraps... everything!! Their food is simply orgasmic!! And I&#39;ll choke the next m-f-er who says their cheesecakes aren&#39;t the best... are you on crack!?! It&#39;s the freaking CHEESECAKE FACTORY! How can their cheesecakes be bland if they sell (AND SELL OUT) daily for $40-$50?!!! Really... some people on yelp need &#34;buds therapy.&#34;<br><br>So what you&#39;ll have to wait for 15 minutes to be seated? If you don&#39;t like that, eat at home. The place is packed because it&#39;s GOOD. Not because they are out to piss you off.<br><br>THE PLACE IS AMAZING. Really. Better than anything else. And yes, their cheesecakes are great, too.

CHEESECAKE AND STRANGE MEN<br><br>My Vietnamese lady and I went to Old Town Pasadena (a.k.a. her old stomping ground, the place where she blossomed into womanhood). After walking the streets and seeing all the places where she did &#39;god knows what&#39;... well, some gents would know too, we stopped at The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The restaurant was crowded, people looked a little bit off, and a few unknown gentleman, who knew my lady, shook my hand and told me I was a lucky guy  O.o  I was inspired by the Cheesecake on display. <br><br>We had great food, and we were at a window seat; a great spot because we pointed and commented on the ugly people of the world that lurked the streets of Old Town Pasadena. We talked too, but not about topics that typically went in circles. Our server was a homosexual. <br><br>The best part of the meal was when the check came, someone had already paid for our meal! It was yet another random gentleman, who knew my love, and quote, &#34;owed her one&#34;. What a great gal I&#39;m with... Thanks Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>HPBX

2nd time reviewing.<br><br>Came here for dinner with the parents.<br><br>They likes their food, new Orleans shrimp, pasta with meat sauce and I had Skinny something grilled chicken. Its the same as the previous weight management chicken. I just feel like the names shouldn&#39;t be so weird.<br><br>I feel the old one of weight management chicken felt like I was on the biggest loser. Yes I watch what I eat and substituted the rice for more veggies.<br><br>My dates always chuckle when I order it though.<br><br>Yelp!!!!!

This is like any other normal american sit down restaurant. Crazy, loud, large portion of food.<br>The only disappointment I realized was that, the more I go to this one, the more oily my food is. Even when I order the exact same thing. As great as the food is, my stomach wouldn&#39;t say the same thing since after my meal, I feel like I&#39;m going to puke all over the place. On top of that, this is probably one of the worst place to go to for someone trying to go on a diet.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory friday for date night with my Fiance and the food service was horrible. The drinks were amazing but I ordered the Crispy Chicken Costoletta and they served my fiance&#39;s food first and told me that they did not make enough mashed potatoes.... so I had to wait 15 minutes for the next batch.... we were already waiting 20minutes.... disappointed.... I did get french fries while waiting but it&#39;s obviously not the same. My fiance&#39;s orange chicken was not good at all he tasted garlic on the fried white rice...

My girlfriend and I went for Valentine&#39;s Day yesterday knowing there might be a bit of a wait, when we checked in, we were told it would be 45-50 min, not too bad considering it was VDAY. As we were waiting , Josh from the bar area came to us and asked us if we would like to avoid the wait and just sit at the bar and have dinner there, I looked at my gf and she nodded &#34;yes&#34;. He escorted us to the bar, and Katie was there to welcome us with a big smile and set up our area very cute with a table cloth and glasses. We ordered dinner and drinks and they both kept checking on us as a team. We had the best time! It was only my second time there so Josh asked me what I like, I said spicy food! Lol (I&#39;m Mexican) he recommended the Jamaican black pepper spicy shrimp and rice, it also came with mango salad and plantains. They made our date fun. Josh and Katie make such a great team. I am definitely going back and will surely look to see if they&#39;re there. Thanks for an awesome Valentine&#39;s date night! Great food and great vibe.

When many people think of dining in Pasadena, they think of Old Town and places like The Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s a shame too, because Old Town is basically a tourist trap with large, soulless chain restaurants (like The Cheesecake Factory).  Pasadena is known for it&#39;s eclectic collection of first class eats - the important thing to note is that these places aren&#39;t in Old Town.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is not worth the long wait, heavy crowds, loud atmosphere, and high prices.   The corporate designed food often arrives cold because your server is just too damn busy trying to help everyone.  To make matters worse, locals will curse you silently as you and your dinner party clog the sidewalk/corner while waiting for your table.<br><br>Pasadena has so much to offer, don&#39;t waste your time with The Cheesecake Factory.

The Cheesecake Factory chain has always been able to please no matter where the location is.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Pasadena location quite a number of times now and I&#39;ve always left fuller, fatter, and happy. For lunch they have a good number of smaller sized lunch portions for a good price. Then for dinner they take out the big guns. I&#39;ve tried most of the pastas and I have to say each one them are really different and unique. Same goes for their steaks and most of all, their cheesecakes.<br><br>List of my favorite dishes (not ranked in order because I like all of them)<br><br>PASTA DA VINCI<br>Sauteed Chicken, Mushrooms, Onions and Garlic in Madeira Wine Sauce with Penne Pasta and Parmesan<br>~This is one of their better pastas because it tastes like no other. The pasta is never overcooked (and this goes for all their pasta) and you could really taste every individual ingredient. The overall flavor is more salty than your typical and the wine sauce really makes this dish great.<br><br>PASTA CARBONARA<br>Spaghettini Tossed with Smoked Bacon, Sweet Green Peas and a Light Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce<br>~I love the texture of the bacon with the pasta. It adds a bit of crunch instead of the all over mushy feeling. I usually hate green peas but these sweet ones really pull it off. The sauce is not overly dousing either.<br><br>GRILLED SKIRT STEAK<br>Served with Mashed Potatoes, Vegetables and Crisp Onions<br>~I get this a lot. Not only is it a good sized steak for the price, but its sauce is sooo good. This can fill anyone up.<br><br>FILET MIGNON<br>with French Fries and Onion Strings<br>~Of course the most tender steak that his restaurant has to offer, but also the most expensive. Very tasty indeed<br><br>HIBACHI STEAK<br>Slices of Hanger Steak and Sauteed Shiitake Mushrooms over Onions, Bean Sprouts and a Soy Steak Sauce. Served with Tempura Asparagus and Wasabi Mashed Potatoes<br>~Now this is something new that most other restaurants don&#39;t offer or haven&#39;t even thought of. It&#39;s more of a Japanese styled steak that really makes the steak exotic. It tastes more salty and has that nice wasabi mashed potato. If you&#39;re not a wasabi fan don&#39;t order!<br><br>GRILLED CHICKEN AND AVOCADO CLUB<br>Grilled Chicken Breast with Avocado, Bacon, Tomato, Melted Swiss<br>and Herb Mayonnaise. Served with French Fries<br>~I probably really like this because the name includes two of my most favorite ingredients. They really compliment each other nicely in this sandwich and that&#39;s what makes it so good. The mayo mixed with the swiss is a very nice experience too.<br><br>and for cheesecakes:<br><br>ORIGINAL<br><br>GODIVA CHOCOLATE CHEESECAKE<br><br>FRESH BANANA CREAM CHEESECAKE <br><br>CHOCOLATE OREO MUDSLIDE CHEESECAKE <br><br>30th ANNIVERSARY CHOCOLATE CAKE CHEESECAKE<br><br>You can tell that I&#39;m a chocolate lover and yes all of these chocolate cheesecakes are actually different in some way.<br>But really all of them are really good, it&#39;s just what&#39;s your favorite topping!<br>The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because you can&#39;t make reservations.

This place is seriously not worth the time and money you spend here. First of all, the food isn&#39;t all that great. They have a huge menu with different kinds of choices but I feel like they don&#39;t really specialize in anything. The portions are big so I recommend sharing if you&#39;re not a big eater. Plus you pay a lot for what you get. I would recommend coming here just got dessert, which is actually good.<br><br>Also, every time I&#39;ve come here for any meal, I&#39;ve had to wait at least 30 - 45 minutes. Seriously, it&#39;s not worth it. You&#39;re in the middle of Old Town Pasadena, there are so many good restaurants up and down Colorado. Go try one of those and skip the long wait.

Never hopped on the Cheesecake Factory bandwagon but now I see why people like this place.<br><br>We went for lunch and chose a booth by the window. The hostess and servers were extremely friendly and responsive. The prices were reasonable, the food was solid, and the portions were great even for lunch specials. Plus, the free bread was delicious.<br><br>Yes, the cheesecake was good. Don&#39;t see why we would not come back except that there are too many other great restaurants to try in this area.

Come here very often with clients and friends since I am a local. Tonight was the only night that I have been disappointed with my server. She threw out drinks and plates down and did not even say anything to us during our whole dining experience. Very disappointed and will not be coming to this restaurant anytime soon.

The prices are decent for their portion size and the food&#39;s pretty good. Dessert was pretty good, too, though I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s so special about their cheesecakes. Waitstaff was quick &amp; efficient. But it&#39;s always super crowded and loud. We had to wait close to an hour because they didn&#39;t take dinner reservations. I wouldn&#39;t normally come here but my friend had never been to a Cheesecake Factory (any Cheesecake Factory anywhere) and it seemed like something she should try at least once just so she knows what everyone else is talking about.

I&#39;ve always been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience, nor food order. One of my memorable favorites is the Biscuits and Gravy! I think theres chicken in there too. My mouth waters just thinking about it. <br><br>The breakfast burrito is massive and can serve 2 people, and is available all day. One of my favorites too. My only thing about this place is that it&#39;s always packed! Still, the food is excellent and the service is great too.

This place is always packed, and the line is too long. So when you get sitted you are already starving to death. Then another 1 hour wait for the food to come. When the food arrive, your appetite is gone. I think they should do something with the kitchen assembly so the turn around of food will be faster. <br><br>This restaurant is over rated and the food is over priced. The room is dark you cannot see the food, it&#39;s like eating spaghetti inside the movie house. If I will go here again, I&#39;ll just have appetizer and wine.<br><br>This is a feel good place, not really a place to dine. It&#39;s like wearing a Louis Vuitton in the Metro train or bus. <br><br>I love their cheesecake, the best! I&#39;ll get it at Ralps, the line is shorter, express check-out!

I love this particular location of Cheesecake Factory- It&#39;s centric, I can go shopping at J crew while I wait for a table, and get gelato after dinner if I&#39;m not in the mood for a cheesecake or pie.<br><br>The food always delivers- My family is obsessed with this place, thus I have been to C.F. wayyy more than I&#39;ve wanted to or needed to in the past two months.<br><br>My favorite dishes: Chicken Madeira, spicy chicken sandwich, grande burrito, and their super disgustingly big appetizer sampler. Delicious!<br><br>Apparently a slice of their chocolate blackout cake is 1500 calories. But I would gladly just eat this cake and nothing else the whole entire day. <br><br>PS. they have cute waiter (s).

I would give this cheesecake factory the poorest possible score. The food is the same as any other factory, but the timeliness of service is unexceptional. They try to placate people with bread, when they should focus on getting some drinks and food orders to the customers. It doesn&#39;t appear to be from lack of staff, as there is a ton all over the place. This leads me to think one of two things, either the staff are incompetent, or it is poorly directed by management. I was here for dessert and coffee on a Tuesday night, and they still can&#39;t handle the load. Try coming here on a Friday or Saturday, and that will be impossible.<br><br>Our server was Kourtney. She was very nice, and probably used to people flat out refusing what they ordered due to long waits.<br><br>The good side is that if you call for an order for carry out, they usually are pretty good with that or if you just picking up dessert at the dessert bar.

B wanted to go to the Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena. I can count the number of times I&#39;ve been to different locations on one hand. The menus are epic, so I figure there&#39;s something there for just about anyone. <br><br>We went on a Saturday night. In my opinion, the wait was minimal, but it&#39;s pretty loud. <br><br>I had a glass of Riesling which was surprisingly tasty. B ordered the Pasta da Vinci and I ordered the crab cake sandwich which is served with lettuce, tomato and tartar sauce. I don&#39;t know what I expected. I had a specific taste and texture in my mind. The brioche was toasted with butter or something. It would have been better on a hard dry roll. B&#39;s pasta was actually pretty good and the waitress grated parmesan on top. <br><br>And of course, we ordered cheesecake and it was good. <br><br>I&#39;ll probably end up at Cheesecake Factory again, because so many people I know love it. <br><br>Anyone got any recommendations for future visits?

The wait is HORRRRRIIIIBBBBLLLLEEEE!<br>about 20-30 minutes.<br><br>The food is decent. The last thing i ate there was some pasta with like bacon, and it was quite good. Other then that the service is actually really good despite them being so busy all the time. The waiters and waitresses really do a great job.<br><br>ill recommend this to anyone who doesn&#39;t mind waiting for 20-30 minutes.
I&#39;m going to have to say no bueno for Cheesecake Factory. Maybe cause I&#39;m so use to Asian food but I just didn&#39;t like it all that much. Stars are for awesome customer service :)

So.. their food is good, and I&#39;ve had many pleasant experiences (none over-the-top)-- but recently I experienced really unprofessional behavior from them. We put our names down, went over to the bar to have a glass of wine, and then had the person in charge of seating come over and give us attitude --- with a frown/scowl saying well, even though we&#39;ve been waiting 10 minutes, they won&#39;t seat us because one of the people in our party wasn&#39;t present (that person was handicapped and took longer to walk over)-- REALLY?? She said she was cancelling our name. She was actually talking back at us and snapping, saying there are other people waiting too. <br><br>I know we all may have bad days, so I&#39;ll give her the benefit of the doubt -- I&#39;m sure she&#39;s really a nice person (and she was really pretty too)-- but her attitude sucked! The manager apologized A LOT, and we ended up getting seated-- and our server was just a doll, and the food rocked.. but still, they could have been more professional. I had never been treated like that before, and I&#39;ve gone to this Cheesecake Factory since 1999. That incident alone made me not have too much faith in this branch.

We were in the bar for 20 minutes nobody came to take our order, so we left... Bad customer service. We told the Host and she only said I&#39;m sorry I understand is not her fault, I&#39;ve been an another Cheesecake Factory always had a great customer.

Such a disappointment.... Our waitress was so rude. She was treating us like she was doing us a favor, lol.. Just because you&#39;re having a bad day doesn&#39;t mean you should ruin everyone else&#39;s day.  I lost my appetite and took my salad to go. Oh and when I asked for a box to go the attitude continued. She literally wanted us to get up and get everything ourselves.

Love this cheesecake, mostly because it&#39;s close by. I love the barbecue ranch ckn salad or the miso salmon. The staff is friendly, and the food is consistently great. You have to try the Oreo cheesecake!

Last night i went to dinner with My friend at the Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena it was probably the most disappointing dinner i&#39;ve had. It took about 25 minutes to get our first round of drinks then it took over an HOUR to get our dinner which was just PASTA and the restaurant was slow. When the food FINALLY came out they brought out her food WRONG. We were just over it and didn&#39;t even want our food anymore. They offered us dessert and the specific cheesecakes that we ordered they had run out of smh. First and LAST time we go there.

I ordered a Lynda&#39;s chocolate fudge cake for my friend&#39;s birthday  it was delicious they did exactly the way I want it. My friend&#39;s so happy. Great service MARIA from the bakery! I would strong recommend this to all of  my friends

The restaurant was full when I arrived, which was normal for a busy Saturday night. my friend and I put our names on the waiting list and we waited for about 30 minutes before we went back to the host to ask them &#34;how much longer would we be waiting?&#34;<br><br>They only found us a place when we showed up to ask them, I guess they saw that we were waiting for a half hour already. Plus they gave priority to people who arrived after us.<br><br>The food was ok, it took about another 30 minutes to come out to the table. So at this point we had been at the restaurant for about an hour.<br><br>The server was cold, impenetrable and disconcerted when we were ordering. He didn&#39;t seem patient enough to suggest what he recommended from the menu. We could barely get a smile from the guy.<br><br>The only good thing about our visit to this restaurant was the dessert and the water.

Came in with friends on a Monday night around 7 and there was no wait! Our waitress was so attentive and continually refilled our water cups and boxed our leftovers for us. As for the food, our table ordered farfalle pasta with chicken and garlic sauce, skinnylicious salmon, lemon chicken and potatoes, garlic noodles with chicken, tomato basil pasta, the gluten free chocolate cheesecake and the pineapple upside down cheesecake. All was good, the portions were huge!
Big portions here. I had the fresh salmon with mash potatoes which was great. The menu is overwhelming, too many choices for me. Good for a birthday because they embarrass you &amp; sing to you =}

The cheese cake and milk shake we ordered was delicious , but the service here is horrible ! Took over 15 minutes to get a cocktail. I don&#39;t know if this establishment is understaffed , which would explain why the service was slow and the waitress attitude unwelcoming . Typical service I guess at these commercial type restaurants...

When it comes to cheese cake factory&#39;s this one is very decent considering. It&#39;s in the middle of old town Pasadena. It has a great vibe, and It&#39;s always busy. I usually go for the happy hour. The price you just can&#39;t beat it! The hosts here are totally hit or miss. They are either great or very rude. Not to mention they served us frozen cheese cake -.- . So I would stick to the appetizers and drinks !
CHEESECAKE - TIME!!!!!!!<br><br>great service, great food. Just park in the public parking lot around the corner and enjoy yourselves in this lovely restaurant.

i love cheesecake factory but this one is very commercial. its like in a shopping center. its like downtown but for rich people lol. it is surrounded by a lot of nice shops but there is no parking in the front or side. well at least most of the time because its meter parking. there is a parking garage but its like 2 or 3 blocks away. If you want to go for a romantic dinner i suggest another one because this one is more for everyone that is tired of walking blocks and blocks and shopping around. it gets packed but they are very fast in attending. when i walked in for my birthday i thought they were at least going to take 30 min because the waiting area was super packed. when i asked how long was the wait they said 3 min. i was a little critical about it, but in like 2 min they told us our table was ready. i was surprised. the food was great and the service as well. it was just really really packed. once we were seated they did take a while to take our order but we didn&#39;t mind since we didn&#39;t know what we wanted.

Service was great the hubby ordered the cajun jambalaya and he loved it, I on the other hand ordered based on the recommendation of our waitress the Bistro shrimp pasta that comes in a lemon sauce with arugula and fried battered shrimp.. The batter on the shrimp was just plain weird crispy on the outside but very soggy on the inside. The sauce was just way too sour for me and it didnt help that I had ordered a lemonade. I would definitely wouldnt recommend that dish. Other then that that the wait was minimal. Our waitress was attentive and prompt. And the bread of basket was delish.

I asked to be seated for 3. The host seated 4 other families (that were parties of 3+) before us even though we checked in before. The host, (younger girl didn&#39;t seem to like me) wasn&#39;t very friendly and had a bit of attitude. Finally we were seated and the waitress took over 15 minutes to even say hi or to ask us for drinks. Our soups were cold and we asked for them to warm them up, when they brought them back for the second time, THEY WERE STILL COLD. Nachos and the sweet tamales weren&#39;t warm either. Super pricey for terrible service and tasteless cold food.

The factory is pretty much what you can expect from a restaurant chain -- big crowds and noise, and even bigger portions.  Cheesecake is the Michael Bay of restaurants, where the explosions happen somewhere besides on the big screen.<br><br>If that&#39;s not enough to stomach, you can try to digest that huge menu of theirs.  Seriously half of the items could be removed and no one would notice.<br><br>The food is fine but short of exceptional. One of their best dishes is their herb crusted filet of salmon.  I also love the brown bread -- you can skip the white bread.  Food might improve if they weren&#39;t trying to cater to so many tastes.<br><br>The service is fast. Heck I went to the restroom after finishing my plate and they cleared it off while I was gone.  When I got back the hostess didn&#39;t recognize me and told me it wasn&#39;t a self seating restaurant lol.<br><br>Food - 3 stars<br>Service - 3 stars
Chicken marasala - tender and flavorful<br><br>Server not memorable. Noisy.

Just looking for some place with a big enough menu for my group of friends so we decided to go to cheesecake. It was the wrong choice. The food was not good. The artichoke was very small and under cooked and had this odd what looked like green dye. The rest was not better. And, it took forever to get our food.

This was the first C.F. I ever stepped foot into (many moons ago) and after having done so, I swore it would be my last, BUTTTT...I gave in to my friend when she asked to go there again soon thereafter.<br><br>This time I liked it and have since eaten at many other locations.  This one gets SUPER DUPER packed though (if you can imagine), the wait here is insane!  But if you can sit by the window it&#39;s nice, you get to see all the hustle and bustle of the people walking by.

A decidedly average restaurant with consistent problems with service.<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at this particular Cheesecake Factory three or four times. And there hasn&#39;t been a single time when something didn&#39;t go wrong. The time before last I was given a ketchup bottle that exploded when I opened it, covering my hands and shirt with fermented ketchup. Now, in all fairness, they are very apologetic when something is awry and they try to fix it.  But it would be nice if it didn&#39;t happen so often.<br><br>At my most recent visit at around 3:30 on a weekday, I was seated relatively quickly. My waiter took my drink order and, five minutes later, my appetizer and entree order. I then proceeded to wait a good thirty minutes for my appetizer (white bean hummus). When it finally came, it was a bit disappointing...chunky and rather bland. I actually added a good amount of table salt to give it a little bit of flavor. Meh.<br><br>The burger I ordered came about 20 minutes later. It was the Kobe Beef Burger with Onions and Mushrooms. I ordered it Medium Rare, like I pretty much always do. When it finally came, it was cooked well-done. When the waiter came to check on me, he asked if everything was the way I wanted it and I mentioned the burger being overcooked. He took my plate and and said he would be back soon. <br><br>In the meantime, I picked at the really bland salad and refrigerated tomato (note: refrigerating tomatoes is a sin) for a few minutes before a manager came by to apologize. It was certainly a good move, but I was already losing hope of having a decent dining experience. The burger finally came back, in the medium to medium rare range. I ate about 3/4 of the burger before getting my check and heading out. While it was actually cooked properly, it was surprisingly bland and came, like the salad, with a gross, mealy slice of tomato. <br><br>For a simple lunch, I ended up being in the restaurant for a good hour and a half. <br><br>While there was no exploding ketchup this time and the staff tried to ameliorate the situtation, I really have no interest in returning for more punishment.

Love the cheesecake but hold the check!  I love coming here for dates or just to have a simple dinner and drinks with my girlfriends.  The food here is always good and the service is so-so and slow at times.  Don&#39;t wait for me to ask you to fill my glass up with water and yes I do want more and I love bread too so keep it coming!  <br>I just recently tried the Louisiana chicken pasta with a spicy &#34;New Orleans sauce&#34; per the waitresses recommendation and boy did she hit the nail on the head! Tastiest pasta ever!!!  I&#39;m very happy and can always count on the servers opinion! The wait wasn&#39;t that long for a Friday night (about 30 minutes) but overall I enjoyed myself and will go back even though I prefer the Cheesecake Factory at Americana instead. Same service and food just a prettier location and parking is better.

You can&#39;t really go wrong with Cheesecake factory. After being to at least 3 different ones in Los Angeles, I still do not understand why there is always a wait. Dinner time is always busy. The cheesecakes, of course, are overpriced and delicious. I would definitely get the red velvet cheesecake. <br><br>I usually get a pasta dish at Cheesecake Factory. The jambalaya is good, as well as the Chicken Bellagio. I would recommend the Chicken Bellagio only if you really like chicken and pasta. <br><br>One of my favorite parts of this restaurant are the free bread. The wheat and white are both warm and very good.

This is a chain restaurant.  Several steps above a diner but not worth 5 stars peeps.  Any place that has this much stuff on the menu can&#39;t be worth that many stars.  The cheesecake might be a 4 or 5 but the rest of the food is hit or miss.  The ambiance is great here as you are right on Colorado Blvd and walking distance to several bars and shops after lunch or dinner.  That is the only reason why I would go is because of the location location location for this place.
My go-to place to hang out with friends, both local and visiting! I always get the BBQ Smokehouse burger and it&#39;s always juicy and perfectly cooked! Would definitely recommend!

As most Cheesecake Factory&#39;s this one has good food with large portions and the service is good.   The wait can be a lengthy if you get there late.  I find it funny how people give it a low rating for having such a long wait.   Well, doesn&#39;t that tell you it&#39;s popular.  Doesn&#39;t that tell you maybe you should get there earlier, maybe have a few drinks at the bar but come on.   Isn&#39;t that like getting to a popular movie late and complaining there aren&#39;t any good seats?   <br>  The bar serves some stiff drinks and the service is all around good.  If you can find a seat at in the bar area while waiting for your table it can be quite enjoyable with your date.   If you&#39;re single there&#39;s a lot of traffic here.
My favorite place to eat with the Mrs. While in Old Towne. Parking is still an issue.
Service was great. The food was really good. I love their cheesecake. I would definitely go back.

I came here to buy two whole cheesecake and the one thing I hate is getting the wrong thing hen you get home.  In my case to a party... I was to get a fresh strawberry and 10&#34; tuxedo cheesecake.  I think they gave me the Kalua cheesecake.  What a disappointment!!  I had the craving for the chocolate tuxedo.  At this point I would return it.  But I think they should confirm the order when you get it.  I spent a ot money and if you know me I always ask for Cheesecake Factory.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. There are so many varieties to choose including salad, entrée, appetizer and of course dessert.<br><br>The environment is the same as the other Cheesecake restaurant. It used to be at least an hour and a half wait. But it was only about 15 to 20 minutes. <br><br>Food quality is good as usual. I still enjoy their bread a lot.

I&#39;ve honestly never tasted a Cobb salad like the one offered at the Cheesecake factory.  It has chicken breast, avocado, blue cheese, bacon, egg and lettuce.  You might say...&#34;what&#39;s so special about this Cobb salad...it sounds fairly ordinary.&#34;  Well....it&#39;s the QUALITY of each ingredient that makes the salad.  Trust me..I&#39;ve had the Cobb at many places and I will confess, hands down, (where did that saying come from anyways? hehe) that the cheesecake Factory has the best one.<br><br>Plus..it&#39;s huge so you will take some home to eat the next day...which I don&#39;t recommend cause salad gets soggy ...so convince a friend to share it with you.  What exactly do you have to lose? ;)<br><br>Now....I&#39;m a little bit discouraged about the service.  I had heard that each waiter is only given 4 tables so that they can attend the needs of the people. (Is that true?)  However...I think I saw my waiter 3 times....once he got my order ( and only after I flagged him down) then he brought us our food ( a million hours later) and then after I flagged him down again he gave us our bill...hmmm...I think that diet coke was never refilled.... oh well...  I just take off one star for that...not a big loss for the Cheesecake Factory..hehe
Front staff was great. Wait staff not so much .. Came in for cheesecake and it was soft. Waiter had a slight attitude about exchanging for cake.

As with other Cheesecake Factories, the food here in the Pasadena location is no different than any of the others.  Service is always good and they always have warm wheat bread.  Parking here is limited to street and 90 mins free at the public lots.  Be prepared to wait as this location is typically busy.

We came here for a &#34;going away&#34; get together for a real close friend on Mother&#39;s Day weekend so I expected long wait, poor service and rush rush rush. What we got was a great dinner experience. <br>I got there 1/2 hour before our meeting time since they didn&#39;t take weekend night time reservations. After about 20 or so minutes I get a call from them saying that a party ahead of us cancelled and we&#39;re more than welcomed to take their table and I&#39;m like hell yeah! We sat and the rest of our party showed up shortly. Drinks ordered, appetizers ordered and then main course ordered. Either they&#39;re quick and organized or our conversations kept us busy that we didn&#39;t even noticed. <br>I ordered the Moroccan chicken which was good. Not even sure what I decided to order until the very last minute. I normally go for the shrimp scampi but changed it at the very last minute. Not really sure why come to think of it. I just looked down when it was my turn to order and guess that&#39;s what I saw right in front of me. Whew... What the hell were we talking about that put me in that position? Anywho, it was a good choice cause the wifey was picking on my plate. <br>I had an iced tea cause I&#39;m not an alchie. And coffee at the end. Tiramisu was amazing but too much whipped cream. Oh, the table was cleaned and water/Iced T replenished quite often that we never saw an empty cup. Great experience and will definitely return.

First of all, DON&#39;T READ THE NUTRITIONAL GUIDE!!!<br><br>If you do the above you will likely walk right back out of the place and let me tell you, you could be making a boo-boo. They serve a good range of dishes here and the service is usually very good. My standard dish is the four cheese pasta with chicken (1200 calories!) but I&#39;ve also had a range of their burgers and steaks and my only complaint to date is a waiter thinking I was an air-steward (due to my British accent).<br><br>If you get here after 7pm be prepared to wait 20 minutes before you are seated, maybe spend the time eyeing the fine selection of cheesecakes they have on display at the front of the &#39;factory&#39;. I would recommended the Godiva chocolate and the original strawberry cheesecake, but again DO NOT check the calorie content.<br><br>The prices here are reasonable compared to other surrounding eateries and the portion sizes, while no where near the size of a Maggiano&#39;s dish (their full portion spaghetti meatballs comes in a bucket and is 4900 claories - I kid you not, check it out), are still very good.<br><br>I would recommened eating here if you are in the area, it has not let me down yet.

I have been here twice. the wait was not too long which Loved. The food is delicious as well, but the only reason i give it 4 stars is because both times the servers were not that good. I&#39;ve had better service in a busier environment.

HELL HOLE!!!! Dirty napkins, dirty silverware, dirty glasses! The mojitos were bomb! Bad service! Bad food...yes really!!! Never had an experience quite like this for a Cheesecake Factory Restaurant! Rats and Roaches eat well here you won&#39;t.

My husband and I were on a Friday night date at The Cheesecake Factory Old Town Pasadena..when it was time to pay the bill I handed the waiter my credit card to process...when the waiter returned he informed me that my card was declined.  I didn&#39;t understand because I had just deposited my paycheck a few hours before..I IMMEDIATELY get on the phone with my bank and to my horror, they said it was a glitch in their system and not to worry but my account would be back to normal in a few days.  My husband also went to get money out of his brand new savings account but since it was new he had to actually activate his card INSIDE the bank, which was now closed. Talk about embarrassing!!!  Long story short we talked to the manager and he was so understanding about the situation that he allowed us to come back in a few days with the money for our bill...no questions asked. And we did exactly that. Just wanted to give our sincere thank you to the manager and the staff members who were so kind and understanding.  THEY ROCK!!!!

Oh, wow. Not wow at the chicken piccata or the vanilla bean cheesecake though--wow at the service from JOSH. He checked on us at all the right times, his presentation was spot on, and it made the experience so much more enjoyable no doubt. I didn&#39;t have high expectations for the cheesecake factory since it was a saturday night, and it&#39;s a chain, but i mean...on all scales, his service is as high as it gets.<br><br>The food was good--good portion size, tasted alright too. The cheesecake wasn&#39;t overbearing, the flavors were subtle overall. I can&#39;t wait to try the other kinds of cheesecake! Their selection is so extensive--but of course, it is &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;!

This review is for Happy hour only! I think Cheesecake factory has one of the best happy hours in Old Town. They offer several full size appetizers for only $5 and $5 mixed drinks. I usually don&#39;t drink because most of the time I&#39;m on my lunch break, but even just the food is a great deal. All of the apps I&#39;ve tried have been very yummy and usually the service is pretty prompt so I have no problem getting back to work on time.

This is one of my least favorite Cheesecake Factory locations.  The wait is usually unbearable with my 90 minutes free parking ticking away.  <br><br>But despite the wait, I do love their menu and I must always order a few of the following: Crusted Chicken Romano, Miso Salmon, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Avocado Eggrolls, Spinach and Cheese Dip, or Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake.

What happens when you&#39;re in a rush and someone else chooses lunch - you end up at the Cheesecake Factory when Pasadena actually has some good grub.<br><br>I went with the Madeira chicken which was ok. If you like chain food, you might love this place

Pleasant staff, average food, it&#39;s what you expect from Cheesecake Factory. What you also expect is to get a buzzer upon entry and have a 40-50 minute wait for a table/booth, and to have to wait more for waitservice, food, and then the check and your to-go box(es).<br><br>Given the quantity of food &amp; fairness of prices, you really can&#39;t go wrong, unless you&#39;re looking for a quick meal.<br><br>Dishes to try:<br># Boston house salad<br># E&#39;s favorite pasta<br># Herb encrusted salmon<br># Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic<br># Tex-Mex egg rolls<br><br>Drinks to try:<br># Green tea, iced and sweetened<br># Pina colada<br># Silverlight mojito<br><br>Cheesecakes to try (of course):<br># Kahlua choco <br># Key lime <br># Godiva<br># Vanilla bean

Happy Hour Review <br><br>Having grown up in the Midwest, I can&#39;t help but love chain restaurants. For this reason, an afternoon trip to Pasadena with Nicandrew included a stop at the chain most cited as a portion-control-killing obesity cause, the Cheesecake Factory!! And I get it - their portions are kinda ridiculous. That&#39;s why you should just go for Happy Hour, have a fantastic cocktail and a large portion-ed appetizer and be on your merry way!<br><br>Which is exactly what our crew did. We dropped in at 4pm, when Happy Hour starts and were glad we were just there for Happy Hour since there was a wait for the restaurant. Happy Hour is served at the bar area and at the nearby high-tables. A couple spots cleared at the bar when we arrived so we took a seat and then a few minutes to make a choice on their wicked-crazy food Happy Hour options; for real, so many delish-sounding options between $4-6!<br><br>The drink choice was a little easier. Besides $5 well drinks, $5 wines by the glass, and $4 select draft beers, they also offer 4 classic cocktails - mojito, Long Island iced tea, margarita, cosmopolitan - and a specialty called J.W.&#39;s Pink Lemonade for only $5. As dorky as it sounds, sometimes it&#39;s nice to see the specialty drinks listed out like that. I love Long Island&#39;s, but always seem to forget that they&#39;re out there waiting to be enjoyed. Seeing it listed on the menu - well, I just had to have one! Nic had a tasty margarita and Drew enjoyed the mojito, which our bartender freshly made right before us. All the drinks were pretty right on, but I think the mojito was my fav.<br><br>After a starter of their delish white &amp; honey-wheat (I think?) bread, Nicandrew ended up going with the artichoke-crab dip for $5.95 and I had an order of the Avocado Eggrolls served with a tamarind dipping sauce for $5. Being the Cheesecake Factory, the eggrolls were actually three whole eggrolls cut in half - more than enough food for one person! Awesomely good though.<br><br>So that was the food and drink... The ambiance was kinda what you&#39;d expect - a couple TVs going (1 sports, 1 CNN), a good-sized crowd for 4pm that was a little loud for my tastes. Luckily, and I don&#39;t know if it was because we were buzzed, but I swear when they dimmed the lights around 4:30, the crowd got quieter! I say dim lights all the time, baby!<br><br>All in all, we had a fun time and the chain restaurant Happy Hour didn&#39;t disappoint! The only disappointment (and it&#39;s kinda major) is that I just don&#39;t understand why HH only runs weekdays from 4-6pm. I know people have more flexible schedules in Los Angeles, but all my working friends don&#39;t get off work until at least 5:30, so I&#39;ll never understand an HH that only lasts til 6, especially if it&#39;s weekday only.
